The surplus revenue derived from Berar, after paying for the cost of the administration, is paid to the Nizam's government. In 1895-6 this surplus was about Rs.112,386.

2. Mysore.—The Mysore State is situated in Southern India between 11° 40' and 15° N. lat., and between 74° 40' and 78° 30' E. long., and is surrounded on all sides by British territory. Its total area is 27,936 square miles, and it contains a population of 4,943,604. The inhabitants are almost exclusively Hindus, who constitute more than 94 per cent. of the whole population. In early times Mysore was the principal seat of the Jains, who have left many interesting memorials of their occupation. The state has always been under Hindu rulers, except during the short interval caused by the usurpation of power during the 18th century by Haidar Ali and his son, Tipu Sultan. After the death of the latter, at the capture of Seringapatam in 1799, the English restored a representative of the ancient line in the person of Krishna Raj, son of Chama Raj of Arakotara. His subsequent misrule, when admitted to power on attaining his majority, led to the resumption of the administrative control of the province by the British government in the year 1831. The government, however continued to be carried on in the name of the native prince, and at his death an adopted son was recognised as successor. This chief, since dead, was duly installed on coming of age in 1881. The British chief commissioner thereupon handed over office to the native diwan, and a political resident was appointed to represent British interests.

3. Baroda.—This state includes all the territories of his Highness the Gaekwar. Its total area is 8,226 square miles, and it contains a population of 2,415,396 souls, the majority of whom (over 89 per cent.) are Hindus. The province of Gujarat was at one time included in the Mughal empire, but, in the early part of the seventeenth century, the Marhattas, under the leadership of Damaji Gaekwar, and afterwards of his son, Pilaji, succeeded in wresting all power out of the hands of the Mughal officers. From that time Baroda has remained continuously under the sway of the Gaekwar family, who held it in the first instance under the Maharatta Peshwa subject to a tributary payment, but afterwards threw off their allegiance and became feudatory to the British government under the guarantee of a treaty executed in the year 1817. The British government is represented at the court of the Baroda State by a political officer, called the resident and agent to the governor-general.

4. Kashmir and Jammu.—This native state includes, in addition to the district of Kashmir proper, Jammu, Punch, and the governorships of Ladakh and Gilgit. Subordinate to it are the petty chiefships of Chitral, Hunza, Nagar, &c. The area is estimated to be 80,900 square miles. The population, according to the census of 1891, amounts to 2,543,952. Kashmir became part of the Mughal empire in 1586 A.D., but it was afterwards subjugated both by the Afghans and the Sikhs. At the time of the Sikh war the state was under the government of Gulab Singh, a Sikh officer, who ruled as a feudatory of the Maharaja of the Punjab. After the victory of the British forces in 1846, the possession of the kingdom was confirmed to Gulab Singh, under certain specified conditions of alliance and subordinate co-operation, by a separate treaty executed at Amritsar in the same year. A political resident is permanently stationed in Kashmir. The ruling family is Hindu, but the greater number of the inhabitants of the country, considerably more than half, are Muhammadans, and chiefly of the Sunni sect.

5. Kalat.—The Khan of Kalat is head of the Baluchistan tribal chiefs whose territories are comprised under the following divisions:—Jhalawan, Sarawan, Makran, Las, and Kachh Gandava. These districts form what may be termed Kalati Baluchistan, and occupy an area of about 100,000 square miles. The inhabitants of the country are either Brahuis or Baluchis, both being Muhammadans of the Sunni sect. The country is sparsely populated, the total number being roughly estimated at 350,000 persons only. It derives its chief importance from its position with regard to Afghanistan on the north-western frontier of British India. The Khan of Kalat is under a treaty obligation of subordinate cooperation with the British government. The governor-general's agent in Baluchistan conducts the relations between the government of India and the Khan, and exercises a general political supervision over the district.

6. Rajputana Agency.—Rajputana is the name of a great territorial circle, situated between 23° and 30° N. lat., and between 69° 30' and 78° 15' E. long. Within these limits are twenty native states, having each its own autonomy and separate chief, together with the British district of Ajmere-Merwara. Of the Native States, 17 are Rajput, 2 are Jat (Bhartpur and Dholpur), and 1 only is Muhammadan (Tonk). Their combined area is about 130,000 square miles, and they contain a population of over 12 millions. The chief administrative control of the British district is vested ex officio in the political officer, who holds the post of governor-general's agent for the supervision of the relations between the several native states of Rajputana and the government of India.

7. **Central India Agency.**—Central India is the name given to the country occupied by the native states grouped together under the supervision of the political officer in charge of the Central India Agency. These states lie between 21° 24' and 26° 32' N. lat., and between 74° 0' and 83° 0' E. long. The British districts of Jhansi and Lalitpur divide the Agency into two main divisions—Native Bundelkhand and Baghelkhand lying to the east, and Central India proper to the west. The total area covered is about 77,800 square miles, and the population amounts to 10,318,812. The great majority of the people are Hindus. The principal states are six in number—Gwalior, Indore, Bhopal, Rewa, Dhar, and Jaora, of which two, Bhopal and Jaora, are Muhammadan, and the rest are Hindu. Besides these there are a multitude of petty states held by their rulers under the immediate guarantee of the British government, but having feudal relations with one or other of the larger states. The total number of states amounts to 69, and the petty chiefships to 79—total, 148.

**STATES UNDER THE LOCAL GOVERNMENTS AND ADMINISTRATIONS.**

These states may be divided into two groups: the first consisting of the petty states attached to the Orissa and Chota Nagpur divisions, 24 in number; and the other comprising the states of Kuch Behar to the north, and Hill Tipperah to the east, of Bengal. The inhabitants of the first group are hillmen of Kolarian or Dravidian origin, and their condition is still very primitive. Kuch Behar is inhabited by a Mongoloid people, the Koch. The population of Sikkim consists of the Thibetan races of Lepcha and Bhóti, and the Nipáli tribe, Limbu. 5. Under the Government of the Punjab there are 34 states, varying considerably in size and importance. Area, 38,299 square miles. Population, 4,203,280. Revenue, about Rx. 1,244,000.

The Punjab states may be grouped under three main classes. The hill states, 23 in number, lie among the Punjab Himalayas and are held by some of the most ancient Rajput families in all India. Along the western half of the southern border lies the Muhammadan state of Bahawalpur. The remaining states, including the Sikh principalities of Patiala, Jind, Nabha, Kapurthala, Faridkot and Kalsia, and the Muhammadan chiefships of Maler Kotla, Pataudi, Loharu and Dujana, lie east of Lahore, and, with insignificant exceptions, occupy the centre of the eastern plains of the province.

7. Under the Chief Commissioner of Assam there is only one state—Manipur. Its area is estimated to be about 7,500 square miles, and it has a population of about 250,000, chiefly Kuki and semi-Hindu forest tribes. Revenue, about Rx. 28,000.

8. Under the Chief Commissioner of Burma there are a number of Shan states and other petty chiefships, the population of which was roughly estimated in 1890-91, when it was returned at 373,000. The Shan States are, properly speaking, not Native States, the territory being part of British India. They are administered, however, through the Sawbwas or hereditary chiefs.

The Following have been added to the Stock of Books on Sale at the India Office.

Finance and Revenue Accounts of the Government of India, 1895-96. (2s. 6d.)

Tribes and Castes of the North West Provinces and Oudh. By W. Cooke. (3s.)

Indian Monumental Inscriptions. I—Bengal. By C. R. Wilson. (3s. 6d.)

Engineering Works of the Godovari Delta. By G. T. Walch. (9s.)

Handbook of the Lais Language. By Surgn.-Major A. G. E. Newland. (13s. 6d.)

Archaeological Survey of India:

Technical Art Series, 1896 (4s.)

List of the Factory Records of the India Office. (5s.)

Assam Code. (Rs. 7.)

Epigraphia Indica. Vol. IV, Parts 5, 6, and 7. (Rs. 3 each.)

Records of the Geological Survey. Vol. XXIX, Part 4; Vol. XXX, Parts 1, 2, and 3. (R. 1 per part, or Rs. 2 per year of 4 parts.)

Judicial and Administrative Statistics, 1895-96 (Rs. 2).

India Trade Review, 1896-97. (8a.)

Prices and Wages in India. Fourteenth issue. (R. 1-8.)

Report on Land and Agricultural Banks. By F. A. Nicholson. Part 2. (Rs. 2 4a.)

Financial and Commercial Statistics. Fourth issue. (Rs. 4.)

Agricultural Statistics of British India. 1895-96 (10a.); 1891-92 to 1895-96. (Rs. 3.)

Indian Museum Notes. Vol. III, No. 7 (6a.); Vol. IV, No. 2 (R. 1).

Dyes and Dyeing in Bengal. By N. N. Banerjee. (R. 1 8a.)

Cotton Fabrics and Cotton Industry in Burma. By G. F. Arnold (12a.).

Cotton Fabric Industry in Madras. By E. Thurston.

Brass and Copper Ware of the N. W. Provinces and Oudh. By G. R. Dampier (12a.).

Buddhist Remains near Kasia. By V. A. Smith (R. 1 8a.).

RECORD OF SERVICES.

ABBOTT, EVELYN ROBINS, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Bath Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 30th Oct., 1893, and served in the Punjab as ass't commr.

ABBOTT, HENRY BYAM, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., June, 1861; asst. rest., Aden, 1865; from Oct., 1869, served as asst. agent, Rajputana; pol. asst., Manpura, and dep. Bhil agent, 1875-76; supt. of Jhalawar, March, 1876; pol. agent, Alwar, Jan., 1891; rest., W. states of Rajputana, April, 1892; offg. gov't.-gen.'s agent in Rajputana, March, 1895.

ABBOTT, HERBERT EDWARD STACY, D.S.O., Major, R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 16th Sept., 1878, and was posted to the Punjab; on field service during Afghan war, 1880-81 (medal); exec. engr., Jan., 1885; field engr. in Hazara expdn., 1888 (medal and clasp), and in Miranzai expdn., 1891 (clasp); under sec. to Punjab govt., public works dept., May, 1893; D.S.O., Jan., 1896.

ABDUL GHAFUR KHAN or ZAIDA, Punjab Commn.—Apptd. prob. under native civil service rules, 14th Feb., 1889; asst. commr., Dec., 1891.

ABDULLAH IBN YUSUF ALI, KHAN BAHA'DUR, B.A., LL.B., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Bombay Univ. and St. John's Coll., Camb., and Lincoln's Inn, London; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 18th Jan., 1896, and served in N.W.P. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

ABRAHAMS, BARNETT LIONEL, B.A., Finl. Dept., India Office.—Educ. at the City of London Sch. and Balliol Coll., Oxford (scholar, 1888-92; Jenkyns exhib., 1892; Arnold prize, 1894); junr. clerk, 21st Feb., 1893; précis writer, Dec., 1894; joint editor, India Office List, Nov., 1896.

ABU TURAB KHAN, Agha, Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. proby. asst. mag. and collr. under the statutory civil service rules, 16th April, 1898; confd., 8th Aug., 1892, joint mag., Feb., 1897.

ABUL HUSSAIN, B.I., Sub-judicial service, Bengal.—Joined the service Dec., 1887, as registrar, Calcutta small cause court; offd. as judge, small cause court, May, 1891; confd., Oct., 1895.

ACKLON, ROBERT EVATT, Cent. Prov. Police Dept.—Joined the service, 18th April, 1867, as asst. district supt. of police; supt., Rajputana-Malwa railway police, May, 1883; asst.-insp.-gen., Aug., 1893; insp.-gen. of police and jails, Cent. Prov., April, 1897.

ACWORTH, HARRY ARBUTHNOT, C.I.E., B.I., late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Brighton Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 31st Oct., 1870, and served as asst. collr. and mag., dep. municipal commr., and dep. collr. of salt rev.; member of mixed commn. at Goa, 1884-85; municipal commr. for city of Bombay, April, 1890; C.I.E., May, 1895; editor of the Bombay Rev. Handbook, 3rd edn., and author of 'Ballads of the Marathas,' 1894; retd., March, 1896.

ADAMS, GEORGE, late Indian C.S. (N.W.Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Christ's Hosp.; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 30th Dec., 1861, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., dep. commr., and mag. and collr.; commr. in Oudh, Nov., 1889; commr., Benares, Aug., 1890; Lucknow, April, 1893; junr. member, board of rev., April, 1894; also member of prov'l. legis. council, June, 1894; retd., Dec., 1896.

ADAMS, JOHN, Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 13th May, 1869; asst. engr., Nov., 1871; exec. engr., Sept., 1881; architectural exec. engr. and surveyor, Jan., 1882; is a fellow of Bombay univ.

ADAMSON, CHARLES HENRY ELLISON, C.I.E., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., late Burma Commn.—First commn., royal artillery, Jan., 1868; joined the Burma commn., Dec., 1871, and served as asst. mag., asst. commr., and pres't of municipal committee, Rangoon; dep. commr., June, 1885; C.I.E., May, 1889; commr., Jan., 1892; retd., Oct., 1896.

ADAMSON, HARVEY, M.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at the Gymnasium, Old Aberdeen, and King's Coll., Aberdeen; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 17th Dec., 1877, and served in Burma as asst. commr. and settl. officer; dep. commr., April, 1883; acted as commr. in 1888, 1894, and from June, 1895.

ADDIS, DAVID FOULIS, M.A., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Univs. of Glasgow and Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 14th Nov., 1872, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., asst. settl. officer, and dep. commr.; mag. and collr., July, 1890; district and sessions judge, March, 1895; retd., Oct., 1897.

ADDIS, HENRY BAWN, late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 25th Jan., 1871,
as asst. engr., and was employed on the Nimach, W. Rajputana and other railways; exec. engr., April, 1878; retd., Aug., 1894.

ADIE, WALTER SIBBALD, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Trin. Coll., Camb., apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived, 7th Dec., 1896, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

AGNEW, PATRICK DALREAGLE, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Bedford Gr. Sch. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1837; arrived, 1st Dec., 1839, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and asst. settl. officer.

AGNEW, WILLIAM FISCHER, B.I., Jud. Dept., Burma.—Reporter for Indian law reports, high court, Calcutta, from Feb., 1877; law lecturer, presidency coll., 1879; advocate, high court, Calcutta, 1879; recorder of Rangoon, March, 1884; offd. as judge, high court, Calcutta, in 1885 and 1886; author of 'The Law of Patent,' 'The Statute of Frauds,' 'The Law of Trusts in India,' 'The Criminal Procedure Code,' &c.

AHSANUDDIN AHMAD, B.L., Statutory C.S.(Bengal).—Apptd.asst.mag.and collr. under the native civil service rules, 3rd Jan., 1882; confd., June, 1887; joint mag. and dep. collr., March, 1893.

AIKMAN, ROBERT SMITH, M.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Madras Coll., St. Andrew's, and St. Andrew's Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1867, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; on famine relief duty in Bengal, 1874; from March, 1884, served in the jud. dept.; puisne judge, high court, Sept., 1896.

AINSLEY, WILLIAM, late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury Coll., 1345; arrived, 7th Nov., 1845; served in Bengal as asst. and joint mag. and dep. collr. in Cuttack; specially employed in 1850-51 and 1851-52 in the suppression of Meriah sacrifices in the Kandh districts; mag. of Rangpur, July, 1852; railway commr., E. Indian railway, 1856-57; mag. and collr., Bhagalpur, March, 1857; railway commr., E. Bengal railway, 1858, and subsequently of the S.E. railway also; from Aug., 1863, served in the jud. dept., and was apptd. civil and sessions judge of Patna, Jan., 1864; prest., tea commn., 1867-68; judge of the high court, Calcutta, May, 1873; retd., April, 1880.

ALCOCK, JOHN BACKHOUSE, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 10th Nov., 1876, and served as asst. collr. and mag., and railway mag.; from Jan., 1884, served as asst. and joint judge and sessions judge; judge and sessions judge, March, 1894.

ALEXANDER, ERNEST BRUCE, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Repton; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 1st Nov., 1871, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., asst. settl. officer, junr. sec. to the board of rev., joint mag. and dep. collr., and dep. commr.; mag. and collr., Oct., 1880; in 1894 acted as sec. to govt. jud. dept.; commr., Nov., 1896; author of 'Gazetteer of Gorakhpur.'

ALEXANDER, JAMES WILLIAM, India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, June, 1865; asst. engr., Dec., 1866; asst. sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., Jan., 1868; exec. engr., March, 1870; suptg. engr., Feb., 1890.

ALEXANDER, MOSES, Store Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 3rd March, 1839.

ALEXANDER, NATHANIEL STUART, late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury Coll.; arrived, 10th July, 1858; from Oct., 1859, served in the Bengal rev. and jud. depts., and was apptd. mag. and collr., 1st grade, Jan., 1879; commr., Dacca, Aug., 1884; Bhagalpur, Dec., 1885; and Bardwan, Aug., 1887; retd., March, 1890.

ALGIE, WILLIAM, B.A., B.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. apprentice engr., 19th April, 1875, and posted to Burma; asst. engr., April, 1876; exec. engr., May, 1885; employed on irrig. works in Egypt, 1885-86.

ALI AHMAD HASSANALLY, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Karachi Mohammedan Sch., Bombay Univ., and Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived 27th Feb., 1866, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

ALISON, SIR ARCHIBALD, Bart., G.C.B., Gen.—First commn., ensign, 72nd foot, 3rd Nov., 1846; served in the Crimean campaign of 1855, and was present at siege of Sevastopol (medal and clasp and Turkish medal); served in the Indian Mutiny, and was mil. sec. to the commander-in-chief, Aug., 1857, to March, 1858; was present at relief of Lucknow (arm lost, medal and clasp, and C.B.); in staff employment, adjutant-gen.'s dept. at headquarters, and in the south western district, and at Aldershot, 1862-73; served in the Ashanti war of 1873-74 as brigadier-gen. of European brigade (thanks of both houses of parliament, medal with clasp, and K.C.B.); dep. adjutant-gen., headquarters, Ireland, 1874-77; commandant, staff college, 1878; dep. quartermaster-gen., intelligence branch, 1878-82; served in the Egyptian expdn. of 1882 as major-gen. in command of troops at Alexandria, and on the Mahmoudiyeh canal, and, in command of 3rd brigade, 2nd divn., at battle of Tel-el-Kebir (thanks of both houses of parliament, medal with clasp, bronze star, and 2nd class Osmanieh); promoted lieut.-gen. for distinguished service, Nov., 1882; commanding divn., Aldershot, Aug., 1883, to Feb., 1885; and again, Oct., 1885; adjutant-gen. to the forces, Feb.-Sept., 1885; G.C.B., June, 1887; member of the council of India, Jan., 1889.

ALLEN, BASIL COPLESTON, B.A., Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Haileybury and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 14th Dec., 1893, and served in Assam as asst. commr. and personal asst. to chief commr.

ALLEN, BERNARD, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Lancing Coll. and Trin. Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894, arrived 1st Dec., 1895, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

ALLEN, CHARLES FRANCIS EGERTON, B.A., B.L., late Jud. Dept., Burma.—Called to the bar (Inner Temple), 1871; admitted advocate of high court, Calcutta, Nov., 1873; law examr., Calcutta univ., Dec., 1874, and again in 1875 and 1876; acting judge of the Calcutta court of small causes, 1875-76; lecturer on English law, presidency coll., Calcutta, Feb., 1876, and prof'r. of law (temporary), May, 1877; served as govt. advocate, Rangoon, and acted as recorder of Rangoon for various periods; M.P. for Pembroke district, 1892-95.

ALLEN, CHARLES GEORGE HILLERSDEN, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Haileybury and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1833; arrived,
16th Dec., 1885, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and settl. officer; joint mag. and dep. collr., Jan., 1893; mag. and collr., Nov., 1896.

ALLEN, David Bird, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Eton, and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 5th Nov., 1873, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., asst. to dir.-gen. of statistics, and under the dir. of the agric. dept., May, 1885; joint mag. and dep. collr., Sept., 1897; mag. and collr., Aug., 1899.

ALLEN, Edward Cuthbert, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Charterhouse and Lincoln Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 6th Dec., 1895, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

ALLEN, Jeffery Julian, M.I.E.E., India Telegraph Dept.—Joined the service as asst. supt., 26th Nov., 1886; supt., Aug., 1881; dir., traffic branch, May, 1895.

ALLEN, Percy Underhill, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Univ. Coll. Sch., Cheltenham Coll., and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 21st Nov., 1888, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., April, 1892.

ALLEN, Thomas Taylor, late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Cork; apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 7th Feb., 1861, and served in the Beng. rev. and jud. depts.; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1866; district and sessions judge, March, 1875; supt. and remembrancer of legal affairs, Feb., 1883; served for various periods as member of legisl. council; retd., Nov., 1894.

ALLEN, Walter Griffith, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1874, and employed on state railways; exec. engr., May, 1883.

ALLEN, William, late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., and St. Catherine's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 10th Oct., 1868, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; junr. collr. and mag., Nov., 1886; senr. collr. and mag., Nov., 1891; retd., Sept., 1893.

ALLISON, Hazlett, M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service as surgn., Sept., 1873; arrived, 26th April, 1874, and served on mil. duty; fort surgn., Fort St. George, prof. of anatomy in the med. coll., and med. inspr. of seamen, Jan., 1888; fellow of Madras univ., Aug., 1892.

ALLSOPO, James George Whittlesea, Punjab Police.—Joined the police as asst. dist. supt., Nov. 1866; dist. supt., July, 1886.

AMBICA CHARAN SEN, M.A., Statutory C.S. (Bengal).—Apptd. under the native civil service rules asst. mag. and collr., 21st Jan., 1884; confd., 10th Feb., 1886; joint mag. and dep. collr., Jan., 1893; mag. and collr., Feb., 1897.

AMEER ALI, Syed, C.I.E., M.A., B.L., Bengal Jud. Dept.—Educ. at Calcutta Univ.; called to the bar (Inner Temple), 1873; presidency and chief presidency mag., 1878-81; member of the Bengal legisl. council, 1878-79, and 1881-83; member of the supreme legisl. council, 1884-85; Tagore law prof., 1884; C.I.E., 1887; judge of the high court at Calcutta, April, 1890; author of the 'Tagore Law Lectures for 1884.'

AMEER HOSSEIN, The Hon. Syed, C.I.E., Nawab, Bengal Jud. Dept.—Joined the service as offg. dep. mag. and dep. collr., 29th Aug., 1864; confd., 5th Feb., 1867; member of Bengal legisl. council, April, 1878; member of central exam. committee, April, 1886; addl. member of govrn.-gen.'s council, Dec., 1886, and again Dec., 1888; C.I.E., Jan., 1888; presidency mag., Calcutta, Nov., 1888; acted as coroner of Calcutta in 1888-89 and in 1896; and as inspr.-gen. of registrn. in 1893 and 1894.

AMIRTA LAL CHATTERJEE, B.L., late Bengal Jud. Dept.—From 19th May, 1862, served in the subord. jud. service; Bengal, subord. judge, April, 1873 to 1896.

ANDERSON, Alexander, C.I.E., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Gordon's Hosp., New Gr. Sch., and King's Coll., Aberdeen; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 4th Nov., 1872, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and forest settl. officer; dep. commr., March, 1889; C.I.E., Jan., 1897.

ANDERSON, Francis Charles, late Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Edinburgh Acad. and Repton Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 31st Oct., 1871, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., personal asst., and ass't sec. to the chief commr.; commr. of excise, supt. of stamps, and inspr.-gen. of registrn., Feb., 1882; sec. to chief commr., Jan., 1891; commr., Jabalpur, April, 1894; retd., Jan., 1893; prepared an excise manual for the Central Prov., 1885.

ANDERSON, Francis Geoffrey Hartnell, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Bath Coll. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1893, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; asst. pol. agent, Savanur, June, 1896.

ANDERSON, George Arthur, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1875, and posted to Central India; transfd. to state railways, Jan., 1878; exec. engr., Oct., 1885; offg. dep. consulting engr. for railways, Bombay, June, 1886; services lent to Bengal-Nagpur railway co., Nov., 1887; under sec. to Govt., P.W.D., Oct., 1896.

ANDERSON, Henry Aiken, C.S.I., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Edinburgh Acad. and Repton Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 13th Nov., 1873, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; asst. pol. officer, Kuram, Aug., 1880; dep. commr., May, 1889; acted as commr. and supt., Derajat, in 1892, also in 1893 and 1896; on special duty with Waziristan delimitation commn. in 1894; and from Feb., 1895; C.S.I., June, 1897.

ANDERSON, James, M.A., B.L., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 14th Nov., 1867; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. dep. commr., and mag. and collr.; on special duty connected with the Wahabi case, June, 1870; retd., 1888.

ANDERSON, James Arthur, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept. as asst. engr., 13th Dec., 1871; exec. engr., Dec., 1876; employed on the Sind-Pishin, Indus valley and E. Bengal railways; engr.-in-chief, Kashmir railway survey, Oct., 1890; supt., way and works, E. Bengal railway, July, 1892; suptg. engr., Oct., 1892; chief engr., March, 1896.

ANDERSON, James Drummond, Ind'ian
C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Rugby; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 14th Nov., 1875, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transf'd. to Assam, Jan., 1880, and served as asst. commr., and asst. sec. to chief commr.; dep. commr., April, 1889; returned to Bengal as mag. and collr., April, 1894; author of vocabularies of the Tippera-Deori-Chutia and Aka languages, and a collection of Kachari folk stories.

ANDERSON, JOHN ALEXANDER, B.L., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at the Gr. Sch. and Univ. of Aberdeen, and was also student of the Inner Temple; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1874, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; district judge, April, 1889; divnl. judge, June, 1894.

ANDERSON, JOHN W. M., Col., late Rev. Survey Dept., Bombay.—First commn., Jan., 1855; from Nov., 1862, served in the rev. survey dept., Mysore, as asst. supt. and dep. supt.; from April, 1881, served as supt. of the Sind settl. survey; retd., March, 1888.

ANDERSON, ROBERT HILDEBRAND, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 7th Dec., 1876, and served as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; district and sessions judge, Oct., 1893; acted as jud. commr., Chota Nagpur, in 1895.

ANDREW, JAMES, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Royal Sch., Armagh, and Kingstown Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 17th Nov., 1879, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settl. officer; head asst. to collr. and mag., N. Arcot, April, 1888; India principal asst., Ganjam, Dec., 1891; collr. and mag., Trichinopoly, Nov., 1895.

ANDREWS, WILLIAM, Accntn.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 30th March, 1876.

ANLEY, GEORGE AUGUSTUS D'AUVERGNE, late Public Works Dept., Bengal.—Apptd. exec. engr., 25th Jan., 1861; served in the Bengal public works dept., and temporarily under the municipality of Calcutta; offg. asst. to chief engr. and asst. sec. to the gov't. of Bengal, April, 1876; suptg. engr., March, 1882; retd., Nov., 1888.

ANNESLEY, ROBERT, Major, late Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov.—Entered the army in 1855, and served in the Crimean and Abyssinian campaigns; retd. in 1869; joined the service, 4th Jan., 1871, and served as asst. district supt. of police; cantonmt. mag., June, 1877; judge, small cause court, June, 1880; 1st class cantonmt. mag., Oct., 1886; retd., April, 1895.

ANSON, GEORGE WEYSS, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Oudh Commn.—First commn., 11th Jan., 1867; private sec. and A.D.C. to lieut.-gov'r., N.W. Prov., 1871, and 1875-78; from April, 1872, served as offg. cantonmt. mag. and offg. asst. commr.; confd. in latter appt., Sept., 1875, and in the former, Sept., 1877; agent, Balrampur estate, June, 1886; in addn. cantonmt. mag., Aug., 1887; agent and dep. commr., Nov., 1890.

ANTHONY, ADAM HENRY, Finl. Dept. Govt. of India.—Entered the dept., Oct., 1876; asst. comptr.-gen. in charge of paper currency, April, 1892.

APJOHN, JAMES HENRY, M.A., M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 22nd Dec., 1868, as asst. engr., and was employed on irrign. works in Bengal; exec. engr., Sept., 1873; services lent to Calcutta port commrs., March, 1887.

ARBUTHNOT, SIR ALEXANDER JOHN, K.C.S.I., C.I.E., late Madras C.S., late Member of the Council of India.—Educ. at Rugby and Haileybury Coll., and apptd. to the Madras civil service in 1842; arrived, Sept., 1842; served as asst. collr. and mag., Malayalam translr., sec. to the coll. and univ. boards, and dep. and acting registrar to the sadar court; dir. of public instrn., March, 1855; chief sec. to govt. and member of legisl. council, Oct., 1862; member of Madras council, Oct., 1867, to Oct., 1872; temporary govr. of Madras in the absence of Lord Napier, Feb.-May, 1872; retd. from the Madras civil service, Oct., 1874; member of govr.-gen.'s council, June, 1875, to April, 1880, and acted as prest. in 1878 and 1879; vice-chancellor of the univ. of Madras, Oct., 1871, and of the univ. of Calcutta, Oct., 1878; counsellor of the Empress of India, Jan., 1877; member of the council of India, 1st Nov., 1887—31st Oct., 1897; vice-pres., 1893-94; author of various publns. on educ. and other subjects in connection with India, among which are 'Reports of Selected Cases determined in the Court of Foujdari Adawlut,' 1851; 'Papers relating to Public Instruction in Madras,' 1855; 'A Memoir of Sir Thomas Munro,' 1881; &c.

ARBUTHNOT, SIR CHARLES GEORGE, G.C.B., Gen., R.A.—First commn., royal artillery, June, 1843; served in the Crimean campaign, 1855 (medal and clasp, 5th class Medjidie, Turkish medal); dep. adjutant-gen., royal artillery, in Bengal, 1873-77; acted as inspr.-gen. of ordnance, 1877-78; inspr.-gen. of artillery in India, Sept., 1878, to July, 1880, during which period he served as brigadier-gen. in the operations in Afghanistan (medal, K.C.B.); with the headquarters of the army in England, 1880-83; inspr.-gen. of artillery in England, 1883-85; prest., ordnance committee, 1885-86; commander-in-chief, and member of council, Bombay, Feb. to Dec., 1886; commander-in-chief, and member of council, Madras, Dec., 1886, to March, 1891; retd. May, 1891; G.C.B., May, 1894.

ARBUTHNOT, ROBERT EDWARD VAUGHAN, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at the Merchant Taylors' Sch., and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 15th Nov., 1892, and served in Burma as asst. commr.; under sec., Nov., 1897.

ARBUTHNOTT, JOHN CAMPBELL, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Fettes Coll., Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 21st Dec., 1879, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transf'd. to Assam, Feb., 1883, and served as asst. commr.; dep. commr., Nov., 1890.

ARCHER, CHARLES, Capt., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 9th Sept., 1882; entered civil employ, 8th Aug., 1887, as acting ass't. agent, Baluchistan; confd., May, 1889; asst. sec. to govt. of India, foreign dept., April, 1891; pol. agent in Zhob, Jan., 1894.

ARDAGH, SIR JOHN CHARLES, K.C.I.E., C.B., Maj.-Genl., R.E.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; entered royal engrs. as lieut., 1st April, 1859; attached to the special embassy during the congress at Berlin, June, 1878, and was made a C.B. (civil), July, 1878; apptd. asst. to commr. for the delimitation of the frontier of Bulgaria, Sept., 1878; commr. for the demarcation of the Greek frontier, June, 1881; served in the Egyptian campaign of 1882-84, including the operations at Alexandria, and the battle of Tel-el-Kebir (medal
with clasp, bronze star, and 4th class of Osmanieh; served in the Soudan in 1884, commanding royal engrs. and chief of the intelligence dept. (battles of Teb and Tamai; 2 clasps); C.B. (mil.), May, 1884; served in Soudan expedit., 1884-85; commandant of base at Cairo, and in the expedit. of 1885-86 with the frontier field force; received the 3rd class of the Medjidie; private sec. to the Marquess of Lansdowne, gov.r-gen. of India, from Dec., 1883, to Jan., 1894; C.I.E., Jan., 1892; K.C.I.E., Jan., 1894; commandant of sch. of mil. engrg., Chatham, April, 1895 to March, 1896; dir. of mil. intell., War Office, April, 1896.

ARGYLL (Duke of), His Grace GEORGE DOUGLAS CAMPBELL, K.G., K.T., P.C.—Born in 1823; succeeded to the dukedom in 1847; chancellor of the univ. of St. Andrew's, 1851; lord privy seal, 1852; postm.-gen., 1855; K.T., 1856; lord privy seal, 1859; in 1860 he was again apptd. postm.-gen., and subsequently lord privy seal; sec. of state for India, Dec., 1868, to Feb., 1874; lord privy seal, May, 1880; resigned in April, 1881; K.G., 1884; elected rector of the univ. of Glasgow, Nov., 1854; presided over the Glasgow meeting of the British association, 1855; prest. of the royal society of Edinburgh, 1861; is hereditary master of the Queen's household in Scotland, a trustee of the British museum, and hereditary sheriff and lord lieut. of Argyllshire; has publd. 'The Reign of Law,' 'Primeval Man,' 'The Eastern Question from the Treaty of Paris to the Treaty of Berlin, and to the second Afghan War,' &c.

ARMSTRONG, FRANCIS BUSFIELD, Finl. Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Cheltenham Proprietary Coll., and King Edward's Sch., Birmingham; junr. clerk, finl. dept., 30th March, 1869; senr. clerk, Sept., 1883.

ARMSTRONG, JOHN ARTHUR, Lieut.-Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., June, 1860; joined the dept., Nov., 1865, and served in the Punjab as asst. engr., and in the Hazara campaign, 1868, in charge of field telegraph; exec. engr., Sept., 1869; asst. to chief engr., and asst. sec. to govt., April, 1877; served in Kashmir on special roadwork, 1881-82; suptg. engr., March, 1886; retd., March, 1887.

ARMSTRONG, JOHN SCOBELL, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Marlborough Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 3rd March, 1866, and served in the rev. and jud. depts. in Bengal; dep. collr. of customs, Calcutta, Dec., 1877; mag. and collr., and collr. of customs, Calcutta, April, 1883; port commr., Calcutta, Nov., 1887; retd., July, 1892.

ARNOLD, GEORGE FREDERICK, B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch., and Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 1st Jan., 1894, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

ARNOTT, JAMES, M.D., C.M., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Med. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the Indian med. service, 1st April, 1867; arrived, 25th Oct., 1867, and was employed under the mil. dept. till Aug., 1868, including service in the Abyssinian expedit. (medal); and subsequently as asst.-surgn. in the David Sassoon hosp., Poona, and in the European gen. hosp., Bombay, and as profr. of pathology in the Grant med. coll.; surgn., European gen. hosp., Bombay, March-April, 1882; prof. of midwifery, Grant med. coll. and obstetric physician, Jamsetji Jijibhoy hosp., April, 1882; physician, European gen. hosp., May, 1891; ditto, St. George's hosp., Dec., 1895.

ARNOTT, NAPOLEON, Maj.-Gen., R.E., Mil. Works Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 22nd Dec., 1865; arrived, 13th Dec., 1868, and served in Bengal and the Punjab on irrign. duty; exec. engr., Jan., 1879; offic. as sec. to agent to govr.-gen., Baluchistan, and as sec. to defence committee in 1882; employed on special defence works, Aug., 1887; suptg. engr., Dec., 1889; dep. dir.-gen., mil. works, Sept., 1896; transfd. to Madras command as chief engr., Mar., 1894; dir.-gen. of mil. works in India, June, 1896.

ARTHUR, SIGISMUND RAYNOR, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Charterhouse, and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 19th Nov., 1888, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settlt. officer; 2nd asst., March, 1896.

ARUNDEL, ARUNDEL TAGG, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 18th Nov., 1865, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; private sec. to govr. of Madras, July, 1875; prest. of the municipal commn., Madras, June, 1881; fellow of the Madras univ., March, 1882; principal asst. to collr. and mag., Vizagapatam, Oct., 1884; district and sessions judge, Kista, Dec., 1884; collr. and mag., Kista, Aug., 1887; member, board of rev., and member of legisl. council, Jan., 1894; sec. to govt., rev. dept., Dec., 1896.

ARUNDELL, EDWARD WILLIAM, B.A., F.C.H., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1874, and employed on surveys and other railway work in the Punjab; exec. engr., May, 1883; dep. consulting engr. to govt. of India for railways, central divn., May, 1887; Lucknow, Nov., 1894; suptg. engr., April, 1897.

ASGHAR ALI, SHEIKH, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Christ's Coll., Camb., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived, 16th Dec., 1896, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

ASHBURNER, LIONEL R., C.S.I., late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1848; served in the rev. and jud. depts. in Broach, Surat, and Kaira; on the outbreak of the Mutiny was apptd. supt. of police, Kaira, and organised a body of horse and foot for the protection of the eastern frontier; special commr. for trial of rebels, 1858; collr. and mag., Khandesh, 1861; rev. and police commr., N. divn., 1872; member of council, Bombay, Aug., 1877; acted as govr., 13th March to 28th April, 1880; retd., 1883.

ASHE, ROBERT WILLIAM D'ESTCOURT, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Dublin High Sch., at the Royal Univ. of Ireland, and Trin. Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 4th Dec., 1895, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

ASHTON, GEORGE, Finl. Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 7th April, 1884.

ASHWORTH, ERNEST HORATIO, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch. and St. John's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 11th Dec., 1894, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

ASTON, HENRY FAURE, B.L., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at the S. African Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 9th Oct., 1869, and
served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., railway mag., and cantonmt. mag.; 1st grade asst. judge and sessions judge, Aug., 1883; jud. asst., Kathiawar, March, 1885; judge and sessions judge, Nov., 1886; on special duty in connection with settlt. cases, Baroda, in 1888; offg. jud. commr., Lower Burma, April, 1894; and Jan.–May, 1895.

ATA-ULLAH KHAN, Mirza, Sardar Bahadur, Hon. Lieut.-Col.—British agent at Kabul, June, 1885; retd., June, 1891.

ATKINS, CHARLES HERBERT, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at King Henry VIII's Sch., Coventry, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 30th Nov., 1891, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

ATKINS, JOHN DE COURCY, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Univ. Coll. Sch., London Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 9th Nov., 1880, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settlt. officer; under sec. to govt. in the fin. and rev. depts.; dep. acctnt.-gen., post mr.-gen.; collr., and dist. mag.; junr. sec. to govt. in the gen. educ. &c., depts., April, 1895; sec. to govt., July, 1896.

ATKINSON, FREDERIC JAMES, Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the service as probr., 9th July, 1873, and served as district grain acctnt. in Bengal, and as asst. acctnt.-gen., in Bombay, Bengal, and N.W. Prov.; ast. comptr., Burma, Dec., 1888; dep. acctnt.-gen., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, June, 1891; dep. acctnt.-gen., Bengal, March, 1896.

ATKINSON, JOHN NATHANIEL, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Marlborough Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1878, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. sessions judge; on special duty under the commr. of salt rev., April, 1885; head asst. to collr. and mag., Sept., 1886; sub-collr. and joint mag., Jan., 1891; collr. and mag., Dec., 1894.

ATKINSON, ROBERT PHILIP, A.M.I.C.E., Public Works Dept.—Apptd. from Roy. Ind. Engineering Coll., 1st Oct., 1876, as ast. engr., posted to N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr.; Jan., 1885; employed on the Ganges Canal.

ATLAY, Ven. B. T., M.A., late Ecclesl. Dept., Bengal.—Arrived, 17th Oct., 1867; chaplain of St. Paul's Cathedral and of the gen. hosp., Dec., 1867; senr. chaplain, Oct., 1877; senr. chaplain, St. Paul's Cathedral, and chaplain of the gen. hosp. and presidency jail, Jan., 1882; commissary to the lord bishop, and offg. chaplain in charge of the diocese, March, 1883; archdeacon of Calcutta, Sept., 1883; retd., 1889, and was apptd. vicar of Willesden.

ATUL CHUNDER DUTT, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Free Church Instn., Calcutta, and at Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 14th Jan., 1890, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., Dec. 1896.

AUCOTT, ELLIOTT, Funds Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 27th Feb., 1886.

AULAD HUSSAIN, C.I.E., Khan Bahadur, Central Prov. Commn.—Joined the service, 29th July, 1844; served in various subord. posts till Dec., 1864, when he was apptd. extra ast. commr.; C.I.E., Jan., 1882; ast. commr., Sept., 1883; settlt. officer, Jan., 1885; also ast. commr., June, 1890.

AUSTIN, ROBERT FREDERICK, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch. and Univ. Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 23rd Dec., 1894, and served in Madras as ast. collr. and mag.

AUSTIN, WARE PLUMPTRE, late Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch., and Gloucester Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 28th Dec., 1864, and served in Madras as ast. mag. and collr., and sub-collr. and joint mag.; district and sessions judge, Oct., 1884, and again in 1888; collr. and mag., Nov., 1886; collr. of sea customs, and of the Madras district, protector of emigrants, supt. of stamps and stationery, and chairman of the harbour trust board, Nov., 1891, retd., May, 1897.

AYLING, WILLIAM BOCK, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Weymouth Coll. and Magdalene Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 30th Jan., 1889, and served in Madras as ast. collr. and mag.; head assist. Oct., 1895.

BADCOCK, FRANCIS WILLIAM, late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Harrow Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 24th Nov., 1869, and served in Bengal as ast. mag., joint mag., and dep. collr., and settlt. officer; offg. inspr.-gen. of registrn., March, 1879; joint mag. and dep. collr., Oct., 1881; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1888; retd., March, 1895.

BADDELEY, WILLIAM LEWIS CLINTON, Major, R.E., Madras Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., 23rd July, 1874; ast. engr., Aug., 1875; exec. engr., May, 1883; dep. chief engr. and under sec., public works dept., Nov., 1886, to March, 1891.

BADEN-POWELL, BADEN HENRY, C.I.E., late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861; ast. commr., May, 1862; from July, 1866, to April, 1869, served as small cause court judge, Lahore, and subsequently in the forest dept.; addl. commr., Lahore and Rawalpindi, Oct., 1881; dep. commr., Dec., 1882; judge, chief court, Punjab, March, 1889; retd., May, 1889, but employed for a time under govt. of India, rev. and agric. dept.; has publd. 'Punjab Products,' 'Punjab Manufactures,' 'Manual of the Land Revenue System and Land Tenures of British India,' and 'Manual of Jurisprudence for Forest Officers.'

BADGLEY, WILLIAM FRANCIS, Col., I.S.C., late Survey of India.—First commn., April, 1857; arrived, May, 1857; served during the Mutiny in Central India and Oudh, and afterwards with the Lushai expdn. in charge of a survey party (medals and clasp); apptd. to the topogr. survey, May, 1865, and was employed in Rewa and Bundelkhand, and in the Khasi, Garo, and Naga Hills; dep. supt., Dec., 1880; in charge of Gujarat survey, March, 1884; offg. ast. surveyor-gen. in charge of photo. and litho. offices, March, 1886; retd., June, 1889.

BADOCK, HENRY WALTER, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Junn. clerk, 11th Feb., 1876; senr. clerk, June, 1893.

BADROODIN TYABJI, Barr.-at-Law.—Judge of High Court, Bombay, July, 1895.

BAGLEY, FREDERICK ROBERT, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 16th Sept., 1871, and was employed on road works in the Central Prov., and on famine relief works in Bengal; transf. to state railways, and employed in Burma on railway survey and construction; exec. engr., May,
1883; supt. engr., Dec., 1896; has received the India medal and two Burma clasps.

BAGNELL, Henry William James, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Eastbourne Coll., Keble Coll., Oxford, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 1st Nov., 1882, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settlt. officer.

BAGSHAWE, Cecil, Forest Dept., Haidarabad Administration.—Joined the service as temporary sub-asst. conservator, 26th Oct., 1869; asst. conservator, 14th Aug., 1871; dep. conservator, Oct., 1876; employed in the mil. dept. in the Kuram valley, Aug., 1879, and at the forest sch., Dehra Dun, Dec., 1879; conservator, Jan., 1880.

BAGSHAWE, Frank Theodore, Madras Police Dept.—Entered the service May, 1869, and served in rev. dept. till June, 1876; then in police dept. as asst. supt. and supt.; dep. insp. gen. July, 1865; commr. of police, Madras city, Nov., 1895; acting inspr.-gen., Dec., 1896-May, 1897.

BAILEY, Frederick, Lieut.-Col., R.E., late Forest Dept., N.W. Prov.—Arrived as a lieut., 12th Nov., 1864; served under the mil. dept. till July, 1876, when he was apptd. asst. engr.; exec. engr., June, 1871; from Aug., 1871, served in the forest dept. as dep. conservator and supt. of forest surveys; conservator of forests, and dir. of Indian forest sch., in addn. to his duties as supt. of forest surveys, Sept., 1878; retd., April, 1892; is lecturer on forestry at Edinburgh univ., and sec. to royal Scottish geographical society.

BAILEY, Richard Jones, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 25th Oct., 1872, and posted to the mil. works branch in the Punjab; transfd. to Burma, Jan., 1881; exec. engr., May, 1883.

BAILLIE, Duncan Colvin, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Inverness Acad., Glasgow Acad., and Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 10th Nov., 1879, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., asst. commr., and asst. settlt. officer; joint mag., Sept., 1889; provl. supt. of census operations, April, 1890, and prepared the report; dep. commr., April, 1894; mag. and collr., Feb., 1896.

BAINBRIDGE, George, M.D., Surgn.-Col. Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 1st April, 1867; arrived, 25th Oct., 1867, and served in Bombay as civil surgn. and in various acting appts.; civil surgn., Karachi, Dec., 1891; princ. med. officer, Sind dist., Oct., 1896.

BAINES, Jervoise Athelstan, C.S.I.; late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Rugby, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 12th Nov., 1870, and served as asst. collr. and mag., asst. pol. agent, and cantonmt. and railway mag.; dep. supt. of census operations in Bombay presidency, and under sec. to govt., gen. dept. (census), April, 1880; 2nd asst. collr. and forest settlt. officer, Dec., 1882; on special duty to supervise the work under the income tax act in the Bombay presidency, May, 1886; also acting as dir. of agric. from Dec., 1886; 1st asst. collr. and mag., Oct.-Nov., 1886; served under the govt. of India as census commr. for India from Aug., 1889; on depn. to England to complete census report, May, 1892; on depn. at India office, July, 1893, and prepared decennial report on moral and material progress of India, 1891-92; C.S.I., Jan., 1894; sec. to royal commn. on opium, June, 1894, to March, 1895; retd., Sept., 1895.

BAIRD, Andrew Wilson, C.S.I., F.R.S., Col., R.E., late Mint Dept., Calcutta.—Lieut., royal engrs., Dec., 1861; arrived, March, 1863, and served in the Bombay public works dept. as asst. engr., and was employed on the harbour defences and reclamations; exec. engr., Oct., 1867; served in the Abyssinian expdn. as asst. field engr., 1868 (medal); from Dec., 1868, served in the trigonl. survey as asst. surveyor, and was employed in Kathiawar and Gujarat; asst. supt., Oct., 1871; in July, 1877, was apptd. to the general superintendence and control of tidal observations upon the Indian coasts; on depn. as commr., Venice geographical congress and exhibn., Aug., 1881; dep. supt., July, 1882; mint master, Calcutta, Aug., 1889; author of various papers and reports on tidal observations, and other works; and joint author of the annual tide tables for Indian ports.

BAKER, Charles Maurice, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Tonbridge Gr. Sch. and Trin. Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 6th Dec., 1895, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

BAKER, Edward Norman, Indian C.S.—Educ. at Christ's Coll., Finchley; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 15th Nov., 1878, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; under sec. govt. of Bengal, finl. dept., May, 1885; acted as under sec., govt. of India, fin. and commerce dept., in 1885; dep. commr., June, 1890; dep. sec. to govt. of India, fin. and commerce dept., Sept., 1892; mag. and collr., Aug., 1895; collr. of customs, April, 1897.

BAKER, Francis, late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Berkhamstead Gr. Sch. and Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 13th Nov., 1869, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and first asst. sec. to govt.; private sec. to lieut.-govr., N.W. Prov., April, 1874; junr. sec. board of rev., May, 1878; under sec. to govt., May, 1881; supt. of Dehra Dun, March, 1884; joint mag., Aug., 1886; dep. commr., March, 1888; mag. and collr., March, 1889; offg. commr., Allahabad, April, 1895; retd., Dec., 1896.

BAKER, Harry Victor Sampson, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1875, and employed on irrign. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., May, 1883; under sec. to govt., Punjab, public works dept., 1892-94.

BAKER, Montagu Bernard, late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Winchester, and Pembroke Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 29th Nov., 1864, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and in Sind as acting jud. commr. and judge of the sadar court; judge and sessions judge, May, 1882; retd., June, 1891.

BAKER, Oswald, Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Med. Dept., Burma.—Joined the Bengal med. service, 1873; was employed under the mil. dept. up to May, 1874, and served subsequently in Burma as civil surgn. and supt. of jail; med. officer to the mission to Siam under Major C. W. Street, Feb., 1879; offg. inspr.-gen. of jails for Burma, May, 1887; joint med. officer, Simla, Sept., 1889; junr. civil surgeon, Rangoon, Nov., 1890.

BAKEWELL, James Herbert, LL.B., B.L., Madras Jud. Dept.—Apptd. dep. registrar
High Court, original side, Madras, May, 1896.

BALFOUR, CHARLES FREDERICK, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Clifton Sch. and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived, 8th Dec., 1896, and served in the N.W.P. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

BALTHASAR, GUSTAVE, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch. and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 29th Nov., 1893, and served in Assam as asst. commr.

BAMBER, HENRY WILLIAM JOHN, late Police Dept., Bengal.—From 1st Oct., 1857, to May, 1862, served as asst. supt., and supt. of salt chowkies; from May, 1862, served in the Bengal police dept., and was promoted to district supt., 1st grade, Aug., 1885; retd., July, 1891.

BANERJEE, DURGAGATI, C.I.E., Rai Bahadur, Bengal Administration.—Joined the service, Aug., 1865, and held various subord. posts till April, 1889, when he was apptd. dep. collr. of Calcutta, supt. of excise rev., &c.; C.I.E., Jan., 1895; member of provl. legisl. council, March, 1895.

BANERJEE, GOOROO DASS, M.A., D.L., Jud. Dept., Bengal.—Educ. at the Presidency Coll., Calcutta, and Calcutta Univ.; asst. lecturer on mathematics at that coll., 1865; law lecturer, Berhampur coll., 1866-72; Tagore law prof., 1878; judge, high court, Calcutta, Jan., 1889; member of Bengal legisl. council, 1888; vice-chancellor of Calcutta univ., 1890-92; author of 'The Hindu Law of Marriage and Stridhan.'

BANERJI, ALBION RAJ, KUMAR, M.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Calcutta Univ. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived 16th Dec., 1895, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

BANKS, CHARLES, M.B.—Entered the Service 7th June, 1892; civil med. officer, Noakhali, November, 1893; protector of emigrants and supt. of emigration, Calcutta, May, 1897.

BANKS, SAMUEL HENRY O'BRIEN, F.R.C.S., Surgn.-Col., Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Oct., 1866, and arrived, 17th April, 1867; served in the Abyssinian campaign, and afterwards on civil, mil., and jail duty; presidency surgn., Nov., 1888; principal med. officer, Nagpur, Oct., 1895.

BANNERMAN, PATRICK WILSON, Col., I.S.C., late Pol. Dept., Govt. of India.—Ensign, Bombay army, June, 1852; asst. to the supt., Nimach, July, 1859; asst. to govr.-gen.'s agent, Central India, 1860; pol. asst., Bhopawar, Aug., 1865; also Bhil agent and commandant, Malwa Bhil corps; pol. agent, Rewa, March, 1871; pol. agent, Bhopal, 1880; rest., E. states, Rajputana, Oct., 1881; rest., Gwalior, March, 1882; acted as agent to govr.-gen. for Central India in 1883-84, and again in 1887; reverted to mil. dept., 1888.

BANNERMAN, WILLIAM BURNEY, M.D., Surgn.-Major, Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service 29th Sept., 1883; on mil. duty till 1891; Inspir. of vaccn. and dep. sany. commr., Dec., 1893.

BANTON, WILLIAM HERBERT PHILIPPE, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Writer, India office, 5th Aug., 1875; clerk specially attached, 26th March, 1893.

BARADA CHARAN MITRA, M.A., Statutory C.S. (Bengal).—Apptd. undernative civil service rules asst. mag. and collr., 30th March, 1886; confd., 23rd March, 1888; asst. settlt. officer, Orissa, March, 1891; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1894.

BARBOUR, SIR DAVID MILLER, K.C.S.I., late Indian C.S.—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 20th Dec., 1863, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; under sec., govt. of India, finl. dept., Aug., 1873; acctnt.-gen., Punjab, and dep. commr., paper currency, Lahore circle, June, 1877; offg. sec., govt. of Bengal, finl. dept., April, 1878; acctnt.-gen., Madras, and commr. of paper currency, Jan., 1880; acctnt.-gen., Bengal, Sept., 1881; offg. sec., govt. of Bengal, rev. and gen. depts., Jan., 1882; Bengal legisl. council, Jan. to Oct., 1882; sec., govt. of India, dept. of fin. and commerce, July, 1882; C.S.I., Feb., 1887; on special duty in England as member of the royal commn. on currency in 1886; finl. member of council of govr.-gen., Nov., 1883, to Nov., 1893; K.C.S.I., Jan., 1889; member of royal commn. on finl. relations between Great Britain and Ireland, May, 1894; author of 'The Theory of Bimetallism.'

BARCLAY, ERNEST, Jud. Dept., Madras.—Served from 18th Sept., 1861, as French interpreter to the supreme court, Madras, acting dep. clerk of the crown and acting asst. registrar; apptd. govt. solicitor, Feb., 1876.

BARCLAY, PRINGLE DAVID, late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., March, 1875, as asst. traffic supt., Rajputana state railway; traffic supt., Punjab N. railway, March, 1881; E. Bengal railway, June, 1884; retd., 1896.

BARKER, FREDRICK CHARLES, Brig. Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., I.M.S., Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Oct., 1869; mil. duty to 15th Dec., 1871; civil surgn., Oct., 1874; presy. surgn., marine surgn., and in med. charge Elphinstone Coll., Oct., 1895.

BARKLEY, DAVID GRAHAM, M.A., B.L., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 29th Dec., 1877, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Punjab as asst. mag. and collr., asst. commr., personal asst. to commr., Ambala, and asst. sessions judge; dep. commr., Oct., 1874; addl. commr., Delhi, May, 1876, and subsequently at Jalandhar and Lahore; offd. as judge, chief court, Punjab, 1878 and 1880; civil and sessions judge, Nov., 1880; commr. and supt., Multan, Sept., 1881; addl. judge, chief court, Jan., 1882; addl. member of govr.-gen.'s council, 1883 and 1884; judge of the chief court, Punjab, Feb., 1886; retd., Jan., 1887; has publd. 'Directions to Rev. and Settlt. Officers, Non-Regulation Law.'

BARLOW, SIR RICHARD WELLESLEY, Bart., late Madras C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1855, and served in the rev. and jud. depts., Madras; from 1871 to 1878 served as collr. and mag. of Chengalpat, and subsequently as commr., Nilgiris, 1878-80, and 1881; major commandant Nilgiri volunteer rifles, 1878-79; acted as member of the board of rev. in 1880, and again in 1881 and 1886; collr. and mag., and addl. sessions judge, Nilgiris, Feb., 1882; collr. of sea customs, &c., Madras, Jan., 1883; acting rest., Travancore and Cochin, Feb. to Aug., 1884; member of the legisl. council, Madras, Sept., 1885; chairman of the harbour trust board, May, 1886; supt. of stamps and stationery, April, 1887, in addn.; retd., Nov., 1889.
BARNES, HERBERT CHARLES, B.A., Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Westminster Sch. and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 13th Dec., 1894, and served in Assam as asst. commr., and personal asst. to chief commr.

BARNES, HUGH SHAKESPEAR, C.S.I., Indian C.S., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Educ. at Malvern Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 30th Oct., 1874, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; transf'd. to finl. dept. of govt. of India, Dec., 1876, and apptd. asst. acctnt.-gen. in the N.W. Prov.; private sec. to the finl. member of the govrn.-gen.'s council, Dec., 1876; acted as under sec. in the home dept. in 1878; on special duty under the foreign dept., Nov., 1879; asst. to rest., Kandahar, Nov., 1880; served in the Afghan campaign, 1881, as pol. officer with Gen. Wilkinson's brigade; asst. to the govrn.-gen.'s agent in Baluchistan, 1881-83; pol. agent in Quetta and Pishin, June, 1883; in charge of arrangements, supplies, &c., for passage of Afghan boundary commn., across Baluch desert, Aug., 1884; under sec. to govt. of India, foreign dept., May, 1890; rev. commr., Baluchistan, Dec., 1890; offd. as govrn.-gen.'s agent and chief commn. in 1891 and 1892; rest., Kashmir, March, 1895; offd. as sec. to govt. of India, Foreign Dept., March, 1896; rest. and agent for govrn. genl. in Beluchistan, June, 1896; C.S.I., June, 1897.

BARNIVILLE, JOHN JOSEPH, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at the Univ. of Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 3rd Dec., 1896, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

BARR, DAVID WILLIAM KEITH, C.S.I., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Sept., 1864; served in Abyssinian expedn. (medal); boundary commr., Rewa Kantha, and Malwa Bhil agency, 1869; pol. asst. and boundary officer, Bhopal, July, 1869; asst. to govrn.-gen.'s agent, Central India, 1870; offg. pol. agent, Jodhpur, 1878-79; pol. agent, Bha-gelkhand, July, 1881; also supt., Rewa state; rest. at Gwalior, May, 1887; rest. in Kashmir, Nov., 1893; govrn.-gen.'s agent in Central India, March, 1895; C.S.I., Jan., 1896.

BARRETT, EDWIN CLIFFORD, Survey of India Dept.—Apptd. proby. asst. surveyor, Indus-Sind rev. survey, 18th Nov., 1862; asst. supt., Dec., 1868; accompanied Lushai expedn., 1871-72 (medal and clasp); dep. supt., Oct., 1884; supt. (new scale), Aug., 1892.

BARRON, ALBERT HENRY, India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 27th May, 1868, as asst. engr., and was employed on irrign. work in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., Sept., 1875.

BARRON, CLAUD ALEXANDER, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at the Aberdeen Gr. Sch., Aberdeen Univ., and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 12th Nov., 1892, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; under sec. to govt., rev. dept., May, 1896.

BARROW, FRANK, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Oudh Commn.—Educ. at Bruton Gr. Sch., Victoria Coll., Jersey, and Cheltenham Coll.; first commn., 6th Nov., 1863; from Aug., 1869, served as asst. commr. in Oudh, offg. junr. sec. to the chief commr., and offg. cantonmt. mag.; dep. commr., June, 1889; retd., May, 1896.

BARROW, FRANK HUNTER, late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Bruton and Felsted Gr. Schs., and Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 17th Jan., 1870, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Nov., 1881; mag. and collr., March, 1887; retd., Aug., 1894.

BARROW, OSCAR THEODORE, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Gloucester Coll. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1877, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transf'd. to finl. dept., govt. of India, Dec., 1882; asst. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, March, 1887; dep. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, April, 1887; offg. acctnt.-gen. and dep. commr., paper currency, N.W. Prov., May, 1888; acctnt.-gen., Bengal, April, 1891; acctnt.-gen., Bombay, March, 1894.

BARROW, REGINALD POCKOCK, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Oxford Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 13th Nov., 1885, and served in Sind as asst. collr. and mag., and asst., and forest settlt. officer; 1st asst., July, 1896.

BARROW, WILLIAM FRANCIS, India Public Works dept.—Joined the service as accountant, May, 1874; served in the office of examiner of public works accounts, asst. examiner, July, 1877; dept. examiner, July, 1880; examiner May, 1886.

BARRY, THOMAS DAVID COLLIS, Surgn.-Capt., Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the dept., 27th May, 1889, as acting chemical analyser, prof. of chemistry and med. jurisprudence, Grant med. coll., and prof. of chemistry, Elphinstone coll.; confd. in these posts, April, 1892.

BARRY, WILLIAM, M.R.C.S., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the High Sch. and Univ. of Glasgow, and Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 14th Feb., 1863, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; employed on famine duty in Bengal, 1873-75; joint mag. and dep. collr., Banda, Aug., 1877; from May, 1881, served in the jud. dept. and was apptd. district and sessions judge, Nov., 1882; retd., March, 1890.

BARSTOW, HENRY CLEMENTS, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; served under the govt. of India, foreign dept., Jan., 1874, to Oct., 1875, as offg. pol. agent, Bhopal; offg. supt., Dehra Dun, Feb., 1876; mag. and collr., Cawnpore, April, 1880; retd., Nov., 1886.

BARTER, JOSEPH FRANCIS, Brigade-Surgn., late Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service, July, 1859; from April, 1862, served in the Central Prov. as civil surgn. and supt. of jail, and acted for various periods as inspr.-gen. of jails; sanitary commr., supt. of vaccn., and inspr.-gen. of dispensaries, Dec., 1878; civil surgn. and supt. of lunatic asylum, Nagpur, July, 1883; retd., April, 1890.

BARTHOLOMEUSZ, MATHEW LORENZ, M.B., C.M., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 30th Sept., 1873, and served on mil. duty, and as med. officer at Zanzibar; civil surgn., Sukkur, April, 1884; transf'd. to Nasik, June, 1888; civil surgn., supt. of lunatic asylum, &c., Ahmadabad, Nov., 1889.
BARTHOLOMEW, ROBERT, Lieut.-Col., Bengal Cavalry, late Punjab Commn.—Arrived 2nd April, 1862; from 1st Aug., 1866, served in the Punjab commn. as asst. commr.; jud. asst., Sept., 1883; district judge, 1st grade, Delhi, offg. as civil judge, Nov., 1884; dep. commr., July, 1886; retd., April, 1894.

BARTLETT, HUBERT FREDERICK, late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Marlborough Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 25th Oct., 1871, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; transf'd. to the N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Jan., 1880, and served as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; mag. and collr., July, 1889; offd. as district and sessions judge, June, 1895–Jan., 1896; retd. March, 1897.

BARTLETT, THOMAS WALTER, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 31st Jan., 1871, as asst. engr., and was employed on Rajputana state railway; exec. engr., Jan., 1880; supt. of works, Bolan railway, April, 1885; services lent to Bengal-Nagpur railway co., Jan., 1888; transf'd. to Madras, Nov., 1889, and employed on Villupuram-Guntakal and E. Bengal state railways.

BARTON, FRANCIS JOHN HERBERT, Captain, Indian Staff Corps, Pol. Dept., Punjab.—Joined the service, 23rd April, 1881; in mil. employ till July, 1892; commdt. Port Blair, July, 1892; European asst. to pol. offr., Khyber, April, 1897; offg. commdt., Khyber rifles, May, 1897.

BARTON, WILLIAM PELL, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Bedford Modern Sch. and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 17th Dec., 1894, and served in the Punjab as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., Sept., 1895.

BATCHELOR, STANLEY LOCKHART, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at St. Edmund's Coll., Wore, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 1st Dec., 1889, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 2nd asst., May, 1890; under sec. to govt. pol. dept., Sept., 1896.

BATE, THOMAS ELWOOD LINDSAY, Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Jail Dept., Punjab.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1875; arrived, 14th Nov., 1875; served in mil. dept. to Nov., 1880, when he was apptd. civil surgn., Gujrat; inspr.-gen. of prisons, Punjab, April, 1891.

BATTEN, HALLET GEORGE, Burma Commn.—Joined the service, 17th Oct., 1869, and on 13th Feb., 1871, was apptd. extra asst. commr., Burma; asst. commr., Nov., 1877, and dep. commr., May, 1888; served also as cantonmt. mag. and judge of small cause court in 1886-87.

BATTEN, JOHN KAYE, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Haileybury Coll., and at Oriel Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 29th Nov., 1887, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; special asst., Malabar, Nov., 1893; head asst., Jan., 1895.

BATTY, HERBERT, M.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 31st Oct., 1870, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., prof. of logic and moral philosophy in the Deccan coll., Poona (1872-75), and asst. judge and sessions judge; under sec. to govt. of Bombay, pol., &c., depts., and sec. to the legisl. council, Nov., 1885; acting chief presidency mag., Bombay, April, 1888; remembrancer of legal affairs, June, 1892; member of legisl. council, June, 1893, and again, July, 1895; acting chief sec. to govt., pol., &c., depts., July, 1896.

BAXTER, BERNARD, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 1st Nov., 1871, and employed on state railways in Sind and Baluchistan; transf'd. to Bengal, April, 1881; exec. engr., May, 1883; employed in Burma, April, 1888; and in Madras, on E. Coast railway, from Nov., 1889; engineer-in-chief, July, 1897.

BAYLAY, CHARLES ALLEN, Col., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Lieut., Bengal artillery, Dec., 1857; asst. commr., Berar, Jan., 1866, and subsequently in Ludhiana; pol. asst., Rajputana, 1868-70; asst. gen. supt. for thagi and dakaiti, Dec., 1870; pol. agent, Haroati and Tonk, 1876; pol. agent, Kotah, Dec., 1879; acted as rest. W. states of Rajputana, in 1884; retd., May, 1890.

BAYLEY, CHARLES STUART, B.L., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Harrow and Heidelberg; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 31st Dec., 1877, and served as asst. mag. and collr. in Bengal, offg. asst. sec. to chief commr. of Assam, July, 1880, and offg. under sec. to govt. of Bengal; member of exec. committee, Calcutta international exhibt. of 1883-84; offg. registrar, high court, March, 1884; under sec. to govt. of India, rev. and agric. dept., April, 1885; asst. commr., Ajmir, Sept., 1886; pol. agent, Bikanir, June, 1888; joint mag. and dep. collr., Jan., 1889; pol. agent, Bikanir, Sept., 1891; offg. gen. supt., thagi and dakaiti dept., April, 1894; addl. private sec. to viceroy, Dec., 1894, rest. at Jaipore, April, 1897.

BAYLEY, SIR LYTTELTON HOLYOAKE, Kt., B.L., late Jud. Dept., Bombay.—Called to the bar (Middle Temple), May, 1850; apptd. advocate-gen., Bombay, 17th March, 1866; judge of the high court, Bombay, June, 1869; acted as chief justice for various periods; retd., June, 1895; Kt., Jan., 1896.

BAYLEY, SIR STEUART COLVIN, K.C.S.I., C.I.E., late Bengal C.S., Council of India.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 4th March, 1856, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., junr. sec. to govt., and mag. and collr.; commr., Dacca divn., July, 1873, and Patna divn., Sept., 1873; sec., govt. of Bengal, May, 1877; addl. sec., govt. of India, finl. dept., Aug., 1877; personal asst. to the viceroy, for famine affairs, Sept., 1877; addl. sec., govt. of India, public works dept., famine branch, in addn., Dec., 1877; sec., govt. of India, home dept., June, 1878; offg. chief commr., Assam, June, 1878; offg. lieut.-govr. of Bengal, July-Nov., 1879; chief commr. of Assam, June, 1880; rest., Haidarabad, March, 1881; member of govr.-gen.'s council, May, 1882; lieut.-govr. of Bengal, April, 1887; retd., Dec., 1890; apptd. sec., pol. and secret dept., India office, Dec., 1890; member of council of India, Sept., 1895.

BAYLY, WILLIAM GOODENOUGH, B.A., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to the accs. branch as asst. controller, 28th July, 1868; dep. controller, Nov., 1871; asst. examr., April, 1872; dep. examr., July, 1877; examr., Jan., 1882; examr., public works acts, Burma, Feb., 1889; retd., Aug., 1893.
BAYNE, CHARLES GERWIEN, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Uppingham, and Univ. Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 27th Dec., 1880, and served in British Burma as asst. commr.; junr. sec. to chief commr., April, 1886; under sec., April, 1887; dep. commr., Nov., 1888; junr. sec. to chief commr., Dec., 1890; sec., March, 1891; offg. chief sec., March-July, 1892; rev. sec., March, 1893.

BEACHCROFT, CHARLES PORTER, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Rugby, and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 29th Nov., 1892, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

BEACHCROFT, FRANCIS PORTEN, B.A., B.L., late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Rugby, and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 12th Nov., 1864, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; jud. asst., April, 1878; dep. commr., Dec., 1883; divl. judge, Nov., 1884; offd. as judge of chief court, Punjab, in 1890 and 1891; retd., Nov., 1891.

BEADON, CECIL, Lieut.-Col., Madras Cavalry, late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 24th March, 1858; from May, 1862, served in the Punjab commn. as asst. commr., cantonmt. mag., and jud. asst.; dep. commr., March, 1877; offd. as commr. and supt. at various periods; reverted to mil. dept., Oct., 1893.

BEADON, GUY CECIL, Capt. Indian Staff Corps, Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 11th Oct., 1884; in mil. employ till Dec., 1887; served in Punjab commn. as asst. commr.; dist. judge, June, 1894.

BEAMAN, FRANK CLEMENT OFFLEY, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Bedford Gr. Sch., and Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 22nd Dec., 1879, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; from April, 1883, served in the jud. dept.; special settlt. officer, Baroda, 1886 and 1887; asst. judge, April, 1890; jud. asst. to the pol. agent in Kathiawar, May, 1891.

BEAMES, JOHN, late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 16th March, 1858; from March, 1859, served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and from Dec., 1861, in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; mag. and collr., July, 1867; commr., Bardwan, Nov., 1881; offg. member of board of rev., 1887 and 1889; commr., Bhagalpur, Aug., 1887; prest. of the police revision committee, Aug., 1890; commr., Presidency divn., Nov., 1891; retd., March, 1893; author of 'Outlines of Indian Philology,' 1867, 'Comparative Grammar of the Modern Aryan Languages of India,' 1872-79, and 'Grammar of the Bengali Language,' 1881; edited Sir H. M. Elliot's 'Races of the N.W. Provinces of India,' 1869.

BEAN, MAURICE, Capt. R.I.M., late Port Officer, Bombay.—Joined the service as asst. port officer, Bombay; offg. port officer, Madras, April, 1891; port officer, Bombay, Oct., 1891; retd., Oct., 1896.

BEATSON, JOHN FULLARTON, C.I.E., B.A., M.D., Surgn.-Gen., late Bengal Med. Service.—Educ. at Glasgow Univ.; asst. surgn., Bengal, 16th June, 1843; served with the army of the Sutlej, 1845-46 (medal and clasp), and in the Punjab campaign (medal); in charge of Allahabad gen. field hosp. during the Mutiny; garrison surgn., Allahabad, 1865-68; med. storekeeper, Ambala, 1868-69; dep. inspr.-gen., Meerut, May, 1869; surgn.-gen., Nov., 1875; C.I.E., Jan., 1878; retd., March, 1880.

BEATSON-BELL, NICHOLAS DODD, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Clifton Bank, St. Andrews, Edinburgh Acad., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 16th Dec., 1889, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag.and dep. collr., July, 1895.

BEATTY, JOSEPH, Col., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Madras.—First commn., Dec., 1852; arrived, 6th Jan., 1855, and served in the Madras public works dept. as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; supervisor of the canals, Godavari, May, 1874; suptg. engr., Aug., 1877; retd., May, 1889.

BEATTY, THOMAS BERKELEY, B.A., M.D., Surgn.-Gen., late Bombay Med. Service.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; joined the Bombay med. service, May, 1851; civil surgn., Karachi, July, 1853; supt. of vaccn., April, 1856; supt., Matheran, Dec., 1867; dep. surgn.-gen., Poona, Oct., 1876; principal med. officer, Malta expd. force, 1878; surgn.-gen. with the govt. of Bombay, April, 1880; retd., March, 1885; author of various contributions on med. subjects in the transactions of the med. and physical society, Bombay.

BEAUMONT, THOMAS, M.D., F.R.C.S.I., Dep. Surgn.-Gen., late Madras Med. Dept.—Arrived, 13th Sept., 1857; served under the mil. dept. till Feb., 1864, when he was apptd. residency surgn., Indore; residency surgn., Haidarabad, June, 1881; also supt. of vaccn. and supt. of med. sch.; retd., Oct., 1885.

BEAUMONT, WILLIAM, late Rev. Survey Dept., Madras.—Joined the dept., 27th May, 1858, and served as asst. supt. and dep. supt.; member of reorganisation committee, Madras, March, 1871, and of board of examrs., Nov., 1882; retd., Nov., 1887.

BEAVAN, REGINALD, Col., I.S.C., late Survey of India Dept.—Ensign, 4th May, 1860; arrived, 11th June, 1860; in July, 1868, joined the topogr. survey dept. as asst. surveyor; served with various survey parties, and in July, 1880, organised and took charge of the Baluchistan topogr. survey; dep. supt., Nov., 1884; retd., June, 1892; served in S. Afghanistan, 1878 (medal); accompanied the Marri field force and the Bozdar field force in 1880 and 1881.

BECHER, ALFRED READ, India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., 23rd July, 1868; served in the Punjab as asst. engr. on the Sirdhind canal; from April, 1873, served in the actcs. branch, Punjab, as asst. controller, and dep. controller; transfd. to Bombay, Nov., 1875; served subsequently in Haidarabad, Oudh, Rajputana, and Mysore; examr. of accts., Calcutta, June, 1886; dep. acctnt.-gen. and under sec. to govt. of India, July, 1893; offg. acctnt.-gen., and dep. sec. to govt. of India, Dec., 1895.

BECKETT, HENRY BARRON, Punjab Commn.—Served from 10th May, 1860, as asst. commr. and jud. asst.; dep. commr., Peshawar, Aug., 1884; district judge, Oct., 1885; dep. commr., Aug., 1886.

BEDFORD, CHARLES AUGUSTUS S., Bengal Non-Regulation Commn.—Joined the service, 25th July, 1864, as asst. commr.; civil asst. pol. officer, Lushai expd., Feb., 1890; dep. commr., April, 1891.

BEDFORD, JAMES PERCH, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Clifton Coll. and Balliol Coll.,
Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 14th Dec., 1889, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; asst. acctnt.-gen., Nov., 1895.

BEESTON, ROBERT CHAPMAN, India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 30th Aug., 1873, and was employed on state railways in Central India and Burma; exec. engr., Feb., 1881; on special duty in Upper Burma in 1885-86; employed on Kashmir railway survey, Feb., 1891; and on N.W. line, Jan., 1893.

BEGBIE, ALFRED GLYNN, Lieut.-Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., July, 1861; arrived, Nov., 1870; joined the dept., Feb., 1871, as asst. engr. in the railway dept., Central India; exec. engr., Oct., 1871; Agra-Gwalior railway survey, Nov., 1872; offg. dep. controller of accts., Bengal, Aug., 1874; controller of accts., Mysore, Aug., 1875; examr., guaranteed railway accts., Calcutta, 1878; Punjab N. railway accts., 1880; dep. acctnt.-gen., and under sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., Jan., 1886; acctnt.-gen. and dep. sec., Oct., 1889; retd., July, 1893.

BEHARI LAL GUPTA, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Colootola Branch Sch., Calcutta, Calcutta Univ., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 29th Sept., 1871, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; on famine relief duty, Sept., 1874; presidency mag. and coroner, Calcutta, June, 1881; district and sessions judge, Nov., 1888.

BEIGHTON, THOMAS DURANT, late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at King Edward's Sch., Birmingham; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 4th Dec., 1867; and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; on special duty in connection with boundary disputes on the Bhutan frontier, Jan., 1878; district and sessions judge, May, 1885; acted as supt. and remembrancer of legal affairs in 1894; member of provl. legisl. council, March, 1895; retd., May, 1896; author of 'The Ethnography of the Bhutan Frontier,' and two pamphlets.

BELCHAMBERS, ROBERT, Jud. Dept., Bengal.—Joined the service, 15th Sept., 1848; dep. registrar, Calcutta high court, Feb., 1851; registrar, Oct., 1862; is also keeper of records, taxing officer, acctnt.-gen., and sealer; author of 'Practice of the Civil Courts,' and other legal publns.
