COTTON, SIR ARTHUR THOMAS, K.T., K.C.S.I., Gen., R.E.—Joined Addiscombe, 1818; arrived in Madras, Sept., 1821, as and lieut. of engrs.; asst. to suptg. engr., tank dept., May, 1822; served with the Burmese expdn., 1824-26; from June, 1826, served as suptg. engr. in the tank dept., and in 1828 was apptd. to the charge of the Cauvery irrign., being also employed in the survey and improvement of the Paumen pass; in 1844 was employed in carrying out the systematic irrign. of the Godavari delta; promoted to chief engr., 1852; in 1858 planned works for the irrign. of the Mahanadi delta; was afterwards employed under the govt. of Bengal, reporting upon water communication between the Ganges and Calcutta; resigned govt. service in 1862; in 1863, was employed under the Madras irrign. co., reporting on their works, and also inspecting the Ganges canal works, and proposed addl. works, which were afterwards carried out as the Lower Ganges canal; also projected works for the Sone irrign., which have since been partially executed; retd. from the army in 1877.

COTTON, HENRY JOHN STEADMAN, C.S.I., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Magdalen Coll. Sch., Brighton Coll., and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 29th Oct., 1867; served in the Bengal rev. and jud. dept., and as offg. under sec. to govt. and offg. registrar, high court; asst. sec., govt. of Bengal, June, 1875; junr. sec., April, 1876; mag. and collr., Nov., 1878; offg. commr., Chittagong, 1879, and 1884; sec., board of rev., Jan., 1882; port commr., Calcutta, May, 1887; sec. to govt. of Bengal, finl. and municipal depts., May, 1890; member of Bengal legis. council, June, 1892; chief sec. to govt., July, 1892; chief commr., Assam, Nov., 1896; author of a 'Memo. on the Rev. History of Chittagong,' 1880, 'Memo. on the Land Tenures of Bengal,' 1884, 'England and India,' 1883, and 'New India, or India in Transition,' 1885.

COTTON, JULIAN JAMES, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Sherborne Sch., and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 24th Dec., 1893, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

COTTON, WILLIAM BENSLY, B.L., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Wellington Sch. and Wadham Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 12th Dec., 1894, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

COUCH, RIGHT HON. SIR RICHARD, Kt.—
Recorder of Bedford, 1858-62; judge of the high court, Bombay, 1862-66; chief justice, 1866-70; chief justice of Bengal, March, 1870, to April, 1875, and was pres. of the comm. apptd. to inquire into the charges made against the Gaekwar of Baroda, Feb., 1875; privy councillor, Nov., 1875; member of the jud. committee, Jan., 1881.

COUCHE, THOMAS BENSON, Store Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, India store depot, 22nd Jan., 1875.

COUCHMAN, MALCOLM EDWARD, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Leamington Coll., and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 7th Dec., 1893, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

COUPER, SIR GEORGE E. W., Bart., K.C.S.I., C.B., C.I.E., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Sandhurst, and served in H.M.'s 15th regt. for two years before joining Haileybury; apptd. to the Bengal civil service, 1846; served in Bengal and the Punjab in various grades; under sec., govt. of India, home and fin. dept., 1853; under sec., foreign dept., 1854; sec. to chief commr. of Oudh, 1855; served through the siege of Lucknow, and was present at several engagements during the Mutiny as A.D.C. to Sir H. Lawrence and Sir John Inglis, and afterwards to Sir James Outram; commr. in Oudh, 1858; sec. to govt. of N.W. Prov., 1859; jud. commr. of Oudh, 1863; chief commr. of Oudh, 1874; lieut.-govr. of N.W. Prov., 1877, as well as chief commr. of Oudh; retd., 1882.

COUPLAND, HERBERT, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Ripon Gr. Sch. and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived 21st December, 1895, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

COURTENAY, ROBERT, B.A., late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 24th Nov., 1874, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; acted as asst. judge at intervals from Dec., 1885; retd., Sept., 1890.

COURTNEY, DAVID CHARLES, Major, R.E., Store Dept., India Office.—Entered the royal engrs., 17th April, 1866; served in the S. African war, 1879 (medal with clasp); asst. inspr.of works, royal arsenal, Woolwich, 1880-83; served in the Soudan expedn. of 1884-85 (medal with two clasps, bronze star); retd. from army, Nov., 1887; asst. supt. of the India store depot, 1st April, 1887.

COWAN, SAMUEL HUNTER, Col., I.S.C., late Survey of India.—First commn., lieut., royal artillery, 9th Dec., 1859; arrived, 9th April, 1860; asst. supt., survey dept., Bengal, 19th Jan., 1867; held charge of the Cachar survey, 1878-79; and of the Hugli River survey, 1882-83; dep. supt., April, 1883; retd., Oct., 1891.

COWIE, DONALD WILLIAM GARDEN, M.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Charterhouse and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 30th Nov., 1886, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst. collr., Jan., 1892; registrar, high court (appellate side), Nov., 1895.

COWIE, FRANCIS STEWART, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Winchester, New Coll., Oxford, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 4th Jan., 1896, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

COWIE, HENRY GEORGE, B.A., late Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Educ. at Pembroke Coll., Oxford; from 25th Nov., 1868, served as asst. acctnt.-gen., asst. compr.-gen., and as asst. commr. of paper currency, in the N.W. Prov., and at Calcutta; from April, 1876, served in the Central Prov. as dep. acctnt.-gen. and dep. commr. of paper currency; comprtr., Assam, March, 1883; dep. acctnt.-gen., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, 1887; dep. acctnt.-gen., Bengal, June, 1889; and Madras, Jan., 1890; dep. compr.-gen., March, 1892; retd., April, 1896.

COWIE, THOMAS RENNY, Col., I.S.C., Oudh Commn.—Arrived as ensign, 12th Aug., 1860; employed under the mil. dept. till Aug., 1869, from which date he served in Oudh as asst. commr., sub-judge, and dep. commr.; cantonmt. mag., Feb., 1881; dep. commr., Oct., 1888; district and sessions judge, April, 1891.

COWLEY, FRANCIS WILLIAM RICE, M.A., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1863, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; employed in public works dept., March, 1873; dep. commr., wards' estate, Patna, June, 1875; joint mag. and dep. collr., Feb., 1878; district and sessions judge, April, 1879; jud. commr., Chota Nagpur, Sept., 1887; retd., Oct., 1897.

COWLEY, WILLIAM DOUGALD FLOWER, Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Entered the dept. Dec., 1877; dep. acct.-gen., Punjab, Oct., 1896.

COX, ARTHUR FREDERICK, Indian C.S.—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch. and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 3rd Nov., 1871, and served in Madras as asst. mag. and collr.; on special duty in connection with visit of H.R.H. the Prince of Wales, Nov., 1875; from Sept., 1882, served in the finl. dept.; asst. comprt.-gen., July, 1883; dep. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, April, 1885; sub-collr. and mag., Nov., 1887; district and sessions judge, April, 1889; acctnt.-gen., Bombay, Dec., 1889; offg. comprt. and auditor-gen., March, 1894; acctnt.-gen., Bengal, April, 1895; compiled 'N. Arcot District Manual.'

COX, HENRY WILLIAM HOLMES, Col., I.S.C., Police Dept., Madras.—Ensign, Madras infantry, Nov., 1857; arrived, 26th Dec., 1857; served in the Madras police from April, 1861; supt., April, 1873; asst. inspr.-gen., Dec., 1881; presidency mag., Oct., 1883; pol. officer in charge of ex-King Thebaw of Burma, Dec., 1885, to April, 1886; dep. inspr.-gen. of police, Aug., 1886; commr. of police, Madras city, Dec., 1891; vacated, Dec., 1895.

COX, JOHN HUGH, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Clifton Coll. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 21st Nov., 1890, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., April, 1896.

COX, PERCY ZACHARIAH, Capt. Indian Staff Corps, Pol. Dept., Bombay.—First commn. 6th Feb., 1884; military employ to June, 1893; first asst. pol. resdt., Aden, Aug., 1893; transf. to Baroda, Nov., 1895; first asst. to pol. agent, Baroda, Feb., 1897.

COXE, HENRY REYNELL HOLLED, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Winchester, and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 1st Nov., 1884, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; employed in Burma, 1887-91, as asst. commr. and under sec. to chief commr.;
joint mag. and dep. collr., March, 1893; dist. and sess. judge, April, 1896.

CRADDOCK, REGINALD HENRY, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Reading Gr. Sch., Wellington Coll., and Keble Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 1st Dec., 1884, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., asst. to commr. of settlts. and agric., and settl. officer; commr. of excise, April, 1893; dep. commr., June, 1893.

CRAIG, JAMES, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 10th July, 1866; exec. engr., Sept., 1872; offg. suptg. engr. and sec. to the agents to the govrn.-gen. for Rajputana and Central India, April-Oct., 1891; offg. suptg. engr. and sec. to the agent for Baluchistan, April, 1892; suptg. engr., June, 1892; employed in Burma from March, 1893; retd., Nov., 1895.

CRAMPTON, ARTHUR CECIL, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and employed in the Central Prov. and the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., May, 1883; transf. to Burma, Sept., 1890.

CRANBROOK (Earl of), RIGHT HON. GATHORNE GATHORNE-HARDY, G.C.S.I., P.C.—Born, 1814; educ. at Shrewsbury Sch., and at Oriel Coll., Oxford; called to the bar at the Inner Temple in 1840, and practised as a barrister for several years; contested Bradford unsuccessfully in 1847; sat in the House of Commons for Leominster from 1856 to 1865, when he was returned for Oxford; under sec. of state for the home dept., 1858; prest. of the poor law board, July, 1866; sec. of state for the home dept., 1867-68; sec. of state for war, Feb., 1874; created Viscount Cranbrook, May, 1878; sec. of state for India, March, 1878, to May, 1880; lord prest. of council, 1885-86, and again, 1886-92; created Earl of Cranbrook and Baron Medway, Sept., 1892.

CRASTER, GEORGE AYTON, Col., R.E., late Public Works Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—First commn. as lieut., 11th Dec., 1849; from Nov., 1853, served as asst. and exec. engr. in Assam, Oudh, and the Punjab; transf. to the N.W. Prov., March, 1866; offg. suptg. engr., and dep. sec. to govt., N.W. Prov., public works dept., April, 1872; suptg. engr., April, 1872; retd., Jan., 1888.

CRAWFORD, CLEMENT EDWARD, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 10th Nov., 1892, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., April, 1897.

CRAWFORD, GEORGE ADAM, Col., late R.A.—First commn., Feb., 1855; retired, Dec., 1886; apptd. India Office member of Committee for valuation of military equipment, July, 1897.

CRAWFORD, JAMES ADAIR, Indian C.S.—Educ. at Rugby; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 17th Sept., 1878, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; from Feb., 1881, served in the pol. dept., and acted as asst. to the agent for Rajputana, boundary settlt. officer in Mewar, and asst. to the rest. at Haidarabad; attache, foreign dept., May, 1882; in charge of office of press commr., 1882-83; asst. commr., Ajmir, April, 1884; asst. sec., foreign dept., Jan., 1885; pol. agent, Quetta and Pishin, Nov., 1885; junr. under sec. to govt., foreign dept., March, 1888; acting first asst. and sec. for Berar to rest. at Haidarabad, May, 1890; under sec. to govt. of India, foreign dept., April, 1892; on special duty in connection with the revision of Aitchison's 'Treaties,' Oct., 1892; and again with the Archduke of Austria during his tour in India, 1892-93; offg. pol. rest., Persian Gulf, July-Dec., 1893; rest. and rev. commr., Baluchistan, March, 1895.

CRAWFORD, RICHMOND IRVINE, C.I.E., Col., I.S.C., late Sind Commn.—First commn., Oct., 1857; arrived, 6th Nov., 1857; served in the pursuit of the Gwalior rebels, &c., in 1858 (medal and clasp for Central India); from Sept., 1864, served in Sind as dep. collr. and mag., and supt. of police; pol. supt. of Thar and Parkar, May, 1875; dep. commr., Thar and Parkar, Aug., 1881; collr. and mag., Shikarpur, June, 1885; and subsequently at Karachi; has acted for various periods as commr. in Sind; C.I.E., Jan., 1896; returned to Europe, Mar., 1896.

CRAWFORD, WILLIAM MONOD, B.A., Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Roy. Univ., Ireland, and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived 28th Dec., 1895, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

CRAWFORD, JAMES, B.A., B.L., late Indian C.S.(Bengal).—Educ. at the Coll. Sch. and Univ. of Glasgow, and Dublin Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 23rd Dec., 1868, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; offg. under sec., govt. of India, home dept., Feb., 1875; under sec., govt. of Bengal, July, 1876; first inspr. of registr. offices, Dec., 1877; registrar, high court, Nov., 1878; district and sessions judge, March, 1885; retd., Nov., 1894.

CRAWLEY, CHARLES EDWARD, Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the dept., and was attached to the acctnt.-gen.'s office, Bombay, 25th Feb., 1874; asst. commr., paper currency, Bombay, March, 1878; asst. acctnt.-gen., Calcutta, Oct., 1883; Bombay, Aug., 1884; asst. comptr., India treasuries, Jan., 1889; asst. acctnt.-gen. and examr. of local acct., Bengal, March, 1889; on foreign service, as comptr.-gen. to the Nizam's govt., Aug., 1893.

CRAWLEY, GEORGE BURRIDGE, Capt., I.S.C., Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—First commn., 30th Jan., 1878; entered civil employ as cantonmt. mag., July, 1885.

CRAWLEY-BOEVEY, ARTHUR WILLIAM, M.A., B.L., late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Rugby, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 21st Nov., 1868, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and special asst. to pol. agent; from May, 1873, to Dec., 1874, served in Baroda as acting asst. rest.; in special charge of Sachin state, Dec., 1874; on special duty at Baroda, Feb., 1875; on famine duty at Kaladgi, Aug., 1877; talukdari settlt. officer, Gujarat, June, 1879; special officer for the settlt. of claims to giras and watans in Baroda territory, 1883 and 1885; acting chief presidency mag. and rev. judge, Bombay, May, 1887; junr. collr. and mag., May, 1889; senr. collr. and mag., Nov., 1891; retd., Aug., 1893.

CREAGH, BOYLE PURDON, Commander, R.I.M., Marine Dept., Bengal.—Joined the service, 26th March, 1878; commander of 'Tenasserim,' Sept., 1880; transport officer, Suakin, March, 1885; captain in turn of 'Canning' and 'Clive,' 1885-91; acting port officer,
Madras, Oct., 1891; and Bombay, April, 1892; apptd. port officer, &c., Calcutta, April, 1893.

CREGEEN, ARCHIBALD CRELLIN, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., June, 1859, as asst. engr., Central Prov.; transfd. to Punjab, Feb., 1861; exec. engr., April, 1866; railway dept., Central India, Holkar state railway, Oct., 1870; engr.-in-chief, provl. light railway survey extensions, Lucknow, June, 1878; Nimach-Nasirabad survey, Nov., 1878; W. Rajputana state railway, Aug., 1879; Vizagapatam-Raipur railway survey, Oct., 1882; construction estabt., Nagpur-Bengal railway, Oct., 1884; agent and chief engr., Indian Midland railway, Feb., 1886; retd., Feb., 1888.

CRESSWELL, CHARLES ARTHUR, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Burma Commn.—First commn., royal artillery, Jan., 1866; arrived, 12th Jan., 1867; joined the Burma commn., Feb., 1871, as offg. asst. commr. and cantonmt. mag. at Toungoo; personal asst. to chief commr., Dec., 1875; boundary officer, Sandoway, March, 1881; prest., Sandoway town committee, April, 1884; deputy commr., March, 1885; offf. as prest. Rangoon municipality, July, 1895, addl. sess. judge, Irrawadi divn., April, 1897.

CRICHTON, RICHMOND TREVOR, Capt., I.S.C.—Survey dept.; first commn., 23rd Aug., 1884; joined survey dept., Dec., 1889; supt. of settlement surveys in Bengal.

CROFT, SIR ALFRED WOODLEY, K.C.I.E., M.A., late Educl. Dept., Bengal.—Apptd., 8th Dec., 1865; served as profr., presidency coll., principal, Dacca coll., and inspr. of schools; dir. of public instrn., from Aug., 1878; prest. of the commn. to draw up a code for European schools, Oct., 1881; member of the educn. commn., 1882-83; C.I.E., May, 1884; K.C.I.E., Feb., 1887; member of the legisl. council of Bengal, Feb., 1887; on special duty for the preparation of a report on educn. in British India, 1887; fellow, member of the syndicate and prest. of the faculty of arts of Calcutta univ.; vice-chancellor, Dec., 1893; retd., Feb., 1897.

CROFTON, JAMES Lieut.-Gen., late R.E.—Second lieut., Bengal engrs., 9th Dec., 1844; joined the public works dept., Nov., 1847; asst. engr., Punjab circle, Dec., 1849; exec. engr., Punjab irrigtn., 1858; suptg. engr., Jan., 1862; supt., Sutlej canal surveys; chief engr., irrigtn., and under sec. to govt., Punjab, Sept., 1864; inspr.-gen. of irrigtn. and dep. sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., April, 1874, to Jan., 1882, when he retd. from the service.

CROLE, CHARLES STEWART, C.I.E., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Edinburgh High Sch. and Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 9th Dec., 1863, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and sub-collr. and joint mag.; district and sessions judge, Kista, June, 1881; collr. and mag., Nov., 1882; district and sessions judge, Aug., 1886; member of board of rev., Dec., 1886; and of legisl. council, Dec., 1893; compiled the 'Chingleput District Manual.'

CROMBIE, ALEXANDER, M.D., Brigade Surgn.—Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med.Service.—Joined the service, 30th March, 1872; offg. rest. surgn., Calcutta med. coll. hosp., Jan., 1873; profr. med. coll., in addn., Oct., 1873; transfd. to Burma, Feb., 1875, and apptd. junr. civil surgn., Rangoon, and health officer to the port; from April, 1877, served in Bengal as civil surgn.; also at Simla as joint med. officer, 1880-82; civil surgn., Dacca, with charge of the jail, &c., March, 1882; surgn. supt., presidency gen. hosp., Calcutta, June, 1889.

CROMER (BARON), RIGHT HON. EVELYN BARING, G.C.B., G.C.M.G., K.C.S.I., C.I.E.—Lieut., royal artillery, June, 1858; capt. in 1870, and major in 1876; A.D.C. to Sir Henry Storks, in Ionian Islands, in 1861, and sec. to him in 1865, during the enquiry into the outbreak in Jamaica; private sec. to the govr.-gen. of India (the Earl of Northbrook), 1872-76; commr. of the Egyptian public debt, 1877-79; compt.-gen. in Egypt, Sept., 1879; finl. member of council of govr.-gen. of India, June, 1880; agent and consul-gen. in Egypt, and a minister plenipotentiary in the diplomatic service, Aug., 1883; finl. asst. at the conference in London on Egyptian finance, 1884; G.C.B., Jan., 1895; has 1st class of Medjidie.

CRONIN, JOHN JOSEPH, Capt., I.S.C., Burma Commn.—First commn., Aug., 1880; employed in Burma as asst. commr., July, 1886; dep. commr., Dec., 1895.

CROOKE, WILLIAM, B.A., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Erasmus Smith's Gr. Sch., Tipperary, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 2nd Nov., 1871, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; dep. commr., July, 1886; mag. and collr., Feb., 1890; retd., Aug., 1896; author of a rural and agric. glossary for the N.W. Prov. and Oudh, an 'Ethnographical Handbook for the N.W. Prov. and Oudh,' 'Popular Religion and Folklore of N. India,' and 'Gazetteer of Jalesar.'

CROSS (VISCOUNT), RIGHT HON. RICHARD ASHSETON, P.C., G.C.B., G.C.S.I.—Born, 30th May, 1823; educ. at Rugby Sch., and at Trinity Coll., Cambridge; called to the bar at the Inner Temple, 1849, and for several years went the northern circuit; M.P. for Preston, 1857-62, and S.W. Lancashire, 1868-86; sec. of state for the home dept., 1874-80; bencher of the Inner Temple, 1876; hon. LL.D. of Cambridge, Oct., 1878; G.C.B. in 1880; again sec. of state for the home dept., June, 1885, and was apptd. prest. of the royal commn. on the educn. acts; in Lord Salisbury's second administration, Aug., 1886, was apptd. sec. of state for India, and raised to the peerage under the title of Viscount Cross; G.C.S.I., Aug., 1892; lord privy seal in Lord Salisbury's third administration, July, 1895; author of two legal works.

CROSTHWAITTE, SIR CHARLES HAUKE'S TODD, K.C.S.I., late Indian C.S., Council of India.—Educ. at St. John's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1857; arrived, 29th Dec., 1857, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., and settlt. officer; from April, 1877, served in the Central Prov. as commr. of the Nagpur and Jabalpur divns., and was apptd. jud. commr., Central Prov. Aug., 1881, and addl. member of the govr.-gen.'s council, Dec., 1881; acting chief commr., British Burma, March, 1883, to April, 1884; chief commr., Central Prov., Jan., 1885; member of the public service commn., Dec., 1886; C.S.I., Feb., 1887; chief commr. of Burma, March, 1887; K.C.S.I., May, 1888; member of council of govr.-gen., Oct., 1890, to Feb., 1891; and again from April, 1892; lieut.-govr., N.W.
Prov., and chief commr., Oudh, Nov., 1892, to Jan., 1895; member of council of India, March, 1895; vice-prest., 1897-8; author of 'Notes on the N.W. Prov.' and 'Land Rev. Law.'

CROSTHWAITHE, Sir Robert Joseph, K.C.S.I., B.A., B.L., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch., and Brasenose Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 30th Oct., 1863, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr. and joint mag. and dep. collr.; asst. supt., sub-judge, and registrar of Dehra Dun, Dec., 1873; small cause court judge, Allahabad, March, 1875; registrar of the high court, N.W. Prov., Jan., 1878; acting jud. commr., British Burma, Dec., 1878; district and sessions judge, Allahabad, May, 1881; addl. sec. to govt. of India, legisl. dept., Jan., 1883; jud. commr. of the Central Prov., Jan., 1885; member of viceroy's legisl. council, June, 1889; offg. chief commr., Central Prov., July-Oct., 1889; rest. and agent to the govr.-gen., Central India, Jan., 1891; C.S.I., May, 1890; agent to the govr.-gen., Rajputana, March, 1895; rest. and chief commr., Ajmere, Oct., 1895; K.C.S.I., 1897; author of 'The N.W. Prov. Rev. Law' (legal part).

CROW, William, Store Dept., India Office.—Clerk for railway stores, 23rd Oct., 1883.

CROWDY, John Henry, Lieut.-Col., R.E., late Mil. Works Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn. as lieut., Dec., 1857; posted to Indian establ., Sept., 1870; from Dec., 1870, served as exec. engr. in the Punjab; transf'd. to mil. works, 1872, and served in the Punjab, the N.W. Prov., and Bengal; suptg. engr., March, 1886; retd., March, 1890.

CROWE, William Henry, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Godolphin Gr. Sch., and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 26th Oct., 1867, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., profr. at the Deccan coll., Poona, acting asst. agent for sardars in the Deccan, and asst. judge and sessions judge; acting special judge under the Deccan agriculturists' relief act, March, 1882; judge and sessions judge, Aug., 1883; also agent for sardars in the Deccan, April, 1892; acted as jud. commr. in Sind, Oct.-Dec., 1894; addl. member of Bombay legisl. council, July, 1896.

CROZIER, Robert George, Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Brighton Coll.; temporary clerk, 30th Nov., 1865; junr. clerk, Jan., 1867; senr. clerk, March, 1887; dep. dir. gen. of stores, Aug., 1896.

CRUICKSHANK, Alexander, M.A., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Aberdeen Univ. and King's Coll., Aberdeen; apptd. after exam. of 1861; served in Madras from Oct., 1863, as asst. collr. and mag., and principal asst.; collr. and mag., S. Arcot, special agent, French settl., and pol. agent for Pondicherry, Sept., 1878; collr. and mag., Anantapur, Nov., 1885; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1886; retd., Nov., 1887.

CRUICKSHANK, Alexander Walsesley, C.S.I., B.L., Indian C.S. (N.W.Prov. and Oudh).—Called to the bar at the Middle Temple; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 11th Nov., 1872, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; junr. sec. board of rev., Jan., 1878; under sec. to govt., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Sept., 1885; settl. officer, Oct., 1885; dep. commr., Nov. 1890; mag. and collr., Nov. 1891; commr., Allahabad, April, 1897; C.S.I., Jan., 1898.

CRUICKSHANK, John Donaldson, Col., R.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—First commn., 9th Dec., 1859; joined the dept. as proby. asst. engr., July, 1862, and was employed on irrign. works, &c., in Sind; exec. engr., Dec., 1865; suptg. engr., Nov., 1891; chief engr., Feb., 1894; acting sec. to govt. of Bombay Public Works Dept., May-Nov., 1893; retd., June, 1896.

CRUMP, Henry Ashbrooke, B.A., Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 10th Nov., 1885, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; commr. of excise, June, 1893; dep. commr., Aug., 1894; second sec. to chief commr., Nov., 1894.

CRUMP, Louis Charles, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. under private tuition and at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 10th Dec., 1890, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 2nd asst., Mar., 1897.

CULLEN, Peter, M.D., Brigade-Surgn.—Lieut.-Col., late Med. Dept., Central Prov.—Joined the Bengal med. service, July, 1859; arrived, 24th Jan., 1860, and was employed under the mil. dept., including service in the China war; from Feb., 1862, served in the Central Prov. as civil surgn. and supt. of jail; also supt. of cotton affairs, May, 1865; retd., June, 1892.

CUMINE, Alexander, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Glenalmond; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 28th Oct., 1874, and served as asst. collr. and mag., and railway mag.; 2nd asst. collr., May, 1887; 1st asst. collr., Nov., 1890; junr. collr. and mag., Kaira, and pol. agent, Cambay, May, 1894; senr. collr., March, 1897.

CUMING, Arthur Herbert, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Westminster Sch., London Univ., and Oriel Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 3rd Jan., 1895, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

CUMING, Joseph Henry, Indian C.S. (N.W.Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Westminster, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1891, and served in the N.W.Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr. and asst. commr.; joint mag., Jan., 1897.

CUMMING, Alexander Robertson, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Aberdeen Gr. Sch., Aberdeen Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 18th Dec., 1892, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

CUMMING, Charles Lennox Bruce, late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 29th Nov., 1867, and served in Madras as asst. mag. and collr.; principal asst., Ganjam, Nov., 1883; retd., March, 1888.

CUMMING, John Arthur, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Aberdeen Gr. Sch., Aberdeen Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 16th Dec., 1887, and served in Madras as asst. mag. and collr.; head asst., Dec., 1894; senr. asst., July, 1897.

CUMMING, John Ghest, M.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at High Sch., Glasgow, Glasgow Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 3rd Nov., 1890, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., offg.
under sec. to govt., and settlt. officer; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1896.

CUMMING, WILLIAM GORDON, C.I.E., Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., Madras engrs., 1860; arrived, 7th Oct., 1862; joined the public works dept., Feb., 1864, as asst. engr., Port Blair; exc. engr., April, 1866; transf. to Madras, Aug., 1868; Haidarabad, May, 1870; from Feb., 1874, served in British Burma; suptg. engr., Jan., 1884; offg. sec. to govr.-gen.'s agent, Rajputana, Oct., 1884; sec. to chief commn., Burma, public works dept., May, 1888; rank of chief engr., May, 1888; C.I.E., Jan., 1893; retd., Aug., 1895.

CUNNINGHAM, CHARLES ALEXANDER, Brigadier-Gen., Bombay Pol. Dept.—First commn., 20th June, 1878; served in the Afghan war as asst. adjutant-gen. (medal); dep. asst. adjutant-gen., Bombay, 1877-80, and 1881-88; dep. adjutant-gen., Bombay, 1888-92; asst. adjutant-gen., Bengal, Feb., 1893; sec. to govt. of Bombay, mil., &c., depts., Dec., 1892; pol. rest., collr. of stamp rev., &c., Aden, May, 1895.

CUNNINGHAM, JAMES MAGNABB, C.S.I., M.D., Surgn.-Gen., late Bengal Med. Service.—Joined the dept., 1857; supt. of central prison, Bareilly, 1861, and subsequently at Meerut; offg. supt., govt. press, N.W. Prov., 1863; sec. to sanitary commn., 1866; profr. of hygiene, Calcutta med. coll., 1866; sanitary commn., Bengal, 1869; sanitary commn. with the govt. of India, 1875; surgn.-gen., March, 1880; retd., March, 1885; member of army sanitary commn., Feb., 1891.

CUNNINGHAM, SIR WILLIAM JOHN, K.C.S.I., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Edinburgh Acad., and Clapham Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 21st Nov., 1870, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; from Aug., 1873, served in Mysore as asst. commn. on special duty at Bangalore and Chitraldrug, addl. sec. in the famine dept., and sec. to the chief commn., gen. dept.; asst. to the rest. in Mysore, and sec. to the chief commn., Coorg, April, 1881; asst. to the rest., Haidarabad, Dec., 1883; under sec., govt. of India, foreign dept., Sept., 1885; dep. sec., May, 1890; sec., April, 1894; also sec. of orders of Star of India and Indian Empire, May, 1894; C.S.I., Jan., 1894; K.C.S.I., June, 1897.

CUNLIFFE, ARTHUR TABOR, B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Clifton Coll. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived 9th Dec., 1895, and served in Burma as asst. commn.; acting under sec., Oct., 1895.

CUNNINGHAM, ALEXANDER FREDERICK DOUGLAS, C.I.E., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Kensington Gr. Sch., and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 11th Nov., 1872, and served in the Punjab as asst. commn.; pol. asst. to Major Cavagnari in Afghanistan, Nov., 1878; pol. officer, Khaibar, Oct., 1879; 1st asst. to chief pol. officer, Afghanistan (Kabul), Feb., 1880; offg. under sec. to govt., 1879 and 1881; C.I.E., March, 1881; offg. supt., Kapurthala state, Feb., 1884; under sec. to govt., Dec., 1884; offg. as dep. commn. from Feb., 1885; on special duty at Rawal Pindi durbar, March, 1885; dep. commn., Nov., 1888; offg. commn. and supt., Peshawar, Oct., 1892, and from April, 1894.

CUNNINGHAM, DAVID DOUGLAS, C.I.E., M.B., F.R.S., F.I.S., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—Joined the service, 1st April, 1868; from 19th Dec., 1874, served as special asst. to the sanitary commn. with the govt. of India; profr. of physiology, Calcutta med. coll.; from June, 1879; also acted as govt. quinologist, and as supt. of botanical gardens; apptd. to conduct special cholera inquiries, Dec., 1884; on special duty as naturalist with the Tibet Mission, 1886; C.I.E., June, 1893; hon. surg. to the viceroy; author of various med. and scientific treatises.

CUNNINGHAM, SIR HENRY S., K.C.I.E., late Calcutta High Court.—Advocate-gen., high court, Madras, and addl. member of the govr.'s council, 1872-77; puisne judge, high court, Calcutta, Nov., 1877; member of the famine commn., 1878-81; member of fin. committee, March, 1886; resigned his seat in the high court, Calcutta, July, 1888; K.C.I.E., Jan., 1889.

CURRIE, FENDALL, B.L., Col., late Oudh Commn.—Arrived, 31st Dec., 1858, as cornet, 1st European light cavalry; asst. commn., Hazaribagh, Feb., 1863; from Sept., 1863, served in the Oudh commn., and was apptd. small cause court judge, Sitapur, June, 1868, and junr. sec. to chief commn., Nov., 1868; city mag., Lucknow, Feb., 1870; dep. commn., Nov., 1878; commn., March, 1888, returned to Europe, Nov., 1896; author of several legal commentaries and manuals.

CURRIE, GEORGE MAINWARING, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 28th Oct., 1862; served in the rev. and jud. dept., Bengal, and was apptd. mag. and collr., March, 1884; retd., March, 1892.

CURRY, THOMAS ELMITT, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1875, and posted to state railways; transf. to Bengal, Oct., 1881; exec. engr., Nov., 1885; re-transf. to state railways, July, 1886.

CURSETJEE RUSTOMJEE, B.L., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., London; called to the bar at the Middle Temple; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 29th Nov., 1876, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., April, 1886; dep. commn., Dec., 1891; mag. and collr., Dec., 1893.

CURTIS, GEORGE SEYMOUR, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Marlborough Coll., and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 24th Oct., 1888, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; in 1889-90 acted as asst. pol. rest., Aden; under sec. to govt., rev., &c., depts., Aug., 1894; offg. as postm.-gen., Bombay, May, 1895; 2nd asst., Feb., 1897; offg. as postm.-gen., Madras, 1897.

CURZON, THE RIGHT HON. GEORGE NATHANIEL, M.P.—Educ. at Eton and Balliol Coll., Oxford (B.A., 1882; fellow of All Souls' Coll., 1883; M.A., 1884); private sec. to Lord Salisbury, June, 1885, to Feb., 1886; M.P. for the Southport divn. of Lancashire, from 1886; under sec. of state for India, Nov., 1891, to Aug., 1892; member of royal comm. on Indian expenditure, May, 1895; sworn of the privy council, June, 1895; under sec. of state for foreign affairs, June, 1895; author of 'Russia in Central Asia,' 1889, 'Persia,' 1892, and 'Problems of the Far East,' 1894.

CUSHING, THOMAS, Store Dept., India Office.—Clerk to inspr. of scientific instruments, store depot, Dec., 1867; inspr. of scientific instruments, May, 1876.
CUTHBERTSON, CLIVE, B.A., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at St. Peter's, Adelaide, Glenalmond Sch., and Univ.Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 13th Dec., 1885; and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; under sec. to govt. of Bengal, Nov., 1889; offd. as under sec. to govt. of India, home dept., in March, 1890; joint mag. and dep. collr., Nov., 1893; retd., Nov., 1895.

CUTTLE, GEORGE, Store Dept., India Office.—and class clerk, India store depot, 5th April, 1882.

DADACHANJI, PIROZESHAR KERSHAPJII, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Bombay Univ. and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 20th Dec., 1895, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

DALAL, BARZOE JAMSHEDEI, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Bombay Univ. and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 12th Dec., 1894, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

DALLAS, ALEXANDER MORISON, C.I.E., Dep. Surgn.-Gen., late Med. Dept., Punjab.—Arrived and was apptd. asst. surgn., Bengal med. establ., June, 1856; supt., central jail, Oct., 1859; inspr.-gen. of prisons, April, 1863; surgn.-gen., Punjab, Sept., 1884; inspr.-gen. of civil hosps., Punjab, April, 1885; retd., April, 1886.

DALLAS, JAMES, Capt., R.E., Mil. Secretariat, Govt. of India.—First commn., 30th July, 1879; apptd. to mil. works dept., Nov., 1884; asst. sec. mil. dept., Dec., 1890.

DALLAS, JOHN EDWIN, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; appt. 1st Oct., 1876, and posted as asst. engr. to State Railways; asst. sec. to govt., Nov., 1888; exec. engr., April, 1889; offd. as under sec. to govt. railway branch, Bombay, May, 1893, and 1894; transfd. to Assam, March, 1895.

DALLAS, WILLIAM LISCOMBE, Meteorological Dept., Govt. of India.—Served from 18th July, 1882, as scientific asst. to the meteorological reporter; author of a 'Memoir on the Winds and Monsoons of the Arabian Sea', and other meteorological publs.

DALMAHOY, PATRICK CARFRAE, Maj.-Gen., Bengal Infantry, late Police Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Arrived as ensign, 1st Jan., 1857; adjutant of the Hamirpur district police, Oct., 1858, and commandant, Oct., 1861; district supt. of police, Jan., 1862; asst. inspr.-gen., govt. railway police, April, 1867; offd. commandant of the Mhairwara police battalion, Sept., 1869, to April, 1871; dep. inspr.-gen., Oct., 1882, to 1885.

DALTON, GODFREY JOHN BECTIVE Tuite, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at St. Columba's Coll., Rathfarnham, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 12th Jan., 1864; and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., and dep. commr.; mag. and collr., Aug., 1887; retd., April, 1893.

DALY, HUGH, C.I.E., Capt., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Arrived, 12th Feb., 1882, and served in the mil. dept.; from Nov., 1884, served in the pol. dept. as pol. asst. Rajputana; on special duty in Upper Burma, June, 1886, and with the N. Shan column in Nov., 1887; supt., N. Shan states, May, 1888; on special duty at Mandalay, 1891; asst. sec. to govt. of India, foreign dept.; July, 1892; dep. sec., June, 1896.

DALY, WILLIAM WATT, C.I.E., late Bengal Police.—Served in the dept. from 19th Nov., 1862; attached to Lushai expdn. in command of frontier police, Nov., 1871, to March, 1872; district supt., March, 1873; with Garo Hills expdn., 1873-74; commandant of frontier police, Surma valley divn., May, 1883; dep. inspr.-gen., April, 1891; C.I.E., Jan., 1891; retd., May, 1894.

DAMES, MANSEL LONGWORTH, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 10th Nov., 1870, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; on special duty with the Kabul troops, Jan., 1879; dep. commr., Feb., 1887; divl. judge, Jan., 1897; author of a Baluchi grammar and text-book.

DAMPIER, GERALD ROBERT, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Charterhouse, and Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 10th Nov., 1892, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr. and asst. commr.

DAMPIER, HENRY LUCIUS, C.I.E., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Eton; apptd. from Haileybury, Dec., 1848; arrived, 18th Sept., 1849; served in the rev. and jud. depts., and was apptd. mag. and collr., 1st grade, Oct., 1860; junr. sec., board of rev., Feb., 1861, and sec., Nov., 1861; commr., Nuddaie-divn., July, 1863; on famine duty, 1866; between April, 1867, and Nov., 1874, served as sec. to the govt. of Bengal in the rev. and gen. depts., and as offg. sec. to the govt. of India, home dept., in 1872; member of Bengal legisl. council, 1874 and 1879; board of rev., Oct., 1877; prest. of rent law commn., 1881; retd., July, 1884.

DANCE, GEORGE WHITMORE, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Trinity Hall, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 27th Nov., 1881, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., Oct., 1889; sub-collr. and joint mag., July, 1893.

DANE, LOUIS WILLIAM, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 14th Nov., 1876, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; private sec. to lieut.-govr., Oct., 1879, to April, 1882; on special duty, Lahore Rakhs, 1884-85; offg. registrar, chief court, June, 1886; settl. officer, Gurdaspur, Oct., 1887; asst. commr., 1st grade, May, 1889; dep. commr. and settl. collr., Peshawar, Dec., 1892.

DANE, RICHARD MORRIS, C.I.E., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Kingstown Sch., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 20th Nov., 1874, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and settl. officer; served under the foreign dept. of the govt. of India, 1878-79; sec. to finl. commr., Punjab, Nov., 1880; offg. under sec. to govt., Punjab, March to Aug., 1882; boundary settl. officer, Central India, 1883-84, and asst. commr., Ajmir, 1885; served subsequently as offg. dep. commr., Punjab; settl. officer, Gurdaspur, Nov., 1885; offg. commr. of excise, inspr.-gen. of registrn., &c., 1890-91; acted as commr., N. India salt rev., 1892; on special duty in connection with opium commn., Sept., 1893; dep. sec. to govt. of India, finl. and commerce dept., March, 1895; C.I.E., Jan., 1896.

DANIELL, CAIRNES ANTHONY, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1854; arrived, 2nd Nov., 1854; from
Jan., 1859, served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. under the commr. of Meerut, asst. supt. of Dehra Dun, asst. settl. officer, and joint mag. and dep. collr.; supt., Dehra Dun, April, 1866; mag. and collr., Moradabad, July, 1869; civil and sessions judge, Gorakhpur, April, 1877; commr. and agent, Benares divn., March, 1881; member, board of rev., March, 1884; retd., Nov., 1889.

DANIELL, CLARMONT JOHN, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1855; arrived, 7th Dec., 1855; served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., under sec. to govt., dep. commr., asst. settl. officer, and joint mag. and dep. collr.; mag. and collr., Cawnpore, Aug., 1872; civil and sessions judge, Gorakhpur, Aug., 1873; fellow of Calcutta univ., 1883; offg. commr., 1881 and 1883; 1st grade judge, April, 1885; retd., Oct., 1886.

DANIELS, SIDNEY REGINALD, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Wycliffe Coll., Stonehouse (Glos.), Balliol Coll., Oxford, and London Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 30th Nov., 1893, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

DANKS, ERIC, B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Ripon Gr. Sch. and Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 15th Dec., 1894, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

DANSEY, EDWARD PRINCE, India Forest Dept.—Joined the service, 20th Dec., 1872, as asst. conservator; dep. conservator, Sept., 1882; asst. inspr.-gen. of forests, June, 1888; conservator of forests, Bengal, May, 1891; transf. to the N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Nov., 1894.

DANVERS, FREDERICK CHARLES, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch. and King's Coll., London, and, after a special training preparatory for Addiscombe, studied for two years for a civil and mechanical engr.; East India house writer, old establ., 26th Jan., 1853; junr. clerk, public and eccles. dept., India office, Sept., 1858; public works dept., 1861; senr. clerk, June, 1867; asst. sec. in the public works dept., Feb., 1875; asst. sec. in the rev. dept., 1877; registrar and supt. of records, Jan., 1884; in 1855 designed a salt-weighing machine, of which a number were manufactured in this country for the use of the Madras govt.; in 1859 was depd. to Liverpool and Manchester to report on traction engines, with a view to their being used in India; depd. to Lisbon to examine the Portuguese records relating to India, 1891-92; on similar duty to the Hague, 1893-95; author of articles publd. in 'Engineering' relative to public works in India, 1866-75; of a design for carrying the East India Railway under the Hugli from Howrah to Calcutta, transmitted to India by the sec. of state in 1868; of 'Statistical Papers relating to India' (parly. paper, 1869); of memoranda on Indian coal, coal-washing and artificial fuel, 1867-69; of 'Coal Economy,' 1872; of 'A Century of Famines, 1770-1870,' 1877; of 'Spon's Information for Colonial Engineers—India,' 1877; of papers read before the Society of Arts, on Agriculture in India,' 1878 (Society's silver medal), 'Famines in India,' 1886, and 'The India Office Records,' 1889 (Society's silver medal); of a 'Report on the Records of the India Office,' 1887; of 'Chiefs, Agents, and Governors of Bengal,' 1888; of a 'Report on the Portuguese Records relating to India,' 1892; and of a 'History of the Portuguese in India,' 1894; elected a corresponding member of the royal geographical society of Lisbon, 1894, and of the international colonial institute, Brussels, 1895.

DANVERS, SIR JULAND, K.C.S.I., late Public Works Dept., India Office.—Educ. at King's Coll., London; East India house writer, 22nd March, 1842; junr. clerk, Feb., 1847; minuting branch, sec.'s dept., 1847; private sec. to chairman and dep., 1848-53; senr. clerk, Feb., 1852; asst., minuting branch, sec.'s dept., 1857; asst. sec. in the railway and electric telegraph dept., India office, and asst. dir. of Indian railway cos., Feb., 1858; sec. in the railway and telegraph dept., and dep. dir. of Indian railway cos., Sept., 1858, to July, 1861; govt. dir. of Indian railway cos., 1861; visited India in his official capacity in 1875-76; sec. in the public works, railway and telegraph depts., Aug., 1880, continuing to be dir. of Indian railway cos.; K.C.S.I., 1886; retd., March, 1892.

DARLINGTON, EDWIN, late Customs Dept., Burma.—Joined the service as supt. of the Burma secretariat, June, 1868; from March, 1872, served as collr. of customs, Akyab; asst. sec. to the chief commr., April, 1875; collr. of customs, Rangoon, July, 1877; chief collr., Sept., 1880; also vice-chairman of the Rangoon port commrs., March, 1882; retd.,

DARRAH, HENRY ZOUCH, B.A., LL.B., B.L., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Rathmines Sch., Kingstown Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 24th Oct., 1877, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. dir. of agric. and commerce; acting sec. to chief commr. of Assam, March-April, 1886; dir. of land records and agric., Assam, Jan., 1887; on special duty in the Central Prov. in 1887, and in Burma, 1890; returned to the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as offg. dir. of land records and agric., Nov., 1893; mag. and collr., July, 1894; author of a 'Monograph on Cotton in Assam,' 'Burma and Assam,' 'The Eri Silk of Assam,' 'The Cattle of Assam,' 'An Experiment in Survey and Settlement,' a 'Note on the People of Assam,' 'Eleven Years' Work of a Land Records Department,' &c.

DASHWOOD, FREDERICK AUGUSTUS, Bombay Public Works Dept.—Trained at the Royal Indian Engrg. Coll.; entered the service as asst. engr., Nov., 1897; exec. engr., Dec., 1899.

DAUKES, FREDERICK CLENDON, C.I.E., late Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Uppingham Gr. Sch., Blackheath Proprietary Sch., and Downing Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 8th Nov., 1869, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. sec. to govt.; asst. settl. officer, Banda, Nov., 1873; attache, foreign dept., govt. of India, 1873; offg. asst. sec. to govt. of India, foreign dept., 1876-77; sec., public service commn., Sept., 1886; under sec., home dept., Dec., 1877; sec. to the chief commr. of Assam, Nov., 1890; C.I.E., Jan., 1892; retd., Oct., 1894; transld. Terentyef's 'Russia and England in Central Asia.'

DAVIDSON, ALFRED, M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 23rd July, 1868, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., Jan., 1877.

DAVIDSON, GEORGE, Major, R.E., Bombay
Mint.—First commn. 6th June, 1872; attached to sappers and miners, Nov., 1894; apptd. to public works dept. as asst. engr. April, 1875; exec. engr. Oct., 1884; Mint master, Bombay, April, 1897.

DAVIDSON, JAMES, late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the High Sch. and Univ. of Glasgow, and Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 11th Nov., 1872, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and cantonmt. mag.; on famine duty in Mysore, 1877-78; second asst. collr., Nov., 1886; forest settlt. officer, Nasik, Aug., 1887; first asst. collr. and mag., Nov., 1888; acting collr. of salt rev., Aug., 1892; junr. collr. and mag., March, 1893; retd., Oct., 1896.

DAVIDSON, JAMES YOUNG, late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept. as asst. engr., 9th Dec., 1869, and served in the Central Prov.; exec. engr., Oct., 1875; from Jan., 1882, served as manager, on the Wardha coal, and Nagpur-Chhattisgarh railways; in charge of Umaria colliery, Jan., 1886; acting engr.-in-chief, Nagpur-Bengal railway, Feb., 1886; retd., 1889.

DAVIDSON, JOHN PATON, A.M.I.C.E., Madras Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Oct., 1874, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., April, 1884; asst. to chief engr. for irrign., and under sec., irrign. branch, July, 1886, to Nov., 1888.

DAVIDSON, LIONEL, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Univ. Coll. Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 22nd Dec., 1889, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and acting asst. and under sec.; head asst., Feb., 1895; spl. asst. collr. and mag., Oct., 1895; under sec. to govt., Oct., 1896.

DAVIDSON, ROBERT, C.S.I., late Madras C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1852; served as asst. collr. and mag., sub-judge, small cause court judge, civil and sessions judge, Trichinopoly, and district and sessions judge; acted as collr. and mag. of Karnul during the famine, 1877-78; third member, board of rev., March, 1878; chief sec. to govt., Dec., 1878; legis. council, 1880-83; provisional member of the exec. council, May-July, 1881; 1st member, board of rev., March, 1882; retd., June, 1884.

DAVIES, ARTHUR MATCHAM, Lieut.-Gen., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Madras.—Arrived, 23rd Jan., 1849; served in the dept. from Sept., 1862, as asst. supt. and supt.; acting personal asst. to commr. of police, Madras, Sept., 1866; dep. inspr.-gen., Nov., 1881, to 1886.

DAVIES, CHARLES ALLAN WILLIAM, late Hyderabad Commn.—Joined the service, 22nd March, 1855, as attaché to dep. commr., N. Berar; extra asst. commr., July, 1858; also asst. commr., paper currency, July, 1868; special asst. commr., July, 1891; retd., June, 1893.

DAVIES, CHARLES MERSON, late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. locomotive supt., 15th Sept., 1875; supt., March, 1880; retd., Sept., 1893.

DAVIES, HENRY SAMUEL PRICE, Capt., Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 28th June, 1878, and from April, 1883, served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; on special duty at Rawal Pindi durbar, March, 1885; acted as private sec. to the lieut.-govr. of the Punjab in 1887 and 1888; asst. commr. and settlt. officer, Oct., 1888; dep. commr., March, 1895.

DAVIES, JAMES ACWORTH, B.L., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Denmark Hill Gr. Sch., and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 3rd Jan., 1869, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; asst. sec. to govt. in the jud. and legis. depts., April, 1880; member of the board of exams., Jan., 1882; under sec. in the rev. dept., Oct., 1882; acting sec. to the board of rev., June, 1883; from Oct., 1883, acted as registrar, high court, Madras, and was apptd. sub-collr. and joint mag., Kistna, July, 1884; district and sessions judge, March, 1888; judge, high court, Dec., 1895.

DAVIES, SIR ROBERT HENRY, K.C.S.I., C.I.E., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. to the Bengal civil service from Haileybury in 1844; served in the N.W. Prov. and cis-Sutlej territory as asst. commr.; settlt. officer, Bari Doab, 1851; joint mag. and dep. collr., Azimgarh, 1858; sec. to govt. of Punjab, 1859; finl. commr., Oudh, 1864; chief commr., Oudh, 1869; lieut.-govr., Punjab, 1871; retd., 1878; member of council of India, March, 1885, to March, 1895.

DAVIES, SIR WILLIAM GEORGE, K.C.S.I., Maj.-Gen., I.S.C., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 23rd Jan., 1849; from April, 1854, served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and asst. settlt. officer; dep. commr., May, 1862; commr. and supt., Delhi, Nov., 1876, and subsequently in the Jalandar divn.; finl. commr., Punjab, Dec., 1883; member of the govr.-gen.'s legis. council, March, 1886; K.C.S.I., Feb., 1887; retd., April, 1887; author of a report on the settlt. of the Shahpur district.

DAVIS, ARTHUR WILLIAM, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Rossall, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 14th Dec., 1882, and served in Assam as asst. commr.; dep. commr., March, 1891; on special duty with Manipur field force, 1891; on special duty as pol. officer, N. Lushai, Oct., 1892; confd., April, 1893; insp.-gen. of police, Assam, July, 1897.

DAVIS, JOHN SAMUEL CHAMPION, M.A., Indian C.S. (N.W.Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Taunton Coll. Sch., Rossall, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 1st Dec., 1880, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; asst. supt., Dehra Dun, April, 1882; junr. sec. board of rev., Oct., 1886, and Feb., 1890; joint mag., Oct., 1889; settlt. officer, Feb., 1893; mag. and collr., Oct., 1896.

DAWSON, ERNEST FREDERICK, A.M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Trained at the Royal Indian Engrg. Coll.; entered the service as asst. engr. Nov. 1879; exec. engr. April, 1890.

DAWSON, GEOFFREY WILLIAM, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at the Charterhouse, and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 12th Dec., 1893, and served in Burma as asst. commr.; asst. sec., Nov., 1896.

DAWSON, WALTER HILL, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Kensington Gr. Sch., St. Peter's, Weston-super-Mare, and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 21st Nov., 1888, and served as asst. commr. in Burma; under sec. to chief commr., April, 1892; offg. dep. commr., June, 1895.

DAY, ARTHUR SOMERSET, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Brighton Coll., Bedford Gr. Sch., and Clifton Coll.; writer, India office, 26th Oct., 1874; clerk, 2nd class, Nov., 1878.
DAYARAM GIDUMAL, B.A., LL.B. Statutory C.S. (Bombay).—Apptd. probr. under the native civil service rules, and asst. collr., 3rd Jan., 1885; employed from May, 1885, to April, 1886, in compiling a jaghir record for Sind; condl. as member of the civil service, 3rd March, 1887; 1st asst., May, 1896; judge and sessions judge, April, 1897.

DE, KIRAN CHANDRA, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Calcutta Univ., and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 23rd Dec., 1893, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

DEAN, EDWARD JOSEPH, late Bengal printing estabt.—Supt. of Bengal secretariat press, 1st May, 1868, and of the public works dept. press and dep. supt. of govt. printing, April, 1869; supt. of govt. printing, Calcutta, April, 1873; retd., May, 1891.

DEANE, HAROLD ARTHUR, C.S.I., Major, I.S.C., Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 13th Nov., 1874, and from July, 1885, served in the Punjab, as asst. commr.; placed on special duty with Chitral relief force, March, 1895; C.S.I., Jan., 1896; dep. commr., 1896; rest. and pol. officer, Dir, Swat and Chitral, Nov., 1896.

DEANE, THOMAS, Col., I.S.C.—First commn., 21st hussars, March, 1862; licut., Bengal staff corps, March, 1863; adjutant, govr.-gen.'s body guard, Jan., 1871; 3rd asst. sec. to the govt. of India, mil. dept., Jan., 1877; and asst. sec., April, 1884; dep. sec., July, 1886; dir., army remount dept., Nov., 1889.

DEAS, JOSEPH, M.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the High Sch. and Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 1st Nov., 1870, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., asst. settl. officer, and joint mag. and dep. collr.; district and sessions judge, Aug., 1887; legal remembrancer, Dec., 1890; sec. to legisl. council, Dec., 1890; also member of the council, Jan., 1891; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1893; offg. jud. commr. in Oudh, April, 1896.

DEASE, PAGET PATRICK, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st April, 1871, and employed on state railways in the Punjab and Baluchistan; exec. engr., Sept., 1881; engr.-in-chief, Wazirabad-Multan railway survey, Nov., 1892; depd. to Kashmir in 1893, in connection with railway survey; engr.-in-chief, Umarkot-Pachpadra railway survey, Oct., 1893; offg. engr.-in-chief, Kotri-Rohri railway, May, 1895; dep. consulting engr. for railways, Bombay, Feb., 1896.

DE BEAUREPAIRE, ERNEST LUCIEN, Accnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 31st March, 1885.

DE BOURBEL, RAOUl, Maj.-Gen., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., as licut., Bengal engrs., 1850; joined the dept., Nov., 1852; exec. engr., Lower Prov., Dec., 1853; asst. to chief engr., Lower Prov., Jan., 1857; dep. consulting engr., railway dept., and asst. sec. to govt., N.W. Prov., May, 1866; suptg. engr., Gauhati, June, 1865; dep. consulting engr. for railways, Oudh, Feb., 1870; consulting engr. for guaranteed railways, Lucknow, 1871; in temporary charge of public works dept. in Baluchistan, 1879-80; consulting engr. for guaranteed railways, Calcutta, 1880; chief engr., 1st class, Jan., 1884; retired, 1885.

DE BRETT, EDWARD ADOLPHUS, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Winchester Coll. and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 16th Nov., 1888, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr. and settl. officer, dep. commr., Jan., 1897.

DE BROE, VICTOR EDWARD, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 22nd Jan., 1874, and posted to State Railways; exec. engr., June, 1892.

DE FABECK, WILLIAM FREDERICK, M.D., Surgn.-Major-Gen., late Madras Med. Dept.—Entered the army med. dept., June, 1855; joined the Madras med. dept., June, 1857, and served under the mil. dept. to May, 1871, also holding various civil surgeoncies; from Nov., 1873, served in British Burma as civil surgn. and supt. of lock hospital, Maulmain; also health officer, Maulmain, Feb., 1878; dep. surgn.-gen., Nagpur force, and Central India regts., March, 1886; surgn.-gen. with the govt. of Madras, May, 1890; retd., May, 1894; served in the Crimean campaign, 1855-56 (medal and clasp), and in the Mutiny, 1859 (medal).

DEIGHTON, KENNETH, B.A., late Educn. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service as profr., Agra coll., 19th Feb., 1862; principal, Agra coll., March, 1864; inspr. of schs., Rohilkhand divn., April, 1885; retd., 1890.

DE LA COURNEUVE, STEWART HOWARD THOMAS, Burma Commn.—Joined the service, 24th Jan., 1873; extra asst. commr., Feb., 1880; asst. commr., March, 1886; dep. commr., March, 1891.

DE LAESSOE, ALBERT FREDERICK, C.M.G., C.I.E., Capt., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Served in the Danish army from April, 1867; attached to foreign legion of French army, 1870-71; chevalier of legion of honour, 1871; from 1873 to 1880 served as instructor in Persian army and chief of staff coll. in Persia; apptd. translr. to govt. of India, foreign dept., Feb., 1881; attached to Afghan boundary commn., Sept., 1884; on special duty with Sir West Ridgeway in St. Petersburg and London: cantonmt. mag., Nasirabad, Nov., 1887; asst. commr., Mer wara, July, 1889; Ajmir, May, 1892; pol. agent, Bhopawar, Feb., 1893.

DELAWAR HOSAIN AHMED, Khan Bahadur, B.A., Bengal Registrn. Dept.—Educ. at Calcutta Univ.; joined the service, 27th Feb., 1861, as dep. mag., and dep. collr.; apptd. inspr.-gen. of registrn., Bengal, April, 1895.

DELEVINGNE, WALTER NORMAN, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at the City of London Sch. and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 25th Nov., 1891, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

DE MARSAC, FREDERICK ROOME, late India Telegraph Dept.—Apptd., 8th March, 1864; asst. supt., Jan., 1866; supt., April, 1880; in charge, store dept., May, 1891; retd., March, 1892.

DE MORGAN, WALTER CAMPBELL, M.I.C.E., Madras Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Oct., 1874, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., May, 1885.

DEMPSTER, JAMES INNES ROTHEY, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 2nd Nov., 1870, and employed on irrig. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., Jan., 1880; services lent to Egyptian govt., 1885-89; suptg. engr., April, 1893.
DENMAN, John, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Marlborough, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 4th Dec., 1880, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; joint mag., Nov., 1891; small cause court judge, Aug., 1893; district and sessions judge, March, 1894.

DENNYS, Charles John, Major, I.S.C., Jud. Dept., Punjab.—Arrived, 1st May, 1873; services placed at disposal of Punjab govt., July, 1881; offg. asst. cantonmt. mag., Aug., 1881; confd., Oct., 1882; cantonmt. mag., March, 1886.

DE PALEZIEUX-FALCONNET, Grenville Pulteney, Major-Gen., R.E., late Mil. Works Dept., Govt. of India.—First commr., Madras engrs., 1852; joined the Madras public works dept., Aug., 1854, as assg. engr.; from Dec., 1854, served in the Bengal public works dept. as exec. engr., Pegu; Mhow divn., Rajputana, Nov., 1864; offg. suptg. engr., mil. works, Allahabad, 1872; suptg. engr., Meerut, April, 1874, and afterwards at Moradabad and Rawalpindi; offd. as inspr.-gen. of mil. works, 1883-84; retd., 1886.

DE RENZY, Annesley Charles Castriot, C.B., B.A., Surgn.-Gen., late Bengal Med. Service.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; entered the Bengal med. service, 1851; served through the Burmese war, 1852-53 (medal and clasp), and the Mutiny, 1857-58 (medal and clasp); apptd. first sanitary commr., Punjab, 1868; sanitary commr., Assam, 1878; served in the expdn. against the Nagas, 1879 (clasp and C.B.); dep. surgn.-gen. Punjab frontier force, 1880; retd., Dec., 1882; author of sanitary reports to govt. on the Punjab and Assam, and of a paper on the sanitary state of British troops in N. India.

DE ROZARIO, Victor Philip, Madras Jud. Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Oct., 1858, and served in various subord. posts; district munsif., Nov., 1864; sub-judge, Oct., 1875; judge, Madras small causes court, Dec., 1892.

DEVONSHIRE (DUKE OF), His Grace Spencer Compton Cavendish, K.G., P.C., D.C.L., LL.D.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Cambridge; attached to Earl Granville’s special mission to Russia in 1856; M.P. for N. Lancashire from 1857 to 1868, when he was returned for the Radnor boroughs; LL.D., Cambridge, 1862; apptd. a lord of the admiralty, March, 1862; under sec. for war, April, 1863; sec. of state for war, Feb.-July, 1866; postmr.-gen., 1868-71; chief sec. for Ireland, 1871-74; lord rector of the univ. of Edinburgh, 1879; was returned for N.E. Lancashire in April, 1880, and became sec. of state for India; sec. of state for war, 1882-85; a royal commr. for the exhibn. of 1886; chairman of the royal commn. on the labour question, 1891; chancellor of Cambridge univ., 1892; K.G., 1892; lord prest. of the council in Lord Salisbury’s third administration, July, 1895.

DEWHURST, Robert Paget, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Clitheroe Gr. Sch. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 28th Dec., 1893, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., and asst. mag. and collr.

DE WINTON, Walter Bernard, Madras Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Oct., 1874, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., May, 1883; in 1885-86 served temporarily on Madras state railway surveys, and in 1890-91 was employed under the inspr.-gen. of mil. works.

DEY, George Goodair, late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at North London Coll. Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 25th Oct., 1869, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., July, 1880; also served in Assam, in 1880, as offg. judge of Sylhet and Cachar; district and sessions judge, Sept., 1887; retd., April, 1895.

DHANJISHA NAVROJI PARAKH, L.R.C.P., M.R.C.S., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bombay Med. Service.—Joined the service, Sept., 1874; arrived, 5th May, 1875; employed under the mil. dept. till 1881, including service in the Persian expdn., 1856-57 (medal and clasp); served subsequently as asst. civil surgn., Poona, and in various acting appts.; surgn. to the Gokuldas Tejpal hosp., Jan., 1887.

DHARMA RAONAYUDU REDNAM, Dewan Bahadur, late Madras Salt Dept.—Joined the service, 15th May, 1861, and was employed in the police dept. until April, 1869, when he was transferred to the rev. dept. as dep. collr.; personal asst. to salt commr., July, 1878; asst. commr. of salt rev., Feb., 1880; dep. commr., Dec., 1892; retd., April, 1896.

DIACK, Alexander Henderson, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Univ. of Aberdeen, and King’s College, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 3rd Jan., 1882, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and settlt. officer; senr. sec. to finl. commrs., Nov., 1891, to July, 1892; dep. commr. and settlt. officer, Dec., 1894.

DICKENS, Craven Hildesley, C.S.I., Lieut.-Gen., late R.A.—2nd lieut., Bengal artillery, June, 1838; asst. sec., govt. of India, public works dept., June, 1855; chief engr. and sec. to chief commr., Central Prov., April, 1864; sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., March, 1865, to Feb., 1877; retd., 31st Dec., 1878; is a visitor of Cooper’s Hill College.

DICKINSON, Francis Bradley, Forest Dept., Burma.—Joined the dept., 22nd Dec., 1872, and served in Coorg, Madras, Central Prov. and Burma as asst. and dep. conservator; conservator, Burma, April, 1894.

DIMMOCOCK, Henry Peers, M.R.C.S., L.R.C.P., Surgn.-Major, Bombay Educl.Dept.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1880; civil surgn., Sept., 1887; supt., Mahabaleshwar, Sept., 1889; obstetric physician and profr. of midwifery, Grant med. coll., June, 1891; also presidency surgn., April, 1893; member of plague committee, March, 1897.

DIXON, Frederic Percival, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Manchester Gr. Sch., and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 19th Dec., 1895; and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

DIXON, Frederick Thomas, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at London Univ., and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 28th Dec., 1894, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

DIXON, James, Burma Police Dept.—Apptd. inspr. of police, Sept., 1870; asst. district supt., Oct., 1877, and district supt., Jan., 1883; dep. inspr.-gen. of civil police, July, 1880.

DOBIE, William Herbert, Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Educ. at the Merchant Taylors’ Sch.; joined the dept., 23rd May, 1872; on
famine duty, 1874-75; asst. acctnt.-gen., N.W. Prov., Dec., 1875; from Jan., 1876, served in Bengal, as acting dep. acctnt.-gen., and as asst. comptr.-gen.; served in Madras, 1878-83, and in the Punjab, 1883-84; asst. acctnt.-gen., Bengal, Dec., 1884; Punjab, April, 1885; dep. acctnt.-gen., N.W. Prov., March, 1886; comptr., Assam, April, 1887; dep. acctnt.-gen., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Oct., 1890; offig. comptr., Haidarabad, July, 1891; dep. comptr.-gen., April, 1896.

DOBBS, HENRY ROBERT CONWAY, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Winchester and Brasenose Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 6th Dec., 1892, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; asst. supt., Dehra Dun, March, 1895; pte. sec. to lieut.-govr., June, 1896; joint mag., April, 1897.

DOBIE, STANLEY LOCKER, Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 30th March, 1872; supt. of lunatic asylum, Madras, Jan., 1882; served in Afghanistan and Egypt; med. officer, Utakamand, April, 1888, to Nov., 1889; supt. of lunatic asylum, Madras, Jan., 1892; reverted to mil. dept., Dec., 1892; retd., July, 1897.

DODD, CHARLES, late Educn. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service as offg. profr. Agra coll., 4th Aug., 1868; head master, Bareilly coll., Dec., 1868; profr. of English literature, Agra and Benares colls., Dec., 1874; inspr. of schools, Sept., 1884; retd., March, 1894.

DODD, CHARLES ALBERT, Col., I.S.C.—Arrived as ensign, 12th Nov., 1857, and served during the Mutiny (medal and clasp); from Feb., 1860, served in the police dept.; personal asst. to inspr.-gen., N.W. Prov., March, 1861; district supt., Aug., 1861; from April, 1870, served as supt., govt. press, and curator of govt. books, N.W. Prov.; also supt. of emigration, Jan., 1883; reverted to mil. dept., May, 1893.

DODERET, WILLIAM, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Univ. Coll. Sch., London, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 7th Nov., 1882, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; forest settlt. officer, May, 1888; 2nd asst., April, 1890; special under sec. to govt. in the dept. of famine relief, Feb.–May, 1892; 1st asst., May, 1893.

DOGSON, CYRIL GEORGE, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1883, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; forest settlt. officer, and W. Bhil agent; in 1892 acted as undersec., rev., &c., depts.; 1st asst., March, 1894.

DOIG, SCROPE BERDMORE, M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 16th July, 1867, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., Nov., 1872; on special duty, Ahmadnagar water-supply scheme, in 1891, and again as member of Sind irrign. commn.; sanitary engr., and member of sanitary board, Jan., 1892; returned to public works dept., as suptg. engr., Oct., 1893; chief engr., Dec., 1896.

DONALD, JAMES, M.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Aberdeen Univ. and St. John’s Coll., Camb.; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 7th Dec., 1896, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

DONALD, JOHN STUART, C.I.E., Punjab Commn.—Joined the service, April, 1882; extra asst. commr., May, 1884; asst. commr., Nov., 1880; accompanied mission to Kabul under Sir H. M. Durand, 1893; on special duty on the N.W. Frontier, 1894; was British commr. for demarcation of Kurram-Afghan boundary, May-Dec., 1894.

DONALD, WILLIAM, late Finl. Dept., Madras.—Arrived, 26th Oct., 1856; from 23rd May, 1859, served in the central public works office, and the civil paymaster’s office, Madras, and was apptd. to finl. dept., Aug., 1862; asst. acctnt.-gen., Madras, Aug., 1869; dir. of incorporated bank of Madras, March, 1871; asst. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, Nov., 1874, and at Madras, June, 1875; dep. acctnt.-gen., Madras, Dec., 1884; retd., 1889; compiled the manual of rules and regulations for the use of junior members of Madras civil service.

DONOVAN, CHARLES, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Kingstown Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 11th Jan., 1863; from Feb., 1864, served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; served in Assam, Sept., 1879, to June, 1882, as dep. commr.; judge, Benares, Jan., 1885; retd., June, 1889.

DOSABHAI FRAMJI, C.S.I., late Presidency Mag., Bombay.—Served from 6th Oct., 1860, as income tax assessor; police mag., July, 1866; special officer for the imperial licence tax, May, 1867; collr. of income tax, and certificate tax, May, 1869; sheriff of Bombay, Dec., 1871; from June, 1874, served as second mag. of police, Bombay, and also held the posts of chairman of the municipal corporation, chairman of the justices of the peace, member of legisl. council, joint commr. of income tax, &c.; retd., 1888; author of ‘Moral and Miscellaneous Essays,’ ‘The British Raj,’ History of the Parsees,’ and ‘Travels in Great Britain.’

DOUGLAS, EDWARD WILLIAM SPENCER, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd. apprentice engr., 4th Nov., 1871, and posted to state railways; asst. engr., Sept., 1872; transfd. to N.W. Prov. and Oudh, irrign. branch, Nov., 1873; exec. engr., May, 1883; served on state railways in 1885-86 and 1886-87.

DOUGLAS, SHOLTO JAMES, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Clifton Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 6th Jan., 1872, and served in Assam as asst. commr. and inspr. of labourers; from April, 1885, served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., July, 1889; district and sessions judge, Aug., 1894.

DOUIE, JAMES McCrone, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at the High Sch., Edinburgh, Univ. of Edinburgh, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 7th Dec., 1876, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., sec. to the finl. commr. and settlt. officer; senr. sec. to finl. commr., April, 1889; dep. commr., Nov., 1891; offig. rev. sec., April, 1893, to Oct., 1894, and from Nov., 1895, to April, 1896; has publd. a transl. of the Biluchinama, with a Biloch grammar.

DOVETON, JOHN CHADWICK, Col., I.S.C., late Forest Dept., Central Prov.—First commn., Oct., 1883; asst. conservator of forests, Central Prov., 8th April, 1864; dep. conservator, May, 1865; conservator, Sept., 1868; reverted to mil. dept., April, 1894.
DOWDEN, THOMAS FREEMAN, Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., Dec., 1856; joined the Bombay public works dept., Aug., 1859; under sec. to govt., 1865; dep. consulting engr. for railways, Bombay, 1872; manager, Dhond and Manmad state railway, Dec., 1878; served in the Afghan war, 1879-80 (medal); offg. sec. to agent, Baluchistan, April, 1880; acting senr. dep. consulting engr., and under sec. to govt., Bombay, Nov., 1881; asst. to dir.-gen. of railways, 1884; suptg. engr., July, 1886; dep. consulting engr., Calcutta, April, 1886; consulting engr. for guaranteed railways, Lucknow, Feb., 1887; reverted to mil. duty, June, 1892; retd. from the army, May, 1893.

DOWN, JAMES ERskINE, Bombay Police Dept.—Joined the service, 24th May, 1872; asst. supt., Aug., 1875; supt., April, 1876.

DOYLE, BERNARD, B.A., M.B., M.Ch., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Med. Dept., Punjab.—Apptd. to the Indian med. dept., and arrived, 21st Nov., 1876; served in mil. dept. to April, 1881, and afterwards in the Punjab as civil surgn. and dep. sanitary commr.; served in Burma, 1886-87; med. adviser to Maharaja of Jhind, Sept., 1887; civil surgn., Ambala, March, 1890; civil surgn. and supt. of lunatic asylum, Delhi, June, 1890; civil surgn., Firozpur, Oct., 1892; Pesha-war, July, 1893.

DO'YLY, WARREN HASTINGS, late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 23th May, 1858, and served in the Bengal rev. and jud. depts.; inspr.-gen. of jails, May, 1876; mag. and collr., 1st grade, July, 1876; offg. opium agent, Behar, 1878, 1885-87, and 1889-90; offg. commr., Bhagalpur, 1884-85, and 1889; retd., Nov., 1891.

DRAKE, FRANCIS COURTNEY, B.A., India Office.—Educ. at Winchester and New Coll., Oxford; junr. clerk, record office, 23rd Feb., 1892; junr. clerk, India office, 22nd Aug., 1892; private sec. to permanent under sec. of state, Feb., 1894.

DRAKE-BROCKMAN, EDWARD FORSTER, F.R.C.S., L.R.C.P., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Madras Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., 1st Oct., 1866; arrived, 23rd April, 1867, and served under the mil. dept., Madras, and also in acting civil appts.; rest. asst. surgn., gen. hosp., and profr., med. coll., Madras, Oct., 1870; ophthalmic surgn., gen. hosp., and prof. of ophthalmic surgery and physiology, med. coll., March, 1875; fellow of Madras univ., March, 1885; retd., April, 1894; apptd. member of India Office med. board, 3rd Aug., 1897.

DRAKE-BROCKMAN, ELLIOT GEORGE, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Elizabeth Coll., Guernsey, and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 19th Nov., 1888, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Jan., 1895.

DRAKE-BROCKMAN, HENRY VERNON, B.A., LL.B., Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Charterhouse, and St. Peter's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 10th Dec., 1886, and served in the Central Prov. as acting under sec. and asst. commr.; commr. of excise, Aug., 1894; dep. commr., Oct., 1894.

DRAKE-BROCKMAN, RALPH RHENIUS EVANS, A.I.C.E., Lieut.-Col., R.E., Madras Public Works Dept.—Arrived, 1st March, 1864, and joined sappers and miners; from Dec., 1864, served in the public works dept.; exec. engr., March, 1870; suptg. engr., Nov., 1888; acted in 1889 and 1892-93 as joint sec. to govt. and chief engr., gen. buildings and roads branch; chief engr. for irrign., and joint sec. to govt., irrign. branch, April, 1893; chief engr., 1st class, Jan., 1896.

DRAKE-BROCKMAN, WILLIAM DRAKE, A.M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Served in the Punjab as sub. asst. rev. surveyor, 1852-55; joined Thomason Coll., and thence was apptd. to the public works dept., April, 1858, and served in the N.W. Prov., in the buildings and roads branch; transf'd. temporarily to railway dept., 1858-60; employed on famine relief works in 1861, and 1877-78; exec. engr., March, 1874; suptg. engr., March, 1886; retd., March, 1892.

DREW, WILLIAM WILSON, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Charterhouse, and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 14th Nov., 1878, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; from May, 1882, served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and railway mag., and was permanently transf'd., June, 1885; inspr. of factories, town of Bombay, May, 1887; and asst. collr., Nov., 1888; provl. supt. of census operations, April, 1890; 1st asst. collr. and mag., May, 1891; junr. collr. and mag., May, 1896.

DRIBERG, JOHN JAMES STREET, late Assam Commn.—Educ. at St. Nicholas Coll., Lancing; joined the service as acting dep. mag. and dep. collr. in Bengal, Nov., 1861; confd., 16th April, 1862; from Dec., 1863, served in Assam as extra asst. commr.; asst. civil and pol. officer with the Bhutan Duars field force, 1864-65 (medal and clasp); dep. supt. of census in Assam, Oct., 1880; supt. of emigration, June, 1882; dep. commr., May, 1886; inspr.-gen. of jails, &c., Nov., 1891; in 1893 acted as commr., Assam valley districts; retd., April, 1896.

DRUMMOND, JAMES RAMSAY, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Edinburgh Acad., Univ. of Glasgow, and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 27th Nov., 1874, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; district judge, March, 1890; dep. commr., Aug., 1890.

DRURY, GEORGE MARSTON, late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. traffic supt., 30th Jan., 1878, and served chiefly on the E. Bengal state railway; traffic supt., E. Coast railway, Nov., 1891; retd., Dec., 1892.

DRYSDALE, ALEXANDER TOVEY, late Forest Dept., Haidarabad Administration.—Arrived, Dec., 1864; from April, 1865, served in the Central Prov. as head master of govt. sch.; from June, 1868, served in the forest dept., Berar, as asst. conservator, dep. conservator, and conservator; retd., Jan., 1887.

DRYSDALE, THEODORE, late Central Prov. Commn.—Asst. master, govt. school, Saugor, April, 1861; served in the Central Prov. commn. from 19th Jan., 1863; apptd. extra asst. commr., April, 1864; supt. of the jud. commr.'s office, June, 1864; registrar, May, 1869; dep. supt. of census operations, Central Prov., April, 1880, and wrote the provl. report; judge, small cause court, Nagpur, Nov., 1884; dep. commr., April, 1885; cantonmt. mag., Kampti, 1885-89; divl. judge, June, 1895; retd., March, 1897.
D'SOUZA, Francis Xavier, B.A., LL.B., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 20th Jan., 1894, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

DU BOULAY, James Houssemayne, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Winchester and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 1st Dec., 1889, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settl. officer; and assist., May, 1896.

DUCAT, Walter Marden, Col., R.E., late Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service as second lieut., 13th June, 1856; arrived, May, 1858; asst. engr., Aug., 1859; exec. engr., Aug., 1853; suptg. engr., Nov., 1886; retd., April, 1890.

DUCKETT, Francis William, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 31st July, 1893.

DUFF, Alan Colquhoun, late Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Fettes Coll., Edinburgh, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 28th Dec., 1881, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., acting under sec., &c.; judge, small cause court, Oct., 1891; commr. of excise, March, 1892; dep. commr., March, 1892; retd.

DUFFERIN AND AVA (Marquis of), Right Hon. Frederick Temple Hamilton Blackwood, K.P., G.C.B., G.C.S.I., G.C.M.G., G.C.I.E., P.C., D.C.L., LL.D.—Educ. at Eton and Christ Church, Oxford; specially attached to Lord John Russell's mission to Vienna in 1855; in 1860 was apptd.
