HART, JOHN HENRY EUSTACE, M.I.C.E., late Public Works Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 23rd Nov., 1854; joined the dept., Jan., 1855, and served as civil engr., acting exec. engr. for reclamations, Bombay, architectural exec. engr. and surveyor, Bombay, and acting supt., harbour works, Karachi; acting chief engr. for irrign., Sept., 1877; suptg. engr., March, 1880; joint sec. for irrign., March, 1880; chief engr., Dec., 1885; sec., public works and irrign. dept., Sept., 1887; retd., 1888.

HART, SIDNEY GEORGE, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at King's Sch., Rochester, and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 4th Dec., 1895, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

HART, WILLIAM, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. in 1834; served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag. and asst. judge and sessions judge; commr. for enquiring into claims, &c., S. Mahrratta country, 1847; sec. to govt., gen. and ecclesi. depts., 1855, also in the public works dept., and railway branch, 1856; puisne judge of the court of sadar diwani, 1860; rev. and police commr., S. divn., 1862; member of Bombay legisl. council, 1864; retd. in 1865.

HART-DAVIES, THOMAS, late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Marlborough; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 13th Nov., 1869, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; from May, 1876, served in Sind as educ. inspr. and manager of encumbered estates; 1st asst. collr., April, 1887; judge and sessions judge, June, 1891; acted in May, 1895, as jud. commr. in Sind; retd., Feb., 1897.

HARTNOLL, HENRY SULLIVAN, B.L., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Exeter Gr. Sch., and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1883, and served in Burma as asst. commr., (war medal and clasp); dep. commr., July, 1890.

HARTT, WILLIAM EDWARD, India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 19th April, 1876; asst. traffic supt., state railways, 1878; district traffic supt., 1882.

HARTWELL, SYDNEY CHARLES ELPHINSTONE, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. traffic supt., Oudh and Rohilkhand railway, 1st Jan., 1880; offd. manager, 1891-92, and from April, 1895.

HARVEY, EDWARD, Lieut.-Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., 22nd Dec., 1859; served in the dept. from April, 1864; exec. engr., mil. works branch, June, 1871; served in the Lushai expdn., 1871-72 (medal and clasp), in the Jowaki Afridi campaign, 1878-79 (clasp), and in the Afghan war, 1879-80 (medal); suptg. engr., May, 1889; retd., Oct., 1892.

HARVEY, JOHN, Educl. Dept., Punjab.—Served as asst. and head master of various schs. from 1st Nov., 1869; asst. inspr. of schs., April, 1877; tutor to the Raja of Chamba, Nov., 1879; inspr. of schs., Nov., 1883.

HARVEY, ROBERT, D.S.O., M.D., Surgn.-Major-Gen., Bengal Med.Service.—First commn., 31st March, 1865; from 1867 served as civil surgn., offd. sanitary commr., Bengal, med. inspr. of emigrants, and supt. of emigration; profr. of midwifery, med. coll., and obstetric physician to the coll. hosp., Sept., 1882; hon. surgn. on personal staff of the viceroy, May, 1883; reverted to mil. dept., March, 1890; inspr.-gen. of civil hosps., Bengal, May, 1894; principal med. officer, Punjab, April, 1895.

HARVEY, WILLIAM LEATHEM, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the Royal Acadl. Instn., Belfast, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 28th Dec., 1883, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settlt. officer; under sec. to govt., rev., finl. and gen. depts., Aug., 1891; 1st asst., Aug., 1894; dep. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, July, 1895.

HARWARD, ALFRED EDGAR, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Rossall Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 12th Dec., 1885, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Feb., 1892; transfd. to Assam as asst. commr., April, 1894; district and sessions judge, July, 1896.
HASHMAT-ULLA, Maulvi, M.A., Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. a probr. under the native civil service rules, March, 1886; confd., 13th June, 1889, as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., April, 1894; asst. commr., Jan., 1897.

HASTED, JOHN ORD, Col., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Madras.—2nd lieut., Madras engrs., Dec., 1853; served in the dept. from 30th Jan., 1856, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., April, 1865, and suptg. engr., Feb., 1877; chief engr. for irrign., and joint sec. to govt., April, 1884; fellow of Madras univ., 1883; sec., gen. and buildings and road branches, 1886; retd., July, 1890.

HASTINGS, CHARLES GODOLPHIN WILLIAM, Punjab Police.—Entered the service as asst. dist. supt., Sept., 1873; dist. supt., Dec., 1882; on special duty in Kabul, Feb.-Oct., 1880; with Chitral relief force, June-Sept., 1895; special duty in Kurram from March, 1896.

HASTINGS, FRANCIS THEOPHILUS CLINTON, India Office.—Educ. at Haileybury Coll.; admiralty writer, 8th Oct., 1868; civil service copyist, Jan., 1874; clerk specially attached to the pol. and secret dept., India office, 7th March, 1877; rest. clerk, July, 1888; asst. private sec. to the sec. of state, June, 1892; précis writer, Nov., 1896.

HASTINGS, WARREN, Major, I.S.C., Berar Commn.—Educ. at Brighton Coll.; first commn., 28th Feb., 1874; served in Bengal as cantonmt. mag. and small cause court judge from Jan., 1881; special asst. commr., Berar, Sept., 1887; dep. commr., July, 1891; in charge of provl. census operations, 1890-92.

HATCH, GEORGE WASHINGTON, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 20th Nov., 1893, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

HATCH, HENRY FREDERICK, Bombay Survey Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Dec., 1873, and served as asst. supt.; supt. of surveys and asst. to pol. agent, Kathiawar, April, 1896.

HATCH, WILLIAM KEITH, M.B., C.M., F.R.C.S., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bombay Med. Dept.—Arrived, 10th Nov., 1877; second surgn. of the Jamsetji Jijibhoi hosp., and prof'r. of anatomy, &c., Grant med. coll., May, 1884; senr. med. officer and senr. surgn. of the hosp., and prof'r. of surgery at the coll., April, 1893.

HATCHELL, CHARLES, Surgn.-Major, late Med. Dept., N.W. Prov.—Asst. surgn., Bengal med. establ., 23rd July, 1858; served in N.W. Prov. as civil asst. surgn. from Dec., 1859, to Oct., 1864, and subsequently under the mil. dept.; took part in the Bhutan expdn.; served again under govt. of N.W. Prov. from Nov., 1869, as civil asst. surgn., jail supt., and civil surgn.; retd., Oct., 1888.

HATHERLY, JOHN RODNEY, Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 23rd July, 1868, as asst. engr., and was employed on various irrign. works; exec. engr., Feb., 1876.

HATHORNTHWAITE, JAMES THOMAS, M.A., Educl. Dept., Bombay.—Educ. at St. John's Coll., Cambridge; arrived, 3rd Oct., 1872, and served from that date as prof'r. of mathematics at the Elphinstone coll., Bombay; also principal of the coll., April, 1894.

HATTEN, JOHN JAMES, B.A., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 12th Oct., 1875, and employed on irrign. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., May, 1883.

HAVELOCK, SIR ARTHUR ELIBANK, G.C.M.G., G.C.I.E.—Entered the army, Jan., 1862; private sec. and A.D.C. to the officer administering the govt. of Mauritius, 1873-74; acting chief civil commr., Seychelles Islands, 1874-75; member of council, Fiji, and for a time colonial sec. and receiver-gen., 1875; prest. of Nevis, 1877; administering the govt. of St. Lucia, 1878-79; chief civil commr., Seychelles, 1879; govr. of W. Africa settlts., 1881, and assisted in Anglo-French negotiations at Paris regarding that territory; consul for Liberia, 1881; K.C.M.G., 1884; govr. of Trinidad, 1884; govr. of Natal and special commr. for Zulu affairs, 1885; also govr. of Zululand, 1887; attended Brussels conference on the suppression of the slave trade, 1889; govr. of Ceylon, 1890; G.C.M.G., 1895; govr. of Madras, March, 1896; G.C.I.E., March, 1896.

HAWKINS, ROBERT WILLIAM LYONS, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 3rd Oct., 1873, and employed on irrign. works in N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., Jan., 1884.

HAY, GEORGE WILLIAM ROBERTSON, M.D., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 1st April, 1868; arrived, 24th Oct., 1868; served in the mil., civil, and jail branches of the service, and was apptd. port surgn. at Aden, June, 1876; sec. to the principal med. officer, Poonah, Oct., 1890.

HAYDON, WILLIAM HENRY, Lieut.-Col., R.E., late Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 17th Dec., 1862; arrived, 1st March, 1865; exec. engr., Jan., 1870; employed on Bombay reclamation works and defences, Tapti bridge, and with the Kandahar field force; employed under mil. works dept., 1890-91; ret., Dec., 1894.

HAYES, ALFRED, late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 5th Feb., 1873, and employed on irrign. works in Bengal; on duty in Madras on famine relief works, 1877-78; exec. engr., May, 1883; retd., March, 1897.

HAYWARD, MAURICE HENRY WESTON, LL.B., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Harrow and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 19th Nov., 1889, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; under sec. to govt. of Bombay, pol., &c., depts., Aug., 1895; jud. asst. to pol. agent, Kathiawar, Sept., 1896.

HAZLETT, HENRY JAMES, M.D., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 1st April, 1867; arrived, 8th Nov., 1867, and was employed on mil. and jail duty; analyst to salt commn., Madras, 1876; surgn., 4th district, Jan., 1887, to May, 1888; also prof'r. in med. coll., Aug., 1887; employed in mil. accts. dept. of govt. of India, 1888 and 1889; surgn., 3rd district, Feb., 1893; retd., July, 1897.

HEAD, EDGAR ALFRED, Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at King Edward's Gr. Sch., Bath; clerk, 2nd class, 30th May, 1895.

HEADLEY, ROBERT HOLLOWELL, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 9th March, 1896.
HEANEY, JOHN SAMUEL, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Royal Univ. of Ireland, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 4th Dec., 1895, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

HEATON, JOSEPH JOHN, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Bradford Gr. Sch., and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 24th Dec., 1881, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and acting under sec.; asst. judge and sessions judge, July, 1889; private sec. to gov'r. of Bombay, July, 1895.

HEAVISIDE, WILLIAM JAMES, Lieut.-Col., R.E., late Survey of India Dept.—Joined Addiscombe, Aug., 1857; lieut., Bengal engrs., June, 1859; served in the public works dept. as asst. engr. from Sept., 1862; asst. field engr. with the Bhutan force, 1865-66 (medal and clasp); joined the great trigonl. survey, Jan., 1866; dep. supt., April, 1872; served in Afghanistan, 1878-79 (medal), and subsequently in Khandesh and Bombay native states; ret'd., July, 1888.

HEBBERT, FREDERICK BENBOW, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1874; exec. engr., Sept., 1883; offg. dep. consulting engr. for railways, Lucknow, April, 1887; under sec. to gov't. of Bengal, public works dept., March, 1888; under sec. and dep. dir.-gen. of railways, May, 1892; offg. manager, Burma state railway, Jan.-May, 1896; suptg. engr., Nov., 1896.

HEINIG, JOSEPH, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 26th July, 1867, and posted to N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., Oct., 1877; suptg. engr., Oct., 1895.

HEMING, DEMPSTER, Lieut.-Col., late Police Dept., Madras.—First commn., 16th Nov., 1861; proby. asst. supt. of police, Dec., 1865; dep. commn., Oct., 1874; asst. with the gov't. of Madras, 1888, and 1890; supt. of police, Jan., 1892; ret'd., Feb., 1894.

HEMINGWAY, PERCY, B.A., Indian C.S. (Central Provs.)—Educ. at Oundle, and Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived, 14th Dec., 1896, and served in the Central Provs. as asst. commr.

HENDERSON, EDWARD PIERCY, B.L., late Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Edinburgh Acad., and St. Peter's Coll., Radley; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 10th Oct., 1871, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; gov't. advocate, Feb., 1878; ret'd., Sept., 1897.

HENDERSON, GEORGE, M.D., Surg.-Major, late Med. Dept., Punjab.—Joined the Indian med. dept. in 1859; civil asst. surgn., Shahpur, May, 1862; supt. of Lahore central jail, April, 1868; offg. supt., botanical gardens in Bengal, Dec., 1872; civil surgn., Gujranwala, Dec., 1875; and subsequently at other stations in the Punjab; ret'd., Nov., 1889.

HENDERSON, PHILIP DURHAM, C.S.I., Maj.-Gen., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Madras cavalry, Feb., 1857; attache, foreign dept., May, 1871; under sec. to the gov't. of India, foreign dept., Nov., 1872; on special duty in Kashmir, 1874; pol. officer on staff of H.R.H. the Prince of Wales, Sept., 1875; C.S.I., March, 1876; gen. supt. of operations for suppression of thagi and dakaite, March, 1878; rest. in Mysore, and chief commr., Coorg, April, 1892; reverted to mil. dept., Feb., 1895.

HENNESSY, SEPTIMUS HOPE, late Jud. Dept., Central Prov.—Joined the service as acting extra asst. commr., 13th July, 1864, and was confd., 8th July, 1867; judge, small cause court, Sept., 1889; acted also as cantonnt. mag. from Nov., 1888; ret'd., Jan., 1892.

HENNIKER, FREDERICK CHANDOS, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 26th Nov., 1887, and served in Assam as asst. commr.

HENRY, EDWARD RICHARD, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at St. Edmund's Coll., Ware, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 22nd Oct., 1873, and served in Bengal; joint mag. and dep. collr., 1st grade, June, 1882; on famine duty, Tirhut, 1873; private sec. to lieut.-gov'r. in 1879 and 1880; mag. and collr., May, 1890; offg. sec. to board of rev., 1890-91; inspr.-gen. of police, May, 1892.

HENSLOWE, CECIL WILLIAM EDWARD, late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., June, 1866, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh, and in the Central Prov.; transfd. to railway establ., Jan., 1880; engr.-in-chief and manager, Cawnpore-Farukhabad and Muttra-Hathras railways, Dec., 1880; manager, Cawnpore-Achnera state railway, 1884; transfd. to Burma state railway, Dec., 1886; ret'd., 1890.

HENVEY, FREDERICK, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Rugby Sch.; apptd. after exam.of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., under sec. to gov't., offg. sec. to board of rev., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; on special duty in 1871 for purpose of compiling a narrative of the famine of 1869-70; under sec. to gov't. of India, foreign dept., July, 1874; offg. rest., Nepal, 1877-78; on special duty, Kashmir, April, 1878; commr., Haidarabad assigned districts, Jan., 1883; rest., E. Rajputana states, Dec., 1885; agent to the gov'r.-gen. in Central India, Jan., 1889; ret'd., Jan., 1891.

HERALD, JOHN LUMGAIR, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Arbroath High Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 24th Dec., 1883; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and in Assam as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., May, 1894; mag. and collr., Aug., 1895; dep. commr., March, 1896.

HERBERT, CHARLES, Major, I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., June, 1874; served under the mil. dept. to 1882, including Afghan war of 1879-80; extra A.D.C. to viceroy, 1878 and 1882; offd. as asst. to the gov'r.-gen., Rajputana, June, 1882; mag. of Abu, Nov., 1882; on depn. to Mewar states to settle boundary disputes, 1883; offg. cantonnt. mag., Nasirabad, 1884 and 1885-86; asst. commr., Ajmir, April, 1886; asst. to the agent, Rajputana, and chief commr., Ajmir-Merwara, March, 1891; offg. pol. agent in E. states of Rajputana, 1891-92; 1st asst. to agent, Central India, Oct., 1892; pol. agent, Kotah, March, 1894.

HERBERT, PATRICK HERBERT COGHLAN, Jud. and Public Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; junr. clerk, accts. branch, 11th March, 1872; jud. and public dept., 1877; rest. clerk, 1885-88; senr. clerk, May, 1891; private sec. to parly. under sec. of state (Mr. G. W. E. Russell, M.P.), 1892-94; editor of India Office List, 1887-91; compiled jointly with Mr. Newmarch the India office cypher code.
HERRON, Herbert George Whitley, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Rugby and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 27th Dec., 1887, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transf. to Burma as asst. commr., Nov., 1888, and offg. under sec.; returned to Bengal, Nov., 1890; joint mag. and collr., Dec., 1896.

HERSCHEL, John, F.R.S., Col., R.E., late Survey of India.—Joined Addiscombe, Feb., 1855; first commn., Dec., 1856; arrived at Calcutta, Jan., 1859; served in the great trigonl. survey from Nov., 1859, in the grades of asst. surveyor and dep. supt.; retd., March, 1886.

HERVEY, Hamilton Law, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Giggleswick Sch. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 27th March, 1887, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 2nd asst., May, 1894; 1st asst., April, 1897.

HEWETSON, John, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Repton, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 13th Dec., 1880, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; served in Burma, from March, 1886, as asst. commr., judge, civil court, Mandalay, and district officer; returned to Madras, Oct., 1888; senr. asst., Ganjam, July, 1889; head asst., Aug., 1893; sub-collr. and joint mag., Dec., 1894; district and sessions judge, May, 1897.

HEWETT, John Prescott, C.I.E., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Winchester, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 17th Dec., 1877, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; in charge of provl. gazetteer, Aug., 1883; acted as asst. acctst.-gen., Jan., 1884; junr. sec., board of rev., April, 1884; offg. under sec. to govt. of India, home dept., Oct., 1886; confd., Aug., 1887; offd. as private sec. to the viceroy in 1888 and 1892, and as sec. to govt. of India, home dept., March, 1890; offg. census commr. for India, July, 1890; dep. sec. to govt. of India, home dept., Dec., 1890; C.I.E., May, 1891; dep. commr., March, 1893; sec. of royal commn. on opium, Oct., 1893; mag. and collr., April, 1894; sec. to govt. of India, home dept., Dec., 1895; author of contributions to provl. gazetteer.

HEWETT, William Selwood, Major, I.S.C., Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—First commn., 30th Dec., 1871; arrived, 13th March, 1872, and was employed on mil. duty, including service in the Afghan war, 1878-80 (medal and clasp); cantonmt. mag., March, 1887.

HEWISH, John, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Junr. clerk, 1st Feb., 1869; senr. clerk, Sept., 1883.

HEWITT, James Francis Katherinus, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1858; arrived, 12th Feb., 1859, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and settl. officer; dep. commr., wards' estate in Behar, Feb., 1873; offg. sec., board of rev., Sept., 1874; mag. and collr., Oct., 1878; commr., Chota Nagpur, March, 1879; retd., July, 1885; author of 'The Ruling Races of Pre-Historic Times in India,' &c.

HEXT, Rear-Admiral Sir John, A.D.C., K.C.I.E., R.N. (Retd.)—Apptd. Director of the Royal Indian Marine, 26 Feb., 1883.

HEYCOCK, William Bissell, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Oakham Sch., and Sidney Sussex Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived, 7th Dec., 1896, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

HEYWOOD, John Magee, Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Joined Addiscombe, Aug., 1854; 1st commn., Bengal engrs., June, 1856; served in the Bengal public works dept. from April, 1858, as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; suptg. engr., May, 1881; offg. chief engr., and joint sec. to govt. of Bengal, public works dept., 1883-84; chief engr. and joint sec., irrign. branch, Punjab, 1886; retd., Dec., 1889.

HIGGENS, Alfred William Buckle, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Haileybury; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 6th Dec., 1876, and served as asst. collr. and mag.; on famine duty, 1877-78; sec. to the draft forest bill committee, 1882; dep. conservator of forests, Cuddapah, Dec., 1882; also forest settlt. officer, July, 1886; sub-collr. and joint mag., June, 1890; principal asst. to collr., Jan., 1891; collr. and mag., Jan., 1892.

HIGGINS, Andrew Frank, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 23rd Oct., 1873, and posted to Haidarabad; exec. engr., May, 1881.

HIGGINS, John James, late Police Dept., Central Prov.—Apptd. acting adjutant, mil. police, Narsinghpur, for services rendered during the Mutiny under Sir Henry Havelock, Dec., 1858; from March, 1861, served in the police dept. of the Central Prov., and was promoted to district supt., 1st class, June, 1879; retd., March, 1894.

HIGHAM, Thomas, C.I.E., M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. proby. asst. engr., July, 1867; arrived, Oct., 1867, and served in the irrign. dept., Punjab; exec. engr., Sept., 1873; asst. sec. to govt. irrign. branch, Nov., 1882; supt. of works, Derajat, Sept., 1883; suptg. engr., Aug., 1886; offd. as chief engr. and joint sec. to govt., Punjab, July-Oct., 1891; chief engr. and sec., irrign. branch, Oct., 1894; author of 'Hydraulic Tables'; C.I.E., May, 1896.

HIGHT, Arthur Edward, A.M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Trained at the Royal Indian Engrg. Coll.; entered the service as asst. engr., Nov., 1878; exec. engr., March, 1890.

HILDEBRAND, Arthur Hedding, C.I.E., Burma Commn.—From Feb., 1868, served in the Burma police dept. as asst. supt.; from March, 1872, served in the Burma commn. as asst. commr., and was sent on special mission to Chiangmai, 1875, and in charge of expdn. to W. Karenni, 1876; dep. commr., Jan., 1885; supt., S. Shan states, May, 1888; C.I.E., May, 1888; supt. and pol. officer, S. Shan states, Aug., 1891.

HILDEBRAND, Godfrey, Col., R.E., late Mil. Works Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Oct., 1864; arrived, Jan., 1868; joined the public works dept., March, 1869, and served in Bengal and the N.W. Prov.; transf. to mil. works, May, 1872; sec. to defence committee, 1881; suptg. engr., March, 1886; dep. dir.-gen., mil. works, 1890-91; asst. insp.-gen. of fortifications, War Office, July, 1894.

HILL, Charles Henry, B.L., Calcutta High Court.—Joined the service, 30th March, 1889, as public prosecutor to govt. of N.W. Prov. and Oudh; judge, Calcutta high court, April, 1892.

HILL, Claude Hamilton Archer, Indian C.S.—Educ. at St. Mark's Sch., Windsor, and
Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1887, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; under sec., pol., &c., depts., and sec. to legisl. council, Nov., 1892; under sec. to govt. of India, home dept., Aug., 1895.

HILL, FREDERICK GEORGE, Funds Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 6th July, 1882.

HILL, HARRY CHARLES, India Forest Dept.—Arrived, 16th Dec., 1872, and was apptd. asst. conservator of forests; dep. conservator of forests, April, 1879; transf'd. to the Punjab as offg. conservator, Jan., 1883; conservator of forests, and ex officio sec. to chief commr., Burma, in the forest dept. for Upper Burma, March, 1887; conservator, Naini Tal, March, 1893; acting inspr.-gen., 1889, 1893, and from Feb., 1895.

HILL, HENRY, Public Works Dept., India Office.—Educ. at the Edinburgh Acad. and Edinburgh Univ.; India office writer, old establ., 1859; junr. clerk, finl. dept., 1860; asst. private sec. and précis writer to the sec. of state, 1867-74; senr. clerk, Jan., 1872; rev., statistics and commerce dept., 1874; asst. sec. in that dept., Sept., 1877; asst. in the public works dept., and asst. govt. dir. of guaranteed Indian railway cos., June, 1892.

HILL, JOHN, Col., R.E., late Survey of India Dept.—Lieut., royal engrs., June, 1862; arrived, 10th Dec., 1865; apptd. to the trigonl. survey as asst. surveyor, Dec., 1866, and employed in Kumaon and Garhwal, Bombay, &c.; dep. supt., July, 1882; attached to Afghan boundary commn., Sept., 1884; supt. (new scale), Aug., 1892; in charge of tidal and levelling operations, Poona, Nov., 1890; reverted to mil. dept., Dec., 1895; retd., March, 1896.

HILL, THOMAS COUTTS, M.I.E.E., late India Telegraph Dept.—Apptd., 1st Aug., 1857; supt., British Burma, Feb., 1879; employed in connection with occupation of Upper Burma, 1886; chief supt., Sept., 1892; retd., March, 1894.

HILL, WILLIAM, Maj.-Gen., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Madras infantry, Aug., 1853; served in the Mysore commn. from July, 1859; dep. supt., Nov., 1862; dep. commr., April, 1873; acted for various periods as commr. of divn.; acting commr. of Coorg, 1881; from March, 1885, served as civil and sessions judge, Bangalore; returned to Europe, 1891.

HILTON, JOHN EDWARD, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 8th Oct., 1868, and posted to the Punjab; transf'd. to mil. works dept., May, 1872; exec. engr., Aug., 1877; transf'd. to Punjab provl. establ., Nov., 1880; under sec. to govt., Sept., 1892; suptg. engr., May, 1893.

HIRTZEL, FREDERIC ARTHUR, B.A., Revenue and Statistics Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., and Trinity Coll., Oxford (Craven scholar); fellow of Brasenose, 1895; apptd. junr. clerk, 11th June, 1894.

HITTU RAM, C.I.E., Rai Bahadur, Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the service, 1st April, 1859, and held non-gazetted appts. till Feb., 1877, when he was apptd. native asst. to govt.-gen.'s agent in Baluchistan; on special duty with Afghan boundary commn., 1884; extra asst. commr., Jan., 1890; on special duty under Kalat state, May, 1893; author of a Baluchi manual, and a history of Dera Ghazi Khan.

HLA OUNG, MAUNG, Burma Accts. Dept.—Entered the service, 1872; and served in the finance dept.; asst. comptr., Nov., 1880; has published a revision of 'Gordon's Burma manual.'

HOARE, HERBERT JAMES, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at private schs. and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 4th Nov., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., April, 1895; settlt. officer, Nov., 1896.

HOBART, ROBERT THOMPSON, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861, and served in the N.W. Prov., as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; dep. inspr.-gen. of police, Dec., 1873; inspr.-gen. of prisons, Oct., 1882; inspr.-gen. of police, May, 1886; retd., Dec., 1889.

HOBDAY, JAMES RAMSAY, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Survey of India Dept.—First commn., 13th Jan., 1869; proby. asst. supt., survey dept., Sept., 1874; confd., July, 1875; served in the Afghan war, 1879, and with Upper Burma field force, 1886; dep. supt., Jan., 1887; accompanied special expdn. in Upper Burma along the Chinese frontier, 1890-91.

HOBHOUSE (BARON), RIGHT HON. ARTHUR HOBHOUSE, K.C.S.I., C.I.E., Q.C.—Born 10th Nov., 1819; educ. at Eton and Balliol Coll., Oxford, where he gained a first-class in classics in 1840; called to the bar, 1845, and practised in the Rolls court; Q.C. in 1865; apptd. a charity commr. in 1866; endowed schools commr., 1869; legal member of council of the govt.-gen. of India, 1872-77; K.C.S.I., Jan., 1877; arbitrator under the Epping Forest Act, 1878; privy councillor, and member of the jud. committee, 1881; created a baron in 1885; one of the quorum of the House of Lords for jud. purposes; author of 'The Dead Hand,' a collection of addresses connected with endowments and the settlements of land, 1880; contested Westminster unsuccessfully in the general election of 1880.

HOBHOUSE, SIR CHARLES PARRY, Bart., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Rugby; apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 22nd July, 1844, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and in the finl. dept., govt. of India, as asst. to sub-treasurer, and asst. to acctnt.-gen.; collr. of Bardwan, 1857-59; mag. and collr., 1859; on special duty in 1860 to adjudicate on suits arising out of the indigo disturbances, Nuddea and Jessore; supt. and remembrancer of legal affairs, and govt. advocate, 1862; also member of Bengal legisll. council, 1863-64; civil and sessions judge, 1864-66; member of govt.-gen.'s legisll. council, 1866; chairman of the Orissa famine fund, 1867; judge of the high court, 1868-71; retd., 1872.

HODGES, ROBERT NATHANIEL, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 15th Oct., 1873, and posted to N.W. Prov. and Oudh; transf'd. to state railways, Nov., 1879; exec. engr., Sept., 1880; employed as engr.-in-chief on several railway surveys, including Saugor-Katni scheme.

HODGSON, GEORGE ROBERT, Lieut.-Col., late Madras Police Dept.—Admitted to Bombay staff corps, 23rd June, 1863; after service under the mil. dept., was apptd. acting asst. supt. of police in Madras, March, 1869; confd., Dec., 1872; supt., Oct., 1882; retd. July, 1895.
HODGSON, Godfrey Beckett, Capt., I.S.C., Survey of India Dept.—First commn., 1st May, 1878; served in Afghan war, 1880; apptd. proby. asst. supt., 13th Sept., 1883; confd., July, 1884; dep. supt., May, 1889; supt., June, 1897.

HODSON, Charles William, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1873, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., April, 1883; supt., way and works, N.W. railway, Nov., 1891; engr.-in-chief, Mushkal-Bolan railway, July, 1894; services lent to Ceylon Govt., June, 1896; suptg. engr., Aug., 1896.

HODSON, Richard George, late Educn. Dept., Burma.—Joined the dept. as dep. inspr. of schs., Mysore, April, 1861; inspr., April, 1867; acting dir. of public instrn., 1879-80; transfd. to Burma as acting principal, high sch., Rangoon, April, 1880; from Oct., 1881, served as inspr. of schs. in Burma, and offd. as dir. of public instrn.; retd., Feb., 1893; has transld. Munshi Srinivasaya's 'Dialogues in Kanarese.'

HODSON, Thomas Callan, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Christ's Hosp. and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 11th Dec., 1895; and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

HOEY, William, M.A., D.Lit., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Wesleyan Connexion Sch., and Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 18th Oct., 1872, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., asst. mag., and joint mag.; employed on archaeological explorations in Gonda in 1884; dep. commr., Feb., 1890; mag. and collr., Aug., 1890; author of 'Trades and Manufactures in N. India,' 'A History of Asaf-ud-Daulah, Nawab Wazir of Oudh,' 'Buddha; His Life, His Doctrine, and His Order,' 'Memoirs of Delhi and Fyzabad,' &c., &c.

HOGAN, John Lemon Poictevin, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 1st Nov., 1873, and posted to mil. works; transfd. to Mysore, Sept., 1877; to Central Prov., Sept., 1878; and to state railways, Jan., 1880; services lent to Bombay, Baroda and Central India railway co., Jan., 1885; exec. engr., Feb., 1885.

HOGG, Adam George Forbes, C.B., Lieut.-Gen., I.S.C., late Pol. Dept., Bombay.—First commn., Bombay infantry, Jan., 1854; served with the Persian expdn., 1857 (medal and clasp), in the Mutiny, the China war, 1860, the Abyssinian expdn., 1867-68 (medal), and the Afghan war, 1879-80 (medal and clasp); apptd. pol. rest. and collr. of stamp rev., with charge of the vice-admiralty court, Aden, May, 1885; reverted to mil. duty, 1890.

HOGG, Sir Frederic Russell, K.C.I.E., C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1856; arrived, 12th Feb., 1857, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; postmr.-gen., Punjab and Sind, July, 1863; postmr.-gen., Bengal, Nov., 1868; representative of the govt. of India at the postal congress, Paris, 1878; dir.-gen. of post office of India, March, 1882; C.S.I., Feb., 1887; K.C.I.E., May, 1888; retd., April, 1889.

HOGG, Stapleton Cotton, Finl. Dept., India Office.—Temporary clerk, 25th July, 1861; junr. clerk, accts. dept., 1862; transfd. to finl. dept., 1863; senr. clerk, Dec., 1875; asst. sec., Sept., 1895.

HOGG, Sir Stuart S., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1853; arrived, Jan., 1853; served in the Punjab as asst. commr. till 1859, and afterwards in Oudh as dep. commr.; mag. and collr., Bardwan, 1861; chairman, justices of the peace, Calcutta, 1866; commr. of police, Calcutta, and member of Bengal legisl. council, 1874; retd., 1878.

HOGG, Theodore William, Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—First commn., 4th Dec., 1857; arrived, 28th Jan., 1858; and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr. from Aug., 1867; small cause court judge, March, 1883; dep. commr., Aug., 1889.

HOJEL, Abraham Nickson, Brigade-Surgn., M.K.Q.C.P., L.R.C.S. (Ir.), late Med. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the Indian med. service, 27th July, 1859, and served under the mil. dept.; profr. Grant med. coll., and asst. surgn., Jamsetji Jijibhoy hosp., Feb., 1865; from July, 1866, to Nov., 1871, served in the Persian Gulf as civil surg., Bushire, and asst. to the rest.; served subsequently under the mil. dept., and as acting ophthalmic surg., presidency surgn., and marine surgn., Bombay; profr. of physiology, Grant med. coll., and second physician, Jamsetji Jijibhoy hosp., Sept., 1876; physician of the European hosp., April, 1887; retd., April, 1891.

HOLBROW, Stanley Charles, late Police Dept., Punjab.—Joined the service, 16th May, 1864, as asst.; district supt., April, 1873.

HOLDERNESS, Thomas William, C.S.I., B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 17th Feb., 1873, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., asst. sec. to govt., and junr. sec., board of rev.; under sec. to govt. of India, rev. and agricl. dept., Sept., 1881; joint mag., N.W. Prov., April, 1885; under sec. to govt., N.W. Prov., Nov., 1886; dir. of land records and agricl., Nov., 1888; sec. to govt., finl. dept., March, 1892, at the same time acting as sec. in the jud. dept.; member of legisl. council, Aug., 1892; mag. and collr., Aug., 1893; sec. to govt., judl. dept., July, 1894; famine duty, home dept., govt. of India, Jan., 1897; C.S.I., Jan., 1898.

HOLDICH, Sir Thomas Hungerford, K.C.I.E., C.B., Col., R.E., Survey of India.—Lt., royal engrs., Dec., 1862; arrived, 3rd March, 1865, and served in the Bhutan campaign, 1865 (medal and clasp); joined the topogr. survey, July, 1866; on duty with the Abyssinian expdn., 1867-68 (medal); joined the Afghanistan field force in 1879, and was in charge of survey operations in N. Afghanistan during second period of the campaign, and asst. field engr. during defence of Sherpur (medal and clasp); in charge of Kohat topogr. survey, Feb., 1881; dep. supt., April, 1883; in charge of Baluchistan topogr. survey, Oct., 1883; attached to the Afghan boundary commn., Sept., 1884; survey officer with the Zhob field force in 1890; supt. (new scale), Aug., 1892; C.B. and C.I.E., May, 1894; on special duty with Khaibar-Asmar delimitation commn., 1894-95; in charge, Pamir detachment, June, 1895; temporary appt. to Ceylon, Sept., 1896; K.C.I.E., June, 1897; chief survey officer with Tirah expedy. force, Aug., 1897; author of articles on the geography
of Afghanistan and the Indian frontier, and on mil. instrn., topography, &c.

HOLIDAY, FREDERICK CHARLES, India Audit Office.—Temporary clerk, 17th June, 1861; junr. asst., June, 1863; senr. examr., Dec., 1868; designation changed to senr. clerk, Oct., 1892; asst. auditor, Jan., 1895.

HOLLAND, ROBERT ERSKINE, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Winchester and Oriel Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived, 10th Dec., 1896, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

HOLME, ALAN THOMAS, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Bedford Gr. Sch., Clifton Coll., and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 15th Nov., 1893, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr. and asst. mag. and collr.

HOLME, CHARLES HENRY, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll., apptd. 1st Oct., 1876, and posted as asst. engr. to N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., March, 1891.

HOLME, HENRY EDWARD, B.L., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 27th Sept., 1890, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; under sec. to govt., May, 1894; joint mag., June, 1896.

HOLMES, ROBERT ANDREW KING, M.A., M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Jail Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service, 30th March, 1872, as asst. surgn., Bengal med. establ.; jail supt., Meerut, April, 1876; transf. in similar capacity to Lucknow, Feb., 1885; in 1892 acted as inspr.-gen. of prisons.

HOLMES, WILLIAM, late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Windermere Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 21st Nov., 1868, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; in charge of Amir Yakub Khan, March, 1880; joint mag., April, 1881; private sec. to lieut.-govr., N.W. Prov., March, 1883; asst. commr., Oudh, Dec., 1883; joint mag., June, 1884; dep. commr., Aug., 1887; mag. and collr., Dec., 1888; acted as inspr.-gen. of police in 1893; retd., Sept., 1894.

HOLMES, WILLIAM CUTHBERT, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 7th Nov., 1877, and served in Madras as asst. mag. and collr., and in Bombay as offg. asst. acctnt.-gen.; head asst., Coimbatore, Dec., 1884; sub-collr. and joint mag., Jan., 1890; district and sessions judge, S. Kanara, Feb., 1893; collr. district mag. and agent to govt., Vizagapatam, Dec., 1896.

HOLMS, JOHN MITCHELL, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 26th Nov., 1883, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., April, 1889; junr. sec. to board of rev., May, 1889, and Feb., 1891; asst. commr., Oudh, March, 1892; joint mag., Sept., 1892; acted as registrar, high court, in 1894; dep. commr., Nov., 1895; mag. and collr. and joint sec. to rev. board, Aug., 1896.

HOLMWOOD, HERBERT, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Uppingham; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 16th Dec., 1879, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Feb., 1890; inspr.-gen. of registrn., Nov., 1890; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1894.

HOLROYD, WILLIAM RICE MORLAND, Col., I.S.C., late Educl. Dept., Punjab.—First commn. as ensign, Dec., 1853; served from 11th Aug., 1858, as inspr. of schools, and was apptd. dir. of public instrn., Punjab, Feb., 1868; under sec. to govt., educ. dept., Oct., 1884; reverted to mil. duty, Oct., 1890.

HOME, ALEXANDER LEFEVRE, Indian Forest Dept.—From 1st March, 1864, served in the dept. in the Punjab, Central Prov. and Bengal, and was apptd. dep. conservator, Oct., 1871; asst. comptr.-gen. of forests, April, 1877; conservator of forests, Bengal, April, 1883; Upper Burma, Oct., 1892; Assam, Dec., 1894.

HOME, FREDERICK JERVIS, C.S.I., Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., 11th June, 1858; arrived, 9th Sept., 1860; served in the public works dept., N.W. Prov., irrign. branch, from Feb., 1861, as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; suptg. engr., Jan., 1883; offg. chief engr., irrign. branch, and joint sec. to govt., N.W. Prov., 1885; on special duty in the Bhartpur state, Oct., 1886; chief engr. and joint sec., Punjab, Dec., 1889; inspr.-gen. of irrign. and dep. sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., Nov., 1890; C.S.I., May, 1892; reverted to mil. dept., Oct., 1894; retd., May, 1895.

HOME, WALTER, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. 1st Oct., 1877, and posted as asst. engr. to State Railways; exec. engr., Dec., 1891.

HOOKER, WILLIAM HENSLOW, Store Dept., India Office.—Supervisor, 2nd grade, India store depot, Aug., 1877; 1st grade, July, 1883.

HOOPER, JOHN, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., and Univ. of London; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 7th Dec., 1871, and served in Oudh as asst. commr.; settl. officer, Basti, Nov., 1884; mag. and collr., April, 1890; sec., board of rev., Aug., 1890; addl. commr., Fyzabad, Oct., 1896; author of Basti settl. report.

HOOPER, WILLIAM ROE, Surgn.-Major-Gen., Med. Board, India Office.—Asst. surgn., Bengal med. establ., Feb., 1859; arrived, Aug., 1859, and served in Bengal, holding various mil. med. charges; from July, 1861, served in the N.W. Prov. as civil asst. surgn., jail supt., Benares, and civil surgn. at Benares and Lucknow; prest. of the India office med. board, Jan., 1895.

HOPE, CHARLES WILLIAM WEBLEY, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Mannamead Sch., Plymouth, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1885, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Aug., 1860; asst. commr., Oudh, June, 1891; settl. officer, April, 1893; joint mag., April, 1896; dep. commr., June, 1896.

HOPE, HUGH RICHARD, C.B., Major-Gen.—Joined the service, 4th Nov., 1860; A.D.C. to Sir W. Denison, govr. of Madras, 1863-64; sec. to govt. of Madras, mil. dept., Oct., 1891, to 1st April, 1895 when appt. was abolished.

HOPE, JAMES, B.A., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1861, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; served in Bombay, 1854-67; principal asst. collr. Ganjam, Sept., 1870; from Jan., 1877, served in
the jud. dept. as district and sessions judge; retd., 1888.

HOPE, Sir Theodore Cracraft, K.C.S.I., C.I.E., B.L. late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury Coll.; arrived, 5th June, 1853, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and educ. inspr.; private sec. to gov'r. of Bombay, May, 1860; pres't. of committee on finances of educ.dept., March, 1861; joint commr. to receive N. Kanara from the Madras govt., Feb., 1862; dep. commr. of customs, salt, and opium, Oct., 1862; collr. and mag., Jan., 1867; from July, 1875, served as addl. member of the gov'r.-gen.'s council, also acting as sec. to gov't. of India in dept. of rev., agric. and commerce, and was apptd. addl. sec. for famine, Dec., 1876; reapptd. as addl. member of gov'r.-gen.'s council in 1877 and 1878; commr., N. divn., and agent to gov'r., Surat, Jan., 1878; on special pol. duty in England, 1878; provisional member of council, Bombay, Oct., 1880; sec. to gov't. of India, fin. and commerce dept., Aug., 1881; ordinary member of gov'r.-gen.'s council in charge of public works dept., July, 1882; C.I.E., July, 1882; K.C.S.I., May, 1886; retd., Jan., 1888.

HOPKINS, Egbert Silas, Finl. Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, registry dept., 14th Nov., 1883; transf'd. to finl. dept., Sept., 1891.

HOPKINS, Henry Mayne Reid, Indian C.S. (N.W.Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 24th Nov., 1887, and served in the N.W.Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Aug., 1892; ass't. supt. and small cause judge, Dehra Dun, Feb.-Dec., 1893; ass't. commr., Feb., 1896.

HOPKINSON, William, Col., Bengal Infantry.—First commr., 1859; from 28th Nov., 1867, served in Bengal as asst. commr. and sub-registrar of assurances; cantonmt. mag., March, 1874; small cause court judge, Nov., 1875; dep. commr., April, 1886; again cantonmt. mag., April, 1887; retd., Jan., 1891.

HORDERN, Peter, B.A., late Educ. Dept., Burma.—Apptd. to the dept., 19th Nov., 1861; arrived, March, 1862; asst. profr., presidency coll., Calcutta, March, 1862; dir. of public instrn., British Burma, Nov., 1867; fellow of Calcutta univ., April, 1876; retd., 1889; author of a 'Handbook of Rules and Practice of the Educn. Dept., Burma.'

HORMASJI DADABHAI, Khan Bahadur, Bombay Jud. Dept.—Joined the service, 26th April, 1880; judge, Bombay small cause court, July, 1881.

HORN, David Bayne, F.C.H., A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and employed on irrigtn. works in Bengal; asst. sec. to gov't., irrigtn. branch, Feb., 1878; exec. engr., March, 1882; under sec., public works dept., 1885-86; suptg. engr., Feb., 1896.

HORNE, William Ogilvie, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam.of 1880; arrived, 7th Dec., 1882, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and acting dep. registrar, high court; head asst., March, 1890; special asst., Ganjam, Feb., 1893; dep. commr. of salt, &c., rev., Nov., 1893; head asst., S. Kanara, March, 1894; sub-collr. and joint mag., April, 1890.

HORSFALL, Jeremiah Garnett, C.I.E., B.L., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Giggleswick Gr. Sch., and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1861; served in Madras, and was apptd. district and sessions judge, April, 1878; collr. and mag., Jan., 1879; retd., April, 1890; C.I.E., May, 1890.

HORSFALL, Thomas Mendelssohn, B.L., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Wilhelms-Gymnasium, Berlin; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 5th Dec., 1876, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., Madura, Dec., 1884; also forest settlt. officer, Nov., 1885; registrar of high court (appellate side), Sept., 1888; principal asst., Ganjam, Dec., 1890; collr. and mag., Dec., 1891; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1892.

HORSFORD, Norman Macleod Thomas, Col., I.S.C.—Arrived, as ensign, 29th Dec., 1857, and served in the Mutiny campaign (medal and clasp); from Aug., 1861, served in the police dept., N.W.Prov., as asst. inspr.-gen., and district supt.; and from Dec., 1867, in Oudh as asst. commr., junr. sec., and offg. dir. of public instrn.; supt. of encumbered estates, Rae Bareli, 1874-76; offg. supt. of excise and stamps, and inspr.-gen. of registrn., April, 1876; cantonmt. mag., Lucknow, March, 1878; city mag. and wasika officer, Lucknow, April, 1883; district judge, April, 1886; dep. commr., March, 1887; chief commr., Andaman and Nicobars, April, 1892; reverted to mil. dept., Sept., 1895.

HORSLEY, William Henry, B.A., late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at King's Sch., Canterbury, and Corpus Christi Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 31st Oct., 1870; served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and was in charge of the forests in Khandesh, 1872-74; on famine duty, 1874 and 1877; forest settlt. officer, Nov., 1878; second asst. collr., Sept., 1883; judge and sessions judge, May, 1887; retd., Jan., 1896.

HORSPPOOL, William Paddison, India Audit Office.—Educ. at the Newark Coll. Sch.; clerk, and class, 19th Aug., 1878.

HÖRST, Henry, late Survey Dept., Govt. of India.—Librarian and accountant, Thomason coll., Jan., 1853; sub-asst., great trigonl. survey, Sept., 1854; in charge of picket which repulsed night attack on Murrree sanitarium, 1857 (medal); transf'd. to topogr. survey, April, 1868; supt., Sept., 1882; retd., 1886.

HORST, Walter Philips Von der, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 17th Oct., 1872, and employed on irrigtn. works in the N.W.Prov. and Oudh; offg. asst. sec., public works dept., 1881 and 1882-84; exec. engr., Jan., 1883.

HOSE, John Walter, Indian C.S. (N.W.Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Dulwich and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1886, and served in the N.W.Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., May, 1891; under sec. to gov't., April, 1893; registrar, high court, March, 1894.

HOSKING, Edward, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 1st Feb., 1869, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., asst. judge and sessions judge, and registrar of the high court; judge and sessions judge, Jan., 1884; acted as jud. commr. and judge of the sadar court in Sind, in 1890-91 and 1892; jud. commr., Lower Burma, Nov., 1892;
HOSKYN, CHARLES REGINALD, Major, R.E., India Public Works Dept.—First commn., 9th Jan., 1873; apptd., 29th Sept., 1876, and employed on the Punjab N. and Indus valley railways; transf'd. to superior accts. establ., and served as dep. examr. and examr.; dep. acctnt.-gen. for inspn. duty, March, 1894; examr., guaranteed railway accts., Bombay, Oct., 1894.

HOUGH, ALFRED LACEY, Burma Commn.—Joined the service, 25th Oct., 1870, as sub-asst. conservator of forests; apptd. to the commn. as extra asst. commr., Oct., 1874; dep. commr., Aug., 1891.

HOUGHTON, BERNARD, B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at All Saints, Bloxham, Wellingborough Gr. Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 23rd Jan., 1885, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; transf'd. to Burma, as asst. commr., Aug., 1886; dep. commr., March, 1891; author of an 'Essay on the Language of the S. Chins,' and other linguistic works.

HOUSDEN, CHARLES EDWARD, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd. 23rd Oct., 1876, and posted as apprentice engr. to Rajputana; asst. engr., Oct., 1877; transf'd. to Upper Burma, Jan., 1887; exec. engr., Sept., 1887; asst. sec. to chief commr., Feb., 1890; under sec. to govt., Upper Burma, Dec., 1895.

HOUSE, HENRY FREDERICK, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Bristol Gr. Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 10th Nov., 1884, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., asst. supt., Dehra Dun, and asst. commr.; settl. officer, Nov., 1893; mag. and collr., Jan., 1897; has edited the N.W. Prov. rent act.

HOUSLEY, ARTHUR WILLIAM, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 19th Feb., 1872; junr. clerk, June, 1882.

HOWARD, EDWARD STAFFORD.—Educ. at Harrow, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; called to the bar at the Inner Temple, 1785; M.P. for E. Cumberland, 1876-85, and for the Thornbury divn. of Gloucestershire, 1885-86; under sec. of state for India, April-Aug., 1886; apptd. a commr. of woods and forests, Oct., 1893.

HOWARD, WILLIAM STUART, M.I.C.E., late Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 10th June, 1859; arrived, 20th Nov., 1859; exec. engr., Dec., 1865; chief engr., Aug., 1888; sec. to govt. of Bombay, public works dept., June, 1892; retd., Feb., 1894.

HOWELL, ARTHUR PEARSE, M.A., late Bengal C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at St. John's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1857; arrived, 27th Jan., 1858, and served in the N.W. Prov. and in Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; from April, 1864, to March, 1878, served in the secretariat of the govt. of India, in the finl., home, and rev. depts.; commr., Jabalpur, Central Prov., April, 1877; sec. famine commn., March, 1878; commr., Narbada, Sept., 1878; acting jud. commr., Central Prov., 1879-80, and again in 1885; commr., Haidarabad assigned districts, June to Dec., 1882; member of educn. commn., 1882-83; offg. resp., Haidarabad, March, 1888; retd., Aug., 1889; author of notes on educn. in India, and on jails and jail discipline, and of a paper on educn. legislation.

HOWELL, MORTIMER SLOPER, C.I.E., LL.D., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Christ's Hosp., and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 10th Oct., 1862, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; offg. inspr. of public instrn., April, 1867; asst. supt. and small cause court judge, Dehra Dun, March, 1868; joint mag. and dep. collr., Feb., 1871; mag. and collr., Nov., 1879; from March 1880, served as district and sessions judge in various districts; addl. jud. commr. in Oudh, Dec., 1891; jud. commr., November, 1892; retd., April, 1896; author of an Arabic grammar.

HOWLETT, RICHARD ROSS, B.A., Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Westminster Sch., and Christ's Coll., Cambridge (scholar); junr. clerk, 16th April, 1895.

HUDSON, CHARLES WILLIAM MAITLAND, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Doveton Protestant Coll., Madras, Madras Univ., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 1st Nov., 1887, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; and asst., May, 1895; 1st asst., July, 1897.

HUDSON, WILLIAM HEBARD, B.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Pembroke Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 17th Nov., 1861; from Jan., 1863, served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; on famine duty in Behar, 1873-75; from May, 1880, served in the jud. dept., N.W. Prov., as civil and sessions judge; retd., Jan., 1890.

HUGHES, ARTHUR JOHN, C.I.E., M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 11th July, 1862, and arrived, 7th Dec., 1862; exec. engr., Dec., 1869; asst. sec. to govt. of Bengal, irrign. branch, May, 1872; on famine works, Salem district, Sept., 1877; served under the foreign dept. in Kashmir, 1884-85; suptg. engr., Nov., 1888; suptg. engr. for waterworks, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, 1888-93; offg. chief engr. and sec. to chief commr., Central Prov., April, 1895; retd., 1896; author of a report on the feasibility of improved water communication between the Ganges and Calcutta.

HUGHES, DAVID ERSKINE, M.D., F.R.C.S., Surgn.-Col., late Bombay Med. Service.—Joined the service, March, 1866; arrived, 9th Nov., 1866; served under the mil. dept., and also acted as civil surgn.; civil surgn. and supt. of jail, Belgaum, from May, 1882; civil surgn., Poona, Sept., 1890; reverted to mil. dept., Sept., 1892; and apptd. prin. med. officer, Bombay and Aden dists.; vacated, September, 1897.

HUGHES, EDWARD WILLIAM MACKENZIE, late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., April, 1871, as asst. engr., Punjab irrign.; locomotive supt., Dhond-Manmad state railway, May, 1879; Indus valley railway, Feb., 1881; dep. locomotive supt., N.W. railway, Jan., 1886; on special duty in Mexico in 1887-88; locomotive supt., E. Coast railway, Jan., 1892; retd., Aug., 1893.

HUGHES, GEORGE, late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at the Liverpool Inst., and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 23rd Oct., 1875, and served in the
Punjab as asst. commr., and offg. under sec.; district judge, Aug., 1890; asst. commr., 1st grade, December, 1890; retd., December, 1891.

HUGHES, JOHN WILLIAM, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the City of London Sch., and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 25th Nov., 1892, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

HUGHES, RALPH BULLER, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Marlborough, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 4th Nov., 1892, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr. and asst. settlt. officer.

HUGHES, THEODORE WILLIAM HUGHES, A.R.S.M., F.G.S., late Geological Survey of India.—Apptd. asst., and joined, 11th Nov., 1862; 1st grade officer, April, 1883; suptd. Rewa coal explorations from March, 1883; designation changed to dep. supt.; supt., April, 1887; acted as dir. in 1892; retd., Oct., 1894; author of contributions to the survey publns.

HUGHES, WALTER CHARLETON, M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 23rd July, 1868; arrived, 3rd Oct., 1868, and served in various grades of the dept.; asst. sec. to govt., April, 1882; under sec., March, 1884; sec., Nov., 1888; chairman, Bombay port trust, June, 1892.

HUGHES, WILLIAM, B.A., M.I.C.E., Madras Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 23rd July, 1868, as proby. civil engr.; asst. engr.; Sept., 1870; exec. engr., Sept., 1877; suptg. engr., Feb., 1894; chief engr. and joint sec. to govt., Oct., 1896.

HUGHES, WILLIAM Gwynne, Col., I.S.C., late Burma Commn.—First commn. as ensign, June, 1858; arrived, 11th Sept., 1858, and was employed on mil. duty and in the police dept., Burma; transfd. to the Burma commn., June, 1864, and served as asst. commr., cantonmt. mag. of Rangoon, town mag. of Akyab, supt. of the hill tracts, Arakan, and dep. commr.; retd., June, 1889; author of 'The Hill Tracts of Arakan.'

HUGHESDON, JOSEPH CHARLES, B.L., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Sutton Valence Gr. Sch., and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1862; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., small cause court judge, and sub-collr. and joint mag.; on famine duty, June, 1877; district and sessions judge, Tinnevelll, March, 1880; retd., Aug., 1883.

HULLAH, ARTHUR, late India Telegraph Dept.—Apptd. asst. supt., 20th Feb., 1869, and employed on various lines; supt., Aug., 1885; in charge, Rajputana divn., April, 1892; personal asst. to dir.-gen., Feb., 1893; retd., Sept., 1896.

HUME, ALLAN OCTAVIAN, C.B., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1849; arrived, 7th March, 1849; served in N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; mag. and collr., Etawah, March, 1858; commr. of customs, N.W. Prov., Punjab, and Central Prov., July, 1867; offg. sec. to govt. of India, home dept., 1870-71; sec. to govt. of India in dept. of rev., agric., and commerce, June, 1871; member of board of rev., N.W. Prov., Oct., 1879; retd., 1882; author of several works on ornithology.

HUMFRRESS, GEORGE, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1873, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., May, 1883; employed on N.W. railway from Jan., 1886.

HUMPHREYS, ROBERT, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at the Royal Univ. of Ireland and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 29th December, 1894, and served in the Puujab as asst. commr.

HUMPHRIES, EDGAR DE MONTFORT, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Grammar Sch., Lichfield, and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived, 9th Dec., 1896, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

HUMPHRYS, ISAAC HUTCHINSON, Accntn.-Gen.'s Dept., India Offic.—Educ. at the Royal Sch., Raphoe, and Trinity Coll., Dublin (exhibir. and prizeman); clerk, 2nd class, 5th July, 1872; junr. clerk, Feb., 1876; senr. clerk, Sept., 1894.

HUNT, SAMUEL BRADSHAW, Surgn.-Col., Indian Med. Service.—Asst. surgn., 31st March, 1865; arrived, 10th Dec., 1865, and served under the mil. dept., and also as civil surgn. in Madras; surgn., 4th district, and profir. of med. jurisprudence, med. coll., Feb., 1893; reverted to mil. dept., Aug., 1893, and apptd. princ. med. officer, Bangalore and Southern districts.

HUNTER, FREDERICK MERCER, C.B., C.S.I., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., late Pol. Dept., Bombay.—Arrived as ensign, Bombay infantry, June, 1861; asst. pol. rest. at Aden, Aug., 1871; first asst. there, Sept., 1880; also pol. agent for the Somali coast, and collr. of abkari and dep. collr. of salt rev.; pol. agent, Cutch, 1889-93 and 1894; pol. agent, Kolhapur and S. Maratha-country, 1893-94 and 1894-95; transfd. to Mahi Kantha, March, 1895; retd. May, 1896.

HUNTER, GEORGE YEATES, M.R.C.S., L.S.A., Brigade-Surgn., late Med. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the Indian med. dept., 23rd July, 1858; arrived, 9th Sept., 1858, and served in the mil. dept., and as civil surgn. in various stations; civil surgn., Karachi, Feb., 1882; presidency surgn., Bombay, in med. charge of jail, &c., May, 1884; retd., Oct., 1888.

HUNTER, JOHN MUIR, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Pol. Dept., Bombay.—First commn., royal artillery, 12th April, 1864; arrived, 14th Dec., 1865; boundary settlt. officer, Baroda and Mahi Kantha states, Oct., 1869; from June, 1872, served as asst. pol. agent in Mahi Kantha, Kolhapur, and Kathiawar; from Feb., 1883, served as supt. of surveys under the rajasthanik court, Kathiawar, and was employed in settling claims in dispute between native states, from Dec., 1884; prest., rajasthanik court, May, 1891; asst. agent, Baroda, Oct., 1891; first asst. pol. agent, Mahi Kantha, Jan., 1892; pol. agent, Mahi Kantha, July, 1893, to Jan., 1894, and Nov., 1894, to March, 1895; prest., rajasthanik court, January, 1894; pol. agent, Kolhapur, April, 1896; pol. agent, Kathiawar, April, 1897.

HUNTER, SIR WILLIAM GUYER, K.C.M.G., M.D., F.R.C.P., F.R.C.S., Surgn.-Gen.—Educ. at King's Coll., London, Aberdeen Univ., &c.; joined the Bombay med. service, 1850; served in the Burmese war and Indian Mutiny; principal
of the Grant med. coll., Bombay, 1868; surgn.-gen., Bombay, Feb., 1877; vice-chancellor of the univ. of Bombay, 1879; retd., March, 1880; served on the cholera comm. in Egypt, 1883; British delegate to the international sanitary conference at Rome, June, 1885; M.P. for Hackney (central divn.), 1885 and 1886-92.

HUNTER, Sir William Wilson, K.C.S.I., C.I.E., M.A., LL.D., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at the Univs. of Glasgow, Paris, and Bonn; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 10th Nov., 1862, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; supt. of labour transport, Kushtia, July, 1865; dir. and compiler of the statistical acct. of Bengal, July, 1869; compiled plan for a statistical survey of India, Jan., 1871; offg. under sec., govt. of India, home dept., Feb., 1871; dir.-gen. of statistics, govt. of India, Sept., 1871; on special duty to England for purpose of compiling statistical acct. of Bengal, and 'Imperial Gazetteer,' 1875 and 1876; on special duty in England, 1877-81; dir.-gen. of gazetteers, Oct., 1877; C.I.E., 1878; dir.-gen. of gazetteers and statistics, June, 1878; dir.-gen. of statistics, Dec., 1881; addl. member, govr.-gen.'s council, 1881, 1883, and 1885; pres't of the educn. commn., 1882-83; dep'd. to give evidence before the committee of the House of Commons on Indian railways, May, 1884; C.S.I., 1884; member of finance committee, Feb., 1886; K.C.S.I., Feb., 1887; retd., Sept., 1887; author of 'The Annals of Rural Bengal,' 1868; 'A Dictionary of the Non-Aryan Languages of India and High Asia,' 1868; memo. on the older records of the board of rev., N.W. Prov., 1870; 'The Indian Mussulmans,' 1871; 'The Province of Orissa,' 1872; 'Famine Aspects of Bengal Districts,' 1874; a collected edition of 'Essays on the External Policy of India,' by the late J. W. S. Wyllie, 1875; 'A Life of Lord Mayo,' 1875; 'A Statistical Account of Bengal,' 1875-77; a 'Statistical Account of Assam,' 1879; 'The Imperial Gazetteer of India,' 1881; 'The Indian Empire,' 1881; 'England's Work in India,' 1881; 'A Brief History of the Indian People,' &c., &c.

HURRY, Arnold Eardley, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at the City of London Sch. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 25th Oct., 1882, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; from March, 1886, served in Burma as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; re-transf., Dec., 1890; junr. sec. to govt., March, 1895; dep. commr., June, 1896; offg. divl. judge, March, 1897.

HUTCHESON, George, M.D., C.M., Surgn.-Col., Indian Med. Service.—Joined the service as asst. surgn., 1st Oct., 1866; served on gen. and mil. duty, and in 1870-71 as chemical analyst; on special duty, cholera enquiry, 1872-73; sanitary commr. and supt.-gen. of vaccn., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, May, 1889; on dep'n to mil. duty, April-Oct., 1895; admin. med. officer, Central Provs., July, 1896; author of 'Cholera, its Causes, and Mode of Dissemination,' and 'Cholera as a Preventible Disease.'

HUTCHINGS, Francis Smith, India Audit Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 23rd June, 1879.

HUTCHINS, Sir Philip Perceval, K.C.S.I., B.L., late Madras C.S., Jud. and Public Dept., India Office.—Apptd. to the Madras civil service from Haileybury, 1857; arrived, 27th Feb., 1858; served as asst. collr. and mag., dep. sec. to govt., sec. to board of examrs., and as judge of the court of small causes, Chittur; private sec. to govr. of Madras, Nov., 1863; registrar, high court, March, 1865; district and sessions judge, Madura, April, 1873; called to the bar (Inner Temple), June, 1875; member of rent law committee, Sept., 1882; acting sec., rev. dept., Dec., 1882; on special duty in connection with reorganization of jud. establs., March, 1883; board of examrs., May, 1883; judge of the high court, Madras, Nov., 1883; fellow of Madras univ., March, 1884; member of govr.'s council, Dec., 1886; C.S.I., Jan., 1888; member of the council of the govr.-gen., Nov., 1888; K.C.S.I., May, 1891; retd., Nov., 1892; sec., jud. and public dept., India office, Dec., 1893.

HUTCHINSON, Frederick Thomas, India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 25th March, 1871, as asst. comptr.; dep. comptr., May, 1874; examr., Sept., 1881; examr., public works acct., Bombay, May, 1890.

HUTCHINSON, James Bird, Lieut.-Col. I.S.C., Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 26th May, 1864; from March, 1868, served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; district judge, Nov., 1884; dep. commr., Dec., 1884; served under govt. of India, Aug. to Oct., 1887; commr. and supt., Lahore, March, 1894; has publd. a 'Guide to Dalhousie,' and a gen. index of regulations and acts in force in the Punjab.

HUTCHINSON, Sydney Hutton Cooper, Indian Telegraph Dept.—Apptd., 30th Nov., 1871, as asst. supt.; supt., Oct., 1887.

HUTTON, Edward, late Postal Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the service as supt. of mails, Jalapar, 10th Feb., 1858; supt., travelling post office, Nov., 1877; inspr., field force, Peshawar column, Feb., 1879; presidency postmtr. at Calcutta, April, 1881; acted as postmtr.-gen. at Lahore in 1890, at Bombay in 1891, and at Calcutta from April, 1892; retd., April, 1893.

HYDE, Henry, Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Madras Med. Dept.—Arrived, 27th June, 1867; surgn., Oct., 1871; zillah surgn. and jail supt., April, 1872; civil surgn., Nov., 1884; retd., May, 1895.

HYNES, George John, late Postal Dept., Govt. of India.—Entered the dept., 4th May, 1868; asst. dir.-gen. of the post office of India, Oct., 1880; dep. postmtr.-gen., Burma, June, 1887; postmtr.-gen., Punjab, Jan., 1891; dep. dir.-gen. of post office of India, July, 1891; offg. postmtr.-gen., Bengal, March-Aug., 1894; retd. Jan., 1896.

IBBETSON, Denzil Charles Jelf, C.S.I., B.A., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Coll. Sch., Adelaide, and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 8th Dec., 1870, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and settlt. officer; dep. supt. of census, Punjab, Aug., 1881; compiler, 'Punjab Gazetteer,' March, 1883; offg. dir. of public instrn., March, 1884; dep. commr., April, 1885; offg. supt., Kapurthala state, Nov., 1885; offd. as 2nd finl. commr. in the Punjab in 1890; in charge of Gujranwala settlt., May, 1891; member of Deccan agriculturists relief commn., 1891-92; on special duty connected with the cantonmt. act, 1893; offg. sec. to govt. of India, dept. of rev. and agric., July, 1894; promoted to commr., retaining his offg. appt., April, 1895; C.S.I., Jan., 1896; sec. to govt. of India, dept. of rev. and agric., Dec., 1896; has publd. 'Census Report of the Punjab (1881)'; 'Outlines of
Punjab Ethnography,' the Karnal settlt. report, and contributions to the provl. gazetteers.

ILBERT, Sir Courtenay Peregrine, K.C.S.I., C.I.E.—Educ. at Marlborough, and Oxford; scholar, and afterwards fellow of Balliol Coll.; Hertford scholar, 1861; Ireland scholar, 1864; Craven scholar, 1864; Eldon law scholar, 1867; called to the bar at Lincoln's Inn, 7th June, 1869; counsel to educn. dept., 1878-82; law member of the council of the govr.-gen. of India, 1st May, 1882, and was pres't. of the council, 3rd Feb. to 8th March, 1886; resigned, 13th Nov., 1886; vice-chancellor of Calcutta univ., 1885-86; asst. parl'y. counsel to the treasury, 1886; K.C.S.I., Jan., 1895.

IMPEY, William Henry Lockington, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Wellington Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 7th Nov., 1878, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; asst. commr., Naini Tal, Nov., 1886; under sec't. to govt. of N.W. Prov. and Oudh, May, 1888; settlt. officer, Oct., 1889; joint mag., April, 1892; sec. to govt., finl. dept., Aug., 1893; also member of legisl. council, Dec., 1893; mag. and collr., and acting sec. to govt., jud. dept., March, 1895; part author of Jhansi settlt. report.

INAM ALI, Maulvi, B.A., Punjab Commn.—Apptd. asst. profr., govt. coll., Lahore, 31st Oct., 1887; prob'r. under native civil service rules, 4th Feb., 1888; asst. commr., April, 1891; dist. judge, Aug., 1895; has publ'd. in Urdu a transln. and an epitome of Hamilton's lectures on psychology.

INCH, George Frederic, Accnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 9th Oct., 1879.

INGLIS, Ernest, Major, I.S.C., Punjab Commission.—Arrived 27th March, 1877; in mil. employ till 1886; asst. commr., Punjab, Aug., 1886; dep. commr., Nov., 1896.

INGLIS, Thomas, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Wellington Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 27th Nov., 1880, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., May, 1890; junr. sec. to board of rev., July, 1892; mag. and collr., June, 1896.

INGLIS, William Arbuthnot, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1874, and employed on irrigtn. works in Bengal; exec. engr., May, 1883; offg. under sec', public works dept., Bengal, 1891-92; suptg. engr., July, 1896.

INGRAM, Gerald Constantine Winnington, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Bromsgrove Sch., and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 13th Dec., 1893, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr. and asst. commr.

INNES, James John McLeod, Lieut.-Gen., V.C., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn. in Bengal engrs., 1848; served under the civil engr., Punjab, from 1852; asst. to chief engr., Oudh, Jan., 1857; served during the Mutiny (medal and two clasps, V.C.); exec. engr., Cawnpore, Dec., 1857; garrison engr., presidency, April, 1858; comptlr. and examr. of accts., Lahore, Feb., 1861; offg. acctnt.-gen., public works dept., 1865-66, and 1867-68; suptg. engr., Punjab, Oct., 1869; acctnt.-gen. and dep. sec., public works dept., June, 1870; chief engr., Sept., 1881, and dep. inspr.-gen., mil. works; inspr.-gen., 1882; retd., March, 1886.

INNES, Lewis Charles, late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Charterhouse and Haileybury, and apptd. in 1844; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., sub-judge, and civil and sessions judge; judge of the high court, Madras, Feb., 1865, to Sept., 1883, and offd. on several occasions as chief justice; retd., 1883; fellow of the univ. of Madras, 1865-83; vice-chancellor, 1874-80.

IRELAND, William de Courcy, B.A., LL.D., late Burma Commn.—Joined the service as acctnt. in office of commr. of Pegu, April, 1859; asst. supt. of forests, Toungoo, April, 1860; collr. of customs, Nov., 1860; from April, 1861, served in the commn. as asst. commr., town mag. and dep. commr.; acted also as inspr.-gen. of police; boundary officer, Akyab district, Sept., 1880; addl. sessions judge, Tenasserim, Jan., 1886; commr., Irawadi, July, 1886, and Arakan, Jan., 1890; retd., Dec., 1890.

IRVINE, George Duncan, late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch., and St. John's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1861; served in Madras from May, 1865, as asst. collr. and mag., sub-collr. and joint mag., and acting collr. of sea customs at Madras; district and sessions judge, July, 1882; retd., June, 1891.

IRVINE, Robert Hamilton Grant, late Bengal Police Dept.—Joined the service as dep. mag. and dep. collr., Aug., 1861; apptd. asst. supt. of police, April, 1863; district supt., July, 1860; retd., Sept., 1891.

IRVINE, William, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at St. Anne's Sch., Brixton, and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 12th Dec., 1863, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; mag. and collr., Dec., 1881; retd., 1888; author of 'Canal Rates versus Land Revenue,' 'The Rent Digest: or the Law Procedure relating to Landlord and Tenant, Bengal,' 'Bangash Nawab of Farukhabad,' and Ghazipur settlt. report.

IRVING, Lewis Allen, Brigade-Surg'n.—Lieut.-Col., Army Med. Staff.—Med. officer to govr. of Bombay (Rt. Hon. Lord Reay), 1885 to 1890.

IRWIN, Alfred Macdonald Bulteel, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 24th Nov., 1876, and served in the Punjab till June, 1877, and subsequently in Burma as asst. commr.; dep. commr., Aug., 1886; offd. as commr. in 1894, and from June, 1895.

IRWIN, George Robert, B.A., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Uppingham, and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 16th Nov., 1878, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr.; asst. sec. to govt. of India, foreign dept., Dec., 1886; first asst. sec. for Berar to rest., Haidarabad, March, 1892; pol. agent, Jhalawar, April, 1893.

IRWIN, Henry, C.I.E., M.I.C.E., late Madras Public Works Dept.—Joined the service as asst. engr., Central Prov., 1st Feb., 1868; exec. engr., Sept., 1872; supt. of works, Simla imperial circle, Oct., 1881; C.I.E., June, 1888; acting public works sec. to agents for Raiputana and Central India, Nov., 1888; transf'd. to Madras public works dept. as suptg. engr., and apptd. consulting architect to govt., Sept., 1889; retd. Jan., 1896.
IRWIN, Henry Crossly, B.A., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Blackheath Proprietary Sch., St. Edmund's Hall, and Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 6th Nov., 1871, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., joint mag. and dep. commr.; mag. and collr., Nov., 1889; acted as sec. to the board of rev. in 1893; offd. as dist. and sess. judge, April, 1895; retd., July, 1896; author of 'The Garden of India; or Chapters on Oudh History and Affairs.'

ISAACSON, Stephen Henry Holden, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Writer, India office, 15th April, 1869; clerk, 2nd class, Sept., 1878.

ISMAY, Stanley, B.L., Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Bromsgrove Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 14th Nov., 1871; served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., and was on special duty in the Kalahandi state, 1882; registrar, jud. commr.'s court, May, 1884; offg. inspr.-gen. of police and jails, 1885 and 1890; judge, small cause court, Jabalpur, Dec., 1889; dep. commr., Jan., 1890; addl. sessions judge, Jan., 1892; offg. jud. commr., Feb., 1895; divl. judge, June, 1895; author of 'Rules for the Superintendence and Management of Jails in the Central Prov.'(1885).

IVENS, John Henry Anderson, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. to the public works dept. as asst. engr., Oct., 1877; exec. engr., Aug., 1881.

IVENS, Thomas Edward, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 26th July, 1867, and posted to the Punjab; exec. engr., Sept., 1874; offg. under sec., Oct., 1886, and again, May, 1889; suptg. engr., Oct., 1892.

IZAT, Alexander, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., June, 1863, as asst. engr., Haidarabad; exec. engr., March, 1868; transfd. to railway branch, 1870, and served on Nizam's, Holkar's, Dhond and Manmad, Kathiawar, and Bombay E. Deccan lines; suptg. engr., April, 1880; offg. under sec. to govt. of India, railway branch, Jan., 1883; services lent to Bengal and N.W. railway co. as agent and chief engr., Feb., 1883; retd., 1889.

JACKSON, Archibald, India Audit Office.—Clerk, and class, 24th Dec., 1892.

JACKSON, Arthur Mason Tippetts, M.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Westminster Sch., and Brasenose Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 17th Dec., 1888, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; asst. collr. and inspr. of factories, Bombay, Sept., 1892; 2nd asst., July, 1895; under sec. to govt., rev. and finl. depts., Feb., 1897.

JACKSON, Edwin James, Survey of India Dept.—Joined the service, 26th Sept., 1864; asst. supt., Nov., 1868; dep. supt., Oct., 1885; supt., March, 1895.

JACKSON, Frank Ernest, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at the City of London Sch., and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 17th Nov., 1893, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr. and sub-divl. officer.

JACKSON, Freeman Henry, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Pol. Dept., Bombay.—First commn., Bombay infantry, 1861; arrived, 10th Jan., 1862; from Jan., 1867, acted in charge of office of asst. rest., Amreli, and was apptd. to settle boundaries in E. Kathiawar, Jan., 1868; acting asst. rest., Dwarka, and commandant of the Gaekwar's battalion, March, 1869; asst. rest., Baroda, in charge Okhamandal, July, 1874; on duty in Baroda, Jan., 1875; extra asst. gen. supt., thagi and dakaiti dept., June, 1875; from May, 1876, served as asst. agent to the govr.-gen., Baroda, and from Feb., 1879, as supt. of the Gaekwar's contingent, Kathiawar, asst. in charge of Amreli Mahals, and supt. for the improvement of the breed of horses in Kathiawar; offd. for various periods as rest. and govr.-gen.'s agent, Baroda; pol. supt. of Palanpur, Aug., 1895.

JACKSON, Hugh Milbourne, Major, R.E.—late Survey of India Dept.—First commn., 10th June, 1877; entered the dept. as asst. supt., June, 1883; dep. supt., April, 1889; served in the Burma expdn., 1886, the first S. Shan expdn., 1886-87, and with the N. Karen column, 1888-89.

JACKSON, William Grierson, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Manchester Gr. Sch., and Univ. of London; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 12th Nov., 1874, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and in British Burma as asst. commr.; dep. supt. of family domains of Maharaja of Benares, March, 1882; joint mag., Nov., 1887; dep. commr., Aug., 1891; mag. and collr., Sept., 1892; inspr.-gen. of registrn. and commr. of excise and stamps, March, 1897; author of Mirzapur volume of N.W. Prov. Gazetteer.

JACOB, Edward Fountaine, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; joined the service, 1st Oct., 1876, as asst. engr.; district traffic supt., Feb., 1880; attached to public works secretariat, govt. of India, April, 1888; dep. traffic supt., N.W. railway, May, 1890; traffic supt., May, 1892.

JACOB, George, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Bedford Gr. Sch., and Highgate Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 21st Nov., 1879, and served as asst. collr. and mag.; from May, 1883, served as asst. judge and sessions judge, and as asst. agent for sardars in the Deccan; joint judge and sessions judge, Nov., 1886; acting registrar, high court, appellate side, Feb., 1888; 1st asst. judge, Nov., 1891; judge and sessions judge, March, 1894.

JACOB, Herbert Bruce, Col.,I.S.C., late Jud. Dept., Bombay.—First commn., Dec., 1857; served from 26th June, 1869, in the educ. dept., Central Prov., and was apptd. inspr. of schools, April, 1871; acting inspr.-gen. of educn., 1882-84; cantonnt. mag., Karachi, 1889-92; retd. to Europe, Dec., 1895.

JACOB, Lionel Montague, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1875, and employed on irrig. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., May, 1883; under sec. to govt., irrig. branch, Nov., 1894.

JACOB, Samuel Swinton, C.I.E., A.I.C.E., Col.,I.S.C., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 17th Nov., 1862, and posted to Bombay; services lent to Jaipur state, July, 1867; exec. engr., Sept., 1870; public works sec. to agent in Rajputana, 1886, 1887, and 1889; C.I.E., May, 1890; suptg. engr., Jan., 1893; services specially retained, under Jaipur state, Dec., 1896; sec. to govt. of Punjab, public works dept., Nov., 1897.

JACOB, Stephen, C.S.I., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Highgate Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1866;
