LEWTAS, JOHN, M.D., Surg. Lieut.-Col., Indian Med. Service.—Joined the service 30th Sept., 1875; in mil. employ to July, 1878, and again from Oct., 1878 to Nov., 1881, and from Feb., 1883 to Nov., 1890; joint med. offr., Simla, Nov., 1890; civ. surg., Chittagong, June, 1894.

LIARDET, CHARLES AYLMER, Col., I.S.C., late Rev. Survey Dept., Madras.—Ensign, Madras infantry, Oct., 1855; arrived, 14th Nov., 1855; served in the Madras rev. survey dept.
from Oct., 1868; on famine relief works, 1877-78; dep. supt., Sept., 1884; retd., April, 1888.

LIDDERDALE, ROBERT, M.D., Brigade-Surgn., late Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., 1853; supt. of vaccn., 8th Nov., 1869; sanitary commr., Bengal, April, 1880; retd., Jan., 1880.

LIGHTFOOT, JABEZ, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. from the Sind, Punjab, and Delhi railway as dep. manager, N.W. state railway, Jan., 1886; manager, Punjab section, March, 1887; Sind section, May, 1887; auditor, Oudh and Rohilkhand railway, Jan., 1886; transf. to superior accts. estabt., Sept., 1889; acted as manager, Oudh and Rohilkhand railway, in 1890 and 1891; examr. of guaranteed railway accts., Madras, Oct., 1891; examr. of accts., N.W. railway, Oct., 1896.

LILLEY, ABRAHAM ROBERT, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 14th Sept., 1870, and employed in the Central Prov. and on state railways; transf. to Mysore, Oct., 1875; and to Assam, Oct., 1880; exec. engr., Jan., 1885; employed on railways in Burma from May, 1887.

LILLINGSTON, EDWARD GORDON, Col., I.S.C.—First commn., 30th Aug., 1859; from Feb., 1864, served in Bengal as asst. commr., offg. pol. agent, Hill Tipperah, supt. of the central jail and the European penitentiary at Hazaribagh, and dep. commr.; reverted to mil. dept., March, 1892.

LINDSAY, BENJAMIN, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Methodist Coll., Belfast, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 4th Nov., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and in Oudh as asst. commr.; asst. supt., and small cause court judge, Dehra Dun, April, 1894; joint mag., May, 1894.

LINDSAY, JAMES GAVIN, Col., R.E., late Indian Public Works Dept.—Lieut., Madras engrs., Aug., 1855; joined the dept., Dec., 1857; served during the Mutiny (medal and clasp); and subsequently as exec. engr. in Banda and Orissa; dep. consulting engr. for railways, 1862; exec. engr., railway survey, Mysore, April, 1870; offg. engr.-in-chief, N. Bengal railway, 1872; acted as dir. of state railways, N.E. system, and joint sec. to Bengal govt., 1878-79; engr.-in-chief, Harnai and Gulistan-Karez sections of Kandahar railway, Feb., 1880; served in the Afghan campaign, 1879-80 (medal); suptg. engr. and sec. to rest., Haidarabad, March, 1881; engr.-in-chief, S. Mahatta railway, Nov., 1881; services lent to S. Mahratta railway co., May, 1884; engr.-in-chief, Bolan railway, April-June, 1885; retd., April, 1891.

LINDSAY, WILLIAM, Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Winchester; junr. clerk, 31st Jan., 1867; private sec. to parly. under sec. of state, 1877-81; senr. clerk, Jan., 1882.

LIST, GEORGE HENRY, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., 12th April, 1873; exec. engr., July, 1875; asst. sec., railway branch, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Oct., 1879; served subsequently on various railways; suptg. way and works, N.W. railway, Nov., 1891; suptg. engr., March, 1892; chief engr., Aug., 1895.

LISTER, ALLEN LINDSAY, late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Rossall Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1862; served in Madras as asst. and sub-collr. and on special duty in connection with the relief of the poorer classes, S. Arcot, 1868; on famine duty, 1877; collr. and mag., S. Kanara, July, 1882; district and sessions judge, Nov., 1882; retd., March, 1890.

LISTER, EDWARD, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Sheffield Gr. Sch., and Wadham Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 26th Dec., 1894, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

LISTER, WASTEL JAMESON, Major, R.E., late Bombay Public Works Dept.—Educ. at Wellington Coll.; entered the service, 6th Jan., 1872; joined the dept., 26th April, 1875; served with the Kandahar field force in 1881; exec. engr., Sept., 1884; retd., March, 1897.

LISTON, JOHN, Col., I.S.C.—Arrived as ensign, 29th May, 1856; served with the Bundelkhand field force in the campaign of 1859; from Aug., 1863, served in Jhansi, Kumaon, and Ajmir as asst. commr.; dep. commr., Lalitpur, Dec., 1879; offg. commr., Jhansi, Aug. to Nov., 1882; retd., Nov., 1889.

LITTLE, CHARLES, M.D., M.C., L.R.C.S., L.M., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Madras Med. Service.—Arrived, 1st Nov., 1872, and served under the mil. dept.; civil surgn., Akola, Jan., 1877; sanitary commr., inspr.-gen. of dispensaries, and supt. of vaccn. in the Haidarabad assigned districts, July, 1881; admn. med. officer, Haidarabad contingent, June, 1897.

LITTLE, CHARLES, M.A., Bengal Educl. Service.—Educ. at the Univs. of Aberdeen and Cambridge; entered the service, Oct., 1885, as professor, Presidency coll., also meteorological reporter to the govt. of Bengal, March, 1896.

LITTLE, FREDERICK ARTHUR, Jud. Dept., Bombay.—Educ. at Uppingham Sch.; admitted a solicitor, 1874; acted as govt. solicitor and public prosecutor, Bombay, 1870 and 1883, and was confd. in this appt., May, 1884.

LITTLE, JOHN ALBERT, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., 9th March, 1867, and served in various divns. in Central India; transf. to state railways, Feb., 1871; exec. engr., Sept., 1872; dep. consulting engr. for railways, Calcutta, April, 1889; consulting engr., Aug., 1892, with rank of suptg. engr.; reverted to mil. dept., Feb., 1895.

LITTLE, THOMAS DAVID, C.I.E., M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, June, 1859, and arrived, Oct., 1859; asst. engr., Aug., 1862, and exec. engr., Jan., 1869; suptg. engr., Sept., 1889; member of Bombay legis. council, 1889-90, and from Jan., 1894; chief engr., Nov., 1891; sec. to govt., public works dept., Feb., 1894; C.I.E., Jan., 1895.

LIVESAY, JOHN JAMES, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 14th Nov., 1861; from Jan., 1863, served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., dep. commr., mag. and collr.; on famine duty in 1874; retd., March, 1883.

LOYD, ERNEST SAMSON, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Lincoln Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 21st Dec., 1894, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

LOYD, ERNEST THOMAS, B.A., B.L., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Charterhouse, Shrewsbury, and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived,
2nd Feb., 1832, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transfd. to N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Nov., 1885, as asst. commr. and offg. city mag., Lucknow; joint mag., March, 1889; retd., Sept., 1894.

LLOYD, FRANCIS, late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at the Coll. Sch., Gloucester; apptd. from Haileybury Coll., in 1844; served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. judge and sessions judge; jud. asst. to mag., Satara, 1860; judge and sessions judge, 1861; judge of the high court, Bombay, 1869; retd. in 1873.

LOCH, JAMES HENRY, M.D., Dep. Surgn.-Gen.—Joined the Bengal med. service, Dec., 1854; served with the Oudh field force in 1855, and at the relief of Azamgarh, 1858 (medal); from Aug., 1859, served in the N.W. Prov. as civil asst. surgn. and civil surgn. in various stations, and supt. of jail; dep. surgn.-gen., Central Prov., Jan., 1884; retd., Jan., 1889.

LOCH, WILLIAM, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Pol. Dept. Govt. of India.—First commn., March, 1866; asst. pol. supt., Sawantwari, May, 1877, asst. to gen. supt. of operations for suppression of thagi and dakaiti, 1878; 2nd asst. to govt.-gen.'s agent, Indore, 1879; asst. at Banswara and Partabgarh, 1880; during the Afghan war was on pol. duty with Major-Gen. Sir R. Phayre's force, marching to the relief of Kandahar (medal); 2nd asst. agent, Baluchistan, in charge of Pishin valley, Nov., 1880; ass't rest., W. Rajputana, and boundary settlt. officer in Marwar, April, 1889; acting pol. agent, Bikanir, April, 1894; pol. agent, E. states of Rajputana, July, 1895.

LOCH, WILLIE WALKER, B.A., late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Glenalmond, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 14th Nov., 1868, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; junr. collr. and mag., Sept., 1888; senr. collr. and mag., Nov., 1890; acting commr. of customs, &c., Bombay, May, 1891; also British delegate for the Portuguese-Indian treaty; acting commr., N. divn., April-July, 1892; acting sec. to govt., rev., &c., depts., Oct., 1894; offd. again as commr. of customs, &c., Bombay, in 1894, and from March, 1895; member of legisl. council, July, 1895; retd., Sept., 1896.

LOCKHART, GEN. SIR W. S. A., K.C.B., K.C.S.I.—Nominated Commander-in-Chief in India on expiry of Sir G. S. White's period of tenure, April, 1898.

LOGAN, ALEXANDER COCHRANE, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 22nd Dec., 1881, and served as asst. collr. and mag., forest settlt. officer, and offg. under sec. to govt.; 1st asst., March, 1892; junr. collr. and collr. and mag., March, 1897.

LOGAN, ROBERT, late Indian C.S.—Educ. at the Royal Acad., Inverness, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 28th Oct., 1869, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; from April, 1881, served in the finl. dept.; asst. comptt.-gen., Sept., 1881; under sec., govt. of India, fin. and commerce dept., July, 1883; dep. acctnt.-gen., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Dec., 1885; acctnt.-gen., Punjab Oct., 1889; acctnt.-gen., Bombay, and commr. of state paper currency, March, 1890; on special duty in Kashmir, 1891; offg. compt. ptr. and auditor-gen., April, 1892; retd., Aug., 1894.

LOGAN, WILLIAM, late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Musselburgh Gr. Sch., and Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1861, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., sub-collr., and collr. and mag.; fellow of univ. of Madras, March, 1881; acting member, board of rev., Nov., 1882; acting rest. of Travancore and Cochin, May, 1883 to Feb., 1884; retd., 1888; publ. a collection of treaties, &c., relating to British affairs in Malabar, 1879; and edited Mr. Graeme's glossary of Malayalam words and phrases, 1882.

LOKENDRA NATH PALIT, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., London, and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 13th Dec., 1886, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., March, 1893.

LONGE, FRANCIS BACON, Major, R.E., Survey of India Dept.—First commn., 2nd Feb., 1876; asst. supt., survey dept., March, 1880; dep. supt., April, 1888; served in Afghan war, 1879-81, and with the Suakim expndy. force, 1885.

LORD, ROBERT JOHN CORNWALLIS, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at St. Peter's Sch., Weston-super-Mare, and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, and Nov., 1892, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

LORD, WALTER FREWEN, late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., London, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1881, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; retd., Feb., 1889.

LORIMER, JOHN GORDON, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at the Dundee Instn., High Sch., Dundee, Edinburgh Univ., and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 23rd Nov., 1891, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and acting under sec. to govt.; asst. settlt. collr., Jan., 1896.

LOVE, HENRY DAVISON, Major, R.E., Madras Educn. Dept.—Educ. at Univ. Coll., Bath, and Royal Mil. Acad., Woolwich; lieut., R.E., 12th Sept., 1872; acted as inspr. of schools for science and art dept., 1875-76; admitted to Madras establ., Oct., 1876; first asst. master, civil engrg. coll., July, 1877; served subsequently in the public works dept., and acted as dep. consulting engr. for railways, and as dep. chief engr. and under sec. to govt.; asst. examr. of acts., Nov., 1879; principal, civil engrg. coll., Jan., 1880; fellow of Madras univ., March, 1881; compiled a 'Manual of Hydraulics,' 1886.

LOVETT, BERESFORD, C.B., C.S.I., Major-Gen., R.E., late Mil. Works Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., June, 1883; arrived, Sept., 1886; joined the public works dept., April, 1861, and served in the Punjab till Sept., 1866, when he was transfd. to the Persian telegraph dept.; asst. commr., Seistan boundary commn., Sept., 1870; rejoined public works dept. as exec. engr., Sept., 1872; C.S.I., Feb., 1873; attached to Bori valley field force, 1877-78; served in the Afghan war, 1878-79; transfd. to Bengal, Feb., 1881; British consul at Astrabad, 1880-83; suptg. engr., Bengal, 1885; transfd. to mil. works dept., April, 1886; commanding engr., Hazara field force, Sept., 1888; C.B., 1889; retd., Nov., 1894.

LOVETT, HARRINGTON VERNEY, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Sherborne, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of
LOVEITT-THOMAS, LEWIS HENRY, Police Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the dept., 5th Dec., 1870; asst. district supt., Feb., 1874; district supt., July, 1877; dep. inspr.-gen., Sept., 1894.

LOW, CHARLES ERNEST, B.A., Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ at Rugby, and Wadham Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 19th Dec., 1893, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., and offg. under sec.

LOWIS, CECIL CHAMPAINE, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Newton Coll., Devonshire, Göttingen Gymnasium, and Corpus Christi Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 8th Jan., 1888, and served in Burma as asst. commr. and registrar to jud. commr.; under sec. to chief commr., April, 1891; offd. as sec. to chief commr., from Feb., 1895.

LOWIS, EDMOND ELLIOT, late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 1st Feb., 1857; asst. mag. and collr., Aug., 1858; joint mag. and dep. collr., Sept., 1861; dep. commr., W. Duars, Oct., 1867; dep. collr. of customs, Calcutta, Oct., 1867; mag. and collr., Maldah, Dec., 1867; commr., March, 1875; retd., Dec., 1891.

LOWNDES, THOMAS, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Burma.—Joined the Madras army, Dec., 1854; served in the dept. from March, 1861, as supt.; on special mission to Chiengme, 1871; pol. agent, Bhamo, May, 1872, to Oct., 1873; inspr.-gen. of police, British Burma, Jan., 1876; apptd. to special duty in Upper Burma, Dec., 1885.; retd., Aug., 1887.

LOWRY, WILLIAM EDWARD, B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Leys Sch., Cambridge, London Univ., and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 30th Dec., 1895, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

LOXTON, CHARLES WILLIAM, B.A., Indian C.S., (Punjab).—Educ. at Dorset County Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived, 7th Jan., 1897, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

LUARD, CHARLES HENRY, Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., June, 1855; joined the dept., Nov., 1857; asst. principal, Thomason coll., 1863; asst. sec., govt. of India, public works dept., March, 1865; dep. supt., Ganges canal, 1865; dep. consulting engr., Bengal, Oct., 1867; offg. under sec., railway branch, 1873-75; suptg. engr., June, 1874; acted as mint master, Calcutta, 1876; and as consulting engr., Lucknow, 1877, Lahore, 1884, and Calcutta, 1885; chief engr., May, 1886; retd., Jan., 1890.

LUCAS, ARTHUR, Indian C.S., (Haidarabad Administration).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1883, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., forest settl. officer, and W. Bhil, agent; first asst., May, 1894; dep. commr., March, 1896.

LUCAS, WILLIAM HENRY, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 19th Nov., 1888, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; employed in Sind from Nov., 1891; on special plague duty in Karachi, March, 1897.

LUCKSTEIDT, HENRY, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 10th Oct., 1871, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., May, 1884.

LUDLOW, EDMOND SAMUEL, C.I.E., Col., I.S.C., late Haidarabad Administration.—Served with the Madras native infantry from 1858 to 1864, and with the Saugor field divn. in 1859; from Oct., 1864, served in Mysore and Coorg as asst. supt., small cause court judge, asst. commr., and cantonmt. mag.; services lent to the Nizam's govt. and apptd. judge of the suburban court, Haidarabad, Feb., 1884; inspr.-gen. of police to the Nizam's govt., April, 1884; rank of dep. commr., May, 1887; returned to Europe, Feb., 1896.

LUGARD, HENRY IBBETSON, Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—First commn., Dec., 1853; employed under the mil. dept. till 1864, also serving in the Madras police in 1857 and 1860-61; from Jan., 1864, served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., cantonmt. mag., and dep. commr.; reverted to mil. duty, Jan., 1893.

LUKE, STEPHEN PAYET WALTER VYVYAN, C.I.E., M.I.E.E., late India Telegraph Dept.—Joined the dept., 16th Jan., 1868; had charge of field telegraph with Peshawar valley force, 1878, and with Afghanistan force, 1879; C.I.E., Jan., 1880; sept., April, 1880; dir., construction branch, April, 1890; dep. dir.-gen. of telegraphs, April, 1895; retd., March, 1897.

LUMSDEN, JOHN JAMES FOOTE, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 16th Nov., 1856, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., asst. settlt. officer, and joint mag. and dep. collr.; mag. and collr., Gorakhpur, July, 1874; commr., Dec., 1879; senr. member of board of rev., Nov., 1889; member of provl. legisl. council, 1891, retd., Nov., 1891.

LUMSDEN, SIR PETER STARK, G.C.B., C.S.I., Gen., late Council of India.—Ensign, Bengal army, Dec., 1847; asst. exec. engr., 1849; served in various expdns. against the frontier tribes in 1852-56; on a special mil. mission to Afghanistan, 1857-58 (medal and clasp); asst. quartermaster-gen., Sept., 1858; served with China expdn. in 1860 (medal and 2 clasps); dep. quartermaster-gen., April, 1863; with Bhutan field force in 1865 (clasp); quarter-master-gen., May, 1868; offg. rest., Haidarabad, 1872; adjutant-gen., Sept., 1874; chief of the staff, 1879; member of council of India, Dec., 1883, to Dec., 1893; Afghan boundary commr., 1884-85.

LUPTON, WALTER JAMES EDWIN, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the City of London Sch., London Univ., and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 17th Jan., 1895, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

LUSHINGTON, EDWARD HARBOURD, late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1841; arrived, 22nd June, 1841; served in Bengal as asst. collr. and mag., joint mag., and mag.; dep. collr. of govt. sea customs, Calcutta, 1855; collr., Nuddea, 1856; junr. sec., board of rev., Lower Provinces, 1857; acting commr. of Bardwan, Manbhum, and Singhbum, 1857-58 (medal); commr. of rev. and circuit, Nuddea, 1861; sec. to govt. of Bengal, 1861; sec. to govt. of India in the finl. dept., govt. dir. of Bank of Bengal, and member of mint committee, 1863; retd., 1871.
LUSON, Hewling, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at St. Olave's, Southwark, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 30th Dec., 1884, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; under sec. to govt., jud., &c., depts., Oct., 1891; under sec. to govt. of India, home dept., March, 1893; joint mag. and dep. collr., Aug., 1895; mag. and collr., Dec., 1895; dep. commr., Nov., 1896; dep. sec. to govt. of India, home dept., Oct., 1897.

LUTTMAN-JOHNSON, Henry, B.A., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Winchester, and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 4th Dec., 1867, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., offg. private sec. to lieut.-govr., and acting under sec. to govt.; transf. to Assam, Feb., 1874; as dep. commr., and sec. to chief commr.; judge and commr., Assam valley districts, May, 1886; retransf. to Bengal as commr., Nov., 1892; retd., Jan., 1898.

LYALL, Sir Alfred Comyns, G.C.I.E., K.C.B., D.C.L., late Indian C.S., Council of India.—Apptd. to the Bengal civil service from Haileybury, 1855; arrived, 2nd Jan., 1856, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; transf. to Central Prov., April, 1864, and served as dep. commr., offg. sec. to chief commr., and offg. commr. of the Nagpur divn.; transf. to Haidarabad assigned districts, July, 1867, and apptd. commr., W. Berar, Aug., 1867; sec. to the govt. of India, home dept., March, 1873; from Nov., 1874, served in the foreign dept., and was apptd. agent to the govr.-gen. in Rajputana, and chief commr. of Ajmir; on special duty in England, Aug., 1876; sec. to govt. of India, foreign dept., April, 1878; on special pol. duty in Kabul, March, 1880, and again in Sept., 1880; K.C.B., May, 1881; lieut.-govr., N.W. Prov., and chief commr. of Oudh, April, 1882; C.I.E., May, 1882; K.C.I.E., Feb., 1887; retd., Dec., 1887; apptd. member of the council of India, 17th Jan., 1888; vice-pres., 1895-96; D.C.L. (Oxon.), 1889; G.C.I.E., Jan., 1896; author of 'Rajputana Gazetteer,' 'Berar Gazetteer,' 'Asiatic Studies,' 'Manual of the Law of the Hyderabad Assigned Districts,' 'Life of Warren Hastings,' 'Verses written in India,' 'Natural Religion in India' (Rede Lecture for 1891), and 'The Rise of the British Dominion in India.'

LYALL, Sir Charles James, K.C.S.I., C.I.E., M.A., LL.D., Indian C.S.—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., King's Coll., London, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 4th Dec., 1867, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and offg. under sec.; asst. under sec. to govt. of India, foreign dept., April-June, 1872; under sec. in the dept. of rev., agric., and commerce, Sept., 1873; C.I.E., Jan., 1880; offg. sec. to chief commr., Assam, April, 1880; offg. judge and commr., Assam valley districts, 1883 and 1888; sec. to chief commr., Oct., 1883; offg. sec. to govt. of India, rev. and agric. dept., Feb.-Nov., 1886, and in the home dept., Aug., 1889; on special duty to report on penal settl., Port Blair, Dec., 1889; sec. to govt. of India, home dept., Nov., 1890; C.S.I., June, 1893; offg. chief commr. of Assam, July-Oct., 1894; chief commr. of Central Prov., Dec., 1895; K.C.S.I., June, 1897; author of article on 'Hindustani Literature' in Encyclopaedia Britannica, 1880; 'Sketch of the Hindustani Language,' 1880; 'Translations of Ancient Arabic Poetry,' 1835; and 'Guide to the Transliteration of Hindu and Muhammedan Names in the Bengal Army,' 1885.

LYALL, David Robert, C.S.I., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Edinburgh Acad.; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 25th Sept., 1861; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., and mag. and collr.; inspr.-gen. of police, March, 1883; commr. of Chittagong, Aug., 1887; offd. as pol. officer with the Lushai expdy. force in 1889; C.S.I., Jan., 1891; member of rev. board, May, 1892; member of Bengal legis. council, June, 1893; on special duty in mil. dept., April-Nov., 1894; retd., April, 1896.

LYALL, Frank Frederick, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Edinburgh Acad. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 11th Oct., 1893, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

LYALL, Sir James Broadwood, G.C.I.E., K.C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1858; arrived, 8th April, 1858, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., settl. officer, and dep. commr.; settl. commr., Multan and Derajat, March, 1874; finl. commr., Punjab, Jan., 1879; rest in Mysore and chief commr. of Coorg, Dec., 1883; also jud. commr. of Coorg; lieut.-govr. of the Punjab, April, 1887, to Nov., 1892, when he retd. from the service; K.C.S.I., June, 1888; G.C.I.E., May, 1892; member of the royal commn. on opium, 1893-95.

LYDE, Malcolm Thomas, Major, I.S.C., Bombay Pol. Dept.—First commn., 21st Jan., 1874; mil. duty to April, 1885; pol. rest., Aden, till Jan., 1890; served also at Savantvadi, Kathiawar, and Baroda; administrator, Radhanpur state, April, 1896.

LYLE, David Ranken, B.A., LL.B., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Acad.Instn., Coleraine, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 30th Oct., 1893, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

LYLE, Henry Ward, LL.B., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Winchester, and Trinity Hall, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 24th Nov., 1887, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., and asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Oct., 1891; dep. supt., family domains of Maharaja of Benares, April-July, 1892; district and sessions judge, Feb., 1897.

LYNCH, Sidney S., late Med. Dept., Bengal.—From 16th Nov., 1858, served in Assam as civil med. officer, &c., and from Jan., 1866, in Bengal, as supt., presidency jail; supt. of the Alipur jail, and ex-officio dep. inspr.-gen. of jails, Lower Prov., Jan., 1871; health officer, port of Calcutta, April, 1882; retd., 1889.

LYON, Isidore Bernadotte, C.I.E., Brigade-Surgn.—Lieut.-Col., late Med. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the Indian med. service, 31st March, 1865; apptd. profr., Grant med. coll., and chemical analyser to govt., Jan., 1867; was also third physician at the Jamsetji Jijibhoj hosp. 1867-72, and profr. at the Elphinstone coll. from Dec., 1875; on special duty conducting petroleum experiments, 1882; C.I.E., May, 1889; retd., April, 1892.

LYON, Percy Comyn, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at King's Sch., Bruton, and Oriel Coll.,
Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 1st Jan., 1884, and served in Assam as asst. commr. and personal asst. to chief commr.; offd. as private sec. to lieut.-govr. of Bengal, 1888 and 1890; under sec. to govt. of Bengal, jud., &c. depts., June, 1890; offg. under sec. to the govt. of India, rev. and agric. dept., April, 1891; asst. settlt. officer, Cuttack, Nov., 1891; joint mag. and dep. collr., Dec., 1891; employed on N. Behar survey, as asst. supt., Oct., 1892; also settlt. officer, Saran and Champaran, Feb., 1895; mag. and collr., April, 1895; acting dir. of land records and agric., Feb., 1896.

LYONS, ROBERT WILLIAM STEELE, Indian Med. Service.—First commn., 1st April, 1882; in mil. employ till Jan., 1897; acted as 1st physician Jamsetji Jeejeebhoy hospit., and as profi. Grant med. coll. in 1893 and 1894; confid. Jan., 1897; prest. plague committee, Jan., 1897.

LYS, WILLIAM, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Bath Coll., and Brasenose Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 10th Dec., 1893, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

LYTTELTON, Hon. NEVILLE GERALD, Col., late Rifle Brigade.—First commn., 17th Jan., 1865; A.D.C. to lord lieut. of Ireland, 1860-73; served in the Jowaki expedit. of 1877 (medal with clasp); private sec. to sec. of state for war, 1880-82; A.D.C. to chief of staff, expedy. force, Egypt, 1882 (medal with clasp, bronze star, 4th class Osmanieh); asst. mil. sec. to govr. of Gibraltar, 1883-85; mil. sec. to govr. of Bombay, March, 1885, to April, 1890; asst. adjutant-gen., head quarters (England), Dec., 1894.

McARTHUR, ALEXANDER DONALD, Col., R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., March, 1859, and employed on irrig. works in Bengal; exec. engr., Sept., 1872; offg. under sec. to govt. of Bengal, public works dept., 1885 and 1887; suptg. engr., July, 1891; chief engr. and sec. to govt. of Bengal, irrig. branch, Jan., 1895.

MACAULIFFE, MICHAEL, B.A., late Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Newcastle Sch., Limerick, Springfield Coll., and Queen’s Coll., Galway; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 9th Feb., 1864, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and jud. asst.; dep. commr., Dec., 1882; divl. judge, Nov., 1884; retd., April, 1893; author of ‘Life of Baba Nanak, and of articles on the Sikh religion in the ‘Calcutta Review,’ 1880-81.

MACAUSLAND, REDMOND CONYNGHAM SAMUEL, Major, I.S.C., Jud. Dept., Punjab.—Lieut., 13th Nov., 1872; arrived, 9th March, 1873, and served in the mil. dept., and in the Punjab as cantonmt. mag.; 1st class cantonmt. mag., Dec., 1887.

McBLAINE, FREDERICK, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at private schs. and at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 29th Nov., 1886, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; employed in Burma and Assam as asst. commr., from Jan., 1890; dep. commr., April, 1896.

McCALLUM, EDWIN, late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the Wesleyan Connexional Sch., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 31st Oct., 1870, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; first asst. collr., April, 1887; retd., March, 1893.

McCarthy, Samuel Trant, late Madras C.S.—Educ. at St. Patrick’s Coll., Carlow; apptd. after exam. of 1862; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and sub-collr. and joint mag.; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1882; retd., Jan., 1891.

MACCARTHY, The Ven. WELBORE, ECCLES’, Dept., Bengal.—Apptd. junr. chaplain, 20th Dec., 1873; senr. chaplain, Dec., 1883; archdeacon of Calcutta, Aug., 1892.

MACCARTIE, CHARLES FALKINER, C.I.E., late Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Manchester Gr. Sch., and Brasenose Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 21st Nov., 1870, and served in Bombay till Nov., 1872, and subsequently in Madras, as asst. mag. and collr., and addl. sessions judge; on special settlt. duty, Nov., 1883; offg. postmtr.-gen., Madras, 1883; sub-collr. and joint mag., Chengalpat, Feb., 1885; acting sec., board of rev., 1885-86; collr. and mag., Jan., 1889; private sec. to govr. of Madras, Dec., 1891; C.I.E., Jan., 1896; retd., March, 1896.

MACCARTIE, FREDERICK FITZGERALD, C.I.E., M.B., B.Ch. (Dub.), Surgn.-Maj., Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 30th Mar., 1878; arrived, 7th Nov., 1878, and served on gen., mil., and jail duty and as dep. sanitary commr.; apptd. health officer of port of Bombay, June, 1884; served as assay probr. in Bombay in 1886 and 1889; reverted to his appt. as health officer, Jan., 1890; acted as dep. assy master, Bombay mint, in 1891, 1892, and 1893; C.I.E., Jan., 1898.

McCLEVERTY, WILLIAM ANSON, Gen.—Entered the army from Sandhurst, March, 1824; brigade major to the western auxiliary column, Coorg field force, 1834; temporarily attached to the engr. dept. at Gibraltar, 1840-41; dep. quartermaster-gen. in the Australian Colonies, 1846-57; commanded the troops in New Zealand during the native disturbances in 1847 (medal); asst. adjutant-gen. in Scotland, 1859-60; in command of the presidency divn. of the Madras army, 1860-65; in command of the south-eastern district of England, 1866-67; commander-in-chief of the Madras army, and member of the govr.’s council, July, 1867, to April, 1871.

McCOGHY, JAMES, F.R.C.S.I., Brigade-Surgn.-Lt.-Col., Indian Med. Service.—Entered the service 31st Mar., 1875; mil. duty till March, 1891; civil surgn., Karachi, March, 1891; med. officer, Kathiawar agency, Nov., 1895; reverted to Karachi, March, 1897.

McCOLL, HUGH ERNEST, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Christ’s Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1891, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

McCOLLUM, FLORENCE AUGUSTUS, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 31st Dec., 1894.

McCONAGHEY, JOHN, M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Med. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service, 30th March, 1872; from April, 1876, served as civil surg. and supt. of jail at various stations; civil surg. and supt. Lucknow Lunatic Asylum, Jan., 1895.

McCONAGHY, WILLIAM, M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Med. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the service, 1st Oct., 1860; supt. of Matheran, Sept., 1877, and Mahabaleshwar, Oct., 1879; civil surg., Karwar, 1882-83; Dharwar, Feb., 1885; Poona, Oct., 1892.
McCORKELL, GILMOUR, late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Foyle Coll., Londonderry, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 11th Nov., 1872, and served in Bombay as asst. collr.; mag., and asst. judge; senr. asst. judge, April, 1890; judge and sessions judge, June, 1894; retd., July, 1897.

McCUDDEN, EDMUND GERALD JAMES, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., Jan., 1870, and employed on irrign. and damil works in Rajputana; transf'd. to state railways, July, 1875; exec. engr., Nov., 1880; engr.-in-chief, Cuttack-Midnapur-Calcutta railway survey, March, 1894; N. Bengal-Assam connection survey, Nov., 1894; retd., 1896.

MCCULLAGH, JAMES ROBERT, Col., R.E., late India Survey Dept.—First commn., 18th Dec., 1861; arrived, 20th Oct., 1865; apptd. to the public works dept., Nov., 1868, and to the great trigonl. survey of India, March, 1869; asst. supt., Jan., 1872; dep. supt., July, 1882; supt. (new scale), Aug., 1892; retd., Jan., 1895.

McDERMOTT, BENJAMIN KENICOTT SELBY, Burma Commn.—Joined the service, 20th Dec., 1872; asst. supt. of police, Oct., 1880, and district supt., Oct., 1882; apptd. to the commn. as asst. commr., Jan., 1887; dep. commr., Feb., 1891.

MACDONALD, DENIS PETER, M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Port Blair Administration.—Joined the service, 1st April, 1873; served in the Jowaki and Afghan campaigns; on special duty in Egypt, 1883; served with the field hosp., Lushai expdn., Nov., 1889; senr. med. officer, Port Blair, July, 1890.

MACDONALD, DONALD, Col., I.S.C., late Survey of India Dept.—First commn., Bengal infantry, Oct., 1853; arrived, Dec., 1853; apptd. to the survey dept., rev. branch, Dec., 1860; rev. surveyor, Jan., 1865; dep. supt., April, 1866; in charge of the N.W. frontier survey, 1879-84; asst. surveyor-gen., Sept., 1887; reverted to mil. duty, 1890.

MACDONALD, ROBERT GRAHAM, late India Public Works Dept.—Served in the subord. accts. establ., Oct., 1863, and subsequently as examr. of railway accts., asst. acctnt.-gen., Calcutta, &c.; dep. acctnt.-gen. and under sec. to govt. of India, Sept., 1888; prest. of public works accts. committee, Oct., 1888; and of the railway accts. committee, Oct., 1890; acctnt.-gen. and dep. sec., July, 1893; retd., Dec., 1897; has received the Burma war medal.

MACDONNELL, ALEXANDER, M.A., Bengal Educn. Dept.—Educ. at Aberdeen Univ. and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; joined the dept., 30th Aug., 1879, and served in succession as profr. at Patna, Dacca, Presidency, and Hugli colls.; prof., Sibpur coll., Nov., 1890; offg. principal, April, 1897.

MACDONNELL, SIR ANTONY PATRICK, G.C.S.I., M.A., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Galway; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 3rd Nov., 1865, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., offg. mag. and collr., and offg. acctnt.-gen., Bengal; sec., govt. of Bengal, rev. and gen. depts., July, 1884; member of provl. legisl. council, Nov., 1884; sec., govt. of India, home dept., March, 1887; C.S.I., June, 1888; offg. chief commr., Burma, Sept., 1889; chief commr., Central Prov., Nov., 1890; K.C.S.I., Jan., 1893; acting lieut.-govr. of Bengal, May, 1893; member of gov-r.-gen.'s council, Dec., 1893; lieut.-govr. of N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Nov., 1895; G.C.S.I., June, 1897; author of 'Food Grain Supply and Famine Relief in Behar and Bengal,' 1876.

McDOUGALL, HENRY ROBERT LAWRENCE, M.D., L.R.C.S., L.M. (Ed.), Dep. Surgn.-Gen., late Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 1853; civil surgn., Rajkot, Oct., 1878; supt. of Matheran, March, 1884; retd., May, 1886.

MACDOUGALL, JAMES WILLIAM, Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—First commn., June, 1858; from Feb., 1864, served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., and in various acting appts., including charge of the model farm, Nagpur (1873-79); dep. commr., June, 1880; reverted to mil. dept. and returned to Europe, July, 1895.

McDOWELL, GEORGE RONALD, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 26th Sept., 1864, and employed on irrign. works in the Punjab, and in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., March, 1874.

MACEWEN, ROBERT SUTHERLAND TAYLOR, B.L., late Bengal Jud. Dept.—Joined the service, Sept., 1862; clerk of Calcutta court of small causes, July, 1866; judge of that court, Dec., 1870; served temporarily as recorder of Rangoon on various occasions; retd., Dec., 1894; publd. 'The Practice of the Presidency Courts of Small Causes under Act XV. of 1882,' 1883.

MACFARLAN, JOHN, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1857; arrived, 21st Dec., 1857, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; dep. collr. and mag., in Sind, 1860-61; second asst. collr. and mag., 1862-64; first asst., July, 1866; acted as postmr.-gen., Bombay, and was apptd. postmr.-gen., Madras, in 1875; offg. postmr.-gen., Bengal, 1877-78; retd., Dec., 1878.

MCGANN, TERENCE JOSEPH, Surgn.-Col., Madras Med. Service.—Joined the service, 1st April, 1867; senr. surgn., Bangalore, and sanitary commr., Mysore, Sept., 1870; principal med. officer, Rangoon dist., April, 1895.

MACGEORGE, HENRY JOHN, late Central Prov. Commn.—Joined the service, 10th June, 1854; dep. collr., Betul, Nov., 1856; asst. commr., Wardha, Dec., 1860; in charge of settl. duties, Wardha and Chanda, 1862-63; dep. commr., Jan., 1877; retd., March, 1890.

McHUTCHIN, WILLIAM, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Madras Civil Engrg. Coll.; apptd., 13th Oct., 1874, and posted to Mysore; exec. engr., June, 1887; services lent to Mysore state, 1881-87, and again from June, 1889; asst. chief engr. and asst. sec. to govt., June, 1899; local suptg. engr., Oct., 1894.

McINTOSH, HENRY JAMES, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Edinburgh Acad. and Univ., and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 25th Nov., 1886, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; under sec. to govt., finl. and municipal depts., Oct., 1892; employed temporarily in fin. dept., govt. of India, in 1893 and 1894; joint mag. and dep. collr., Jan., 1894; mag. and collr., April, 1897.

McIVER, CHARLES, Bombay Police Dept.—Joined the service as asst. supt. of police, Karachi, 19th March, 1867; supt., March, 1873; district supt., Aug., 1875.

MACIVER, STEWART WILLIAM GRAHAM
IVER, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 20th Dec., 1892, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

MACIVOR, CHARLES VERNON, M.A., L.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 23rd Dec., 1867, and posted to Central Prov.; transfd. to state railways, Jan., 1870; exec. engr., April, 1875; offg. engr.-in-chief, Rajputana-Malwa railway, May, 1884; retd., Aug., 1896.

MACKAY, DUNCAN LACHLAN MACPHERSON, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Madras Coll. and Univ., St. Andrew's; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 8th Nov., 1875, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; transfd. to Burma, July, 1876; cantonmt. mag., Rangoon, May, 1883; dep. commr., Aug., 1892.

MACKAY, HENRY FISHER, Finl. Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Robert Gordon's Coll., Aberdeen; clerk, 2nd class, 2nd Oct., 1895.

McKAY, HENRY KELLOCK, Surgn. Lieut.-Col., I.M.S., Med. Dept., Cent. Prov.—Entered service, Sept., 1873; civ. surgn. and supt. of lunatic asylum, Jubbulpore, Oct., 1894.

MACKAY, Sir James Lyle, K.C.B., member of the council of India; chairman of the Bengal chamber of commerce, 1889 to 1893; member of the viceroy's legisl. council, 1891 to 1893; apptd. member of council of the sec. of state, 27th April, 1897.

MCKEE, JOHN ALEXANDER, Forest Dept., Cent. Prov.—Entered the service, 2nd Oct., 1869; served in the Forest dept. as sub-asst., asst., and dep.-conservator; conservator, Feb., 1894.

MACKENNA, JAMES, M.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Dumfries Acad., Edinburgh Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 23rd Dec., 1895, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

MACKENZIE, Sir Alexander, K.C.S.I., B.A., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Edward VI.'s Gr. Sch., Birmingham, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 11th Dec., 1862, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; from Feb., 1866, served as under sec. and junr. sec. to govt. of Bengal; on famine duty, 1873; offg. sec., board of rev., 1875 and 1877; mag. and collr., Murshidabad, July, 1876; junr. sec., board of rev., May, 1877; sec., govt. of Bengal, finl. dept., Oct., 1877; member of provl. legisl. council, Jan., 1879; sec., govt. of India, home dept., April, 1882; C.S.I., May, 1886; chief commr., Central Prov., March, 1887; chief commr. of Burma, Dec., 1890; K.C.S.I., Jan., 1891; member of govr.-gen.'s council, April, 1895; lieut.-govr. of Bengal, Dec., 1895; author of 'History of the Relations of the Govt. with the Hill Tribes of the N.E. Frontier of Bengal.'

MACKENZIE, Gordon Thomson, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at King William's Coll., Isle of Man, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 10th Nov., 1869, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., asst. commr., head asst. and acting registrar, high court; acting sec., board of rev., Nov., 1884; prest. of the municipal commn., Jan., 1885; sub-collr. and joint mag., Nov., 1886; district and sessions judge, Oct., 1888; compiled district manual of Kistna.

MACKENZIE, KENNETH JAMES LOCH, C.I.E., Col., I.S.C., late Berar Administration.—Joined Madras artillery from Addiscombe, 11th June, 1858; from April, 1862, served in the Haidarabad assigned districts, as asst. commr., asst. conservator of forests, and dep. commr.; jud. commr., July, 1889; commr., March, 1892; C.I.E., Jan., 1893; offg. rest., Haidarabad, March, 1895; reverted to mil. dept., Oct., 1895.

MACKENZIE, THOMAS DUNCAN, late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 9th Nov., 1865, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; sec., Baroda inquiry commn., Nov., 1873; under sec. to govt. in the rev., &c., depts., Nov., 1877; junr. collr. and mag., Broach, May, 1884; collr., mag., and pol. agent, Khandesh, Feb., 1886; acted as chief sec. to govt. of Bombay for various periods; commr., S. divn., May, 1889; chief sec. to govt., rev., finl. and gen. depts., May, 1891; acting commr. of customs, &c., Bombay, March, 1893; retd., May, 1897.

McKERRON, ROBERT GORDON, M.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Kelso High Sch., Edinburgh Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 15th Dec., 1894, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

MACKIE, ANDREW WALLACE, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Univs. of Edinburgh and St. Andrew's; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 20th Oct., 1873, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; on famine duty, 1874 and 1877; asst. to dir.-gen. of statistics, Feb., 1875; joint mag. and dep. collr., Oct., 1884; employed in the Punjab in 1889 as divl. judge; district and sessions judge, Feb., 1890.

MACKINTOSH, HENRY DONALD, Store Dept., India Office.—Writer, 27th June, 1874; clerk specially attached, 25th Sept., 1892.

MACKINTOSH, JAMES SIMON, M.A., B.L., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Royal Acad., Inverness, Edinburgh Univ., and Oriel Coll., Oxford; called to the bar at the Middle Temple; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 4th Dec., 1867, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. sec. to govt.; private sec. to the lieut.-govr., 1874; offg. sec. to govt., 1875; junr. sec. to govt., July, 1876; sec. to board of rev., Aug., 1877; mag. and collr., Jan., 1886; commr., Lucknow, April, 1896; retd., Oct., 1896.

MACLAGAN, EDWARD DOUGLAS, M.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Winchester and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 18th Dec., 1886, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and offg. under sec.; supt. of census operations in the Punjab, 1890; under sec. to govt. of India, rev. and agric. dept., April, 1893; retransfd. to the Punjab, as asst. commr., March, 1895.

MACLARAN, FRANCIS BLANEY, M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 27th Nov., 1872, as local fund engr., Thana; asst. engr., April, 1875; exec. engr., Oct., 1880.

McLAUGHLIN, FREDERICK HUBERT, LL.M., B.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Shrewsbury Gr. Sch., and Magdalen Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 21st Jan., 1863, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; from April, 1876, served in the jud. dept., and was apptd. district and sessions judge, 1st grade, March, 1884; retd., March, 1890.

MACLEAN, CHARLES SMITH, C.B., C.I.E., Maj.-Gen., I.S.C., late Pol. Dept., Govt. of India.
—First commn., 14th Dec., 1853; served in the Indian mutiny, 1857, China war, 1860, Afghan war, 1878-80, and Mashud-Waziri expdn., 1881; consul-gen. at Meshed, March, 1889; agent to govr.-gen., and consul-gen. for Khorassan and Seistan, Nov., 1889; returned to Europe, Dec., 1891.

MACLEAN, SIR FRANCIS WILLIAM, Kt., Q.C.—Appointed Chief Justice, Calcutta High Court, Nov., 1896.

MACLEAN, FREDERICK GURR, M.I.E.E., India Telegraph Dept.—Apptd. to the dept., 1st Sept., 1868; personal asst. to dir. of telegraphs, April, 1890; in charge, Sind and Baluchistan divn., Feb., 1892; in charge, check office, March, 1893; dir., April, 1895.

McLEAN, JOHN JAMES, M.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the International Coll., Ealing, and Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1875, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., asst. commr., and joint mag.; judge, small cause court, Allahabad, 1890; district and sessions judge, March, 1891.

MACLEANE, CHARLES DONALD, Mus. Doc., M.A., late Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Bath Gr. Sch., Shrewsbury Gr. Sch., and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 19th Dec., 1865, and served in Madras as asst. collr.; under sec. to govt. in chief sec.'s dept., July, 1880; fellow of the univ. of Madras, 1881; Kanarese transl. to govt., April, 1881; sub-collr. and joint mag., Jan., 1883; on special duty at Madras in connection with preparation of 'Manual of Administration,' 1883, and again, 1884 and 1886; acting collr. of sea customs, Madras, Feb., 1884; prest. of the committee on Muhammadan educ. endowments, Aug., 1885; Tamil transl. to govt., Sept., 1885; collr. and mag., Feb., 1885; retd., Feb., 1895.

MACLEOD, BANNATYNE, B.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Edinburgh Coll. Sch., Edinburgh Univ., and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 13th Dec., 1880, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settl. officer; head asst., Jan., 1889; sub-collr. and joint mag., Sept., 1894.

MACLEOD, DONALD GRANT, M.A., LL.D., B.L., Jud. Dept., Burma.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Cambridge; called to the bar at the Inner Temple; judge of the court of small causes, Rangoon, Sept., 1869; judge of Maulmain, April, 1876.

MACLEOD, GEORGE EDMONSTONE, late Assam Commn.—Apptd. extra asst. commr. in Oudh, 14th Feb., 1870, and asst. commr. in Assam, March, 1875; inspr. of labourers, Feb., 1882; dep. commr., May, 1888; retd., 1892.

MACLEOD, HARRY, Gen., R.A., Madras Pol. Dept.—First commn., 1st Nov., 1853; commissary of ordnance, May, 1879; dep. inspr.-gen. of ordnance, Madras, Sept., 1880; supt. gun-carriage factory, Sept., 1881; inspr.-gen. of ordnance, Sept., 1886; consular agent, Pondicherry and Karikal, Aug., 1891.

MACLEOD, KENNETH, M.D., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., March, 1865; civil surgn., Jessore, 20th Feb., 1866; sec. to inspr.-gen. of hosps., Jan., 1871; profr. of surgery, med. coll., and surgn. at the hosp., Jan., 1880; also health officer for town of Calcutta, Feb., 1880; retd., April, 1892; member of med. board, India office, July, 1893-July, 1897; profr. Netley hosp. med. sch., July, 1897; author of several publns. on cattle diseases, including the report of the cattle plague commn., 1871, and on medico-legal subjects; also of 'History of the Bengal Medical Schools,' &c.

MCLEOD, NORMAN FREDERICK, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; appointed to the dept. as asst. engr., Sept., 1878, and posted to N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., Jan., 1892.

MACLEOD, RODERICK, M.D., late Bengal Med. Service.—House physician, med. coll. hosp., Calcutta, 24th June, 1865; served as med. officer at several stations, and was apptd. health officer of the port of Calcutta, Oct., 1889; supt. of emigration, March, 1892; retd., Feb., 1897.

MACLEOD, RODERICK HENRY, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., London, and London Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 13th Dec., 1877, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh, as asst. mag. and collr., district and sessions judge, and joint mag.; judge, small cause court, Allahabad, April, 1891; district and sessions judge, May, 1891; legal remembrancer, March, 1894.

McMAHON, ARTHUR HENRY, C.S.I., C.I.E., Capt., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 10th March, 1883 asst. commr., Punjab, June, 1887; employed in Zhob from Oct., 1890; dep. commr., Thal, and pol. agent, Loralai, April, 1892; pol. agent in Zhob, April, 1893; accompanied mission to Kabul, Aug., 1893; C.I.E., Jan., 1894; acting rev. commr., Baluchistan, Feb., 1894; British joint commr., Afghan-Baluch boundary commn., April, 1894, and from January, 1896; C.S.I., June, 1897.

MACMICHAEL, NEIL, M.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Edinburgh High Sch. and Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1894, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

MCMILLAN, ALEXANDER, M.A., B.L., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Aldenham Sch., and Brasenose Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 10th Dec., 1868, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. settl. officer; under sec. to govt., March, 1876; dep. supt. family domains of Maharaja of Benares, March, 1877; joint mag. and dep. collr., Oct., 1883; district and sessions judge, April, 1887; retd., May, 1894.

MACMILLAN, MICHAEL, B.A., Bombay Educl. Dept.—Educ. at Brasenose Coll., Oxford; joined the service, 12th June, 1878, as profr. of logic and moral philosophy, Elphinstone coll.; profr. of English literature, April, 1892; is the author of 'A School History of India,' and of a volume of Indian studies; has edited various English classics for Indian students.

MINN, CHARLES WILLIAM, B.A., late Bengal C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived 21st Jan., 1863, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., settl. officer, asst. commr., and joint mag.; from March, 1879, served in the Central Prov. and was apptd. dep. commr., Nov., 1884; offd. as commr. in 1887; retd., Aug., 1891; compiled Gazetteer of Oudh.
MACMULLEN, GEORGE READE, Major, I.S.C., late Police Dept., Burma.—First commn., 11th Sept., 1876; served in the Burmese war, 1887-88 (medal and clasp), and Miranzai expdn., 1891; dep. inspr.-gen. of mil. police, Burma, March, 1892; reverted to mil. duty, 1897.

MACNABB, SIR DONALD C., K.C.I.E., C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1853; served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; dep. commr., Peshawar, 1865; commr., Hissar divn., 1872, and subsequently in the Lahore, Rawal Pindi, and Peshawar divns.; retd., 1881; K.C.I.E., Feb., 1887.

MACNABB, JAMES WILLIAM, late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 2nd Jan., 1852, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; commr. and supt., Ambala, Nov., 1875, and afterwards in the Hissar and Delhi divns.; retd., March, 1886.

McNAIR, ARTHUR WYNDHAM, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 8th Nov., 1893, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

McNEILE, CHARLES, Col., I.S.C., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 11th Dec., 1853; from Dec., 1861, served in the Punjab police dept. as asst. supt.; from May, 1865, served in the commn. as asst. commr. and jud. asst.; dep. commr., March, 1886; retd., March, 1888.

McNEILE, JOHN MAGEE, Col., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Bengal.—Joined at Addiscombe, Aug., 1854; first commn., Bengal engrs., June, 1856; arrived, 10th April, 1858, and served in the public works dept. as asst. and exec. engr. in Bengal; also as asst. supt., Alguada reef lighthouse works, 1860-65; offg. supt. of works, Ajmir and Merwara, 1874-76; re-transfd. to Bengal, Nov., 1876; suptg. engr., Jan., 1879; suptg. engr. and sec. to chief commr. of Assam, public works dept., Jan., 1882; chief engr. and joint sec. to govt. of Bengal, public works dept., Jan., 1884; chief engr. and sec., Jan., 1890; reverted to mil. duty, March, 1892; retd., Dec., 1892.

McNEILL, DUNCAN, Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Punjab.—Joined the service, 8th Dec., 1855; arrived, 29th Dec., 1855, and served in the suppression of the Mutiny, and with the expdn. to the Pachmarhi hills; asst. district supt. of police, Punjab, July, 1862; district supt., April, 1867; reverted to mil. dept., Jan., 1893.

McNEILL, JAMES, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., Blackrock, Royal Univ., Ireland, and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1890, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 2nd asst., Oct., 1896; compiled the gen. administration report, 1895-96.

MACONACHIE, GEORGE ARCHIBALD, M.D., C.M., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Med. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the Indian med. dept., 1st April, 1867; was employed under the mil. dept. till Jan., 1872, including service in the Abyssinian campaign (medal), and subsequently as ophthalmic surgn. and profr. at the Grant med. coll., Bombay; also presidency surgn. from June, 1880; principal and profr., Grant med. coll., April, 1893; retd., June, 1897.

MACONACHIE, JAMES ROBERT, B.A., late Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch. and London Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 9th Jan., 1872, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., settlt. officer, and offg. postmr.-gen.; dep. commr., Feb., 1887; offd. as commr., Lahore, 1893; author of 'Agricultural Proverbs of the Punjab,' and a report on the settlt. of the Delhi district; retd., Aug., 1896.

MACONOCHE, ALEXANDER FRANCIS, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Westminster, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 8th Dec., 1882, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and acting joint administrator, Rajpipla; survey and settlt. supt., Baroda, Dec., 1890; first asst., March, 1895.

MACONOCHE, EVAN, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Sherborne Sch., and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 29th Oct., 1889, and served in Bombay as asst. mag. and collr.; acted as administrator, Sachin state, 1890 and 1891; dep. supt. Gujarat rev. survey, April, 1896; and asst., July, 1896.

MACPHERSON, ANDREW KENNEDY, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Punjab Administration.—First commn., 19th Dec., 1865; arrived, 9th March, 1866; from April, 1871, served as cantonmt. mag. at various stations in the Punjab, and was employed under govt. of India, home dept., in 1891 and 1892.

MACPHERSON, SIR ARTHUR GEORGE, K.C.I.E., late Jud. and Public Dept. India Office.—Educ. at the Univ. and King's Coll., Aberdeen, and Univ. of Edinburgh; called to the bar, Inner Temple, 1852; 1st judge of Calcutta small cause court, 1859; sec. to govt. of Bengal, legisl. dept., 1862; offg. dep. sec. to govt. of India in the home dept. (legisl.), 1863, and apptd. asst. sec., Oct., 1864; judge of the high court, Calcutta, 1865; acted as chief justice, 1875; retd., 1877; legal adviser to the sec. of state, Nov., 1879; sec. in the jud. and public dept., India office, 1882-93; K.C.I.E., Jan., 1889.

MACPHERSON, CHARLES GORDON WELLAND, C.I.E., late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 30th Dec., 1869, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and supt. of police; under sec. to govt. of Bombay, for famine relief, Nov., 1876; on famine relief duty in Madras, 1877-79; under sec. to govt. of Bombay, pol. and jud. depts., Feb., 1881; acting private sec. to govr. of Bombay, 1880-81; acted as sec. to govt., pol., &c., depts., in 1884 and 1885; acting special judge under the Deccan agriculturists relief act, 1885 and 1886; judge and sessions judge, Nov., 1885; retd., April, 1897.

MACPHERSON, DUNCAN JAMES, M.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at the High Sch. and Univ., Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 19th Nov., 1878, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Sept., 1883; mag. and collr., April, 1893.

MACPHERSON, GEORGE MORISON, M.A., LL.D., B.L., late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Univ. of Aberdeen; apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 10th Oct., 1860, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., asst. judge, small cause court judge, and judge and sessions judge; jud. commr. in Sind, Jan., 1885; also judge of the sadar court, Oct., 1887; acted as commr. in 1886; retd., May, 1895.

MACPHERSON, HUGH, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Paisley Gr. Sch., Glasgow Univ., London Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 28th Nov., 1891,
and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and collr., June, 1897.

MACPHERSON, James, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Gymnasium, Old Aberdeen, and Univ. of Aberdeen; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 1st Nov., 1872, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; supt. of Dehra Dun, Aug., 1886; dep. commr., July, 1890; mag. and collr., April, 1891.

MACPHERSON, John Molesworth, B.L., Legis. Dept., Govt. of India.—Educ. at Westminster Sch.; advocate of the high court, Calcutta; served from Dec., 1877, as dep. sec. to the govt. of India in the legis. dept.; ofid. as sec. for various periods; confd. as sec. to govt., Dec., 1895; editor of 'Macpherson's Law of Mortgage in British India,' and compiler of 'Lists of British Enactments in force in Native States.'

MACPHERSON, William, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 30th Nov., 1856; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; mag. and collr., Nov., 1866; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1874; judge of the high court, Calcutta, Jan., 1885.

MACPHERSON, William Charles, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Winchester Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 27th Dec., 1877, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and in Assam as asst. commr. and asst. sec.; under sec. to govt. of Bengal, Nov., 1885; ofid. under sec. to govt. of India, Jan., 1888; joint mag. and dep. collr., May, 1888; mag. and collr., July, 1892; dir. of land records and agric., Jan., 1894; author of 'An Aid to Revenue and Magisterial Duties in Bengal.'

McQUEEN, Sir John Withers, K.C.B., Lieut.-Gen., I.S.C.—First commn., Bengal infantry, April, 1854; served throughout Indian mutiny campaign of 1857-58; commanded 4th Punjab infantry in Oudh and Rohilkhand campaign of 1858; served against the Kabul Kheyl Waziris in 1860 (medal and clasp), and in the Jowaki Afridi expedn., 1877-78 (clasp); served in Afghan war, 1878-80 (medal and two clasps, C.B.); served in Mahsud Waziri expdn., May, 1881; mil. sec. to govt., Punjab, Jan., 1883; brigadier-gen., commanding Haidarabad contingent, Sept., 1885; Punjab frontier force, Oct., 1886; commanded Hazara expdn., 1888 (medal); K.C.B., April, 1889; returned to Europe, Aug., 1892.

McRAE, John Graham, Col., I.S.C., late Forest Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 10th July, 1858, and served in Bombay on mil. duty till March, 1867, and subsequently in the rev. survey dept. as asst. supt.; on mil. duty, 1867-68 (field service in Abyssinia), and again, 1870-71; from Nov., 1871, served in the Bombay forest dept. as dep. conservator; conservator of forests in Sind, Aug., 1878; retd., May, 1891.

MACRAE, John Kenneth, late Burma Commn.—Joined the commn., 20th July, 1860; registrar to the court of the recorder, and judge of the court of small causes, Maulmain, May, 1864; dep. commr., July, 1869; town mag., Akyab, Nov., 1874; boundary officer, Nov., 1880; prest., Akyab municipal committee, Jan., 1885; retd., April, 1894.

MACRURY, Colin William, Brigade-Surgn.—Lieut.-Col., Bombay Sanitary Dept.—Joined the service, 1st April, 1869; arrived, 30th Oct., 1869, and served on gen. duty in Sind; dep. sanitary commr., Feb., 1878; dep. supt. of census in Sind, 1881; sanitary commr. to the govt. of Bombay, May, 1888; retd., March, 1896.

MADDEN, John Mellish, Col., Bombay Infantry.—Ensign, Bombay army, Sept., 1859; employed on mil. duty, including service in Abyssinia in 1868, up to 1876; served subsequently as asst. cantonmt. mag., Poona; cantonmt. mag., Ahmadabad, Jan., 1880; retd., May, 1892.

MADDOX, Stuart Lockwood, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Fettes Coll., Edinburgh, and Worcester Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 23rd Nov., 1888, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. settlt. officer; joint mag. and dep. collr., Nov., 1894; settlt. officer, Cuttack, March-April, 1896.

MADGAVKAR, Govind Dinanath, B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at St. Xavier's and Elphinstone Colls., Bombay, Bombay Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1892, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

MAGRATH, Henry Marsh Septimus, Col., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept. Govt. of India.—First commn., 5th April, 1858; ofid. as mag. and prest. of the municipal commn., Bangalore, 1884-85; confd., Feb., 1887; returned to Europe, March, 1896.

MAGUIRE, Hugh Fitzjohn Tyrrel, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 25th Nov., 1878, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; ofid. as asst. sec. to the govt. of India, foreign dept., 1880; on special duty in connection with census work in Calcutta, 1890; mag. and collr., April, 1893.

MAHADEV GOVIND RANADE, Rao Bahadur, C.I.E., M.A., LL.B., Bombay High Court.—Served from 28th May, 1866, in the educ. dept., and also in the jud. dept.; apptd. under the Deccan agriculturists relief act to supervise the lower courts in Poona and Satara, Aug., 1881; judge of the court of small causes, Poona, Feb., 1884; C.I.E., Feb., 1887; confd. as special judge under Deccan agriculturists' relief act, May, 1887; judge, high court, Nov., 1893.

MAHANY, Horace George Harold.—Apptd. clerk, 2nd class, India office, and detached for duty with the asst. mil. sec. for Indian affairs, War office, 3rd April, 1894.

MAHESH CHANDRA NYAYARATNA, Mahamahopadhyaya, C.I.E., late Bengal Educn. Dept.—Served in the educn. dept. from 10th Jan., 1864, as asst. profir. and profir. in the Sanskrit coll., Calcutta, and was apptd. principal, May, 1885; retd., Feb., 1895; author of 'Tulsi Mimansa,' 'Loopta Sambatsara,' &c.

MAIR, Edward, M.B., Surgn.—Lieut.-Col., Jail Dept., N.W.Prov.and Oudh.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1874; employed on mil. duty and in acting civil appts. till Jan., 1879, when he was apptd. civil surgrn., Bijnor; was afterwards jail supt. at Jhansi and Benares; supt., central jail, Bareilly, Oct., 1891; acted as inspr.-gen. of prisons in 1892.

Maitland, John, M.D., M.C. (Edin.), Surgn.Lieut.-Col.Madras Med.Dept.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1876; 2nd surgrn., gen. hosp., Madras, Feb., 1882; profir., med. coll., April, 1882; surgrn. to the govr. of Madras, March, 1889;
civil surgn., Coconada, Jan., 1891; surgn., 4th district, Madras, and profr., med. coll., Aug., 1893.

MAITLAND, PELHAM JAMES, Maj.-Gen., C.B., I.S.C., Mil., Secretariat, Govt. of India.—First commn., 2nd May, 1866; served in the Afghan war of 1878-79 (medal); dep. asst. quartermaster-gen., intelligence branch, Bengal, 1880-85; asst. quarter-master-gen. in the same dept., 1885-87; employed with the Afghan boundary commn., 1884-86; asst. sec., mil. dept., govt. of India, Jan., 1881; dep. sec., April, 1892; sec., April, 1896.

MAITLAND, WILLIAM JAMES, C.I.E., India Office.—Educ. at the Edinburgh Acad., and abroad; temporary clerk, 3rd Nov., 1866; junr. clerk, July, 1867; asst. private sec. and précis writer to the sec. of state, 1878; private sec. to the sec. of state (Viscount Cross), Aug., 1886; C.I.E., Feb., 1887; dep. govt. dir. of Indian guaranteed railways, June, 1892.

MALET, ALLEN ARTHUR GRENVILLE, A.M.I.C.E., Madras Public Works Dept.—Trained at the Royal Indian Engrg. Coll.; entered the service, Oct., 1877; exec. engr., Nov., 1890.

MALLETT, FREDERICK RICHARD, F.G.S., F.C.S., late Geological Survey of India.—Apptd. asst. and joined, 12th Feb., 1859; dep. supt., April, 1883; designation changed to supt. of survey; retd., 1889; author of contributions to the survey publins.

MALLETT, ROBERT TREFUSIS, late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the Bombay public works dept., Jan., 1868; exec. engr. on the Punjab N. state railway, Nov., 1868; engr.-in-chief, Indus valley railway, April, 1879; dir. of stores, railway branch, Oct., 1880; engr.-in-chief, Rewari-Firozpur railway, Nov., 1881; engr.-in-chief, Firozpur bridge, 1885; transf. to N.W. railway as chief engr., Jan., 1886; engr.-in-chief, Chenab bridge project, May, 1887; temporarily held office of dir.-gen. of railways, 1887; retd., March, 1892.

MALLOW, HENRY ARCHIBALD, Col., I.S.C., late India Telegraph Dept.—Lieut., Bengal artillery, Dec., 1853; joined the telegraph dept., Jan., 1861; supt., 1st grade, and storekeeper, Dec., 1866; dir. of construction, April, 1868; dep. dir.-gen., June, 1883; offg. dir.-gen., 1886-87, and 1888; reverted to mil. dept., 1889.

MALTBY, EDWARD PENNYCUICK, Lieut.-Col., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Madras infantry, Jan., 1861; served in civil employ in the Mysore commn. from Jan., 1864; dep. commr., Oct., 1877; small cause court judge, and town and cantonmt. mag., Bangalore, March, 1879; district mag. and collr., and prest., municipal commn., Bangalore, March, 1881; retd., Jan., 1887.

MAN, EDWARD HORACE, C.I.E., Port Blair Administration.—Joined the service as asst. supt., 3rd Nov., 1869; was in charge of Nicobar Islands in 1871 and 1874, and from 1883 to 1888; 1st asst. supt., Jan., 1888; dep. supt., April, 1891; C.I.E., Jan., 1893; joint author of a work on the S. Andaman language; has also publd. a monograph on 'The Aboriginal Inhabitants of the Andaman Islands,' and a 'Grammar and Dictionary of the Central Nicobarese Language.'

MANSE, SIR HENRY CHRISTOPHER, Kt., C.I.E., late Indo-European Telegraph Dept.—Apptd. to the dept., July, 1863; supt., Karachi, Persian Gulf section, Sept., 1866; engr. and electrician, Sept., 1879; C.I.E., Jan., 1883; Kt., 1885; retd., 1886.

MANCHERJI PESTANJI KHAREGHAT, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at St. Xavier's Coll., Calcutta, Univ. Coll., London, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 8th Dec., 1884, and served in Bombay as asst. collr.; 1st asst., July, 1895; judge and sessions judge, Jan., 1897.

MANDER, ALFRED THOMAS, Col., R.E., late Public works Dept., Bombay.—Joined Addiscombe, Feb., 1854; and lieut., Dec., 1855; arrived, 21st Dec., 1857, and served in the dept. as asst. and exec. engr.; suptg. engr., Nov., 1886; retd., Sept., 1889.

MANDERSON, THOMAS CLARIDGE, Col., R.E., late India Mil. Works Dept.—Lieut., Bengal engrs., Aug., 1853; joined the public works dept., July, 1860, asasst. engr., N.W. Prov.; exec. engr., Punjab, April, 1866; transf. to mil. works, 1872, and promoted to suptg. engr.; offg. inspr.-gen., mil. works, April-Nov., 1886; chief engr., June, 1893; retd., April, 1894.

MANISTY, GEORGE ELDON, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Ruabon Gr. Sch., Marlborough Coll., and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 6th Dec., 1873, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Dec., 1884; mag. and collr., July, 1890; offg. acctnt.-gen., Bengal, March, 1894; offg. commr. of excise, June, 1896; author of 'Metamorphosis of Silver,' and 'Currency for the Crowd.'

MANN, GUSTAV, late Forest Dept., Assam.—Asst. in govt. cinchona plantations, Darjiling, Nov., 1863; asst. conservator of forests, Bengal, Dec., 1864; from Nov., 1868, served in the Assam forest dept.; conservator, Sept., 1882; retd., May, 1891.

MANN, JOHN, M.A., Educl. Dept., Bengal.—Educ. at Glasgow Univ.; joined the service, 21st Oct., 1878, as profr., presidency coll.; profr., Hugli coll., Jan., 1879; principal, Krishnagar Coll., Jan., 1883; profr., presidency coll., March, 1883; profr., Hugli coll., June, 1889; again profr., presidency coll., Nov., 1892.

MANSON, ALEXANDER, late Bengali C.S.—Educ. at Highgate Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 12th Nov., 1864; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., offg. district and sessions judge, and mag. and collr.; offg. commr., Chittagong divn., 1885 and 1886; retd., July, 1889.

MANT, REGINALD ARTHUR, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 10th March, 1895, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

MARDOCK, EVELYN JOHN, B.A., LL.B., B.L., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 11th Nov., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr. and asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Nov. 1893.

MARETT, JAMES RICHARD, Col., I.S.C., late Oudh Commn.—First commn., 4th Feb., 1858; served during the Jaintia and Khasia rebellion in 1862-63, and captured the Khasia rebel chief; also during the Bhutan campaign, 1865 (medal and clasp); asst. commr., Oudh, July, 1867; sub-judge, Aug., 1879; district judge, March, 1887; reverted to mil. dept., and returned to Europe, Feb., 1896.
MARINDIN, CHARLES RANDAL, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Shrewsbury Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 11th Nov., 1872, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; on famine relief duty, 1874; joint mag. and dep. collr., Nov., 1884; mag. and collr., April, 1889.

MARJORIBANKS, NORMAN EDWARD, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Bishop Cotton's Sch. and Coll., Bangalore, Belfast Royal Acadl. Inst., Royal Univ. of Ireland, and Trinity Hall, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 29th Oct., 1893, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

MARKBY, SIR WILLIAM, K.C.I.E., D.C.L., late High Court, Calcutta.—Educ. at Merton Coll., Oxford; fellow of All Souls Coll., and of Balliol Coll.; recorder of Buckingham, 1864-66; judge of the high court, Calcutta, 1866-78; vice-chancellor of the univ. of Calcutta, 1877-78; K.C.I.E., Jan., 1889; author of 'Elements of Law.'

MARKHAM, ALEXANDER MACAULAY, late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Down and Connor Diocesan Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 2nd Feb., 1862; served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., settlt. officer, and joint mag. and dep. collr.; mag. and collr., Allahabad, Nov., 1880; offg. commr., 1882 and 1887; district and sessions judge, April, 1889; retld., Feb., 1897.

MARKHAM, SIR CLEMENTS ROBERT, K.C.B., F.R.S.—Educ. at Westminster Sch.; apptd. a naval cadet, 28th July, 1844; served in the Arctic expdn. in search of Sir John Franklin, 1850-51; explored Peru and the forests of the E. Andes, 1852-54; from July, 1854, served as clerk under the India board of control, and was clerk in the correspondence dept. of the India office; private sec. to the parly. under sec. of state (Mr. T. G. Baring), 1862-64; asst. sec. in the public works dept., 1867-71, and in the jud., public, and rev. dept. from 1871 to 1877, when he retd. from the service; C.B. (civil), May, 1871; F.R.S., 1873; K.C.B., May, 1896, was employed in introducing cinchona cultivation into India, 1859-66, and visited India and Ceylon; geographer to the Abyssinian expdn., 1866-67, and was present at the storming of Magdala; sec. to the Hakluyt society, 1858-86, and prest. from that date; sec. to the royal geographical society, 1863-88, and prest. from 1893; prest. of international geographical congress held in London in 1895; author of 'History of the Abyssinian Expedition,' 'History of Persia,' 'Memoir on the Indian Surveys,' 'Missions to Thibet,' &c., &c.; has also edited various works, including 'Early Voyages of the East India Company,' 'Voyages of Balin,' &c., &c.

MARR, WILLIAM ALEXANDER, M.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Aberdeen Univ. and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived, 7th Dec., 1896, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

MARRIOTT, ALFRED BARROW WILSON, Police Dept., Central Prov.—Joined the service, 22nd Sept., 1866, as offg. asst. distric. supt. of police; confd., April, 1867; district supt., Aug., 1870.

MARRIOTT, CHARLES RICHARDSON, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Wellington Coll., and Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 29th Nov., 1875, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr. and joint mag. and dep. collr.; mag. and collr., Dec., 1891; junr. sec. to rev. board, March, 1892; collr. of customs, Calcutta, July, 1892-Nov., 1895.

MARRIS, WILLIAM SINCLAIR, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Canterbury Coll., New Zealand, and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived in India, 18th Dec., 1896, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

MARRYAT, ERNEST LINDSAY, Lieut.-Col., R.E., India Public Works Dept.—First commn., June, 1859; proby. asst. engr., Mhow, Nov., 1862; asst. engr., Central Prov., Oct., 1864; exec. engr., Bombay public works dept., Jan., 1866; asst. consulting engr. for railways, Bombay, June, 1869; consulting engr. for reclamation, Bombay, April, 1870; acting under sec. to govt. of Bombay, public works dept., April, 1874; dep. consulting engr., Bombay, March, 1879; manager, Punjab N. railway, Nov., 1880; retd., June, 1886.

MARSDEN, EDMUND, B.A., Madras Educ. Dept.—Joined the service, Nov., 1865, as asst. mr., Bangalore High Sch.; dep. insp. of schs., Aug., 1873; insp. of schs., June, 1874; Persian and Hind. Trans. to Govt., Dec., 1895.

MARSDEN, FREDERICK JOHN, B.L.—Clerk of the crown, 14th May, 1873; offg. mag., Calcutta police, and coroner, Oct., 1874; presidency mag. and coroner, Dec., 1877; chief mag., Calcutta, March, 1878; retd., April, 1894.

MARSH, HENRY, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and employed on irrign. works in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., May, 1883.

MARSHALL, CHARLES HENRY TILSON, Col., I.S.C., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 20th Nov., 1859; from July, 1865, served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and jud. asst.; offg. private sec. to lieut.-govr., Oct., 1878; supt., Chamba state, Oct., 1879; divl. judge, Sept., 1886; sec. to Nizam of Hyderabad, 1886-88; divl. judge, May, 1889; returned to Europe, July, 1896; author of 'A Monograph of the Capitonidae' (with G. F. L. Marshall), 'The Game Birds of India' (with A. O. Hume), 'The Ornithology of the Hills about Murree,' and 'The Ornithology of Chamba.'

MARSHALL, GEORGE FREDERICK LEYCESTER, C.I.E., Major-Gen., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., June, 1860; joined the dept., 28th March, 1864, and served in the irrign. dept., N.W. Prov.; exec. engr., Sept., 1868; asst. sec. to govt. of India, civil works branch, Sept., 1879; under sec., June, 1882; suptg. engr., Dec., 1884; suptg. engr. and public works sec., Rajputana and Central India, 1888; chief engr. and sec. to govt. of Punjab, public works dept., June, 1892; C.I.E., Jan., 1893; retd., Nov., 1897; author of 'A Monograph of the Capitonidae' (with C. H. T. Marshall), 'Bird-nesting in India,' and 'The Butterflies of India, Burma, and Ceylon.'

MARSHALL, LOUIS, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Rugby, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 15th Dec., 1891, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Dec., 1896.

MARSHALL, ROBERT WILLIAM GROGAN, B.A., Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at
the City of London Sch., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 3rd Jan., 1895, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

MARTELLI, Norton Charles, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 11th Oct., 1864; served in civil employ from April, 1872, as asst. cantonmt. mag., Morar, and pol. asst. in Rajputana; guardian and tutor to Maharaja of Alwar, Aug., 1876; served in Baluchistan, 1880-81, as pol. officer, Jacobabad, Quetta, and the Bolan; asst. at Banswara and Partabgarh, and supt. of operations for control of Moghias, Oct., 1881; pol. agent, Bhopawar, 1885; pol. agent, E. states of Rajputana, June, 1888; offg. rest. at Mewar and at Gwalior, 1893; rest., Baroda, July, 1895.

MARTEN, John Thomas, Indian C.S. (Cent. Prov.).—Educ. at Clifton and at New College, Oxford, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived, 9th Dec., 1896, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

MARTIN, Caulfield Aylmer, B.A., LL.D., Educn. Dept., Bengal.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd., 22nd Nov., 1864, and served as profr. at Dacca and Krishnaghar colls.; inspr. of schs., March, 1874; dir. of public instrn., Feb., 1897.

MARTIN, Charles William Wall, B.A., LL.D., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1862; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and sub-collr. and joint mag.; collr. and mag., S. Kanara, Nov., 1882; district and sessions judge, Oct., 1883; retd., April, 1889.

MARTIN, Edward James, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., May, 1859; arrived, 6th Sept., 1859, and served in the Punjab and the N.W. Prov.; engr.-in-chief, Rangoon and Irawadi valley state railway, Aug., 1877; engr.-in-chief of the Central Bengal system of state railways, Nov., 1878; suptg. engr., Jan., 1880; transfd. to Bengal provl. branch, Jan., 1880; gov't. architect, April, 1881; depd. to Indore on special duty, Jan., 1884; offg. sec. to gov't. of Bengal, public works dept., June, 1888; chief engr., May, 1889; chief engr. and joint sec., Jan., 1890; retd., 1891.

MARTIN, Gerald Ward, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Bombay Mint.—Ensign, 88th foot, 22nd June, 1867; from March, 1871, served as asst. supt. of survey in Assam, in the Deccan topogr. survey, and in the Soane irrigtn. survey; transfd. to the assay dept., July, 1878, and was apptd. assay master, Bombay mint, May, 1884; also served with the Afghan expdny. force, 1879-80 (medal and clasp), and with the Waziri expdny.

MARTIN, Henry, M.B., Surgn.—Major, Staff of Govr. of Bombay.—Surgn., 6th March, 1880; served with the Zohb valley expdny. of 1884; med. officer to gov'r. of Bombay, April, 1890.

MARTIN, James Wentworth, late Madras Public Works Dept.—Arrived, 8th March, 1868, and served in Madras as asst. engr.; exec. engr., Sept., 1876; suptg. engr., April, 1893; retd., April, 1896.

MARTIN, William Thomas, B.L., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Regent's Park Coll., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1865, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., asst. settlt. officer, and joint mag. and dep. collr.; judge, April, 1885; retd., March, 1893.

MARTINDALE, Arthur Henry Temple, Indian C.S.—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 10th Nov., 1875, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and in the foreign dept. of the govt. of India as attache, and asst. and junr. under sec. to gov't.; offg. asst. to rest. in Mysore and sec. to the chief commr. of Coorg, Feb., 1885; offg. rest., May-June, 1885; first asst. and sec. for Berar to the rest., Haidarabad, Nov., 1885; pol. agent, Quetta and Pishin, April, 1887; 1st asst. to gov'r.-gen.'s agent, Central India, Oct., 1888; pol. agent, Bhopal, July, 1890, and Jhalawar, Jan., 1892; commr., Ajmir, May, 1894; acting rest., W. states of Rajputana, June, 1895.
