MARTINDALE, Cecil Sydney De Butts, Capt., I.S.C., Punjab Commn.—In mil. employ from 12th Jan., 1881; joined the Punjab commn. as asst. commr., 3rd Dec., 1883; district judge, Feb., 1893.

MARTINEAU, Alfred Edward, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Univ. Coll. Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1889, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and offg. registrar, chief court; district judge, June, 1896.

MARTYNE, George Valentine, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 10th Feb., 1873, and posted to Oudh; transfd. to state railways, Dec., 1877; exec. engr., Oct., 1882; asst. dir., N.W. railway, Aug., 1887; dep. consulting engr. for railways, Lucknow, Jan., 1889; Calcutta, Oct., 1893.

MASSY, Charles Francis, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 11th June, 1868; from June, 1870, served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; on depn. to Kashmir, 1876; pol. officer with the Punjab native chiefs contingent, Nov., 1878; on special duty for viceregal durbar, 1880; on special duty to inspect the Punjab-Rajputana border, Nov., 1883; supt., Kapurthala state, Aug., 1886; dep. commr., Dec., 1890; commr. and supt., Jullundur, April, 1896; has publ. a new edn. of Sir Lepel Griffin's 'Punjab Chiefs,' and 'Chiefs and Families of Note in the Punjab.'

MASSY, George, Brigade-Surgn.—Lieut.-Col., late Med. Dept., Punjab.—Arrived, 11th April, 1866; from April, 1867, served in the Punjab as civil surgn., supt. of jail, and supt. of vaccn.; dep. sanitary commr., 1880-81; retd., Sept., 1896.

MASTER, Charles Gilbert, C.S.I., B.L., late Madras C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1854; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag. and dep. sec. to gov't. in rev. dept.; commr. of income tax, 1860-65; sec. to the board of examrs., 1861-66; collr. and mag., Nov., 1869; sec. to gov't., rev. dept., June, 1877; chief sec. to gov't., June, 1882; member of legisl. council, June, 1882; ordinary member of council, Madras, Jan., 1884; pres't. of the committee for draft tenancy bill, July, 1885; C.S.I., Feb., 1887; retd., Jan., 1889.

MASTERS, John, Bengal Police Dept.—Joined the service, 21st July, 1861; asst. supt., June, 1863; district supt., April, 1870; dep. insp.-gen., April, 1897.

MATHEW, George Felton, C.I.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., June, 1876, and served on various railways; C.I.E.,
Jan., 1882; dep. manager, N.W. railway, May, 1890; offd. as traffic supt., 1890; manager, Burma state railway, May, 1892; retd. Jan., 1893.

MATHEWS, Henry Montagu, C.I.E., M.I.C.E., late Indian Public Works Dept.—Apptd. exec. engr., 8th Oct., 1868; arrived, Dec., 1868, and served in British Burma; employed in examining lighthouses, British Burma, 1878; transfd. to railway branch as engr.-in-chief and manager of the Rangoon and Irrawadi valley state railway, Nov., 1878; offd. as chief engr. and sec. to the chief commr., 1880 and 1886; also chairman, Rangoon port trust; C.I.E., Feb., 1887; retd., 1887.

MATHEWS, Henry Montagu Segundo, Burma Commn.—Joined the telegraph dept., 2nd Sept., 1879; employed at Mandalay with the Upper Burma field force, 1885; transfd. to the commn. as asst. commr., Feb., 1886; settl. officer, Bassein, 1888-92; offd. as dir. of land records and agric. in 1892 and 1893-95.

MATHIAS, Henry Vincent, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Central Prov.—Ensign, Bengal infantry, Dec., 1849; in command, Nagode divl. mil. police, Oct., 1862; from 1st July, 1865, served in the police dept., Central Prov., as asst. and district supt.; reverted to mil. duty, 1885.

MATTHEWS, Harold Francis, M.A., Indian C.S.(Bengal).—Educ. at Tonbridge Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 10th Nov., 1871; and served in Bengal and Assam; joint mag. and dep. collr., Nov., 1884; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1889.

MAUDE, Henry, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Rugby; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 27th Dec., 1877, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and offg. senr. sec. to finl. commr.; under sec. to govt., Punjab, April, 1885; junr. sec., April, 1892; district judge, March, 1895; divl. judge, March, 1895.

MAUDE, Walter, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Highgate Sch. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 17th Nov., 1883, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; under sec. to govt. of Bengal, gen., rev., and statistical depts., Aug., 1890; settl. officer, Orissa, Nov., 1892; joint mag. and dep. collr., March, 1893; mag. and collr., July, 1895.

MAW, William Newton, B.A., Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Wesley Coll., Sheffield, and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 19th Dec., 1893, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

MAXWELL, Frederick Doveton, B.L., Capt., I.S.C., Burma Commn.—First commn., July, 1882; employed in Burma as supernumerary asst. commr., July, 1885; dep. commr., Dec., 1891.

MAXWELL, Henry St. Patrick, C.S.I., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C.—Educ. at Wellington Coll. and Sandhurst; arrived, 26th March, 1869; from May, 1873, served in civil employ in the Assam commn.; also in the Datla expdn., 1874-75, and as pol. officer with the Naga Hills expdn., 1879-80 (medal); inspr. of immigrants, Jan., 1881; from May, 1881, acted as dep. commr. in the Garo Hills; pol. officer with the Aka field force, 1883-84; dep. commr., Sept., 1885; pol. officer, Manipur, April, 1891; C.S.I., May, 1892.

MAXWELL, William, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Belfast Methodist Coll., Royal Univ. of Ireland, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1891, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and collr., April, 1897.

MAYES, Herbert Frederick, B.L., Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Dover Coll. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 17th Nov., 1890, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

MAYHEW, Alfred Hercules, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Sind Commn.—First commn., Madras army, June, 1861; from July, 1865, served in Sind as dep. collr. and mag., and head asst. collr.; dep. commr., Upper Sind frontier, Dec., 1884; collr. and mag., Shikarpur, and pol. agent, Khairpur state, Dec., 1885; pres. of plague committee, March, 1897.

MAYNARD, Herbert John, M.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch. and St. John's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 4th Dec., 1886, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; under sec., rev. dept., Nov., 1891, to May, 1894; junr. sec. to govt., Dec., 1896.

MAYNE, Arthur, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Christ's Hosp. and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 27th Oct., 1890, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; also registrar, jud. commr.'s court, March, 1892; asst. acctnt.-gen., Bengal, 1893-94.

MEAD, Henry Robert, Col., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Madras.—First commn., Dec., 1855; arrived, 26th Dec., 1857, and served in the dept. as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; suptg. engr., Oct., 1878; on special duty in Travancore, Feb., 1882; chief engr., and joint sec. to govt., irrign. branch, March, 1887; acting chief engr. and sec., Oct., 1888; retd., Sept., 1889.

MEAD, Percy James, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Haileybury Coll., and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 24th Dec., 1894, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; admn., Sachin state, July, 1897.

MEADE, Malcolm John, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 9th Aug., 1873; arrived, 10th Nov., 1873; served under the mil. and foreign depts., and was apptd. asst. to rest., Haidarabad, and asst. gen. supt. in thagi and dakaiti dept., Aug., 1878; from 1879, was asst. to govr.-gen.'s agent in Central India for various periods; supt. of operations for control of Moghias, July, 1885; pol. agent, Baghelkhand, and supt. of Rewah state, May, 1887; pol. agent in Bhopawar, Dec., 1889; pol. agent, Bhopal, Dec., 1891; pol. rest. in the Persian Gulf, 1897.

MEADOWS, Charles John Walford, Brigade - Surgn. - Lieut. - Col., Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., 1st Oct., 1869; from 26th April, 1872, served as civil asst. surgn. and civil surgn. at various stations in Bengal; also offd. as supt. of med. school, Dacca, 1888-90.

MEARES, William Edward, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 1st April, 1874, and posted to N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., Nov., 1881; served on state railways, 1874-76 and 1884-88, and was transfd. to that branch, Dec., 1889.

MEDLICOTT, Henry Benedict, M.A., F.R.S., F.G.S., late Geological Survey of India.—Engaged from the geological survey of Great Britain; joined appt., March, 1854; prof. of geology, Kurki coll., 1854-62, when he rejoined
the survey as dep. supt. for Bengal; received the Indian mutiny medal for special services in Rohilkhand; supt. of the geological survey (subsequently designated dir.), April, 1876; fellow of Calcutta univ., 1876; retd., April, 1887; author of numerous contributions to the survey publs., and (in part) of a manual of the geology of India.

MEHERJIBHAI KUVARJI TARAPUR-VALA, Khan Saheb, Bombay Pol. Dept.—Joined the service, 4th Oct., 1875, and served in the Bombay jud. dept.; chief judge, Kolhapur, Feb., 1882; divan and prest. of council, Kolhapur, from 1885.

MEIKLEJOHN, DAVID OGILVY, B.L., late Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Rugby; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1870, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; on famine duty in Bengal, 1874; registrar, jud. commr.'s court, Dec., 1882; judge, small cause court, Jalapur, April, 1885; dep. commr., Sept., 1886; retd., May, 1897.

MEIKLEJOHN, GEORGE FORBES, B.L., Coorg Administration.—Joined the service, 30th Nov., 1867, as proby. asst. supt.; confd., June, 1868; special dep. commr., March, 1881; dep. commr., Bangalore, and prest. of Mysore municipality, Nov., 1889; commr. of Coorg, Jan., 1891.

MELHUISH, WILLIAM FRANCIS, M.I.E.E., late India Telegraph Dept.—Joined the dept. as inspr., 29th May, 1865; arrived, 9th Sept., 1865, and served in Bengal and Bombay; accompanied Persian Gulf cable expdn., 1869; supt., April, 1880; personal asst. to dir.-gen., Dec., 1881; electrician, May, 1889; dir., traffic branch, Feb., 1891; chief supt., Sept., 1892; dir., June, 1894; retd., May, 1897.

MELITUS, PAUL GREGORY, C.I.E., Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at St. Marylebone, All Saints' Gr. Sch., Marlborough Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 4th Dec., 1880, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; asst. commr. in Assam, Nov., 1885; acted as postm.-gen., Calcutta, in 1890; under sec. to govt. of India, home dept., Jan., 1891; dep. sec., March, 1893; C.I.E., Jan., 1894; sec. to chief commr., Assam, Oct., 1894.

MELLOR, CHARLES WARREN, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Corpus Christi Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; mag. and collr., Nov., 1879; retd., Aug., 1887.

MELVILL, PHILIP JAMES, Capt., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 1st May, 1878; from Oct., 1886, held offd. appts. at Haidarabad; apptd. asst. agent, Indore, Dec., 1887; asst. to rest., Bushire, May, 1888; asst. commr., Merwara, Jan., 1890; asst. commr., Ajmir, Nov., 1892; pol. agent and dep. commr., Quetta, July, 1895.

MELVILL, PHILIP SANDYS, C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Rugby, and Haileybury Coll., from which he was apptd. in 1846; arrived, 4th Oct., 1846; attached to the Punjab, and served as asst. to the rest, at Lahore, and asst. commr.; settl. officer in the Hoshiarpur and Ambala districts, 1850-54; dep. commr., Jan., 1854; commr., 1860; offd. as finl. commr. of the Punjab in 1869 and 1873, and as jud. commr. of the Central Prov. in 1870-71; commr., Jalandhar, 1872-75, and offd. as judge of the chief court of the Punjab in 1873 and 1874; agent to the govr.-gen. and rest., Baroda, Oct., 1875; retd., Jan., 1882.

MENZIES, HUGH CHRISTIAN, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Berar Commn.—Ensign, Dec., 1849; arrived, 7th June, 1850, and served under the mil. dept. in Madras, and took part in the operations against the insurgents in the Parla Kimed district, 1857; served in Burma from Aug., 1859, as asst. commr.; from Oct., 1860, served in Madras as asst. of police, and from Dec., 1864, in the Haidarabad assigned districts as asst. commr., and small cause court judge at Amraoti; inspr.-gen. of registrn., Aug., 1871; dep. commr., April, 1878; reverted to mil. duty, 1887.

MENZIES, OSWALD, Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Punjab.—First commn., 26th Aug., 1854; arrived, 19th Dec., 1854; from March, 1861, served in the police dept., Punjab, as district supt., and was promoted to dep. inspr.-gen., July, 1880; inspr.-gen. and under sec. to govt., March, 1885; reverted to mil. dept., Aug., 1892.

MEREDITH, ARTHUR, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 25th Nov., 1878, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and district judge; offg. under sec., rev. dept., 1886-87; dep. commr., March, 1894.

MERES, WILLIAM FITZPATRICK, B.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Oakham Gr. Sch., and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 29th Nov., 1864, and served in Bengal and Assam as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and district and sessions judge; acting jud. commr., Burma, Feb., 1885; prest. of the educ. syndicate, Burma, Feb., 1885; retd., 1890.

MERK, WILLIAM RUDOLPH HENRY, C.S.I., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Kornthal, Wurttemberg, Old Aberdeen Gr. Sch., and the Univ. of Aberdeen; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 1st Dec., 1875, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; asst. rest., Kandahar, Nov., 1880; offg. under sec. to govt., 1882 and 1884; on special duty with the Afghan boundary commn., 1884; C.S.I., Feb., 1887; dep. commr., Peshawar, Aug., 1890, and again from Dec., 1891; district judge, Peshawar, 1890-91; on special duty in the Kuram valley, Sept., 1892.

MERRIMAN, CHARLES JAMES, C.S.I., Gen., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., Bombay engrs., June, 1850; arrived, 20th Oct., 1852; asst. engr., Sept., 1853; field engr., Persia, Nov., 1856; exec. engr., Sept., 1857; suptg. engr. in Sind, May, 1868; chief engr. and sec. to govt. of Bombay gen. and buildings and roads branches, March, 1880; retd. from the dept. in 1885; from the Army, Feb., 1887.

MERRIMAN, JOHN HENRY, Salt Dept., Madras.—Served in the Madras rev. survey dept. from June, 1868; on special duty in Ganjam for settling boundary disputes, March, 1877; from Nov., 1880, served in the salt dept. as asst. commr.; dep. commr., salt rev., Dec., 1885.

MERRIMAN, WILLIAM, C.I.E., Col., R.E., late Mil. Works Dept.—Joined the service, 12th Dec., 1856, and arrived, Feb., 1859; apptd. special asst. engr., harbour defences, Bombay, Nov., 1862; exec. engr., Jan., 1864; served under the home govt., 1866-82; returned to India as exec.
engr., March, 1882; served as suptg. engr. of West of India coast defences in 1888; chief engr., Sept., 1890; Bombay command, July, 1891; retd., May, 1893.

MESTON, JAMES SCORGIE, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Gr. Sch. and Univ. of Aberdeen, and at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 23rd Nov., 1885, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; joint mag., May, 1890; settl. officer, April, 1892; dep. commr., Nov., 1896; dir. of land records and agriculture, April, 1897.

METCALFE, CHARLES THEOPHILUS, C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 30th Oct., 1857, and served in the Bengal rev. and jud. depts.; dep. commr. and civil officer, Bhutan field force, Oct., 1864; senr. supt. of survey, May, 1869; addl. commr., Patna divn., March, 1874; offg. commr. of police, Calcutta, Nov., 1876; offg. opium agent, Behar, July, 1884; commr. and supt., Orissa divn., Sept., 1884; retd., Oct., 1889.

METCALFE, EDWARD PARR, M.A., late Madras Educl. Dept.—Apptd., 10th Nov., 1872, and served as head-master of Rajmahendri sch., and acting inspr. of schs.; fellow of Madras univ., 1880; principal of Rajmahendri coll., Oct., 1887; retd., March, 1897.

MEYER, CHARLES HARDWICK LOUW, M.D., Surgn.-Capt., Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 2nd Dec., 1887; prof. of physiology and histology and of hygiene, Grant med. coll., Jan., 1889.

MEYER, WILLIAM STEVENSON, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Blackheath Missionary Sch., Univ. Coll. Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 25th Dec., 1881, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; asst. sec. to govt. jud. and legisl. depts., Nov., 1888; acting under sec. to govt., rev. dept., 1889-90; dep. commr. of salt, &c., rev., Sept., 1891; sec. to commrs. of land rev., Nov., 1893; sub-collr. and joint mag., Feb., 1894; principal asst., March, 1894.

MICHAEL, JAMES, C.S.I., Gen., I.S.C.—Educ. at the Temple Sch., Brighton; also studied on the Continent, and at the Mil. Acad., Edinburgh ensign, Madras infantry, Dec., 1844; in 1848 was apptd. to organise a scheme of forest conservancy, which he suptd. till the establ. of a regular forest dept. in 1856; asst. chief engr., Haidarabad, March, 1857; exec. engr., Secunderabad, Sept., 1862; supt. of family payments and pensions, and curator of govt. books, Madras, 1865-76; commr. for Madras at the Paris exhibn., 1867; acted as dep. sec. to govt. of Madras, mil. dept., 1869; commr. for India to the Vienna exhibn., 1873 (apptd. commander of the order of Francis Joseph of Austria); fellow of the univ. of Madras, 1874; attached to the staff of H.R.H. the Prince of Wales during his visit to Madras, 1875; sec. to govt. of Madras, mil. dept., 1876-83; C.S.I., March, 1876; commr. for India to the Edinburgh forestry exhibn., 1884; royal commr. for the colonial and Indian exhibn., 1886.

MICHAEL, WALTER HENRY, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Newark Gr. Sch., and at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 5th Dec., 1887, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; special asst., March, 1894; dep. acctnt.-gen., Madras, Nov., 1894.

MICHELL, The Ven FRANCIS RODON, late Ecclesl. Dept., Bengal.—Apptd. junr. chaplain, 12th Aug., 1867; senr. chaplain, Aug., 1877; archdeacon of Calcutta, Feb., 1889; retd., Aug., 1892.

MICHELL, RICHARD BROOKE, M.A., B.L., Madras Jud. Dept.—Called to the bar (Lincoln's Inn), April, 1872; admitted an advocate, Madras high court, Feb., 1874; law profr., presidency coll., July, 1881; acting administrator-gen., May, 1893; chief judge, Madras small causes court, July, 1894.

MICHELL, THEOPHILUS, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1875, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., Jan., 1885; services lent to S. Mahrratta railway co. in 1888-89, and to S. Indian railway co., 1891-92.

MICHELL, THOMAS BERNARD, Col., I.S.C., late Assam Commn.—First commn., Feb., 1858; arrived, 29th Jan., 1860; served in the Assam commn. from March, 1866; also temporarily in Bengal as cantonmt. mag., 1877-78; retd., March, 1886.

MICHELL, WILLIAM, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1876, and posted as asst. engr. to state railways; exec. engr., Feb., 1888.

MIDDLETON, JAMES RUSSELL, M.A., late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at St. Andrew's, and Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 9th Nov., 1865, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and sub-collr. and joint mag.; junr. collr. and mag., Aug., 1883; senr. collr. and mag., Nov., 1886; acted as commr., S. divn., 1889; retd., 1890.

MILES, SAMUEL BARRETT, Col., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Ensign, Bombay infantry, Aug., 1857; from Nov., 1867, served as cantonmt. mag. and asst. rest., Aden; asst. pol. agent, Mekran Coast, 1871; from Oct., 1872, served as pol. agent and consul, Muscat; offg. pol. agent, Turkish Arabia, and consul-gen., Baghdad, 1879-80; pol. agent, Zanzibar, 1881; returned to agency of Muscat, 1883; acting pol. rest., Persian Gulf, April, 1886; pol. rest., Mewar, Dec., 1890; reverted to mil. dept., Dec., 1892; author of several papers on the history and geography of S. and E. Arabia.

MILLAR, THOMAS, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Liverpool Coll., King's Coll., Cambridge, and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, and 2nd Dec., 1893, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; transfd. temporarily to Central Prov., March, 1897.

MILLER, SIR ALEXANDER EDWARD, Kt., C.S.I., B.A., LL.D., Q.C.—Educ. at Rugby and Trinity Coll., Dublin, where he obtained scholarship, 1st gold medal in mathematics and physics, and 2nd gold medal in classics, besides the Berkeley medal in Greek; hon. LL.D. in 1875; called to the bar (Lincoln's Inn), 1854; Q.C. in 1872; examr. in law, London univ., 1874-79, and for council of legal educn., 1877-78; legal member of railway commn., 1877-88; master in lunacy, 1889; apptd. legal member of the govt. of India, Dec., 1890; took up his post, 8th April, 1891; C.S.I., May, 1895; called to the Irish bar, Nov., 1897.

MILLER, ARTHUR, Library, India Office.—Writer, 11th Oct., 1867; clerk, 2nd class, March, 1880.

MILLER, JOHN FRANCIS JAMES, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the
service, 13th Nov., 1868, and was employed on irrig. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., Sept., 1874; served through the Hazara campaign, 1868 (medal with clasp), and Afghan war, 1879-80 (medal); suptg. engr., Nov., 1890.

MILLER, JOHN ONTARIO, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at King's Coll., Aberdeen; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 8th Dec., 1879, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., and asst. mag. and collr.; asst. sec. to govt., Jan., 1883; under sec., May, 1884; private sec. to leit.-govr., 1886-87; settl. officer, Oct., 1888; dir. of land records and agric., March, 1892; dep. commr., Nov., 1895; mag. and collr., Dec., 1895; offd. as jud. sec. and as fin. sec. to govt. from Aug., 1895.

MILLER, LESLIE CREERY, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Charterhouse, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 28th Nov., 1883, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and head asst.; manager, Pittapur estate, 1891-92; princpl. asst. and dist. mag., Nov., 1895.

MILLETT, H., B.L., late Bengal Jud. Service.—Profr. of English law, presidency coll., Calcutta, April, 1870; receiver, high court, April to Dec., 1873; offg. asst. sec. to govt. of Bengal, legal dept., Dec., 1873, to April, 1875; first judge, Calcutta court of small causes, Jan., 1876; retd., 1889.

MILLETT, MONTAGUE, Major-Gen., late Police Dept., Punjab.—First commn., 1857; arrived, 16th Oct., 1857; from Sept., 1864, served in the police dept., Punjab, as asst. supt. and district supt.; reverted to mil. dept., Oct., 1887.

MILLS, CHARLES AUGUSTUS, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1870, and posted to Bengal; exec. engr., May, 1883; inspr. of works, Behar divn., Nov., 1892; supt. famine relief works, 1st circle, 1897.

MILLS, JAMES, Veterinary Capt., Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the dept., 23rd June, 1875; apptd. principal and profr., Bombay veterinary coll., Aug., 1891.

MILNE, ALEXANDER, M.B., C.M., F.C.S., Surgn.—Major, Calcutta Mint.—First commn., 2nd April, 1881; after serving in mil. employ, and offg. as chemical analyser, Bombay, and civil surg. at various stations, was apptd. dep. assay master, Calcutta mint, Nov., 1892; dep. assay master, Bombay, March, 1895.

MILNE, WILLIAM PAUL, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at the Calcutta Civil Engrg. Coll.; apptd. as foreman of works, Bengal, July, 1874; apprentice engr., Oct., 1874; asst. engr., Sept., 1875; exec. engr., Dec., 1887; transf. to state railways, July, 1890.

MILSOM, BOSWELL PARKINSON, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 1st March, 1871, and posted to state railways in the Central Prov.; in 1873-76 was employed in the provl. roads and buildings, and irrig. branches; exec. engr., Sept., 1883; employed on Kashmir railway survey, Nov., 1890; offg. dep. manager, E. Bengal line, March, 1891; services lent to Assam-Bengal railway co., Jan., 1893.

MINCHIN, HUGH DILLON MASSY, Major, Indian Staff Corps.—First commn. 31st Oct., 1895; in mil. employ to Dec., 1891; cantonmt. mag., Belgaum, Dec., 1891.

MINNS, WALTER HARDWICK CHRISTOPHER, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Marlborough, and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 17th Nov., 1891, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

MIRZA ABBAS ALI BAIG, B.A., Statutory C.S. (Bombay).—Joined the service, 8th Jan., 1882; employed in Janjira state, 1886-90; probr. under the native civil service rules, and asst. collr., 1st April, 1890; offg. as 4th presidency mag., 1893; apptd. oriental translr. to govt., June, 1893.

MITCHELL, HORACE, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch.; clerk, 2nd class, 27th March, 1885.

MITCHELL, THOMAS CANDY, M.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 13th Nov., 1875, and served as asst. mag. and collr. in Bengal; from May, 1876, served in Burma as asst. commr. and boundary and settl. officer; dep. commr., Aug., 1886.

MOBERLY, ARTHUR NORMAN, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Winchester and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 7th Dec., 1896, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

MOBERLY, CHARLES MORRIS, Col., I.S.C., late India Public Works Dept.—Ensign, and European regt., Madras, May, 1855; joined the dept., May, 1867, and served as examr. of railway accts. at various stations; sec. to railway conference, 1884; reverted to mil. dept., July, 1892.

MOBERLY, HENRY, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Bradfield Coll., and King's Coll. Sch., London; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 7th Dec., 1880, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settl. officer; special asst., Nov., 1888; sub-collr. and joint mag., March, 1894; dist. and sess. judge, Godaveri, Oct., 1896.

MOCKLER, EDWARD, Col., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Bombay infantry, Aug., 1859; served as asst. rest., Aden, 1866-73; in civil employ, Mekran coast, from 1873; asst. to the govr.-gen.'s agent, Baluchistan, Oct., 1879; asst. agent and consul, Bassora, Nov., 1881; asst. pol. agent, Bassora, 1883-86 and 1887; pol. agent, Muscat, 1886-87 and 1887-91; pol. rest., Turkish Arabia, May, 1892; author of an Arabic grammar, a Baluchi grammar, &c.

MOHENDRO NATH BOSE, late Jud. Dept., Bengal.—From 26th Feb., 1859, served in the subord. jud. service, Bengal; small cause court judge, Feb., 1872; offg. judge, high court, 1882-84; retd., Oct., 1890.

MOHSIN BADRUDDIN TYABJI, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at St. Mary's Inst. and St. Xavier's Coll., Bombay, and at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 28th Oct., 1887, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 2nd asst., Feb., 1895; 1st asst., June, 1897.

MOIR, WILLIAM, M.A., M.B., Brigade Surgn., late Med. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Asst. surgn., Bengal med. establ., 20th Jan., 1860; from June, 1863, served in the N.W. Prov. as civil asst. surgn. and supt. of jail; supt. meteorological observatory, Meerut, June, 1868; offg. chemical examr., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, 1878-79; and again in 1888; retd., April, 1891.

MOIR, WILLIAM ROBERT GRAY, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Charterhouse and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after
exam. of 1887; arrived, 11th Nov., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.

MOLESWORTH, Sir Guildford Lindsay, K.C.I.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Educ. at the Coll. of Civil Engrs., Putney; in 1852 was chief asst. engr. on the London, Brighton, and South Coast Railway, which he left in order to superintend the construction of buildings and machinery at Woolwich, during the Crimean war; afterwards practised as a consulting engr. in London; engr. on the Ceylon railway, 1859, and chief engr., 1862; dir.-gen. of the railway, 1865; dir. of public works in 1867; consulting engr. for state railways to the govt. of India, April, 1871; acted as dir.-gen. of railways and dep. sec. to govt. of India, March-June, 1880; K.C.I.E., June, 1883; retd., 1889; fellow of the univ. of Calcutta; a British delegate to the Brussels monetary conference, 1892; is the author of many publs. on engrg., monetary, and other subjects, including a 'Pocket-book of Engrg. Formulae,' 'Iron Manufacture in India,' 'Text-book of Bimetallism,' 1886, &c., &c.

MOLLOY, Robert Alfred, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and employed on irrig. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., May, 1883.

MOLONY, Edmund Alexander, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Marlborough and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 16th Dec., 1886, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr. and asst. commr.; asst. settl. officer, Nov., 1893; joint mag., Nov., 1895; dep. commr., Dec., 1896.

MONAHAN, Francis John, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at the Oratory Sch., Birmingham, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 13th Dec., 1885, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., offg. under sec., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; transfd. to Assam as asst. commr., March, 1892; dep. commr., May, 1894; acting dir. of land records and agriculture, Oct., 1895.

MONDY, Edmund Felix, A.R.S.M., F.C.S., Bengal Educn. Dept.—Joined the service, 5th Nov., 1880, as prof'r, Sibpur civil engrg. coll.; profr. Rajshahi coll., Oct., 1877; and at Dacca coll., Nov., 1887.

MONEY, Alonzo, C.B., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1843; joint mag. and dep. collr., Barakganj, 1846; supt. of survey, Monghyr, 1850; mag. and collr., Behar, 1857, and afterwards of Shahabad, Tihurut, and Puri; controller of govt. salt-chowkies, 1869; commr., Bhagalpur, 1862; commr. of Patna, and member of legisl. council, 1866; member of rev. board, 1869; also district and sessions judge, Bareilly, 1875; retd., 1878.

MONEY, Robert Cotton, Major-Gen., I.S.C.—First commn., 20th March, 1855; from 1st March, 1861, served in Bengal, and was apptd. dep. commr., 2nd grade, April, 1877; manager of the Darbhanga Raj estate, 1876-78, and again, Jan., 1880; retd., March, 1886.

MONEY, William James, C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1853; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. supt. of survey, and was employed as civil officer with the troops in the Sonthal insurrection, 1855-56; private sec. to chief commr. of Oudh, Aug., 1857; served during the Mutiny (medal); employed subsequently in Bengal and N.W. Prov.; supt. of rev. survey, 1860; mag. and collr., and salt agent, Cuttack, 1861; district and sessions judge, Maimansingh, Sept., 1873; retd., 1879.

MONIES, Alfred, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at the Thomason Coll. Roorkee; apprentice engr., Oct., 1871; asst. engr., March, 1873; exec. engr., May, 1883.

MONK, Hugh Lewin, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apprentice engr., 1st Sept., 1865; asst. engr., April, 1866; transfd. to state railways, Dec., 1869; exec. engr., Sept., 1873; engr.-in-chief, Mu valley railway, April, 1891; suptg. engr., Jan., 1892; offg. manager, Burma state railway, March, 1895.

MONRO, Alexander, M.A., B.C.L., B.L., Educn. Dept., Central Prov.—Arrived, 2nd June, 1879, and served as inspr. of schools; fellow of Madras univ., 1885; inspr.-gen. of educn. Central Prov., Jan., 1889; in 1893-94 acted as dir. of public instrn., and member of legisl. council, Madras.

MONRO, James, C.B., late Bengal C.S.—Arrived, 27th Jan., 1858; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., offg. under sec. to govt., joint mag., dep. collr. of customs, Calcutta, and sec. to the board of rev.; mag. and collr., Feb., 1872; district and sessions judge, April, 1874; inspr.-gen. of police, Bengal, Jan., 1878; commr. of the presidency divn., March, 1883; retd., 1884, and was apptd. dir. of criminal investigations in Scotland Yard; in Nov., 1888, was apptd. chief commr. of metropolitan police, but resigned that office, June, 1890.

MONTAGU, John Montthermer, M.A., M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1876, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., Nov., 1888.

MONTEATH, George, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Clifton and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 4th Dec., 1896, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

MONTEATH, James, M.A., C.S.I., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Royal Acadl. Instn., and Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 5th Nov., 1870, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; under sec. to govt., rev., &c., dept., May, 1884; private sec. to the govt., Oct., 1886; junr. collr., Aug., 1891; senr. collr., May, 1894; sec. to govt., rev. and finl. depts., July, 1895; member of Bombay legisl. council, Dec., 1896; chief sec., rev. and finl. depts., March, 1897; C.S.I., June, 1897.

MONTGOMERY, James Alexander Lawrence, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 26th Feb., 1868; from Nov., 1870, served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and settl. officer; dir. of settl. and rev. records, Dec., 1885; dep. commr., May, 1887; wrote the Hoshiarpur settl. report.

MOORE, Edward James, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 23rd July, 1868; transfd. to state railways, Nov., 1869; exec. engr., April, 1874; services lent to Bengal-Nagpur railway co., Nov., 1887; to Gwalior durbar, Dec., 1890; and to Assam-Bengal railway co., Oct., 1892; suptg. engr., July, 1892; engr.-in-chief, Bezwada-Madras railway survey, March, 1895; chief engr., Aug., 1896.

MOORE, Ernest Andrew, Indian C.S.
MOORE, GEORGE MONTGOMERIE JOHN, C.I.E., Lieut.-Col., late R.A.—Mil. sec. on personal staff of the govr. of Madras (Sir M. E. Grant Duff), 1834-86; prest. of Madras municipal commn., Dec., 1886; retd., Jan., 1887; C.I.E., Jan., 1894.

MOORE, HARRY CHRISTOPHER, B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Bradfield Coll., Balliol Coll., Oxford; and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 24th Dec., 1895, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

MOORE, JOHN GEORGE, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1856; arrived, 6th Nov., 1856, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and in Sind as asst. commr., &c.; junr. collr. and mag., Oct., 1876; senr. collr. and mag., Sept., 1877; prest. of the jail commn., 1878; acting commr. of customs, &c., May, 1887; commr., central divn., July, 1888; temporary member of govr.'s council, March, 1890; retd., Nov., 1891.

MOORE, LEWIS, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Royal Sch., Armagh, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 7th Nov., 1869, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and sub-collr. and joint mag.; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1888; compiled 'Trichinopoly District Manual.'

MOORE, LEWIS GRENVILLE, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and Worcester Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 12th Dec., 1892, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

MOORE, ROSS ARTHUR LESLIE, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Dulwich, and Peterhouse, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 7th Nov., 1882, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 1st asst., Nov., 1893; administrator, Sachin state, May, 1895; resdy. mag. Bandea, Nov., 1895.

MORELAND, WILLIAM HARRISON, B.A., LL.B., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 11th Nov., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and acting under sec. to govt.; asst. settl. officer, Nov., 1893; asst. commr., April, 1894.

MORGAN, CHARLES, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—East India house writer, old establ., 22nd April, 1857; asst. to registrar, Oct., 1874; despatch clerk, Oct., 1892.

MORGAN, HENRY TILSON, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Bath Coll. and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 12th Dec., 1894, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

MORGAN, JOHN WILLIAM AKERMAN, Veterinary Capt., India Civil Veterinary Dept.—Joined the (home) service, 12th June, 1878; served in the Zulu and Afghan wars; supt., civil veterinary dept., Bombay, May, 1892.

MORGAN, SIR WALTER, late Madras High Court.—Called to the bar, Middle Temple, 18th Nov., 1844; clerk of legisl. council of India, 1854; master in equity of the supreme court, Calcutta, 1859; puisne judge of Calcutta high court, 1862; chief justice of the high court of the N.W. Prov., 1866; and of the high court of Madras from 1871 until his retirement in 1879.

MORIARTY, ARTHUR STEPHEN, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 8th Dec., 1880, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. judge; judge and sess. judge, Feb., 1896; offg. remembrancer of legal affairs, July, 1896.

MORIARTY, MATTHEW DENIS, M.D., B.A., F.R.C.S.I., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Indian Med. Service.—Entered the service Oct., 1872; offg. civ. surg., Sultanpore, March, 1881; confd. Oct., 1883; Meerut, April, 1891.

MORISON, WILLIAM THOMSON, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Fettes Coll., Edinburgh, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1881, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settl. officer; transfd. to Burma as asst. commr., 1887 (medal with clasp); dep. commr., May, 1889; re-transfd. as 2nd asst., Nov., 1891; administrator, Portbandar state, March, 1894; 1st asst., Aug., 1896; junr. collr., Mar., 1897.

MORLEY, GEORGE STREATFIELD, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1877, and posted to Bombay as asst. engr.; lent to Delhi municipality, Oct., 1879; transfd. to Punjab, Jan., 1882; exec. engr., March, 1886; transfd. to Hyderabad, May, 1894, and to Assam, Jan., 1896.

MORRIS, JOHN GEORGE, Major, I.S.C., late Berar Administration.—Joined the service, 28th Feb., 1874; acted as boundary settl. officer, Bhopal, 1880-82; cantonmt. mag., Saugor, March, 1883; asst. commr., April, 1887; dep. commr., Jan., 1893; retd., May, 1894.

MORRIS, SIR JOHN H., K.C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1847; arrived, 4th Jan., 1848; served in the Punjab as asst. rest., Lahore, asst. commr. and asst. settl. officer in the trans-Sutlej divn.; settl. officer, Multan, 1854; mag. and collr., Allahabad, May, 1862; settl. commr., Central Prov., Sept., 1863; jud. commr., Central Prov., June, 1868; chief commr., Central Prov., May, 1870; retd., 1883.

MORRIS, ROBERT, M.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at High Sch., Glasgow, Univ. of Glasgow, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 12th Jan., 1885, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., Jan., 1891; dep. acctnt.-gen., Madras, May, 1891; special asst., Vizagapatam, Nov., 1894.

MORRIS, THOMAS WALTER, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Manchester Gr. Sch. and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 17th Nov., 1892, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Mar., 1897.

MORRISON, FRANK, late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the telegraph dept., Sept., 1863; resigned, Feb., 1864; rejoined govt. service, and was employed in the accts. establ. (public works) in Bombay, Sind, the Punjab, and Calcutta; dep. comptr., Nov., 1874; from Dec., 1875, served as examr. of public works and railway accts. in various divns.; govt. examr. of accts., E. Indian railway, Nov., 1891; retd., Feb., 1897.

MORSE, AMYAS, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. 24th Sept., 1878, and posted as asst. engr. to state railways; exec. engr., March, 1893.

MORSE, FRANK HAMAN WALFORD, late India
Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., April, 1870, and posted to mil. works branch; employed in Madras on famine relief works, 1877–79; transfd. to state railways, Sept., 1881; exec. engr., May, 1883; in 1887–89 employed in Burma on provl. works; apptd. to E. Coast railway survey, Dec., 1889; and to open section of same line, March, 1894; retd., April, 1897.

MORSHEAD, LEONARD FREDERICK, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Winchester and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1889, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Oct., 1896.

MORTON, ANDREW, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., July, 1866; transfd. to mil. works dept., July, 1872; and to state railways, locomotive dept., June, 1878; district locomotive supt., N.W. railway, April, 1889; offg. dep. supt., Dec., 1890; offg. locomotive supt., E. Coast railway, Aug., 1893.

MORTON, BOYCE WILLIAM DUNLOP, Lieut.-Gen., I.S.C., late Bengal Commn.—First commn., 9th June, 1848; served in Assam from June, 1854, as junr. asst. and principal asst.; dep. commr., Goalpara, April, 1861; supt. of Darjiling, Dec., 1866; on special duty for conducting the prosecution of Captain Playfair, Aug., 1876; dep. commr., 1st grade, Nov., 1879; reverted to mil. dept., Aug., 1885.

MOSCARDI, EDWARD HENRY, M.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the Somersetshire Coll., Bath, and Worcester Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 7th Nov., 1876, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; asst. judge, Dec., 1881; judge and sessions judge, May, 1894.

MOSLEY, HERBERT, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Bishop's Stortford Coll. Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 12th Dec., 1863; from April, 1865, served in the rev. and jud. depts., Bengal, and was apptd. mag. and collr.; retd., Jan., 1891.

MOSS-KING, ROBERT CURZON HENRY, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Eton and Merton Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 13th Dec., 1894, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

MOULE, HORACE FREDERICK D'OYLY, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 14th Nov., 1863; served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and dep. supt. of family domains of Maharaja of Benares; joint mag. and dep. collr., May, 1877; mag. and collr., Dec., 1884; sec., board of rev., 1886; commr., Nov., 1891.

MOUNSEY, CHARLES HERBERT, B.L., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1878, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. sessions judge; head asst., Anantapur, May, 1886; sub-collr. and joint mag., June, 1890; collr. and mag., Dec., 1894; compiled and edited the 'Reports of the Meriah Agents (Ganjam),' and wrote a 'History of the Ganjam Mahias.'

MOUNTFORD, LEWIS JAMES, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., and Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 20th Nov., 1892, and served in Sind as asst. collr. and mag.

MOWAT, M., M.A., late Educn. Dept., Ben-

gal.—Profr., presidency coll., June, 1876; Dacca coll., Jan., 1878; Patna coll., Feb., 1880; retd., 1891.

MOYLE, GEORGE, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1875, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., Jan., 1885; services lent to Bengal-Nagpur railway co., Oct., 1887.

MUHAMMAD ABBAS, Mirza, late Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Probr. under native civil service rules, 16th Feb., 1880; confd., March, 1882, and served in Oudh as asst. commr.; joint mag., Oct., 1888; resigned, Feb., 1894.

MUHAMMAD AFZAL KHAN, Nawab, Khan Bahadur, Statutory C.S. (Punjab).—Probr. under native civil service rules, 3rd March, 1881; asst. commr., Oct., 1885; British agent at Kabul, June, 1891, to March, 1894; dep. commr., Nov., 1895.

MUHAMMAD ALI, SAIVID, B.A., Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. proby. asst. mag. and collr., under the statutory rules, 4th April, 1887; confd., 17th April, 1889, and served as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; asst. commr., Dec. 1896.

MUHAMMAD ASLAM KHAN, Kazi, C.M.G., Punjab Commn.—Offg. extra asst. commr., 10th Sept., 1881; probr. under native civil service rules, Nov., 1882; asst. commr., Nov., 1884; on special duty with Afghan boundary commn., 1884–86; C.M.G., Feb., 1887; apptd. Mir Munshi to Punjab govt., May, 1887; native attaché to foreign office, April, 1888; asst. commr., March, 1889; dep. commr. March, 1895; district judge, Nov. 1896.

MUHAMMAD HADI, SAIVID, Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. proby. asst. mag. and collr., 5th April, 1890; ass't dir. of land records and agric., Dec., 1891; also supt. of inland emigration, Sept., 1893.

MUHAMMAD HYAT KHAN, Khan, C.S.I., Punjab Commn.—Joined the service, 16th April, 1883; extra asst. commr., Punjab, March, 1862; asst. commr., Jan., 1872; C.S.I., May, 1872; offg. pol. asst. with the Kuram field force, 1878; pol. officer with the staff of Sir F. Roberts, Kabul field force, 1879–80; district judge, Dec., 1886; divl. judge, March, 1890; member of council, Kashmir, 1892–94.

MUHAMMAD ISHAK KHAN, Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. a probr. under native civil service rules, Jan., 1884; confd., Aug., 1886; asst. mag. and collr., April, 1888; asst. commr., Nov., 1889; joint mag., May, 1890; district and sess. judge, Feb. 1897.

MUHAMMAD RAFIQ, B.L., Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service, 1st Sept., 1892, as small cause court judge, Lucknow; addl. civil judge there, Jan., 1894.

MUHAMMAD RAZA KHAN, Statutory C.S. (Madras).—Served from 14th Jan., 1874, in the Madras rev. and educ. depts., and in Haiderabad as attaché to the rest.; apptd. a member of the civil service, 3rd Nov., 1882; asst. collr. and mag., Feb., 1883; head asst., Feb., 1890; sub. collr. and joint mag., July, 1895.

MUHAMMAD SAMI-ULLA KHAN, Maulvi, C.M.G., late Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov.—Joined the service as sub-judge, 1st May, 1873; district judge, May, 1887; retd., Nov., 1892.

MUHAMMAD YASIN KHAN, Berar Administration.—Joined the service, 3rd May,
1876, as attaché to the rest., Haidarabad; asst. commr., Berar, Sept., 1881; special asst. commr., May, 1894; services lent to Haidarabad state from July, 1891.

MUIR, ARCHIBALD MUNGO, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 30th Sept., 1868; served in the Afghan war, 1878-80 (medal and clasp); private sec. and A.D.C. to lieut.-govr. of N.W. Prov., Aug., 1878; served in 1878 as asst. agent to the gov'r-gen. in Rajputana, pol. officer at Kandahar, and as asst. gen. supt. for thagi and dakaiti; asst. boundary settlt. officer, Central India, Nov., 1883; and in Rajputana, Nov., 1885; cantonmt. mag. at Nasirabad, April, 1886, and afterwards at Haidarabad; 2nd asst. and asst. sec. for Berar, Jan., 1889; pol. agent, S.E. Baluchistan, July, 1890; pol. agent, Bhopawar, April, 1892; pol. officer in charge of ex-Amir of Kabul, March, 1893.

MUIR, JOHN FAIRLIE, late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Edinburgh Acad., and Rugby Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 10th Oct., 1867, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; 1st asst., May, 1880; junr. collr. and mag., Belgaum, April, 1887; senr. collr., June, 1890; collr. and mag., Dharwar, and pol. agent, Savanur, Aug., 1893; retd., May, 1896.

MUIR, JULIUS WOOD, M.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Dumfries Acad., and Edinburgh Univ.; called to the bar at the Middle Temple; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 1st Nov., 1871, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; asst. commr., in Oudh, Sept., 1885; district and sessions judge, Nov., 1889.

MUIR, SIR WILLIAM, K.C.S.I., D.C.L., LL.D., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Kilmarnock Gr. Sch., and Edinburgh and Glasgow Univs.; apptd. from Haileybury, 1837; arrived, 16th Dec., 1837; settlt. officer in Cawnpore and Bundelkund, 1840-43; offg. collr., Fatehpur, 1844-45; sec. sadar board of rev., 1847; sec. to govt. of N.W. Prov., 1852; member, board of rev., 1856; in charge of intelligence dept. at Agra during Mutiny, 1857; sec. with Lord Canning at Allahabad for N.W. Prov., 1858; reverted to board of rev., 1859; member of legisl. council of govr.-gen., 1864; foreign sec., govt. of India, 1865; lieut.-govr., N.W. Prov., 1868-74; finl. member of govr.-gen.'s council, 1874-76; member of council of sec. of state, 1876-85; principal, Edinburgh univ., 1885; hon. D.C.L. of Oxford, and LL.D. of Glasgow and Edinburgh; author of 'Life of Mahomet and History of Islam to the Era of the Hegira,' 1853; 'Annals of the Early Caliphate,' 1883; and other works on the same subject; of a pamphlet on indigenous educn. in Fatehpur, 1845; and of papers on rev. settlt. in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh, &c.

MUIR, WILLIAM JAMES WEMYSS, Col., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Lieut., Bengal artillery, Dec., 1858; asst. agent to govr.-gen., Rajputana, Sept., 1865; asst. gen. supt., thagi and dakaiti, June, 1864; pol. supt., Sirohi, Sept., 1865; pol. agent, Murshidabad, 1876; cantonmt. mag., Nimach, 1879; Haraoti and Tonk, 1880; Ajmir-Merwara, May, 1889; offg. pol. agent, Alwar, Aug., 1889; retd., June, 1892.

MUIR-MACKENZIE, JOHN WILLIAM PITT, M.R.A.C., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Eton; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 28th Nov., 1876, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., asst. pol. agent in charge of Jath state, and forest settlt. officer; on famine duty in 1876 and 1877; 2nd asst., Nov., 1887; acting dir. of land records and agric., Feb., 1888; under sec. to govt. of India in rev. and agric. dept., March, 1889, to April, 1893; on special duty to Réunion, April, 1893; 1st asst. collr. and mag., Aug., 1893; junr. collr. and collr. of salt rev., Feb., 1895; junr. collr. and mag., March, 1896; offg. sec. to govt. rev. and fin. dept., July, 1896; senr. collr. and mag., May, 1897.

MUKERJEE, SATIS CHANDRA, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. in India and at Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 16th Dec., 1892, and served in Bengal as asst. mag.and collr.

MULES, HORACE CHARLES, Sind Rev. Commn.—Educ. at Wellington Coll.; joined the service, 18th May, 1876, as supy. dep. collr.; asst. collr. and mag., April, 1883; head asst. collr., Feb., 1894; dep. commr., Nov., 1895.

MULLALY, CHARLES MYLNE, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Southampton Gr. Sch., Hartley Instn., Southampton, and London Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 3rd Nov., 1879, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., Nov., 1887; sub-collr. and joint mag., Jan., 1892; collr. and mag., April, 1895.

MULLALY, JOSEPH JOHN, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1874, and employed on irrig. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., Oct., 1882.

MULLEN, DOUGLAS FFRENCH, M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Foreign Dept., Govt.of India.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1877; arrived, 25th Oct., 1877, and served from April, 1878, under the foreign dept. in med. charge of the Mewar Bhil corps, and offg. residency surgn., Mewar; confd. in latter appt., Nov., 1886; civil surgn., Ajmir, and med. officer of Merwara battalion, March, 1893.

MULLINS, JOHN, Lieut.-Gen., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Madras.—2nd lieut., Madras engrs., 8th Dec., 1848; arrived, 28th Oct., 1850, and served in Madras as asst.civil engr., and district engr.; consulting engr. for the irrign. and canal co., Madras, 1864-69; under sec. to govt., public works dept., Feb., 1869; chief engr. for irrign. and joint sec., Nov., 1870; prest., irrign. committee, famine commn., 1877-79; on special duty for drawing up the Bangalore water supply scheme, Oct., 1883; reverted to mil. dept. 1884; retd., 1886; author of 'Madras Irrign. Manual.'

MULOCK, FRANCIS BERRY, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Portora Royal Sch., Enniskillen, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 2nd Nov., 1871, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; on special duty for imperial assemblage at Delhi, 1876; asst. commr., April, 1886; joint mag., Ballia, April, 1887; dep. commr., Lucknow, Oct., 1889; mag. and collr., Feb., 1890; commr., Fyzabad, Dec., 1896.

MULOCK, HENRY PILKINGTON, late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Kingstown Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 1st Nov., 1865, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; on famine relief duty, 1873-74;
joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1878; district and sessions judge, Aug., 1886; retd., Nov. 1895.

MULOCK, WILLIAM BURY, late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 28th Nov., 1862, and served in Bombay as asst. registrar of the high court, and asst. collr. and mag.; from April, 1873, to Nov., 1876, served as asst. commr. and branch inspr.-gen. of assurances in Sind, also as inspr. of educn.; junr. collr. and mag., Jan., 1880; senr. collr. and mag., March, 1885; acting commr., N. divn., Sept., 1888; retd., Nov., 1889.

MUMFORD, CHARLES ALLAN, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Oundle Sch., and Peterhouse, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 8th Dec., 1896, and served in the N.W.P. and Oudh as asst. commr.

MUNRO, JAMES HUME, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Newcastle-on-Tyne Gr. Sch., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 21st Nov., 1886, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., March, 1893.

MURDOCH, DAVID DOIG, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Univ. of Aberdeen, and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 7th Dec., 1882, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., April, 1890; dep. commr. of salt, &c., rev. (S. divn.), and sec. to the commr., July, 1894; sub-collr. and joint mag., Oct., 1896.

MURPHY, MATTHEW JOSEPH, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., Blackrock, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1839; arrived, 21st Dec., 1891, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

MURRAY, ALAN, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Oudh Commn.—Arrived, 4th Feb., 1857, and served during the Mutiny (medal and two clasps); served in the Oudh police dept. as asst. supt. in 1866-67, and subsequently as asst. commr., and asst. settl. officer; junr. sec. to chief commr., 1874-78; attache in foreign office, 1876-77; district judge, April, 1886; dep. commr., Kheri, April, 1886; retd., March, 1887.

MURRAY, FREDERICK CHARLES, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Calcutta Civil Enggrg. Coll.; apptd., 24th May, 1872, and employed in the Punjab in mil. works branch; transfd. to that prov., Nov., 1879; exec. engr., Oct., 1881.

MURRAY, JOHN, M.A., M.D., Inspr.-Gen. of Hosps. late Bengal Med. Service.—Educ. at Peterhead, and Marischal Coll. and Univ., Aberdeen; asst. surgn., Indian med. service, 1832; field surgn. at the battle of Aliwal, 1846; surgn., 1848; dep. inspr.-gen. of hosps., 1858; inspr.-gen. of hosps., 1865; retd., Jan., 1871; has written various papers on cholera and its treatment.

MURRAY, ROBERT DAVIDSON, M.B., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—First commn. 31st March, 1875; served as civil surgn. at various stations, from April, 1876; 1st rest. surgn., Calcutta Gen. Hosp., March, 1886; civil surgn., Howrah, Dec., 1895.

MYLNE, RIGHT REV. LOUIS GEORGE, M.A., D.D., Eccles. Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 4th July, 1876; installed as Bishop of Bombay, 6th July, 1876.

NAFAR CHANDRA BHATTA, B.L., Beng. gal Jud. Dept.—Joined the service, 26th July, 1865, as munsif; subord. judge, Oct., 1877; small cause court judge, July, 1887; subord. judge, 1st grade, Oct., 1893; has edited the Indian evidence act.

NAIRNE, SIR CHARLES EDWARD, K.C.B., Lieut.-Gen., R.A.—First commn., 7th Dec., 1855; served in the Mutiny, 1857 (medal), Yusufzai expdn., 1863, Afghan war, 1878-79 (medal), and Egyptian expdn., 1882 (medal and star, C.B., and 3rd class Medjidie); commandant and supt., sch. of gunnery, Shoeburness, 1885-87; inspr.-gen. of artillery in India, 1887-92; major-gen., Bengal, 1892-93; commander-in-chief, Bombay, and second in council, Sept., 1893, to the abolition of that post, April, 1895; lieut.-gen. commanding the forces in Bombay, April 1895; K.C.B., June, 1897.

NANDA KRISHNA BOSE, M.A., Statutory C.S. (Bengal).—Employed in the educn. dept. from Aug., 1878; apptd. asst. mag. and collr. on probn., Jan., 1880; confd., Sept., 1881; joint mag. and dep. collr., June, 1890; mag. and collr., Aug., 1894.

NANNEY, LEWIS CHARLES, L.F.P.S., L.S.A., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Madras Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., 31st March, 1886; served under the mil. dept., also acting as civil surgn. at various stations, and as supt. of jail; supt., lunatic asylum, Madras, Oct., 1875; also profr. med. coll., July, 1876; med. officer, Coonor and Kotagiri, 1879-81, and at Utakamand, 1881-83; special sanitary officer, Utakamand, Aug., 1881; civil surgn., Cannanore, July, 1883; Trichinopoli, June, 1884; and Karnul, May, 1890; retd., May, 1892.

NAPIER AND ETTRICK (BARON), RIGHT HON. FRANCIS NAPIER, K.T.—Attaché to the embassy at Vienna in 1840, and afterwards at Constantinople; served as sec. of legation at Naples and St. Petersburg, and was apptd. sec. of embassy at Constantinople in 1854; British minister at Washington, 1857, whence he was transfd. to The Hague, 1858, to St. Petersburg in 1860, and to Berlin in 1864; gov'r. of Madras, March, 1866, till Feb., 1872; on the assassination of Lord Mayo, acted temporarily as viceroy; was pres't. of the Social Science Association at Plymouth in 1872; and presided over the educn. section of the Association as Glasgow, in Oct., 1874; a royal commr. on the Highland Crofters question, March, 1883.

NAPIER, ALAN BERTRAM, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Rossall Sch., and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 24th Sept., 1889, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; registrar of the jud. commn.'s court, 1890-91; under sec. to chief commr., April to July, 1892; settlt. officer, Sept., 1894; dep. commr., April, 1897.

NAPIER, HON. GEORGE CAMPBELL, C.I.E., Lieut.-Col., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 14th Dec., 1861; from July, 1867, served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; on special duty in Persia, 1874; and at Kandahar, 1881; private sec. and A.D.C. to lieut.-gov'r. of N.W. Prov., April, 1882, to Sept., 1883; jud. asst., Feb., 1883; dep. commr., Nov., 1884; supt., Kapurthala state, April, 1885; retd., April, 1887.

NARAIN DAS, Rai Bahadur, late Oudh Jud. Dept.—Served in the postal dept. from June, 1855; temporary extra asst. commr., March, 1867; sub-judge, Oct., 1881; judge of the
small cause court, June, 1882; retd., Sept., 1892.

NARENDRA NATH, Diwan, M.A., Punjab Commn.—Apptd. probr. under native civil service rules, 3rd Feb., 1888; asst. commr., Feb., 1890; has translid. Mill's 'Liberty' into Urdu.

NARSINGRAO BHOLANATH DIVATIA, B.A., Statutory C.S. (Bombay).—Apptd. probr. under the native civil service rules, Jan., 1844; confd. as asst. collr. and mag., Feb., 1886; 1st asst., May, 1895.

NARUL HUDA, SVED, B.A., LL.B., B.L., Statutory C.S. (Bengal).—Joined the service, 4th Aug., 1886; asst. mag. and collr., Jan., 1887; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1893.

NATHAN, ROBERT, B.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at St. Peter's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 20th Dec., 1888, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and on settl. work in Orissa; joint mag. and dep. collr., Nov., 1894; offf. under sec. to govt. of India, fin. and commerce dept., March, 1895; special plague duty, April, 1897; under sec., home dept., 1897.

NAYLOR, JAMES RICHARD, C.S.I., late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 28th Oct., 1862, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. judge; remembrancer of legal affairs, July, 1876; acting chief sec. to govt., jud. &c. depts., 1879-80, and 1887; member of legislat. council, Bombay, Aug., 1884; temporary member of council, Bombay, in 1887 and 1888; C.S.I., May, 1890; retd., June, 1892; legal adviser to the Gaekwar of Baroda, Oct., 1892.

NEALE, WALTER ERSKINE, B.A., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch. and St. John's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 10th Oct., 1862, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr. and settl. officer; district and sessions judge, Nov., 1881; mag. and collr., Dec., 1881; commr. in Oudh, Feb., 1890; commr. Agra, Nov., 1893; acted as member of rev. board in 1894, and from Jan., 1895; commr., Meerut, May, 1896; retd., April, 1897.

NEATHAM, ALBERT HENRY JOHN, India Audit Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 22nd Feb., 1879.

NEDHAM, WILLIAM ALFRED, Central Prov. Commn.—Joined the service as asst. commr., 12th July, 1864; served as asst. district supt. and district supt. of police, supt. of sch. of industry, and in 1874 in Bengal on famine duty; in 1882 was dep. supt. of census; judge of small cause court, Jabalpur, Sept., 1883; dep. commr., Dec., 1883; acting commr., April, 1897.

NEEL, EDMUND, C.I.E., Public Works Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Victoria Coll., Jersey; India office writer, old establ., 3rd March, 1859; jun. clerk, mil. dept., 1860; asst. précis writer to the sec. of state, 1868-71; mil. dept., 1871; senr. clerk, Jan., 1872; funds dept., 1874; asst. sec. in the mil. dept., Aug., 1881; asst. sec. in the pol. and secret dept., 1885; offf. as sec., Jan. to May, 1887, Sept., 1889 to May, 1890, and June, 1890 to Jan., 1891; C.I.E., May, 1890; sec., public works dept., Aug., 1897.

NEILL, JOHN WILLIAM, late Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at King's Coll., London, and Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 25th Nov., 1864, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., registrar, jud. commr.'s court, and asst. sec. to chief commr.; sec., March, 1877; commr., June, 1880; fellow of the univ. of Calcutta, 1883; offf. as chief commr., Feb., 1887; and Nov., 1890; judicial commr., Jan., 1891; prest. of the commn. on the working of the Deccan agriculturists relief act, Dec., 1891; retd., April, 1894; apptd. lecturer on Indian law, Univ. Coll., London, July, 1895.

NEILL, LINDSAY, late Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at foreign schs., King's Coll., London, and Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 31st Oct., 1867, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; under sec. to govt. of India, home dept., April, 1877; inspr.-gen. of registrn., supt. of stamps, and commr. of excise, Central Prov., Dec., 1877; dep. commr., June, 1880; addl. commr., Jan., 1883; sec. to the chief commr., March, 1883; commr., April, 1890; retd., Oct., 1894.

NELSON, JAMES HENRY, M.A., B.L., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1860, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., acting registrar of the high court, and small cause court judge; from June, 1872, served as civil and sessions judge; retd., Nov., 1887; prepared the Madura district manual.

NELSON, REGINALD ARBOUIN, B.A., LL.B., B.L., Madras Educl. Dept.—Educ. at Clare Coll., Cambridge; called to the bar (Inner Temple), July, 1886; joined the service, 2nd May, 1891, as principal, law coll., Madras; also acting law reporter, April, 1894.

NESFIELD, JOHN COLLINSON, M.A., late Educn. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Educ. at Merton Coll., Oxford; from 22nd Jan., 1867, served in Bengal as profr., Krishnagar coll., and at the presidency coll.; from May, 1872, served in Lower Burma as dir. of public instrn., and inspr. of schs.; transf'd. to Oudh, March, 1874, as dir. of public instrn.; principal, Benares coll., May, 1878; inspr. of schs., Nov., 1879; fellow of the Allahabad univ., 1887; dir. of public instrn., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Aug., 1892; retd., Oct., 1894; author of 'An Essay on the Kanjar Tribe,' 1882; 'On the Results of Primary Educn. in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh,' 1883, and 'On the Tharu and Bagsha Tribes,' 1884; 'Brief View of the Caste System of the N.W. Prov. and Oudh,' 1885; 'Two Essays on the Mushera Tribe,' 1888, &c., &c.

NEWBERY, HENRY JAMES, B.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861; served in the Bengal rev. and jud. dept., and was apptd. mag. and collr., 1st grade, Dec., 1883; retd., April, 1887.

NEWBOULD, BABINGTON BENNETT, B.A., Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Bedford Sch. and Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 28th Nov., 1888, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transf'd. to Assam as asst. commr., April, 1894; dep. commr., Oct., 1895.

NEWCOMBE, ALFRED CORNELIUS, B.A., A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and employed on irrig. works in the Punjab and the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; served in the superior accts. establ., 1878-81 and 1886-90, and in Assam, 1881-86; services lent to Nizam's govt., 1891-95.

NEWILL, JOSEPH HENRY, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn.,
4th July, 1865; arrived, 25th Dec., 1865; served under the foreign dept. in the thagi and dakaiti branch, from May, 1872; cantonmt. mag., Jan., 1882; and asst. to rest. at Haidarabad, March, 1884; from March, 1887, served as pol. agent at Bhopawar, and afterwards in S.E. Baluchistan; pol. officer in charge of Sardar Ayub Khan, Nov., 1889; acting pol. agent, Jhalawar, Nov., 1892; cantonmt. mag., Nasirabad, Feb., 1895; offg. rest., W. states of Rajputana, March, 1895.

NEWMAN, JOHN HENRY, M.D., Surgn.-Col., Bengal Med. Establt.—First commn., 1867; served in the Abyssinian war, 1868, and Afghan war, 1878-79; civil surgn., Ajmir, April, 1879; offd. as agency surgn., &c., in Rajputana in 1884 and 1889; residency surgn. and chiefmed. officer in Rajputana, Aug., 1892; offg. inspr.-gen. of civil hosps., Bengal, July-Nov., 1893; administrative med. officer and sanitary commr., Central Prov., March, 1895; inspr.-gen. of civil hosps., Bengal, Nov., 1897.

NEWMARCH, FRANCIS WELLES, B.A., Mil. Dept., India Office.—Matriculated at Balliol Coll., Oxford, Jan., 1873; scholar of Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford, 1873-78; junr. clerk, mil. dept., India office, 18th May, 1877; senr. clerk, March, 1892; rest. clerk, 1885-94; sec. to Lord Onslow's departmental commn., 1896-97; compiled, jointly with Mr. Herbert, the India office cypher code.

NEWMARCH, LINDSAY SHERWOOD, Capt., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Educ. at Haileybury and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; first commn., 13th Aug., 1879; from Feb., 1885, served as asst. agent at Indore, Ajmir, and Quetta; asst. rest., Mysore, Oct., 1889; first asst. to agent, Rajputana, Oct., 1892; and in same capacity, Central India, Aug., 1893; pol. agent, Bhopal.

NEWMARCH, SIR OLIVER RICHARDSON, K.C.S.I., Major-Gen., late I.S.C.—Ensign, Bengal infantry, March, 1855; admitted to the Bengal staff corps, Feb., 1861; 3rd asst. sec. to govt. of India, mil. dept., 1871; dep. acctnt.-gen., mil. dept., 1875; acctnt.-gen. and ex-officio dep. sec. to the govt. of India, April, 1878; sec. to govt. of India, mil. dept., July, 1886; retd., Nov., 1887; C.S.I., Jan., 1888; sec., mil. dept., India office, May, 1889; K.C.S.I., May, 1894.

NEWNHAM-SMITH, EDWARD DEEDES, B.L., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Bombay Jud. Dept.—First commn., 27th Feb., 1869; served through the Afghan war, 1878-80 (medal and clasp); cantonmt. mag., Disa, Oct., 1887; and at Poona and Kirkee, Oct., 1888.

NEWTON, HENRY, late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Shrewsbury Sch., and Haileybury Coll., from which he was apptd. in 1844; served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. judge; jud. asst. to commr., Satara, 1854; joint judge and sessions judge, 1858; registrar, court of sadar diwani, Nov., 1859; acting puisne judge of the sadar court, Jan., 1860; judge of the high court, Bombay, 1863; acted as chief justice, Bombay, 1868; retd. in 1871.

NEWTON, JOHN, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 9th Oct., 1879.

NEWTON, WILLIAM GYLLICH, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1876, and employed on state railways and in the Central Prov.; on famine duty in Madras, 1877; exec. engr., Jan., 1885; transfd. to Burma, Aug., 1887.

NICHOLETTTS, HENRY SAMUEL, late Haidarabad Administration.—Arrived, 20th Jan., 1883, and served in the telegraph and police depts.; district supt. of police, Berar, 1868; asst. commr., May, 1872; judge, small cause court, Sept., 1882; dep. commr., Nov., 1888; retd., April, 1896.

NICHOLL, BERNARD VINCENT, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Beaumont Coll., Windsor, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 9th Nov., 1889, and served in Assam as asst. commr.

NICHOLLS, GEORGE JASPER, LL.B., B.L., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Exeter Gr. Sch., and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; called to the bar at Lincoln's Inn; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 29th Nov., 1864, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr. and in various acting appts.; transfd. temporarily to Bengal on famine duty, 1874-75; small cause court judge, Jalapur, Sept., 1880; dep. commr., March, 1883; from July, 1883, served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as manager of the Awa state, and district and sessions judge; retd., June, 1895; author of 'The Law of the Central Prov.,' 'Digest of the Circulars and Standing Orders of the Chief Commissioner, Central Prov., 1862-80,' 'An Economic Gazetteer of the Central Prov.,' &c.

NICHOLSON, FREDERICK AUGUSTUS, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Royal Med. Coll., Epsom, and Lincoln Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 4th Dec., 1869, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., acting sub-sec. and sec., board of rev., and principal asst.; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1889; collr. and mag., Oct., 1889; member of viceroy's legis. council, Oct., 1897; compiled district manual of Coimbatore.

NICHOLSON, WILLIAM GUSTAVUS, C.B., Brigadier-Gen., R.E.—First commn., March, 1865; arrived, Dec., 1871; joined the public works dept., Feb., 1872, and served as asst. engr., Haidarabad, and in the Punjab irrig. branch; transfd. to mil. works branch, 1873; exec. engr., March, 1876; served in the Afghan war, 1878-80 (medal and 3 clasps, bronze star); sec. to defence committee, April, 1882; served in Egyptian expdn., 1882 (medal and clasp, bronze star, 4th class Osmanieh); ex-officio asst. adjutant-gen., 1885; suptg. engr., March, 1886; served in Burma expdn., 1886-87; mil. sec. to commander-in-chief, July, 1890, to April, 1893, when he reverted to the mil. works dept.; chief engr., April, 1894; dep. adjutant-gen., Punjab, April, 1895.

NICOLLS, JOHN RICHARD CLINTON, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. 23rd Sept., 1873, as asst. engr., irrigation branch; exec. engr., April, 1892.

NIGHTINGALE, WALTER HAWKINS, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 23rd July, 1868, and posted to Bengal; exec. engr., March, 1873; divl. supt., district works, 1882 and 1887; inspr. of local works in various divns., 1887-91; suptg. engr., March, 1892; sec. to chief commr. of Assam, public works dept., June, 1895.

NISBET, ROBERT PARRY, C.I.E., B.L., Col., I.S.C., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 20th Nov., 1859; from Aug., 1862, served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and asst. settlt. officer; jud. asst., July, 1876; dep. commr., April, 1877; commr., Rawal Pindi, Nov., 1886; rest. in Kashmir, Nov.,
1888; retd., May, 1892; author of Gujranwala settlt. report.

NOBLE, CHARLES SIMEON, Col., I.S.C., late Oudh Commn.—Arrived, as ensign, Bengal native infantry, 14th Nov., 1858; from April, 1862, served in the police dept., Oudh, as asst. district supt., and district supt.; and from June, 1866, in the commn. as asst. commr., and dep. commr.; retd., Nov., 1890.

NOBLE, GEORGE JACKSON, Police Dept., Central Prov.—Joined the dept., 15th Dec., 1868; asst. to cotton commr., Sept., 1869; district supt. of police, April, 1874; supt. of police, B.B. and C.I. Railway March, 1897.

NOLAN, PHILIP, Indian C.S.(Bengal).—Educ. at Stonyhurst Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 4th Dec., 1867, and served in Bengal; joint mag., Feb., 1880; mag. and collr., July, 1882; offg. sec. board of rev., March, 1883; sec. gov't. of Bengal, gen., rev., and statistical dept., March, 1887; commr., Rajshahi divn., Dec., 1891.

NORFOR, CECIL HENRY THOMAS, Madras Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 30th Aug., 1870; exec. engr., May, 1883.

NORMAN, SIR HENRY WYLIE, G.C.B., G.C.M.G., C.I.E., Gen., I.S.C.—Ensign in Bengal army, March, 1844; served throughout the Punjab campaign in 1848-49; brigade-major and asst. adjutant-gen. in various expeds. on the Peshawar frontier in the years 1850-54; commanded a detachment in the Sonthal campaign, 1855; served throughout the Mutiny, 1857-58, as asst. or dep. adjutant-gen., and the greater part of the time as adjutant-gen. to the army in the field; also in the campaigns in Rohilkhand and in Oudh, in 1858-59, including several actions; in 1860 was apptd. asst. mil. sec. at the horse guards; sec. to gov't. of India, mil. dept., 1862-70; member of the council of the gov't.-gen. of India, June, 1870, to March, 1877; member of the council of the sec. of state for India, Feb., 1878, to Nov., 1883, when he was apptd. gov't. of Jamaica; gov't. of Queensland, 1888-95.

NORMAN, MATTHEW JAMES JOSEPH PATRICK, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 17th Oct., 1871, and posted to state railways; transfd. to Bengal irrign., June, 1873; exec. engr., May, 1883.

NORMAN, Thomas, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Royal Sch., Enniskillen, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 21st Jan., 1863; served in Bengal, and was apptd. mag. and collr., 1st grade, Oct., 1886; retd., Dec., 1887.

NORRIS, JOHN FREEMAN, Q.C., B.L., late Calcutta High Court.—Called to the bar (Inner Temple), 17th Nov., 1865; Q.C., Jan., 1882; judge of the high court, Calcutta, 17th June, 1882; retd., Nov., 1895.

NORTHBROOK (EARL OF), RIGHT HON. THOMAS GEORGE BARING, P.C., G.C.S.I., D.C.L.—Born 1826; educ. at Christ Church, Oxford, where he graduated in 1845; was successively private sec. to Mr. Labouchere at the board of trade, to Sir Charles Wood at the India board, and at the admiralty till 1857; M.P. for Penryn and Falmouth, 1857-66; a lord of the admiralty, 1857-58; under sec. of state for India, June, 1859, to Jan., 1861; under sec. for war, Jan., 1861; again under sec. for India, July, 1861, to April, 1864; under sec. for home affairs, 1864-66; sec. to the admiralty, 1866; succeeded as 2nd baron in the same year; again under sec. for war, 1868-72; viceroy and gov'r.-gen. of India, Feb., 1872, to Feb., 1876; G.C.S.I., May, 1872; created Viscount Baring, and Earl of Northbrook, 1876; first lord of the admiralty, 1880-85; high commr. on a special mission to Egypt, 1884; a royal commr. for the London exhibn. of 1886.

NORTHCOTT, JOHN PERCY CYRIL SALT-MARSH, Political Dept, India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., 17th Dec., 1894; transfd. to pol. dept., Nov., 1897.

NORTON, DAVID, C.S.I., Indian C.S.(Burma).—Educ. at Kingstown Sch., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 24th Nov., 1874, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; transfd. for service in Burma as dep. commr., Jan., 1887; prest. of the Rangoon municipality, May, 1890; commr., April, 1891; C.S.I., Jan., 1898.

NUGENT, JOHN, C.S.I., Indian C.S.(Bombay).—Educ. at the Royal Instn. Sch., Liverpool, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 29th Nov., 1864, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; under sec. to gov't. in the jud., &c., depts., Feb., 1875; municipal commr., Bombay, Feb., 1881; sec. to gov't. in rev., finl., and gen. depts., Dec., 1882; prest. of the central committee for vernacular deptl. exams.; chief sec. to gov't., Aug., 1887; addl. member of viceroy's council, Jan.-March, 1897, and again, Dec., 1897, to March, 1892; commr., Belgaum, May, 1891; offg. chief sec. to gov't., Nov., 1894; member of council, July, 1896; C.S.I., Jan., 1897.

NUGENT, JOHN, Indian C.S.(N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Stonyhurst Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 6th Nov., 1872, and served in Bengal, and the N.W. Prov. and Oudh, as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; senr. asst. commr., Kumaon, Jan., 1887; supt., Dehra Dun, May, 1888; dep. commr., July, 1891; mag. and collr., July, 1893.

NURAL HUDA, SYUD., B.A., LL.B., Statutory Civilian (Bengal).—Joined the service 4th August, 1886, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1893.

OAKDEN, RALPH, B.A., Indian C.S.(N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Cranbrook Gr. Sch., and at Hertford Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 16th Dec., 1895; and served in N.W.P. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

OATES, EUGENE WILLIAM, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 26th July, 1867, and posted to Burma; exec. engr., Feb., 1877; suptg. engr., Dec., 1891.

OBBERD, ROBERT, B.A., Indian C.S.(Berar).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 27th Dec., 1873, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; on famine duty in Madras, 1877-78; special asst. commr., Berar, March, 1887; dep. commr., July, 1890; civil and sessions judge, April, 1891; jud. commr., Oct., 1895.

O'BRIEN, BARTHOLOMEW, M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Med. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Apptd. asst. surgn., Bengal med. establ., 1st Oct., 1872; joined the dept. as actg. civil surg. and jail supt., Sept., 1873; confd., Oct., 1875.

O'BRIEN, DONATUS, Lieut.-Co., late R.E., Store Dept., India Office.—First commn., 17th Dec., 1862; asst. inspr. of works, Woolwich
arsenal, 1875-80; dep. dir. of public works, Jamaica, 1880-86; asst. inspr. of building works, Woolwich arsenal, 1886-89; supt. of the India store depot, Lambeth, March, 1889.

O'BRIEN, JOSEPH, M.D., Brigade Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—Joined the service, 1st April, 1870, and was in mil. employ until May, 1881; from that date served as civil surgn. and offg. profrr., Calcutta med. coll.; apptd. profr. at the coll., and surgn. at the coll. hosp., April, 1892.

O'BRIEN, PETER HENRY, Indian C.S.(Assam).—Educ. at Malvern Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 6th Nov., 1882, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Aug., 1891; transfd. to Assam as dep. commr., Jan., 1892.

O'CALLAGHAN, FRANCIS LANGFORD, C.S.I., C.I.E., M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., June, 1862, as asst. engr., Central Prov.; exec. engr., April, 1866; transfd. to the railway branch, 1870, and served as engr.-in-chief on various railway surveys; suptg. engr., Jan., 1880; C.I.E., May, 1883; C.S.I., Jan., 1883; chief engr., April, 1889; consulting engr. to govt. of India for state railways, May, 1889; sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., Aug., 1892; retd., July, 1894.

O'CALLAGHAN, IGNATIUS, late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., Feb., 1873; traffic supt., Rajputana state railway, Dec., 1874; gen. traffic manager, Rajputana-Malwa railway system, April, 1885; retd., 1896.

O'CONNOR, JAMES EDWARD, C.I.E., M.I.S.I., Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Registrar, dept. of agric. and commerce, June, 1873; asst. sec. in statistical branch of dept. of rev., agric., and commerce, Feb., 1875; asst. sec., dept. of fin. and commerce, Dec., 1879; on special duty in connection with the Melbourne exhibn., 1880-81; C.I.E., Jan., 1891; dir.-gen. of statistics, retaining his post as asst. sec., May, 1895; author of reports on the production of tobacco, vanilla, and lac, and on the cultivation of the ground nut, the carob tree, and the eucalyptus in India.
