ODDIE, HENRY JAMES, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. 1st Oct., 1876, and posted as asst. engr. to state rlys; exec. engr., May, 1888.

ODLING, CHARLES WILLIAM, C.S.I., M.E., M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 20th Oct., 1865; exec. engr., Sept., 1870; under sec. to govt. of Bengal, Feb., 1883; suptg. engr., Nov., 1889; chief engnr. for irrign. and joint sec. to govt. of Bengal, March, 1892; sec., irrign. branch, Jan., 1893; transfd. to N.W. Prov. and Oudh as chief engr. and sec. in buildings and roads branch, Dec., 1895; C.S.I., Jan., 1898.

O'DONNELL, CHARLES JAMES, M.A., Indian C.S.(Bengal).—Educ. at St. Ignatius Coll., and Queen's Coll., Galway; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 14th Oct., 1872, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; on famine duty, June, 1874; asst. to dir.-gen. of statistics, Feb., 1875; joint mag., July, 1884; mag. and collr., Aug., 1889; provl. supt. of census, Bengal, 1890-91.

O'DONOGHUE, WILLIAM FREEMAN, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. acctnt. in subord. accts. estab., pub. wks. dept., 4th April, 1873; asst. examr., Sept., 1876; dep. examr., July, 1880; examr., May, 1886.

O'Dwyer, Michael Francis, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at St. Stanislaus Coll., Tullamore, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after open exam. of 1882; arrived, 10th Nov., 1885, and was apptd. asst. commr. in the Punjab; settlt. collr., 1889-94; dir. of dept. of land records and agric., Punjab, Dec., 1896.

O'Farrell, Horace Handley, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Westminster; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 23rd Nov., 1875, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; sub-collr. and joint mag., Dec., 1888; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1891; collr. and mag., Jan., 1894.

Ogilvie, George Macartney, late Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1863, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and jud. asst.; dep. commr., Oct., 1881; commr. and supt., Nov., 1888; in 1893-94 and 1894-95 acted as finl. commr.; retd., Jan., 1896.

OHARA, WILLIAM, Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 30th Sept., 1874; arrived, 18th April, 1875, and served in Madras under the mil. dept., and as civil-surgn. and jail supt. at various stations; district med. and sanitary officer, Trichinopoli, May, 1893.

O'KELLY, Hilary Martin, B.A., M.I.E.E., India Telegraph Dept.—Joined the service as asst. supt., 21st June, 1866; arrived, 14th Sept., 1866; supt., Jan., 1886; offg. dir., traffic branch, July-Oct., 1894.

O'Kinealy, James, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Galway; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 2nd Feb., 1862, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., asst. supt. of survey, asst. commr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; apptd. addl. sessions judge of Bhagalpur, Sept., 1874; district and sessions judge, May, 1875; offg. sec., govt. of India, home dept., Dec., 1877; supt. and remembrancer of legal affairs, Jan., 1878; member of legisl. council, 1880; judge of the high court, Calcutta, Feb., 1883; also prest. of the board of examrs., April, 1885.

O'Kinealy, Peter, B.L., Calcutta High Court.—Called to the bar at Lincoln's Inn, 1876; apptd. standing counsel, Bengal, 19th April, 1895.

Oldfield, Francis Du Pré, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Marlborough and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 11th Nov., 1890, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

Oldfield, Sir Richard Charles, Kt., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1848; arrived, 9th Nov., 1848; served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; asst. sec. to govt., and asst. acctnt., N.W. Prov., March, 1856; mag. and collr., Farakhabad, March, 1864; from May, 1869, served in the jud. dept., and was apptd. civil and sessions judge, Jan., 1872; addl. judge, high court, N.W. Prov., Dec., 1874; puisne judge, high court, Nov., 1882; retd., March, 1887.

Oldham, Abel John, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 1st March, 1873, and posted to Bengal; employed in Madras on famine reliefworks, 1877-78; and in N.W. Prov. and Oudh on public works accts., 1881-82; exec. engr., Aug., 1881; transfd. to state rail-
OLIVER, JAMES WILLIAM, Forest Dept., (N.W. Prov.)—Arrived, 4th Dec., 1874, and was apptd. asst. conservator; dep. conservator, July, 1880; conservator, May, 1891; acting dir. of forest school, Dehra Dun, Aug., 1896.

OLIVIER, HENRY DACRES, Major, R.E., A.M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Entered the service, 15th Dec., 1871; joined the dept., 1st June, 1875; employed in Baluchistan, 1878-80; exec. engr., and dep. consulting engr. for railways, Bombay, March, 1884; employed on Soudan railway, 1885; under sec. to govt., public works dept., 1889-91; agent to the Bombay, Baroda, and Central India railway co., Aug., 1894.

OLLIVANT, ALFRED, Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., N.W. Prov.—Arrived as ensign, 20th April, 1857; medal for services during Mutiny, 1857; apptd. to Jhansi mil. police, July, 1858; from May, 1861, served as district supt. of police; dep. inspr.-gen., June, 1885; inspr.-gen., Jan., 1890; returned to Europe, 1891.

OLLIVANT, SIR EDWARD CHARLES KAYLL, K.C.I.E., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Marlborough; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 21st Nov., 1868, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; on special duty at Baroda in connection with estate of Mir Zulfikar Ali, Jan., 1870; asst. commr., branch inspr.-gen. of registrar, in Sind, and Sindi translr. to govt., Sept., 1880; also dep. supt. of census in Sind, Jan., 1881; municipal commr. for Bombay, May, 1881; on special duty in England in this connection, 1883; C.I.E., May, 1888; pol. agent and collr. of stamp rev., Kathiawar, April, 1889; K.C.I.E., May, 1892; ofld. as commr. in Sind April, 1895 to Mar., 1896; member of council, Bombay, April, 1897.

OMMANNEY, EDWARD LACON, C.S.I., Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 12th June, 1855; asst. to commr. in charge of ex-king of Delhi and state prisoners, Sept., 1857; took ex-king of Delhi and family to Rangoon, and served in Pegu commn., 1858-59; served subsequently in the Punjab as asst. commr., personal asst. and dep. commr.; commr. and supt., Derajat, Dec., 1883; on special duty with Hazara field force, Nov., 1883; C.S.I., May, 1889; reverted to mil. duty, 1891.

OMMANNEY, HENRY TRAVERS, late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 12th Nov., 1870, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., railway mag., cantonmt. mag., and second asst.; acting under sec. to govt., rev., etc., depts., April, 1886; and acting inspr.-gen. of police, May, 1888; junr. collr. and mag., Nov., 1891; senr., Feb., 1895; member of hemp drugs commn., 1893-94; retd., Oct., 1896.

ONSLOW (EARL OF), RIGHT HON. WILLIAM HILLIER ONSLOW, G.C.M.G.—Born in 1833; educ. at Eton and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. partly, under sec. of state for the colonies, Feb., 1887; acted as vice-pres. of the colonial conference, 1887, and as a delegate to the conference on sugar bounties; K.C.M.G., 1887; partly, sec., board of trade, Feb., 1888; govr. and commr.-in-chief, New Zealand, 1889-92; G.C.M.G., 1889; apptd. partly, under sec. of state for India, July, 1895.

OPPERT, GUSTAV, Ph.D., late Educn. Dept., Madras.—Profr. of Sanscrit, presidency coll., and curator of govt. oriental manuscript library,
14th Nov., 1872; fellow of Madras univ., 1873; Telugu translr. to govt., Sept., 1878; retd., April, 1893.

ORMOND, ERNEST W., B.L., Bengal Jud. Dept.—After serving temporarily in 1891-92 as asst. sec. to the govt. of Bengal, legisl. dept., was apptd. to act as 2nd judge, Calcutta small cause court, March, 1893; confd., Dec., 1894.

ORR, JAMES PETER, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at St. John's Coll., Hurstpierpoint, and Caius Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 12th Oct., 1889, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag. and forest settl. officer.

ORR, JOHN WILLIAM, M.A., B.L., Jud. Dept., Bombay.—Served from 7th May, 1860, as acting dep. clerk of the crown, clerk to the chief justice, &c.; prothonotary and eccles. and admiralty registrar, May, 1866; registrar, high court, original side, Feb., 1886; reverted to his post as prothonotary, &c., March, 1894.

OSBORN, WILLIAM, Lieut.-Col., R.E., late Bombay Public Works Dept.—First commn., 18th Dec., 1861; asst. engr., Nov., 1864; served in the Abyssinian campaign, 1867 (medal); exec. engr., Jan., 1869; suptg. engr., Jan., 1893; retd., May, 1894.

OTTLEY, JOHN WALTER, C.I.E., Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., Jan., 1864; arrived, Nov., 1865; joined the dept., Feb., 1870; asst. to chief engr. for irrign., Punjab, April, 1870; exec. engr., Sept., 1872; asst. to chief engr. for irrign., Bengal, Feb., 1874; re-transfd. to Punjab, irrign. branch, June, 1875; asst. sec., irrign. branch, Punjab, July, 1881; supt. of works, Bari Doab circle, April, 1882; suptg. engr., Dec., 1884; chief engr. and joint sec. to govt. of Punjab, public works dept., Nov., 1890; C.I.E., May, 1892; sec., irrign. branch, Sept., 1892; inspr.-gen. of irrign. and dep. sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., Oct., 1894; retd. from the dept., 1896.

OWEN, EDWARD, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 17th Feb., 1872; staff clerk, July, 1896.

OWEN, WILLIAM, M.D., Surgn. Lieut.-Col., Opium Dept., Bengal.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1877, and was employed under the mil. dept. and as second med. officer, Port Blair; from 24th May, 1882, served in Bengal as supt. of vaccn., dep. sanitary commr. and civil surgn.; principal asst. to opium agent, Behar, April, 1889; factory supt., Behar, May, 1891.

OXENHAM, ROBERT G., M.A., late Bombay Educ. Dept.—Arrived, 9th Sept., 1863, and served till Nov., 1874, as prof'r. at the Deccan coll., Poona, and subsequently as principal; principal and prof'r. of history and pol. economy, Elphinstone coll., Dec., 1890; acting dir. of public instrn., May, 1893; retd., April, 1894.

OZANNE, EDWARD CHARLES, M.R.A.C., late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Elizabeth Coll., Guernsey; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 11th Nov., 1872, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; on famine relief duty, 1874, 1877, and 1879; dir. of agric., July, 1883; survey and settl. commr., May, 1891; survey commr. and dir. of land records and agric., April, 1893; retd., July, 1897.

OZZARD, HUDSON HENRY, Major, I.S.C., Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—First commn., 13th June, 1874; arrived, 1st Nov., 1874, and was employed on mil. duty, including service in Perak expdn. (medal and clasp) and Afghan war, 1878-79 (medal); acting cantonmt. mag., Feb., 1888; confd., April, 1890.

PAGE, HORACE, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at St. Olave's Gr. Sch., and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 19th Dec., 1893, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

PAGE, WILLIAM HUMPHREY, late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Nottingham Gr. Sch., and Winchester Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 10th Dec., 1868, and served in Bengal; joint mag. and dep. collr., Aug., 1879; district and sessions judge, Oct., 1885; retd., April, 1895.

PAINTER, EDWIN DYKE, India Audit Office.—Clerk, and class, 25th March, 1895.

PAINTER, HAROLD LISCOMBE, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Clifton Coll. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 9th Dec., 1895, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

PALLE CHENTSAL RAO PANTULU, C.I.E., late Supt. of Stamps and Stationery, Madras.—Served from Feb., 1851, in the jud. and rev. depts., Madras; from July, 1859, served as dep. collr., special asst. to the inam commr., and dep. collr. of salt rev.; sheristadar, board of rev., May, 1872; fellow of Madras univ., 1875; supt. of stamps and stationery, July, 1882; C.I.E., Feb., 1887; retd., April, 1887; member of Madras legisl. council, July, 1887.

PALLISER, HARRY GEORGE, M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Educ. at Chiswick Sch.; joined the dept., 28th Oct., 1867; exec. engr., Nov., 1872; suptg. engr., Feb., 1894.

PALMER, CHARLES EDGAR, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the Mathematical Sch., Rochester, and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived, 5th Dec., 1896, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

PALMER, CHARLES GEORGE, C.I.E., M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 7th Oct., 1868, and employed on irrign. works in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., May, 1876; C.I.E., Jan., 1892.

PALMER, SIR ELWIN MITFORD, K.C.B., K.C.M.G., late Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the finl. dept., Nov., 1871; asst. to acctnt.-gen., British Burma, Dec., 1873; transf'd to Bombay, April, 1876; asst. to comptr.-gen., Oct., 1878; served under the Egyptian govt., 1878-79; from Jan., 1880, served in Madras as ofig. asst. and dep. acctnt.-gen.; comptr., Haidarabad, Dec., 1882; asst. acctnt.-gen., Bengal, Nov., 1884; asst. comptr.-gen., Dec., 1884; transf'd for service under Egyptian govt., Aug., 1885; K.C.B., Jan., 1897.

PANTIN, ROBERT GERALD, B.A., Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Bradfield Coll., and Wadham Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 21st Dec., 1894, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

PANTON, EDWARD BROOKS HENDERSON, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Dulwich, and at Christ's Coll., Cambridge, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 7th Dec., 1896, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

PARGITER, EDWIN HERMANN, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and employed on irrign. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., May, 1883.

PARGITER, FREDERICK EDEN, B.A., Indian
C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Taunton Coll. Sch., and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 6th Nov., 1875; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., settlt. officer, commr. of the Sundarbans, and offg. under sec.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Jan., 1887; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1893; author of 'The Revenue History of the Sundarbans from 1765 to 1870,' and of a transl. of the Markandeya Purana.

PARKER, EDWIN WOODALL, Punjab Administration.—From 20th Oct., 1863, served in the Punjab as extra asst. commr., and small cause court judge; district judge, Simla, May, 1887, to Jan., 1888; registrar of chief court, Oct., 1888; author of 'Outlines of the Constitutional Law of India,' and 'Outlines of Jurisprudence.'

PARKER, SIR GEORGE ARTHUR, late Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Uppingham Sch., and Trinity Hall, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 9th Dec., 1863, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., sub-collr. and joint mag., and district and sessions judge; judge of the high court, Madras, Dec., 1886; retd., 3rd Feb., 1896.

PARKER, JOSEPH, C.S.I., late Dir.-Gen. of Stores, India Office.—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; East India house writer, old establ., 9th July, 1851; junr. clerk, marine dept., Aug., 1858; store dept., 1860; senr. clerk, Nov., 1866; asst. to dir.-gen. of stores, Jan., 1890; dir.-gen. of stores, June, 1891; retd., Aug., 1896.

PARKER, WILLIAM HENRY, M.I.C.E., late Public Works Dept., Bengal.—Apptd., 24th Aug., 1860; from Nov., 1873, served in the railway branch, and was employed on various lines; offg. chief engr. and joint sec., Bengal, railway branch, July-Oct., 1885; served subsequently as engr.-in-chief on various railway surveys; retd., Jan., 1892.

PARKER, WILLIAM JACKSON, Col., I.S.C., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 16th Dec., 1858; from July, 1867, served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and jud. asst.; district judge, Nov., 1884; dep. commr., Sept., 1887; divl. judge, Oct., 1891; reverted to mil. dept., Nov., 1894.

PARKE, BENJAMIN, M.I.C.E., M.E., F.C.H., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and posted to state railways; transf'd. to Punjab provl. establ., Jan., 1879; exec. engr., Oct., 1881.

PARKIN, HENRY, Capt., I.S.C., Burma Police Dept.—First commn., 11th May, 1878; served in the Zhub expdn., 1884, and in Burma, 1886-87 and 1887-89 (medal); asst. dir. of police supply and clothing, Burma, 15th Aug., 1888; dep. inspr.-gen. of police for supply and clothing, June, 1890.

PARLETT, LEONARD MONTAGUE, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Bradfield Coll., and Keble Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 21st Dec., 1891, and served in Burma as asst. commr., and settlt. officer.

PARRATT, CHARLES, Indo-European Telegraph Dept., India Office.—Apptd. to the London office of the Indo-European telegraph dept. as clerk, 26th March, 1881; transf'd. to India office, 1st Jan., 1889.

PARROTT, BENJAMIN ALEXANDER NAPIER, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Burma Commn.—First commn., July, 1868; arrived, Nov., 1868; served in the Lushai expdn., 1871; from April, 1872, served in the Burma commn. as asst. commr., ass't. town mag., and settlt. and boundary officer; dep. commr., Feb., 1886; commr., Oct., 1894.

PARRY, R., late Educl. Service, Bengal.—Joined the service, 14th Jan., 1865; served as head-master, profr., and offg. principal at various colls., and as inspr. of schools (temporary); retd., 1890.

PARRY, ROBERT, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Bedford Sch., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 15th Nov., 1892, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

PARRY, WILLIAM ENSOR, A.M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 23rd Dec., 1859, and posted to state railways; transf'd. to the N.W. Prov. and Oudh, July, 1860; exec. engr., Sept., 1868; retd., Dec., 1895.

PARSONS, CLEMENT GEORGE, Capt., I.S.C., Punjab commn.; arrived 28th April, 1880; apptd. to Punjab commn. as asst. commr., Sept., 1885; dep. commr., April, 1896.

PARSONS, FRANCIS COTTON, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Amersham Hall Sch., Reading, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 30th Jan., 1889, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; special settlt. officer, July, 1894.

PARSONS, HENRY JAMES, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Eton, and Lincoln Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 21st Nov., 1867, and served in Bombay as asst. mag. and collr., asst. judge, and judge and sessions judge; acted as jud. commr. and judge of the sadar court in Sind, in 1881-82, and again in 1887; judge of high court, Nov., 1887.

PARSONS, JAMES EDMUND BACON, B.L., Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 4th Feb., 1849; from Feb., 1856, served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; reverted to mil. duty, Nov., 1885.

PARSONS, JAMES HENRY, Capt., I.S.C. (Burma commn.).—First commn., 11th Sept., 1876; apptd. to the Burma commn. as asst. commr., July, 1884.

PARSONS, OCTAVIUS SYDNEY, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 28th Nov., 1891, and served in Burma as asst. commr., cantonmt. mag., small cause judge, and settlt. officer.

PARTHASARATHI AIYANGAR, M.O., M.A., M.L.—Apptd. judge, court of small causes, Madras, April, 1896.

PARTRIDGE, JOHN GEORGE DENMAN, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Sherborne, and at Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 15th Jan., 1887, and served in Madras as asst. to mag. and collr.; senr. asst., Ganjam, Aug., 1893.

PARTRIDGE, WILLIAM REGINALD, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Blundell's Sch., Tiverton, Sherborne Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1883, and served in Oudh as asst. commr.; under sec. to govt., May, 1888; senr. asst. commr., Garhwal, Nov., 1890; dep. commr., Oct., 1891; also settlt. officer, Nov., 1893; joint mag., Nov., 1894; dep. commr., Nov., 1895; mag. and collr., April, 1896.

PASSANAH, HENRY GEORGE, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.;
apptd., 7th Aug., 1872, and posted to N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., June, 1883; served on state railways, 1883-85.

PATCH, JAMES, late Bengal Police Dept.—Joined the service, 17th May, 1863, as asst. supt. of police; transfd. to Assam, Jan., 1869; district supt., Sept., 1870; served with Lushai expdn., 1871-72; returned to Bengal, July, 1884; retd., April, 1894.

PATERNERSON, GEORGE ALFRED, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Blairlodge Sch., Univ. Coll., London, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 30th Oct., 1893, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

PATTERSON, ALEXANDER BLEARLEY, C.I.E., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Belfast Royal Acad. Inst. and Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 20th Dec., 1893, and served in the N.W.Prov.as asst.mag.and collr., settl. officer, and joint mag.; mag. and collr., Dec., 1893; acting commr.of Jhansi, July-Oct., 1890; commr. of N. India salt rev., April, 1891; C.I.E., May, 1895; author of Fatehpur and Karwi settl. reports.

PATTERSON, WILLIAM HENRY, late Survey of India Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Dec., 1851; served as a volunteer during the Mutiny; asst. supt., Jan., 1883; dep. supt., Feb., 1889; retd., Sept., 1893.

PATTLE, ARTHUR JOHN, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 17th Feb., 1872; staff clerk, July, 1896.

PAUL, ALFRED WALLIS, C.I.E., B.A., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Clifton Coll. and Wadham Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1870, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and acting inspr.-gen. of registrn.; on special duty in connection with the Thibet mission, April, 1886; dep. commr., Aug., 1887; C.I.E., Jan., 1889; on special duty on Thibetan frontier, April, 1890; British commr. for Anglo-Chinese convention regarding Sikkim and Thibet, Feb., 1891; mag. and collr., May, 1891; on special duty at Darjiling, March, 1892; retd., Dec., 1895.

PAUL, SIR GREGORY CHARLES, K.C.I.E., B.A.—Advocate, high court, Calcutta, 1862-78; advocate-gen., high court, Calcutta, from Sept., 1872; also addl. member, govr.-gen.'s council, 1878-82; member of provl. legisl. council, 1885-92; and again, 1897.

PAUL, JOSIAH EDWARD, Madras Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; joined the service, 1st Oct., 1875; asst. to chief engr., and under sec. to govt. irrig. branch, in 1880; exec. engr., June, 1886.

PAUW, EDWARD KLAAS, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 27th Nov., 1891, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr.; dep. commr., Nov., 1894.

PEACOCK, EDWARD BOVILL, Punjab Commn.—Joined the service, 23rd Apr., 1862; apptd. asst. commr., 25th Feb., 1867; offd. as judge of small cause court in 1874 and 1875; district judge, April, 1889.

PEACOCK, HENRY PHIPSON, Major-Gen., late Pol. Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Bengal cavalry, Sept., 1856; served during the Mutiny (medal), and subsequently with the govr.-gen.'s body guard; acted as agent to the govr.-gen. with King of Oudh, and supt. of pol. pensions, on several occasions; pol. agent, Murshidabad, 1878; pol. agent, Alwar, 1882; acting rest., W. Rajputana, March, 1886; offg. rest. at Jaipur and offg. agent in Central India, May, 1888; pol. rest. in Turkish Arabia, Nov., 1891; rest., Jaipur, May, 1892; reverted to mil. dept., March, 1894.

PEARS, THOMAS CALDWELL, Major, I.S.C., Pol. Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 29th May, 1872; served in the Afghan war, 1878-79, and with the Thal Chotiali field force (medal); on special pol. duty in Afghanistan in 1880; apptd. asst. commr., Merwara, Nov., 1882; served in the thagi dept. in Rajputana, and on boundary duty on the Mewar and Tonk border in 1884; pol. asst., March, 1886; settl. officer under the Tonk durbar, Nov., 1886; pol. agent, Nov., 1891; settl. officer, Tonk, Dec., 1891; pol. agent, Alwar, March, 1893, resdt. at Gwalior.

PEARSE, HERBERT GEORGE, B.L. Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Rugby, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 7th Nov., 1871, and served in the N.W.Prov.as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and asst. commr.; judge, small cause court, Allahabad, Dec., 1887; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1890.

PEARSON, CHARLES, M.A., late Educn. Dept., Punjab.—Served in the dept. from March, 1861, as profr. and principal, Agra coll.; inspr. of schs., Nov., 1865; offg. dir. of public instrn. in 1873, 1876, and 1883; retd., March, 1886.

PEARSON, FRANCIS BOYLE, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at the Proprietary Sch., Islington, and Haileybury Coll., from which he was apptd. in 1840; served in the N.W.Prov.as asst. joint mag. and dep. collr., mag. and collr., and civil and sessions judge; also as settl. officer, Jalandhar, 1849-50, and as registrar to the court of sadar diwani and nizamat adalat, 1850-53; judge of that court, 1862-66; puisne judge, high court, N.W.Prov., 1866-81; retd., March, 1881.

PEARSON, JAMES RAE, Indian C.S. (N.W.Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch. and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 10th Nov., 1892, and served in the N.W.Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

PEARSON, TINDAL ARTHUR, B.A., B.L., Bengal Jud. Dept.—Joined the service, 3rd April, 1878, as offg. reporter, Indian law reports; confd., Jan., 1880; acted subsequently as dep. supt. and remembrancer of legal affairs, registrar of the diocese, and receiver of the high court; apptd. chief presidency mag. and judge of the court for trial of pilots, May, 1894.

PEDLER, ALEXANDER, F.R.S., Educn. Dept., Bengal.—Apptd. to the educn. dept., 22nd Jan., 1873; arrived, 8th May, 1873, and served as prof. of agricl. chemistry, presidency coll.; on special duty, eclipse expdn., March, 1875; meteorological reporter to govt. of Bengal, May, 1889, in addn. to his duties as profr.; principal, Presidency Coll., Nov., 1896.

PEET, ARTHUR WILLIAM, Forest Dept., Madras.—Joined the service, 18th Oct., 1871, as asst. conservator; dep. conservator, April, 1872; conservator, Oct., 1891.

PEILE, SIR JAMES BRAITHWAITE, K.C.S.I., M.A., late Bombay C.S., Council of India.—Educ. at Oriel Coll., Oxford; apptd. to the Bombay civil service after exam. of 1855; arrived 8th Oct., 1856, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; on special duty for inquiry into claims of thakurs of Bhaunagar on account of land and sea customs, May, 1859; specially apptd.
to inquire into condition of talukdars, Ahmadabad, Jan., 1860; alienation settl. officer, Gujarat, April, 1861; asst. to rev. commr., Dec., 1861; under sec. to govt. of Bombay, rev. dept., April, 1862; on special duty for carrying out provisions of bill for relief of the talukdars, Ahmadabad, Dec., 1862; commr. for revising subord. civil establs., April, 1866; registrar-gen. of assurances, July, 1866; dir. of public instr., April, 1869; acting municipal commr., Bombay, May-Oct., 1872; acting pol. agent, Kathiawar, Jan., 1873; on duty at Delhi in connection with imperial assemblage, Dec., 1876; acting commr. in Sind, June, 1878; member of famine commn., 1878-79; acting sec. to govt. pol., &c., depts., March, 1879; from April, 1879, served as sec. in the rev., finl., and gen. depts., and acted as chief sec.; on special duty on famine commn. in England, 1879-80; on special duty in India, 1880 and 1881; member of council, Bombay, Dec., 1882; acted as govr. and prest. in council in March, 1885; temporary member of govr.-gen.'s council, Oct., 1886; retd., Nov., 1887; member of council of India, 12th Nov., 1887; vice-prest., 1894-95; K.C.S.I., Jan., 1888; member of royal commn. on Indian expenditure, May, 1895.

PEILE, SOLOMON CHARLES FREDERICK, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Burma Police.—First commn., 9th Aug., 1874; served in the Afghan war of 1878-79 (medal) and in the Burmese expdn. of 1886-87 (medal and clasp); apptd. dir. of police supply and clothing, Upper Burma, March, 1887, the office being subsequently extended to the whole of Burma; dep. inspr.-gen., mil. police, June, 1890; inspr.-gen. of police, Feb., 1892.

PEMBERTON, ROBERT CHARLES BOILEAU, C.S.I., Major-Gen., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Lieut., Bengal engrs., 1853; joined the dept., May, 1857; served during the Mutiny (medal and two clasps), and subsequently in the road dept., Oudh, as exec. engr.; asst. sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., March, 1865; offg. suptg. engr., railway branch, Haidarabad, Sept., 1870; dir. of stores, railway branch, May, 1877; consulting engr. for guaranteed railways, Lucknow, 1880; chief engr., 1st class, March, 1886; dir.-gen. of railways and dep. sec., govt. of India, railway branch, Feb., 1887; sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., April, 1887; reverted to mil. dept., 1890; offg. member of viceroy's council, Feb., 1891, to April, 1892; retd. from army, Nov., 1892; C.S.I., May, 1894.

PEMBERTON, WILLIAM WALKER, Col., I.S.C., late Burma Commn.—First commn., July, 1853; arrived, 25th Sept., 1853; served in the Burma commn. from Dec., 1859, as asst. commr., dep. commr., small cause court judge, and boundary officer; reverted to mil. duty, 1890.

PENNELL, AUBRAY PERCIVAL, M.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at private schools and at Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 25th Nov., 1886, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and as compr. of Indian treasuries; transfd. to Burma, Oct., 1889, as asst. commr.; under sec. to chief commr., Oct., 1890; dep. commr., Jan., 1892; settl. officer, 1892-93; returned to Bengal as joint mag. and dep. collr., Jan., 1895; mag. and collr., June, 1896; district and sess. judge, June, 1897.

PENNINGTON, HENRY FRANCIS DUMARESQ, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Westminster; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 21st Oct., 1875, and served in Oudh as asst. commr. and sub-judge; joint mag., April, 1887; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1890; also addl. judge, Moradabad, 1893-94.

PENNINGTON, JAMES BURN, B.L., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Sedbergh Gr. Sch., and St. Peter's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1861; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., sub-collr., sub-sec. to the board of rev., and acting collr. of sea customs at Madras; collr. and mag., July, 1875; retd., Sept., 1888.

PENNY, EDMUND, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and posted to state railways; transfd. to Central Prov., Aug., 1875; exec. engr., May, 1883; planned and carried out scheme for Nagpur water-works, 1890; acted as asst. sec. to chief commr. in 1891.

PENNY, JAMES CHAMPION, M.D., Dep.-Surgeon, Gen., late Med. Dept., Punjab.—Arrived, 3rd June, 1857; from Feb., 1863, served in the Punjab at various stations as civil asst. surgn., and civil surgn. and supt. of jail; retd., June, 1887.

PENNYCUICK, JOHN, C.S.I., Col., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Madras.—Lieut., Madras engrs., 1st ec., 1858; arrived, 11th Nov., 1860; served in the dept. from April, 1862; exec. engr., Dec., 1866; served in the Abyssinian expdn., 1867-68 (medal); suptg. engr., Oct., 1881; dep. chief engr., and under sec. to govt., Jan., 1883; supt. of works, tank maintenance scheme, April, 1884; on special duty to England to select machinery for Periyar works project, July, 1888; chief engr. and sec. in the public works dept., July, 1890; member of legisl. council, Nov., 1893; C.S.I., Oct., 1895; retd., Jan., 1896.

PERCIVAL, PHILIP EDWARD, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the Charterhouse and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 25th Nov., 1895, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

PERKINS, SIR AEneas, K.C.B., Gen., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., 1851; joined the dept., March, 1855, and served in the Punjab; served during the Mutiny, 1857-58 (medal and clasp); asst. principal and prof., Calcutta civil enggr. coll., 1861; served with the Bhutan field force, 1864-65; acting suptg. engr., N.W. Prov., Oct., 1870; from April, 1872, served in the mil. works branch as suptg. engr.; was also on active service, Oct., 1878, as commanding engr., field force, Cabul, and in Oct., 1879, Kuram divn. (medal and four clasps and bronze star); C.B., 1879; A.D.C. to the Queen, March, 1881; acting dep. inspr.-gen. of mil. works, 1881; chief engr. and sec. to the chief commr., Central Prov., public works dept., Feb., 1883; chief engr. and sec., Punjab, April, 1886; reverted to mil. duty, 1889; K.C.B., June, 1897.

PERKINS, HENRY EDMUND, late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., London; apptd. after exam. of 1855; arrived, 24th Sept., 1856, and served in the Punjab, and temporarily in Oudh, as asst. commr. and personal ass. to finl. commr., Punjab; dep. commr., April, 1866; commr. and supt., April, 1877; retd., Nov., 1886.

PERKINS, NORMAN CHICHEREST, Capt., I.S.C., Burma Commn.—First commn., 13th Aug., 1879; served in Afghan campaign of 1880-81; and in Burma, 1886-89 (medal and clasp); joined the commn. as asst. commr., Aug., 1886; dep. commr., Oct., 1896.

PERRAM, GEORGE JAMES, M.I.C.E., India
Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 21st Dec., 1868, and posted to Mysore; exec. engr., Jan., 1889; transfd. to Central Prov., March, 1881; to Coorg, Jan., 1887; and to Burma, Feb., 1893; suptg. engr., Jan., 1896.

PERRIN, CHARLES, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 10th Oct., 1874, and employed on irrig. works in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., May, 1883; under sec. to govt., Feb., 1892; sanitary engr., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, with rank of suptg. engr., July, 1893; supt. of practical training of passed students at Cooper's Hill Coll., 1896-7.

PERROTT, FINCH, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Jnr. clerk, 24th Dec., 1880.

PERRY, FRANCIS FREDERIC, F.R.C.S., L.R.C.P., Surgn.-Major, Med. Dept., Punjab.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1879; from March, 1882, served in the Punjab as civil surgn., profr., Lahore med. coll., and chemical examr. to govt.; profr. of surgery, and surgn. to Mayo hosp., Lahore, Dec., 1888; acted as profr., Calcutta med. coll., in 1894.

PERT, FREDERICK JAMES, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Sidney Sussex Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 15th Nov., 1888, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Feb., 1893; settl. officer, Nov., 1894.

PETERS, CHARLES JASPER, M.I.C.E., late Madras Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 26th July, 1867, as proby. asst. engr.; exec. engr., April, 1875; retd., Nov., 1894.

PETERS, EDWARD NICOLLS, Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to the Bombay public works dept. as exec. engr., 11th March, 1879; transfd. to state railways, Feb., 1880; served in the Afghan war, 1880-81 (medal); posted to Burma, Sept., 1881; employed on Sind-Pishin railway, April, 1885; transfd. to Central Prov., March, 1888; in 1891 acted as public works sec.; reverted to mil. dept., Nov., 1895.

PETERSON, FRANCIS WILLIAM, late Mint Dept., Bombay.—Joined the mint dept., Calcutta; apptd. dep. assay master, Oct., 1881; dep. assay master, Bombay mint, Oct., 1887; retd., Nov., 1892.

PETERSON, FREDERICK WILLIAM VOYSEY, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Leicester Coll. Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 7th Dec., 1863, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., and dep. commr.; from May, 1877, served in the jud. dept., and was apptd. district and sessions judge, 1st grade, Sept., 1885; retd., April, 1889.

PETERSON, HERBERT PARSONS, late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Loughborough Gr. Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 10th Nov., 1875; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and in Assam as district and sessions judge, Silhet; joint mag. and dep. collr., Dec., 1887; district and sessions judge, April, 1893; retd., Feb., 1895.

PETERSON, PETER, M.A. (Edin.), B.A. (Oxon.), D.Sc., Educl. Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 2nd Jan., 1873, and served in the dept. as profr. of oriental languages, Elphinstone coll.; also univ. registrar, Bombay, Jan., 1878; in joint charge with Profr. Bhandarkar in search for Sanskrit MSS. in the Bombay circle, and has publd. several reports on the results; has also edited several volumes in the Bombay Sanskrit Series.

PETHERAM, SIR WILLIAM COMER, Kt., Q.C., B.L.—Called to the bar (Middle Temple), 1869; chief justice of the high court, N.W. Prov., 1st Nov., 1884; chief justice, Calcutta, 24th March, 1886; retd. Nov., 1896; vice-chancellor of the univ. of Calcutta, 1887-90.

PETLEY, EATON WALLACE, C.I.E., Commander R.N.—Dep. conservator of the port of Calcutta, and river surveyor, Nov., 1881; port officer and master attendant, April, 1888; hon. A.D.C. to lieut.-govr. of Bengal, and commander, Calcutta naval volunteers; C.I.E., Jan., 1897.

PETRE, FRANCIS LORRAINE, B.L., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Oscott Coll., and Univ. of London; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 15th Nov., 1874, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; offig. under sec. to govt. of India, rev. and agric. dept., Aug., 1882; jnr. sec., board of rev., N.W. Prov., Nov., 1882; from April, 1885, served as asst. agent to govr.-gen. in Central India; asst. commr., March, 1888; joint mag., Dec., 1888; joint sec., board of rev., Jan., 1891; mag. and collr., July, 1891.

PETTY, ALBERT JAMES, Store Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 16th July, 1883.

PHEAR, SIR JOHN BUDD, Kt., M.A., B.L., F.G.S.—Educ. at Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; graduated 6th wrangler in 1847; and was elected fellow, and afterwards apptd. mathematical lecturer and asst. tutor of Clare Coll.; called to the bar at the Inner Temple in 1854; judge of the high court, Calcutta, 1864-76; knighted in 1877; chief justice of Ceylon, 1877-79; unsuccessfully contested the Honiton divn. of Devon in 1885, and the Tavistock divn. in 1886; author of 'The Aryan Village in India and Ceylon,' 'International Trade,' and other works.

PHELAN, ALFRED BERNARD, B.A., L.C.E., M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 15th July, 1869, and employed on irrig. work in the Punjab; exec. engr., Oct., 1878.

PHELPS, EDWIN ASHLEY, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Clifton and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 7th Dec., 1896, and served in the N.W.P. and Oudh as asst. commr.

PHELPS, WILLIAM EDMONDSON, Store Dept., India Office.—Entered the royal artillery, 30th Oct., 1869; from Feb., 1876, served in the Bombay and Bengal ordnance depts., including duty with the Quetta field force, 1878-80; supervisor, 2nd grade, India store depot, 17th June, 1884.

PHIBBS, ALFRED, Mil. Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Stourbridge Gr. Sch.; clerk, 2nd class, 16th April, 1844.

PHILLIMORE, JOHN ERNEST, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Westminster and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 12th Nov., 1890, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. settlt. officer; joint mag. and collr., Nov., 1896.

PHILLIPS, ARTHUR, B.L., late Bengal Jud. Dept.—Advocate, high court, Calcutta, from 1871; sec. to govt. of India, legal dept., June to Nov., 1877; standing counsel, high court, Calcutta, from Nov., 1880; retd., March, 1895; author of 'Tagore Law Lectures.'

PHILLIPS, AUGUSTUS MARSHALL, Col., I.S.C., late Pol. Dept., Bombay.—Ensign, Bombay
infantry, June, 1855; arrived, 13th Dec., 1855, and served with the Persian expedy. force, 1856-57 (medal and clasp); from March, 1863, served as asst. pol. supt., Savantvadi, Mahi Kantha, and Kathiawar, and held various acting appts.; pol. supt., Savantvadi, March, 1889; reverted to mil. duty, 1890.

PHILLIPS, ARTHUR NOEL, Col.—First commn., 8th Dec., 1883; asst. commr., Assam, May, 1862; in June, 1880, transfd. to the N.W. Prov. as offg. cantonmt. mag.; confd., Aug., 1881; retd., April, 1890.

PHILLIPS, FRANCIS ANGELO THEODORE, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Winchester and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 11th Nov., 1880, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., and personal asst. to the chief commr.; judge, small cause court, Aug., 1891; commr. of excise, Oct., 1891; dep. commr., March, 1892.

PHILLIPS, JOHN WALDEN, Acctnt.-gen.'s dept., India Office.—Educ. at City of London Sch., and King's College; clerk, 2nd class, 9th Sept., 1897.

PHILLIPS, WILLIAM WATKIN, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Winchester and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 25th Nov., 1890, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

PIGGOTT, THEODORE CARO, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Kingswood Sch., Bath, and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 30th Nov., 1888, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., and asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Nov., 1893.

PIGOT, JONES QUAIN, B.A., B.L., late Calcutta High Court.—Advocate, high court, Bombay, 1870-82; puisne judge, high court, Calcutta, 11th July, 1882; vice-chancellor, Calcutta univ., 1892-93; retd., March, 1896.

PIKE, HERBERT WATSON, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Honiton Gr. Sch., Winchester, and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 17th Nov., 1885, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; under sec. to govt., Nov., 1890; joint mag., April, 1893; dep. commr., March, 1896.

PILCHER, JESSE GRIGGS, F.R.C.S., Surgn.-Col., late Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., 1860; from March, 1866, served as jail supt. at Allahabad and Agra, offg-sanitary commr. for Bengal, and civil surgn. at various stations; dep. surgn.-gen., Central Prov., March, 1890; inspr.-gen. of civil hosps., Bengal, April, 1893; ditto, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, May, 1894; retd., March, 1895.

PIM, ALAN WILLIAM, M.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Leipzig Univ. and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 4th Dec., 1895, and served in the N.W.P. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

PINHEY, ALEXANDER FLEETWOOD, Capt., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 10th May, 1882; from Feb., 1886, served as asst. pol. agent, Banswara, asst. gen. supt., thagi and dakaiti, and supt. for control of Moghias; pol. agent, Haraoiti, March, 1885; acting pol. agent, Baghelkhand, May, 1895; confd., April, 1897.

PINHEY, ARTHUR FRANCIS, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Charterhouse, and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 3rd Nov., 1884, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and in Burma as asst. commr. (1888-90); head asst., June, 1891; sub collr. and joint mag., Dec., 1896.

PINHEY, EDWARD, Bombay Public Works Dept.—Trained at the Roy. Indian Engrg. Coll.; joined the service 1st Oct., 1876, and served as asst. engr.; exec. engr., Oct., 1886.

PINKERTON, JOHN, M.D., Surgn.-Major-Gen., late Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 4th Aug., 1855; served with Indian navy, during the Persian war in 1857; on civil and mil. duty, 1858-61; acting supt. of vaccn., Sind, March, 1863; supt.-gen. of vaccn., Bombay presidency, April, 1868; surgn. in European gen. hosp. and dep. sanitary commr.; dep. surgn.-gen., Sind, Aug., 1882; surgn.-gen. of Bombay, Feb., 1888; member, legisl. council, June, 1892; retd., Feb., 1893.

PITCHER, DUNCAN GEORGE, Col., I.S.C., Oudh Commn.—Arrived, as cornet, Bombay light cavalry, 3rd Sept., 1859, having previously served in the royal marine light infantry and artillery, 1856-59; served from Aug., 1868, in the Oudh commn. as asst. commr., and small cause court judge, and registrar, Lucknow; dep. dir. of agric. and commerce for Oudh, June, 1882, and for N.W. Prov. and Oudh, July, 1886; dep. commr., June, 1887; dir. of land records, Gwalior, Nov., 1890.

PITMAN, CHARLES EDWARD, C.I.E., M.I.E.E., India Telegraph Dept.—Joined the dept. as asst. supt., 16th Jan., 1868; on special duty in connection with Lushai expedn., 1871, and with Afghanistan field force, 1878-79; C.I.E., 1879; supt., April, 1880; chief supt., April, 1891.

PITTAR, CHARLES WILLIAM ERSKINE, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Bedford Gr. Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 31st Oct., 1884, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and in Assam (1889-95) as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., March, 1895; district and sess. judge, Dec., 1896.

PLACE, GEORGE WILLIAM, B.A., LL.B., B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 29th Nov., 1875, and served in Assam as asst. commr.; from Jan., 1886, served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; district and sessions judge, March, 1893.

PLANCK, CHARLES, F.R.C.S., Surgn.-Gen.—Asst. surgn., Bengal med. establ., 4th Aug., 1855; civil asst. surgn., Fateghar, July, 1859; supt., central prison, Agra, Feb., 1862; inspr.-gen. of prisons, British Burma, Oct., 1864; sanitary commr., N.W. Prov., April, 1868; also in Oudh, April, 1877; also supt.-gen. of vaccn., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Jan., 1879; retd., Aug., 1886.

PLATEL, JOHN JOSEPH, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Calcutta Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 14th Dec., 1893, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

PLAYFAIR, ARCHIBALD LEWIS, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Ensign, Bengal infantry, Aug., 1856; served during the Mutiny (medal and clasp); and with the Haidarabad contingent, 1862-73; served
subsequently in civil employ as cantonmt. mag., small cause court judge, and jail supt.; retd., Feb., 1887.

PLOWDEN, Charles Henry, Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—First commn., Feb., 1854; arrived, 28th April, 1854; served during the Mutiny, 1858-59; served from May, 1860, in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., commr. of excise, &c., and dep. commr.; offg. as commr., Jalapur divn., 1892; reverted to mil. dept., April, 1893.

PLOWDEN, George Ward Chichele, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Arrived, as cornet, Bengal light cavalry, 4th April, 1874; served in the Mutiny campaign; from Sept., 1874, was employed in the N.W. Prov. as cantonmt. mag. of Bareilly, and subsequently as Meerut; retd., Jan., 1893.

PLOWDEN, Sir Henry Meredithy, Kt., B.A., B.L., late Jud. Dept., Punjab.—Served in the Punjab from 17th March, 1871, as govt. advocate and offg. judge of the chief court; confd. as judge, chief court, Jan., 1878; knighted, Feb., 1887; retd., April, 1894.

PLOWDEN, Walter Francis Courtenay Chichele, Major, I.S.C., Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—First commn., 19th Oct., 1872; served in the Jowaki expdn., and Afghan war, 1878-80 (medal and clasp); offg. cantonmt. mag., Sept., 1888; confd., May, 1890.

PLOWDEN, Sir William Chichele, K.C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury Coll., 1852; arrived, 20th Sept., 1852; from Nov., 1853; served in the rev. and jud. dept. in the N.W. Prov., Oudh, and Punjab; dep. commr., Aug., 1858, and joint mag. and dep. collr., first grade, March, 1863; sec., board of rev., N.W. Prov., July, 1864; on special duty on the census report, April, 1866, and again, May, 1872; mag. and collr., March, 1870; civil and sessions judge, March, 1877; on special duty at Calcutta as prest. of census committee, Jan., 1878; commr., Meerut divn., Sept., 1879; offg. member, board of rev., Aug., 1880; census commr. for India, March, 1881; addl. member, govrn.-gen.'s council, Dec., 1881; retd., July, 1885; M.P. for Wolverhampton (West), 1886-92.

POCOCK, Reynolds John Michel, late Police Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Served as a volunteer during the Mutiny; joined the dept., 26th Jan., 1861; asst. district supt., Oct., 1866; district supt., Sept., 1872; retd., April, 1895.

POLLEN, Arthur Daniel, B.A., LL.D., B.L., late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Koyal Sch., Dungannon, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 26th Oct., 1867, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., asst. judge and joint sessions judge; special judge under the Deccan agriculturists relief act, Jan., 1880; judge and sessions judge, Jan., 1884; retd., March, 1894.

POLLEN, John, B.A., LL.D., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 22nd Oct., 1871, and served as asst. collr. and mag.; on famine relief duty, 1874 and 1878; on special settlt. duty, March, 1879; acting under sec. to govt. of Bombay, pol., &c., depts., Dec., 1880; asst. commr. and branch inspr.-gen. of registration and stamps in Sind, April, 1881; also Sindi translr. to govt., Nov., 1881; acting collr. and mag., Haidarabad, May, 1887; junr. collr. and mag., March, 1892; senr. collr., June, 1896; author of 'Rhymes from the Russian,' &c.

POLLOCK, Sir Frederick Richard, K.C.S.I., Major-Gen.—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch.; apptd. an Indian cadet of infantry, June, 1844; asst. rest., Lahore, Nov., 1847; on the Sikh outbreak in 1848, accompanied the Firozpur column to Multan as pol. officer, and served during the double siege of Multan, under Sir H. Edwardes (medal and clasp); asst. commr. in charge of Kohat district, April, 1849, and afterwards at Peshawar and Bannu; employed in the expdn. under Sir Charles Napier against the Afridis in the Kohat Pass, 1850 (medal and clasp); civil and pol. officer with the expdn. against the Umarzai Waziris; dep. commr., Dera Ghazi Khan, March, 1854, and afterwards at Rawal Pindi; accompanied Brig.-Gen. Chamberlain's expdn. to the border hills as civil officer, 1857; commr. and supt., Peshawar, 1867; pol. commr. with the Hazara field force, 1868; employed in Afghanistan and Persia with the Seistan commn., 1871-72; commr. of Peshawar up to 1878; retd. from the army, May, 1879.

PONNUSWAMI PILLAI, Tiru Venkata, late Jud. Dept., Madras.—Served from the 15th April, 1844, in various subord. posts in the public works, mil., and jud. depts.; presidency mag. for the town of Madras, Aug., 1883; board of examrs., June, 1884; judge of the court of small causes, Madras, March, 1885; retd., April, 1892.

PONTIFEX, Sir Charles, K.C.I.E., B.A., late Legal Adviser, India Office.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Cambridge; called to the bar, May, 1854; judge of the high court, Calcutta, May, 1872; retd. in 1882 on appt. as legal adviser to sec. of state for India; legal adviser and solicitor, May, 1887; retd., April, 1892; K.C.I.E., May, 1892.

POPE, John Van Someren, M.A., Educn. Dept., Burma.—Educ. at Trinity Hall, Cambridge; joined the Bengal educ. service, 17th June, 1876, and served as prof'r. at the Patna and Presidency colls., and as principal, Dacca coll., Oct., 1881; inspr. of schs., April, 1884; fellow of the Calcutta univ., 1886; apptd. dir. of public instrn. in Burma, May, 1889.

POPE, Philip Joseph, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Oratory Sch., Birmingham, London Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 21st Dec., 1892, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

POPE, Richard Rodney, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Oratory Sch., Edgbaston, and London Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 1st Nov., 1879; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag., and in Assam as asst. commr., and district and sessions judge; district and sessions judge, Jessore, March, 1895; Dinajpore, May, 1896.

POPE, Thomas Henry, M.D., C.M., Surgn.-Major, Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 30th March, 1878, and served in Afghanistan, 1879-81 (medal); acting residency surgn., Travancore, April, 1885; civil surgn., Negapatam, Oct., 1885; asst. physician, gen. hosp., Jan., 1888; also prof'r. at the med. coll., to Dec., 1888; district surgn. and supt. of jail, S. Arcot, March, 1892; supt., ophthalmic hospital, Madras, April, 1894.

POPERT, Edwin Philip, Forest Dept., Madras.—Arrived, 16th Dec., 1872, and was employed in Burma as asst. conservator of forests; dep. conservator, July, 1880; conservator, March, 1887; transfd. to Madras, Jan., 1892.

PORTEOUS, Alexander, Indian C.S.
(Assam).—Educ. at Harrow : apptd. after exam. of 1876 ; arrived, 16th Jan., 1879, and served in Assam as asst. commr.; dep. commr., May, 1890; offg. pol. agent and supt., Manipur, Dec., 1892; offg. pol. officer, N. Lushai, July, 1894, and again, July, 1897.

PORTEOUS, CHARLES ARKCOLL, C.I.E., Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Madras.—Arrived, 26th Nov., 1856, and was employed in the suppression of the Mutiny, 1857-59 (medal and two clasps); served in the dept. from May, 1860, as asst. supt., and supt.; in charge of the Madras police at the imperial assemblage, Delhi, Dec., 1876; dep. inspr.-gen., July, 1883; inspr.-gen. of jails, Jan., 1889; inspr.-gen. of police, March, 1891; reverted to mil. dept., Dec., 1894; C.I.E., May, 1895.

PORTEOUS, WILLIAM, M.A., late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the High Sch. and Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 26th Nov., 1867, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and pol. agent; from Jan., 1874, was employed in Mysore as asst. commr., and in various offg. appts.; from April, 1878, served in Bombay as asst collr. and acting collr. of salt rev.; junr. collr. and mag. Nov., 1886; senr. collr., April, 1890; acted as commr. in 1894; retd., Nov., 1896.

PORTER, ALEXANDER, M.D., F.R.C.S.I., M.R.I.A., Surgn.-Col., late Madras Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., 31st March, 1865; held the civil surgeoncy of Akola, 1866-74, and acted as sanitary commr., Berar, 1870-71; from April, 1874, served in Madras, as chemical examr. to govt., surgn., 4th district, and profr. in the med. coll.; fellow of Madras univ., 1883; principal and profr. of medicine, med. coll., Dec., 1886; reverted to mil. duty, July, 1890; retd., July, 1895; author of 'Notes on the Pathology of Famine Diseases.'

PORTER, FORTESCUE WILLOUGHBY, late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Felsted Gr. Sch., and Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 21st Nov., 1865, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., settlt. officer, and joint mag.; dep. commr., Aug., 1885; mag. and collr., Nov., 1886; inspr.-gen. of police, Aug., 1891; retd., May, 1894.

PORTER, GEORGE EDWARD, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Felsted Gr. Sch., and Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 11th Dec., 1862, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., inspr. of schs., and dep. commr., wards' estate, Patna; district and sessions judge, April, 1879; jud. commr., Chota Nagpur, Oct., 1885; offg. judge, high court, Calcutta, Feb., 1886; retd., Sept., 1887.

PORTER, JOHN SINGLAR, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., settlt. officer, joint mag., and dep. commr.; mag. and collr., Shahjahanpur, April, 1879; acted as opium agent, Benares, 1886, and as commr. of Allahabad, 1886; retd., July, 1889.

PORTER, LESLIE ALEXANDER SELIM, M.A., LL.D., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Royal Acadl. Instn., and Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 13th Nov., 1876, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and settlt. officer; offd. as dep. sec. and sec. to govt. of India, legisl. dept., 1891; sec. to Deccan agriculturists relief commn., Nov., 1891; dep. commr., Sept., 1892; mag. and collr., Feb., 1894.

PORTER, LUDOVIC CHARLES, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Eton, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 8th Jan., 1890, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; city mag., Lucknow, Nov., 1895.

PORTER, WILLIAM NINNIS, Burma Commn.—Joined the service as inspr. of police, 11th Oct., 1870; was apptd. asst. district supt., April, 1875, and district supt., Jan., 1880; asst. commr., April, 1886; dep. commr., Nov., 1890.

PORTMAN, AUGUSTUS BERKELEY, Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 11th April, 1860, and was employed on mil. duties till May, 1866; subsequently served in the dept. as asst. supt., district supt., and supt. of railway police; acting inspr.-gen. of registrn. and stamps, 1879, and 1880-83; 1st grade supt. of police, Jan., 1885; retd., Dec., 1890.

POSFORD, JOSEPH, late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Christ's Coll., Finchley, and Trinity Hall, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 12th Nov., 1869, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Jan., 1882; district and sessions judge, Aug., 1888; retd., April, 1896.

POSSMANN, JULIUS, M.I.E.E., late India Telegraph Dept.—Joined the dept., 11th Aug., 1863; asst. supt., Sept., 1866; supt., Aug., 1866; engr. and electrician, Karachi, Dec., 1886; offg. dir., Persian Gulf section, May-Oct., 1891; retd., Feb., 1897.

POTINGER, BRABAZON HENRY, Lieut.-Gen., R.A.—Second lieut., 12th Dec., 1857; sec. to govt. of Bombay in the mil., marine and eccles. depts., June, 1887; retd., Dec., 1892.

POTTINGER, JOHN CURVEN, M.I.C.E., Bombay Sanitary Dept.—Joined the Bombay public works dept., 23rd July, 1868; exec. engr., May, 1875; sanitary engr. and member of sanitary board, Oct., 1893.

POULTON, HENRY DUNBAR, India Audit Office.—Junr. examr., 26th Dec., 1873; designation changed to junr. clerk, Oct., 1892.

POWELL, WALTER JOHN, Commander, R.I.M., late Marine Dept., Madras.—First comm., 10th Dec., 1864; presidency port officer, Madras, 18th Feb., 1893; retd., Feb., 1896.

POWER, AMBROSE WILLIAM BUSHE, B.L., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. in Germany, and at Kingstown Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 4th Dec., 1867, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and dep. commr. and pol. agent, Hill Tipperah; mag. and collr., Aug., 1887; commr., Bardwan, Dec., 1891; retd., April, 1894.

POWER, GUY FRANCIS THOMAS, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Somersetshire Coll., Bath, and Oriel Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 23rd Nov., 1875, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., head asst., and addl. sessions judge; sub-collr. and joint mag., May, 1890; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1891; collr. and mag., Jan., 1894; again district and sessions judge, March, 1895.

POWLETT, PERCY WILLIAM, C.S.I., Col., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—
Ensign, 58th native infantry, Bengal, April, 1855; served during the Mutiny (medal and clasps); asst. commr., Punjab, 1862; and Berar, 1865; asst. to govr.-gen.'s agent, Rajputana, 1868; settl. officer, Alwar, Jan., 1871; pol. agent, Kota, Jan., 1877; pol. agent for the W. Rajputana states, 1880; rest., W. Rajputana, Dec., 1881; C.S.I., Jan., 1891; reverted to mil. dept., April, 1892; compiled the gazetteers of Bikanir, Alwar and Karoali.

PRAMODA CHARAN BANERJI, B.A., B.L., High Court, N.W. Prov.—Joined the service, 16th Jan., 1872, as munshi; sub-judge, Aug., 1880; after serving as small cause court judge at Agra and Allahabad, was apptd. addl. civil judge, Lucknow, Aug., 1893; and puisne judge, high court, N.W. Prov., Dec., 1893.

PRASANNA KUMAR RAY, D. Sc., Bengal Educl. Dept.—Joined the service, 11th Jan., 1877, and served as asst. profr., Patna and Dacca colls.; profr., presidency coll., Feb., 1888.

PRATT, EDWARD MILLARD, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 21st Dec., 1886, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 2nd asst., March, 1894; 1st asst., March, 1897.

PRATT, FREDERICK GREVILLE, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., and Hertford Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 24th Nov., 1890, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 2nd asst., March, 1897.

PRATT, HENRY JAMES FREDERIC, Bengal Opium Dept.—Entered the dept., Jan., 1861, and served as asst. sub-dep., and sub-deputy opium agent.

PRATT, HENRY SHELDON, B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at King's Grammar School, Warwick, and Lincoln Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 30th Nov., 1896, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

PRATT, JAMES, M.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Aberdeen and London Univs.; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 12th Oct., 1869, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Oct., 1880; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1888; offg. supt. and remembrancer of legal affairs, April, 1897.

PRATT, WILLIAM DERING, Police Dept., Bengal.—Joined the service as asst. supt. of police, 6th Sept., 1862; district supt., Aug., 1868; dep. inspr.-gen., May, 1894.

PRECE, HENRY CHARLES, Store Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, India store depot, 5th Dec., 1885.

PREM NATH PANDIT, Rai Bahadur, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. as accnt., sub-accts. estab., 4th July, 1867; asst. examr., Mar., 1873; dep.-examr., Jan., 1880; examr., May, 1886.

PRENDERGAST, SIR HARRY NORTH DALRYMPLE, K.C.B., V.C., Gen.—Second lieut., 8th June, 1854; served in the Persian war in 1857 (medal with clasp), with the Malwa field force in 1857, with the Central India field force in 1858 (medal with clasp and V.C.), and in the Abyssinian war 1867-68 (medal); in command of sappers in the Indian expdn. to the Mediterranean, 1878; commanded the expdn. that resulted in the annexation of Upper Burma in 1885-86 (clasp); has received the distinguished service reward; held appts. in the dept. of public works and in the railway dept.; commanded the Madras sappers and miners for 10 years; acted as quartermaster-gen. of the Madras army and as sec. to govt. in the mil. dept.; offd. as British rest. in Travancore and Cochin in 1887, and as British rest. in Mysore and chief commr. in Coorg in 1887 and 1888; agent to the govr.-gen., Baroda, Jan., 1889; offg. rest. and govr.-gen.'s agent in Baluchistan, March to Oct., 1889; offg. rest., Mysore, and chief and jud. commr., Coorg, June, 1891; reverted to mil. dept., April, 1892.

PRESTON, SIDNEY, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 10th Aug., 1870, and employed in the Punjab on irrigtn. works; exec. engr., Jan., 1880; offg. under sec. to the Punjab govt., 1885-86; suptg. engr., April, 1893.

PRICE, GORDON, M.D., Surgn.-Lt.-Col., late Bengal Med. Service.—Served from 29th July, 1875, as civil surgn. and on jail duty; principal asst. to opium agent, Behar, Nov., 1887, to April, 1889; civil surgn., Murshidabad, April, 1896; retd., Jan., 1898.

PRICE, JAMES CATTRALL, late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 31st Oct., 1867, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; settl. officer, Midnapur, Dec., 1871; also supt. of survey, March, 1876; mag. and collr., Aug., 1876; author of 'Notes on the History of Midnapur.'; retd., 1896.

PRICE, JOHN ARTHUR, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at the Madras civil engrg. coll.; apptd., 14th May, 1869, and posted to Bengal; exec. engr., April, 1882; transfd. to Burma, July, 1887.

PRICE, SIR JOHN FREDERICK, K.C.S.I., late Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Melbourne Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 25th Oct., 1862; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and sub-collr.; collr. and mag., S. Arcot, and pol. agent for Pondicherry, April, 1878; collr. and mag., Chengalpat, Sept., 1878; board of examrs., Jan., 1882; acting dir. of rev. settl. and agric., Madras, April, 1885; sec. to govt., rev. dept., Oct., 1887; member of legisl. council, Oct., 1888; chief sec. to govt. of Madras, Nov., 1888; C.S.I., Jan., 1893; addl. member of legisl. council, Madras, Jan., 1897; retd., Oct., 1897; K.C.S.I., Jan., 1898.

PRICE, WILLIAM, M.D., M.Ch., Brigade-Surgn.- Lieut.-Col., Madras Med. Dept.—Arrived, 7th Nov., 1890; civil surgn., Vellore, April, 1877; med. officer, Utakamand, March, 1878; zillah surgn., Feb., 1881; senr. physician, gen. hosp., and principal, med. coll., Oct., 1891; retd., April, 1896.

PRIDEAUX, WILLIAM FRANCIS, C.S.I., Col., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Bombay infantry, Jan., 1860; asst. pol. rest., Aden, April, 1864; attached to mission to Abyssinia, March, 1865, and was in captivity at Magdala, 1866-68; offd. as pol. agent, Zanzibar, 1873-75; fellow of Bombay univ., 1874; asst. sec. to govt. of India, foreign dept., June, 1875; offg. pol. rest., Persian Gulf, 1876-77; pol. agent, Bhopal, March, 1879; agent to the govr.-gen. with the ex-King of Oudh, and supt. of pol. pensions, Calcutta, Nov., 1880; offg. rest., E. Rajputana states, 1882-83; apptd. in 1887 agent to the govr.-gen. for the affairs of the late King of Oudh, and supt. of pol. pensions; rest. at Jaipur, Nov., 1888; acting rest., Kashmir, Dec., 1890; rest. in Mewar, Nov., 1893; acting
agent to govr.-gen. in Rajputana, 1893-94; rest., Jaipur, April, 1894; C.S.I., Jan., 1895; reverted to mil. dept., April, 1895.

PRIEST, HENRY HALSTED, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at the Real-Schule, Marburg; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1879, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr. and in various acting appts.; judge, small cause court, Jabalpur, Jan., 1891; dep. commr., Aug., 1891; in addn., pol. agent, Chattisgarh feudatories, June, 1892; rev. sec., May, 1893; chief sec. to chief commr., Sept., 1895.

PRINGLE, JOHN CHRISTIAN, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Winchester and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 17th Nov., 1896, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

PRINSEP, SIR HENRY THOBY, Kt., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 7th Dec., 1855, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; offg. junr. sec., board of rev., Sept., 1861; registrar of the sadar diwani and nizamat adalat, Feb., 1862, and subsequently of the high court, July, 1862; mag. and collr., 1st grade, May, 1866; served in the jud. dept., from Feb., 1867, as district and sessions judge, and offd. as jud. commr. of Mysore, 1875-76; judge, high court, Calcutta, Aug., 1878; member of Viceroy's legislat. council, Jan., 1878.

PRITAMDAS PARSUMAL CHANDANANI, L.C.E., Bo. Public Works Dept.—Joined the service 20th April, 1875, and served as asst. engr.; exec. engr., Nov., 1886.

PRITCHARD, ALFRED BASSETT, Capt., Indian Staff Corps, Burma Commn.—First commn., 11th Nov., 1878; apptd. to Burma as asst. commr., June, 1887.

PRITCHARD, SIR CHARLES BRADLEY, K.C.I.E., C.S.I., late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1857; arrived, 24th Jan., 1858, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; collr. of salt rev., Bombay, Feb., 1873; on special duty in Madras as prest. of the salt commn., 1875; on special duty to submit a scheme for the working of the abkari system, 1877-78; commr. of customs, &c., April, 1881; commr. of salt rev., Oct., 1882; C.S.I., March, 1886; acting commr. in Sind, April, 1887; confd., Aug., 1888; temporary member of council of govr. of Bombay, May, 1889; confd., Nov., 1890; K.C.I.E., May, 1891; member of viceroy's council, Nov., 1892; retd., Feb., 1896.

PRITCHARD, CHARLES HAMERTON, Capt., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Educ. at Clifton Coll.; first commn., 10th May, 1882; from March, 1888, acted as asst. to govr.-gen.'s agent, Baluchistan; engaged in boundary settl. work in Mewar, 1889-90; asst. to rest., Haidarabad, and to the gen. supt. thagi and dakaiti, April, 1890; asst. commr., Merwara, July, 1891; offg. pol. agent, E. states of Rajputana, April, 1893; settl. officer, Tonk, Feb., 1894.

PROBY, DAVID GRANVILLE, Police Dept., Central Prov.—Entered the service as offg. asst. dist. supt. of police, July, 1867; confd., Jan., 1869; dist. supt., April, 1874.

PROPERT, WILLIAM HENRY, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1856; arrived, 6th Nov., 1856, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag. and pol. agent; from Feb., 1876, served as collr. and mag. and pol. agent, Khandesh; senr. collr., Sept., 1877; commr., April, 1886; retd., April, 1890.

PROTHERO, MICHAEL ERNLEE DU SAUTOY, M.A.—Bengal Educl. Service.—Joined the service as profr., presy. coll., Calcutta, 17th April, 1881; inspr. of schools, April, 1897.

PROTUL CHANDAR CHATTERJI, Rai Bahadur, M.A., B.L., Punjab Chief Court.—Joined the service as offg. judge, 14th April, 1894; addl. judge, July, 1894.

PUCKLE, RICHARD KAYE, C.I.E., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Tonbridge Sch., and Haileybury Coll.; entered the Madras civil service in 1851, and was apptd. dep. dir. of rev. settlt. in 1859; collr. and mag., Tinnevelly, 1866; dir. of rev. settlt., 1874, and member of board of rev., 1879; was engaged for 22 years in preparing data for the re-assessment of the lands, and for the revision of govt. estabts. in the ryotwar villages of Madras; employed in famine districts in 1877; C.I.E., 1878; retd. in 1881; publd. a hand-book on rev. matters and the duties of village officers.

PULFORD, RUSSELL RICHARD, Col., R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., 23rd Feb., 1870, as asst. principal, Thomson coll.; asst. engr., June, 1873; exec. engr., March, 1874; served through the Afghan war, 1879-80; suptg. engr., March, 1892; offg. chief engr. and sec. to govt., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, July-Oct., 1894; transf'd. to Rajputana and Central India, May, 1896.

PURSER, WILLIAM EDWARD, late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Enniskillen Royal Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 21st Nov., 1865, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; senr. settlt. officer and dep. commr. of settlt., Jalandhar, Sept., 1880; dep. commr., Dec., 1885; retd., Aug., 1890; author of reports on the settlt. of the Montgomery district, and of the Muktsar and Mamdot parganas.

PURVES, HENRY BLACK, Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Indian Med. Service.—First commn., 1865; from 12th March, 1867, served as civil asst. surgn., and civil surgn., in various stations in Bengal; retd., Dec., 1895.

PUTNAM, JAMES, Pol. Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, registry and record dept., 26th Feb., 1892; transf'd. to pol. dept., Dec., 1895; went to India as confidential clerk on the staff of the Viceroy, Nov., 1897.

PUTNAM, PHILIP, Accntn.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 28th July, 1881.

QUERIPEL, ALFRED ERNEST, Veterinary Lieut.-Col., India Civil Veterinary Dept.—Joined the (home) service, 27th Aug., 1870; arrived in India, 3rd Feb., 1877; served in Afghan war, 1879-80, and with Nile expedy. force, 1884-85; asst. supt., horse breeding operations, Babugarh, 1880-83; reverted to home estabt., April, 1884; apptd. to charge of chief station veterinary hosp., Ambala, and instructor, army veterinary sch., Simla, March, 1891; inspecting veterinary officer, E. circle, Dec., 1893; inspr.-gen., civil veterinary dept., May, 1894; author of an essay on stable management and dietetic disease in India, and of a manual of materia medica for veterinary students.

QUICKE, WILLIAM HENRY, Surgn.-Major, Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1883; acted as Bombay port health officer in 1888-89, and as supt. of vaccn. in the latter year; confd. as civil surgn., Kaira, Sept., 1890; 2nd surgn., Jamsetji Jijibhoj hosp., and profr. of anatomy and curator of museum, Grant med. coll., April, 1893.
QUIN, Henry Osborne, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch., and Trinity Hall, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 13th Nov., 1885, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 2nd asst., March, 1892; administrator, Porbandhar State, Aug., 1896.

QUIN, Thomas James, Col., late Oudh Commn.—First commn., ensign, 13th April, 1859; from May, 1869, served under the govt. of the N.W. Prov. as offg. asst. commr. and cantonmt. mag.; dep. commr., Nov., 1889; served during the Bhutan campaign of 1865 (medal); returned to Europe, March, 1897.

QUINLAN, Francis Peter, late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the accts. branch, Oct., 1870, and was employed on the accts. of various railways in the grades of acctnt., asst. examr., asst. controller, and dep. examr.; examr., Sept., 1881; retd., March, 1895.

QUINN, Charles Campbell, B.A., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at the Royal Sch., Dungannon, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 8th Jan., 1864; served in the rev. and jud. depts., Bengal, and was apptd. mag. and collr., June, 1882; commr., Bhagalpur divn., Oct., 1891; retd., March, 1895.

QUINN, John, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; dep. commr., Oudh, April, 1877, and mag. and collr., Ballia, Dec., 1881; commr., Lucknow divn., March, 1884; offd. as jud. commr., Oudh, in 1884; retd., March, 1888.

RADICE, Charles Albert, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Bedford Sch., and Univ. Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 3rd Jan., 1890, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr. and asst. settlt. officer.

RADICE, Evasio Hampden, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Bedford Sch., and Univ. Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1887, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., asst. supt., Tarai, asst. commr., and joint mag.; city mag. and wasika officer, Lucknow, Aug., 1893; offg. postmr.-gen., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Feb., 1895; joint mag., Nov., 1895; dep. commr., March, 1897.

RAGHUNATH SHIVRAM TIPNIS, B.A., LL.B., Statutory C.S. (Bombay).—Served as subord. judge from July, 1878, and was apptd. as asst. collr. in Bombay, under the native civil service rules, 1st April, 1887; on depn. to the Junagad state, 1893-94; 2nd asst., June, 1894; 1st asst., May, 1897.

RAIKES, Frederic Duncan, C.I.E., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Burma Commn.—Arrived, as ensign, 66th regt., 1st April, 1870; acting asst. supt. of police, Panch Mahals, March, 1873; from May, 1873, served in the Burma commn. as asst. commr., and acted as asst. town mag., Rangoon, 1874-75; transfd. to Upper Burma, Feb., 1886; dep. commr., Aug., 1886; served in the Burmese campaign, 1885-87 (medal and clasp); on special duty with the Chin field force, Dec., 1888; offg. commr., 1892-93 and 1894-95; confd., Oct., 1896.

RAJAGOPALA CHARIYAR, Perungavur, M.A., B.L., Statutory C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Madras Univ.; served in the jud. dept. from 13th May, 1886; dep. collr., Dec., 1887; apptd. probr. for the civil service, 10th Jan., 1888; served as ast. collr. and mag., and was confd., 2nd May, 1890; Dewan to the raja of Cochin, Dec., 1896.

RAJANATH RAY, M.A., Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the dept., Nov., 1872, and served in the Central Prov., and afterwards in Bombay; asst. comptr.-gen., Nov., 1882; dep. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, Aug.-Nov., 1885; dep. comptr.-gen., April-June, 1887; dep. acctnt.-gen., Bengal, April, 1893.

RAJARATHNA MUDALIYAR, Pakam, Dewan Bahadur, Madras Rev. Dept.—Served in the salt dept. from 26th Oct., 1860; head sarishtadar, board of rev., Aug., 1882; sec. to the commr. of rev. settlt. and dir. of the dept. of land records and agric., Nov., 1887; offd. as inspr.-gen. registrn. from July, 1896; member of Madras legislat. council, Nov., 1896.

RAM AUTAR PANDE, Pandit, B.A., Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Joined the service as offg. dep. collr., 13th March, 1884; apptd. asst. mag. and collr. under the statutory service rules, 12th Feb., 1887; joint mag., Nov., 1891; asst. commr., Nov., 1895; addl. judge, July, 1897.

RAM DAYAL, Rai Bahadur, B.A., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll., apptd. apprentice engr., March, 1874; asst. engr., March, 1895; exec. engr., Nov., 1897.

RAMACHANDRA AIYAR, Cuddalore, late Madras Jud. Dept.—Joined the dept., 19th Jan., 1860; 4th presidency mag., Madras, March, 1885; apptd. asst. collr. and mag., Feb., 1887; sub-collr. and joint mag., April, 1888; district and sessions judge, June, 1891; retd., March, 1894.

RAMACHANDRA RAo, Raghunatha Rao, B.A., Madras Rev. Dept.—Apptd. probr. under the native civil service rules, 13th June, 1890, and served as asst. collr. and mag.; dep. collr., July, 1892.

RAMA SHANKAR MISRA, Pandit, M.A., Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Offg. profr. of mathematics, Benares coll., Feb., 1877; resigned, Jan., 1878; rejoined as profr., Agrs coll., 23rd Aug., 1879; apptd. under the native civil service rules asst. mag. and collr., 29th Dec., 1887; joint mag., May, 1892; asst. settlt. officer, Nov., 1893; asst. commr., April, 1896; author of a 'Treatise on Mensuration' in Hindi, and a 'Manual of Rent and Revenue Law.'

RAMPINI, Robert Fulton, M.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at the Acad., Instn., and Univ., Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 28th Nov., 1864, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; joint sessions judge, Sept., 1875; district and sessions judge, July, 1880; judge of high court, Calcutta, April, 1893; edited Alexander's 'Indian Case Law on Torts,' Field's 'Law of Evidence,' and (with Mr. Finucane) 'The Bengal Tenancy Act.'

RAMSAY, Henry Lushington, Major, I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Feb., 1874; acted as asst. to agent to govr.-gen., Rajputana, 1877-78; junr. attache, foreign dept., March, 1878; and seni., June, 1880; pol. officer on staff of Sir F. S. Roberts with the Kuram field force, Sept., 1879 (medal and clasp); asst. to agent to govr.-gen., Rajputana, Oct., 1880; mag. at Abu, and asst. gen. supt., thagi and dakaiti dept., Nov., 1880; asst. agent, Baluchistan, June, 1882; consul at Bassora, May, 1883; cantonmt. mag., Nasirabad, Nov., 1883; British joint commr. of Ladakh, Oct., 1885; pol.
agent, Bhopawar, March, 1891; pol. agent, S. Baluchistan, Nov., 1893; pol. officer with Saradar Ayub Khan, Oct., 1894; author of 'Western Thibet.'

RAMSAY, HERBERT MAYNARD, Col., Police Dept., Bengal.—First commn., 1860; from July, 1863, served in the dept. as asst. supt., district supt., and personal asst. to the inspr.-gen.; on depn. to report on chaukidari system, 1890-91.

RAMSAY, JAMES, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service 8th Oct., 1868; exec. engr., March, 1871; engr.-in-chief, Indus valley state railway, Nov., 1880, and subsequently of the Sind-Sagar and Muskhur-Bolan lines; suptg. engr., Feb., 1890; chief engr., Feb., 1893; retd., July, 1894.

RAMSAY, JOHN, C.I.E., Capt., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 9th Sept., 1882; from July, 1886, served at Ajmir and Indore as acting asst. agent; confid. in latter post, Jan., 1889; pol. agent, Haraoti and Tonk, Dec., 1891; 1st asst., Indore, May, 1892; in addn., asst. gen. supt., thagi and dakaiti, Nov., 1892; pol. agent in Bundelkhand, April, 1893; C.I.E., Jan., 1898.

RANGA CHARLISIVARAPU, B.A., Madras Rev. Dept.—Joined the service, 6th April, 1865; asst. commr. of rev. settl., April, 1887; dep. commr. of rev. settl., Jan., 1889.

RANKIN, JAMES THOMSON, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Glasgow and Edinburgh Univs.; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1892, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and sub-div. officer.

RANKING, GEORGE SPIERS ALEXANDER, M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1875; apptd. sec. to board of examrs., June, 1894; author of a guide to Hindustani for mil. med. officers, a work on Arabic and Persian prosody, &c.

RANSOM, HENRY EDWARD, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Bedford Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 12th Dec., 1885, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and in Assam as asst. commr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., June, 1891; mag. and collr., Nov., 1896.

RASTAMJI MERWANJI PATEL, Khan Bahadur, M.A., LL.B., Bombay Jud. Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Jan., 1894, as 2nd judge, Bombay small cause court.

RATTON, JAMES JOSEPH LOUIS, M.D., M.R.C.S., Surgn.-Major, late Madras Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., 30th Sept., 1867; served in the Abyssinian expdn. (medal); civil surgn., Central Prov., 1869-70; on special duty in connection with salt manufacture, 1872-76; on famine relief works, 1876; zillah surgn. and supt. of jail, Chittur, April, 1877; surgn., gen. hosp., Madras, and prof. in the med. coll., Feb., 1885; fellow of Madras univ., 1886; retd., Jan., 1888; has pubd. a 'Handbook on Common Salt,' a 'Treatise on Tetanus,' and a 'Syllabus of Surgery.'
