RAVENSCROFT, EDWARD W., C.S.I., late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at King Henry VIII.'s Gr. Sch., Ottery St. Mary, and Haileybury Coll.; arrived, 25th May, 1851, and served as asst. collr. and mag.; inspr.-in-chief under the cotton frauds act, Bombay, Feb., 1864; prest. of the municipal commn., Bombay, June, 1864; chief sec. to govt. of Bombay, in the rev., &c., depts., 1877; collr. of Bombay, 1868; member of legisl. council, Bombay, 1871 and 1873; collr. of salt rev., Oct., 1871; senr. collr. and mag., Dec., 1871; member of the Baroda commn. to investigate the charges brought against the Gaekwar; member of govr.'s council, Bombay, April, 1879; retd., March, 1884.

RAVENSHAW, CHARLES WITHERS, Major, I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 8th May, 1872; from Dec., 1875, offd. as asst. cantonmt. mag. at various places; from Feb., 1877, served under the foreign dept. as asst. pol. agent; on special boundary duty in 1879-80; served in Afghan war (medal); supt. of Rajputana railway police, Sept., 1880; asst. commr., Merwara, Dec., 1885; 1st asst. pol. rest., Persian Gulf, July, 1887; cantonmt. mag. and judge, small cause court, Secunderabad, April, 1890; asst. to the rest. in Mysore, and sec. to the chief commr. of Coorg, April, 1891; offg. rest., Gwalior, April, 1895; offg. rest., Mewar, 1897.

RAW, WILLIAM, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Roy. Gr. Sch., Newcastle and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 7th Dec., 1896; and served in the N.W.P. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

RAWLINS, THOMAS WILLIAM, late Indian C.S.—Educ. at Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 17th Jan., 1863, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; small cause court judge, Allahabad, Nov., 1872; served under the govt. of India, fin. dept., from March, 1877; acctnt.-gen., Punjab, and dep. commr. of paper currency, Aug., 1880; acctnt.-gen. and commr. of paper currency, Madras, Oct., 1888; retd., Feb., 1896.

RAWSON, COURTNEY CLARKE, Lieut.-Col., R.E., Madras Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., 27th June, 1871; exec. engr., March, 1878; served in Afghan war, 1878-79 (medal); acted as dep. chief engr. and under sec. to govt. in 1881 and 1882; suptg. engr., Jan., 1896.

RAWSON, EDWARD CRESWELL, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Rossall Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 13th Dec., 1880, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., Jan., 1889; sub-collr. and joint mag., March, 1893; dist. and sess. judge, Dec., 1896.

RAYE, DANIEL O'CONNELL, M.D., Surgn.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., 31st March, 1866; from 1st Sept., 1875, served as rest. surgn., presidency gen. hosp.; prof'r. med. coll., and surgn. to the coll. hosp., May, 1881; principal med. officer, Calcutta, Jan., 1895; inspr.-gen. of civil hosps., Punjab, March, 1895.

RAYMENT, GEORGE JOSEPH, Veterinary Major, late Indian Civil Veterinary Dept.—First commn., 24th July, 1872; apptd. supt., civil veterinary dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, 1st April, 1892; reverted to mil. dept., June, 1894.

REAY (BARON), RIGHT HON. DONALD JAMES MACKAY, G.C.S.I., G.C.I.E., LL.D.—Took his seat as govr. of Bombay, 30th March, 1885; G.C.I.E., June, 1887; G.C.S.I., March, 1890; returned to Europe, April, 1890; was lord rector of the univ. of St. Andrew's, 1884; parly. under sec. of state for India, March, 1894, to July, 1895; chairman, London School Board, Dec., 1897.

REAY, ROBERT WILLIAM, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 23rd Oct., 1894.
REBSCH, SAMUEL, A.M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; joined the service, 1st Oct., 1875, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., April, 1884.

REDFERN, THOMAS ROBERT, B.A., B.L., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at New Coll., Oxford; called to the bar at the Inner Temple; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, and Oct., 1870, and served in Oudh as asst. commr. and offg. settlt. officer; joint mag., May, 1883; district and sessions judge, Sept., 1887; retd., Oct., 1895.

REED, JOHN HENRY FREDERICK, B.A., Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 17th Feb., 1872; B.A., London univ., 1881; junr. clerk, June, 1887.

REES, FREDERICK WILLIAM JOSEPH, B.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Shrewsbury, and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 11th Jan., 1863, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; mag. and collr., April, 1878; from Dec., 1880, served in the jud. dept. as district and sessions judge; retd., Dec., 1887.

REES, JOHN CHARLES, B.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Calcutta Civil Engrg. Coll.; apptd., 8th Aug., 1873, and posted to Burma; exec. engr., Feb., 1882; employed on Burma state railway, 1884-85; received Burma medal and clasp; in charge, Pegu divn., May, 1894.

REES, JOHN DAVID, C.I.E., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., London, and Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 10th Nov., 1875, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; from April, 1882, served in the secretariat as asst sec. and under sec., and in Mysore (1884-85) as acting civil and sessions judge; private sec. to the govr. of Madras, Dec., 1886; fellow of Madras univ., 1887; on special duty in connection with visit of Prince Albert Victor, 1893-94; C.I.E., May, 1890; apptd. collr. and mag. and sessions judge, Nilgiris, Aug., 1890, continuing to act as private sec. until Dec., 1891; acting rest., Travancore, April, 1895; member of govr.-gen.'s legislative council, Oct., 1895 to Oct., 1897; collr. of customs and protector of emigrants, Madras, May, 1897; author of 'Notes of a Journey from Kasween to Hamadan in N.W. Persia,' 'Tours in India by Lord Connewara,' 'The Duke of Clarence in S. India,' and 'Epochs of Indian History: The Muhammandans;' and compiler of 'The Administration of Lord Connewara,' and 'Speeches of Lord Connewara.'

REID, ARTHUR HAY STEWART, M.A., Barrister-at-Law.—Profr. of Law, Muir Coll., Allahabad, May, 1883; offic. as public prosecutor, high court, N.W.P., March, 1895-Jan., 1896; judge, chief court, Punjab, Sept., 1896.

REID, GEORGE BOILEAU, B.A., late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Harrow, and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 26th Nov., 1867, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 1st asst. collr., July, 1878; settlt. officer at Baroda, in 1879 and 1882; junr. collr. and mag., Oct., 1886; collr. and mag., Nov., 1886; senr. collr., May, 1888; commr., N. divn., Nov., 1892; retd. July, 1897.

REID, JAMES ROBERT, C.I.E., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 13th Dec., 1860, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and joint mag., and offg. dep. commr. in Oudh; from Aug., 1868, served as asst. settlt. officer, and settlt. officer, Azamgarh; mag. and collr., Jan., 1873; sec. to govt. of N.W. Prov., Dec., 1883; chief sec. to govt., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, May, 1884; commr., Kumaon divn., Nov., 1888; member of board of rev., Feb., 1890; C.I.E., May, 1890; member of legisl. council, March, 1891; retd., April, 1894.

REID, JOHN WILLIAM, B.L., late Madras C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1855; served from July, 1856, in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., sub-judge, and sub-collr. and joint mag.; from June, 1869, served in Malabar as civil and sessions judge; district and sessions judge, Coimbatore, Oct., 1884; retd., 1886.

REID, WILLIAM JAMES, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Glasgow High Sch. and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 25th Nov., 1891, and served in Assam as asst. commr., and sub. divl. officer.

REILY, CHARLES HORACE, B.L., late Jud. Dept., Bengal.—Joined the service, 1st April, 1876, as reporter for the Indian law reports, Calcutta; in Feb., 1882, was apptd. clerk of the crown and law lecturer, presidency coll.; asst. sec. to the govt. of Bengal, legisl. dept., Nov., 1883; offic. as chief presidency mag. in 1885, and as judge of the court for trial of pilots in 1886-87; resigned, Oct., 1893.

REILY, HENRY MAXWELL, late Police Dept., Bengal.—From May, 1853, served as dep. mag. and dep. collr.; from July, 1863, served in the police dept., and was apptd. district supt., 1st grade, Dec., 1882; on special duty, Garo Hills expdn., Nov., 1872; retd., 1890.

REINOLD, EDWARD KONRAD, late Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 23rd July, 1868, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., Jan., 1879; retd., Jan., 1895.

RENDALL, HUGH DAVY, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Rugby and Trin. Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 4th Dec., 1896, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

RENDEL, SIR ALEXANDER MEADOWS, K.C.I.E.—Educ. at King's Sch., Canterbury, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge (scholar and wrangler); studied as a civil engr., and in 1856 became engr. to the London dock co., the Leith harbour and dock commrs., the East Indian railway, and other companies; visited India in 1857-58, and on various occasions; built the Shadwell new basin, the royal Albert dock, and other works on the Thames, the Albert and Edinburgh docks at Leith, the Workington dock and harbour, and other works; member of the commn. apptd. by the sec. of state for India in 1870, to determine the narrow gauge for Indian railways; designed the Sukkur bridge over the Indus (opened 1880); is consulting engr. to the sec. of state for India, and to various Indian railway cos.

RENDELL, ALAN WOOD, late Public Works Dept., Bengal.—Arrived, March, 1874; joined the dept. as locomotive supt., N. Bengal state railway, 8th Nov., 1877; locomotive supt. of N.E. system, June, 1881; and of E. Bengal state railway, July, 1884; retd., 1890.

RENNICK, ALBERT DE CLANEY, B.L., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Punjab Commn.—First commn., 6th July, 1864; arrived, 28th Nov., 1866; from Oct., 1870, served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; cantonmt. mag., Dec., 1880; dep. commr., May, 1889.
RENNIE, Francis Pepys, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Winchester, and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 23rd December, 1895, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

RENNIE, John George Mackworth, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Winchester, and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 16th Dec., 1881, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; district judge, Dec., 1892; div. judge, July, 1896.

RENNY, Robert Home, Bengal Non-Regulation Commn.—Served in the exec. dept. from 12th Nov., 1864, as dep. mag. and dep. collr. and extra asst. commr.; joined the commn., March, 1877; dep. commr., April, 1890.

RENOUF, Winter Charles, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Victoria Coll., Jersey, and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 14th Dec., 1889, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

REYNOLDS, Charles Henry, M.I.C.E., India Telegraph Dept.—Joined the dept. as asst. supt., 7th Jan., 1868; personal asst. to dir.-gen., 1870, and 1872; in charge of famine divn., 1874; supt., April, 1886; delegate for India at the Berlin telegraph conference, 1885; dir., construction branch, July, 1889; dir., traffic branch, Dec., 1892; dep. dir.-gen., June, 1894; dir.-gen., April, 1895.

REYNOLDS, George Bernard, M.I.C.E., M.I.M.E., M.I.S.I., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 1st Oct., 1875, and posted to state railways; employed in superior rev. establ., locomotive dept., 1879-91; exec. engr. and manager, Warora colliery, April, 1891; retd., Aug., 1897.

REYNOLDS, Herbert John, C.S.I., B.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1855; arrived, 24th Sept., 1856; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., supt. of survey, and mag. and collr.; between 1874 and 1880 served as sec. to the govt. of Bengal, gen. and rev. depts., and as sec. to the board of rev.; member, govt.-gen.'s legisl. council, 1880, and again in 1882 and 1884; member, Bengal legisl. council, 1881, 1883, 1885, and 1887; board of rev., July, 1884; chairman of port commrs., Calcutta, Oct., 1887; retd., April, 1889.

REYNOLDS, Herbert William Ward, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Cheltenham; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 22nd Dec., 1877, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., asst. sec. to govt., and junr. sec., board of rev.; joint mag., Aug., 1890; dep. commr., Dec., 1893; mag. and collr., Jan., 1895.

REYNOLDS, Playford, M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 8th Oct., 1868, and was employed in Khandesh and Gujarat on irrig. works; exec. engr., May, 1879; supt. engr., June, 1896; services lent to Baroda state in 1883-85.

REYNOLDS, William Henry, Survey of India Dept.—Joined the service, 14th March, 1861, and was engaged on survey duty on the N.W. frontier until 1871, including service with the Ambela expedit., 1863; from Jan., 1871, served in the forest dept. as asst. conservator, dep. conservator, and dep. supt. of forest surveys; rejoined the survey dept. as dep. supt., Oct., 1890; supt. of forest surveys, March, 1891.

RHIND, Robert Hunter, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. probr. by the sec. of state, June, 1862; arrived, 7th Dec., 1862, and served in Madras as asst. engr., and exec. engr.; transf'd. to Bengal, Aug., 1872; suptg. engr., Nov., 1886; retd., May, 1893.

RHODES, Francis William, D.S.O., Col., late 1st Royal Dragoons.—First commn., lieut., 23rd April, 1875; served in the Soudan expedit. in 1884 (medal with clasp and Khedive's star); also in Nile expedit. of 1884-85, and in the operations near Suakin, 1888 (3rd class Medjidie); mil. sec. to Lord Harris, govr. of Bombay, 1890-93; retd., Sept., 1896.

RIBBENTROP, Berthold, C.I.E., Forest Dept., Govt. of India.—Apptd. by the sec. of state an asst. conservator of forests, Dec., 1866; conservator, Burma, Oct., 1876; transf'd. to the Punjab, 1883; inspr.-gen. of forests, Jan., 1889; C.I.E., Jan., 1890; author of 'Hints on Arboriculture.

RICE, Percival Stanley Pitcairn, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Winchester, and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 8th Dec., 1890, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

RICE, Walter Francis, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 16th Dec., 1892, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

RICE, William George Lewis, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Oscott Coll., and Jesus Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 10th Nov., 1882, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; transf'd. to Burma, Feb., 1886, as asst. commr.; resigned, Oct., 1890.

RICE, William Roche, M.D., C.S.I., Surg.-Major-Gen.—Joined the Bengal med. service Nov., 1856; served during the Mutiny (medal); civil asst. surgn., Central Prov., June, 1859; civil surgn., Jabalpur, May, 1871; acting asst. to sanitary commr., Central Prov., July, 1872; supt., central jail, Jabalpur, April, 1873; civil surgn., July, 1879; inspr.-gen. of civil hosps., N.W.Prov.and Oudh,Oct.,1887; sanitary commr. and surgn.-gen. to govt. of India, March, 1890; retd., March, 1895.

RICHARD, Henry Joseph, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, July, 1868; asst. engr., Rangoon, 28th Oct., 1868; exec. engr., April, 1875; served with the Burma exp. force, 1885-86 (medal with clasps); supt. of works, Upper Burma, Jan., 1886; suptg. engr., Sept., 1889; chief engr. and sec. to chief commr., Burma, public works dept., Aug., 1895.

RICHARDS, James Day, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Apptd. supplemental clerk, 1st Jan., 1893; 2nd class clerk, Nov., 1896.

RICHARDSON, Edward, Jud. Dept., Burma.—After service in various subord. posts, was apptd. extra asst. commr., 2nd Feb., 1865; first judge, civil court, Mandalay, Sept., 1887.

RICHARDSON, John, M.B., M.A., Surg.-Col., late Med. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Asst. surgn., Bengal med. establ., 27th July, 1859; served with the Bhutan field force (medal and clasp); from April, 1866, was employed under the govt. of the N.W. Prov. as civil asst. surgn., supt. of vaccn., and sanitary commr.; dep. surgn.-gen., Central Prov., May, 1889; inspr.-general of civil hosps., N.W. Prov. and
Oudh, March, 1890; in 1892 acted as surgn.-gen. and sanitary commr. with the govt. of India; retd., May, 1894.

RICHARDSON, THOMAS WILLIAM, Indian C.S.(Bengal).—Educ. at Brighton Coll., Cheltenham Coll., and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 8th Dec., 1886, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; under sec., gen., rev., and statistical depts., March, 1893; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1895; registrar, high court, appellate side, Dec., 1895.

RICHARDSON, WILLIAM PELHAM, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 8th Oct., 1868, and employed on irrigation works in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., Sept., 1872; retd., May, 1896.

RICHEY, Sir James BELLETT, K.C.I.E., C.S.I., late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1856; arrived, 7th Dec., 1856, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., educ. inspr., asst. rev. commr., offg. under sec. to govt., talukdari settl., officer, and asst. to the agent and special commr. at Baroda; junr. collr. and mag., Jan., 1879; senr. collr., May, 1880; on special duty at Kharghadha, 1883 and 1884, and at Baroda, 1884; acting commr. of customs, March, 1884; acting member of council, Bombay, March, 1885, and again, Oct., 1886; chief sec. to govt., pol., &c., depts., May, 1885; confd. as member of council, Bombay, Aug., 1887; retd., March, 1890; K.C.I.E., May, 1890.

RICKETTS, GEORGE H. M., C.B., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Winchester, and Haileybury; apptd., 1847; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and as asst. to the govt.-gen.'s agent, S.W. frontier; from 1853, served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and dept. commr., and from 1858 in the N.W. Prov. as mag. and collr., and civil and sessions judge; C.B. for service in the Punjab in 1857, and medal for service with the troops; commr., Allahabad divn., 1873; junr. member, board of rev., 1878; retd., 1879.

RICKETTS, MONTAGUE POYNTZ, Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—Arrived 22nd March, 1855; served in the Central Prov. from Sept., 1859, as asst. commr.; small cause court judge, Jabalpur, Aug., 1862; dep. commr., May, 1867; addl. commr., Nov., 1883; retd., April, 1890.

RIDDELL, ROBERT VANSITTART, Col., R.E.—Joined Addiscombe, Feb., 1858; lieut., royal engrs., 10th June, 1859; arrived, March, 1861; from Aug., 1862, served in the topogr. survey of India as mil. asst.; dep. sup., Oct., 1867; asst. surveyor-gen. Oct., 1876; apptd. mint master, Calcutta, Jan., 1884; mint master and mint engr., Bombay, Aug., 1889; retd., March, 1895.

RIDGEWAY, The Right Hon. Sir Joseph WEST, K.C.B., K.C.S.I., Col.—First commn., Bengal infantry, Dec., 1860; in civil employ from May, 1868, in the Central India and Rajputana agencies; attaché, foreign dept., 1873; asst. agent to govt.-gen. in Rajputana, 1875; pol. agent, E. states, Rajputana, Aug., 1876; on special pol. duty with the field force in Afghanistan, under Gen. Sir F. Roberts, 1880 (medal with clasp, bronze star); from Sept., 1880, served in the secretariat of the foreign dept., and was apptd. asst. sec., Nov., 1880, and junr. under sec., Dec., 1881; from Aug., 1884, served as asst. with the commn. for the delimitation of the Afghan frontier, and was apptd. H.M.'s commr. for this purpose, Sept., 1885; subsequently was H.M.'s commr. for same purpose at St. Petersburg; ret-

turned to Europe, 1887, and was apptd. under sec. for Ireland; retd. from the army, Aug., 1889; K.C.B., Jan., 1891; envoy to Morocco, Jan., 1893; lieut.-govr. of the Isle of Man, Nov., 1893; apptd. gov. of Ceylon, Sept., 1895.

RIEU, Jean Louis, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Univ. Coll. Sch., London, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 20th Nov., 1891, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

RIGG, Arthur Edmund, B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Kingswood Sch., Bath, and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 15th Dec., 1894, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

RIGG, Henry, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 13th June, 1862, and arrived, 7th Dec., 1862; asst. engr., Feb., 1864; served in various divns. in Madras, and was apptd. exec. engr., March, 1868; on special duty, Upper Burma, 1885-86 (medal and clasps); manager and engr.-in-chief, Burma state railway, June, 1889; consulting engr. to the govt. of India for railways, central divn., May, 1892; chief engr., Aug., 1892; consulting engr. for railways, Lucknow, Jan., 1896.

RIGHY, Vans, M.I.C.E., late Public Works Dept., Bengal.—Apptd. proby. asst. engr., Feb., 1856; exec. engr., March, 1871; from Jan., 1875, was employed on Tirhut state railway, and was apptd. manager and supt. of way and works, Tirhut and Patna Gya state railways, March, 1880; transf. to superior rev. estabt., Oct., 1882; supt. of way and works, N.W. railways, 1886; retd., Dec., 1891.

RILEY, Henry James, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 3rd April, 1882.

RIPON (Marquess of), The Right Hon. George Frederick Samuel Robinson, K.G., G.C.S.I., C.I.E., P.C., D.C.L.—Born 24th Oct., 1827; attache to a special mission to Brussels, 1849; sat in the house of commons (as Viscount Goderich) as member for Hull, 1852-53, for Huddersfield, 1853-57, and for the W. Riding of Yorkshire, 1857-59, in which year he succeeded to the upper house; under sec. for war, June, 1859; pres. of the royal geographical society, 1860; under sec. for India, Jan.-July, 1861; sworn a privy councillor, April, 1863; lord high steward of Hull, Oct., 1863; sec. for war, April, 1863, to Feb., 1866; sec. of state for India, Feb.-July, 1866; lord pres. of the council, Dec., 1868, to Aug., 1873; K.G., 1869; hon. D.C.L., Oxford, 1870; chairman of the joint high commn. which arranged the treaty of Washington, 1871; created Marquess of Ripon, 1871; viceroy and govt.-gen. of India, June, 1880, to Dec., 1884; was a royal commr. for the London exhibn. of 1886; first lord of the admiralty, Feb.-Aug., 1886; sec. of state for the colonies, Aug., 1892, to July, 1895.

RISLEY, Herbert Hope, C.I.E., B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Winchester, and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 24th Oct., 1873, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. to dir.-gen. of statistics; asst. sec., govt. of Bengal, Oct., 1877; under sec., rev. and gen. depts., Jan., 1878; offg. under sec., govt. of India, some dept., Feb., 1879; asst. commr., Jan., 1880; supt. of survey of Ghautwali and other service tenures in Manbhum, Feb., 1884; employed on the special duty of compiling statistics relat-
ing to the castes and occupations of the people of Bengal, Jan., 1885; dep. commr., April, 1886; sec., police commn., collr. and mag., May, 1890; sec. to govt. of Bengal, finl. and municipal depts., July, 1892; member of provl. legisl. council, 1892-93, and from March, 1895; C.I.E., Jan., 1892; author of 'Sikkim and Tibet,' 'Tribes and Castes of Bengal,' an 'Ethnographic Glossary,' and other works on ethnology.

RITCHIE, JOHN GERALD, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Winchester, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 28th Oct., 1875, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., March, 1887; dep. commr., May, 1891; mag. and collr., Dec., 1891; chairman of Calcutta commrs., April, 1895.

RITCHIE, RICHMOND THACKERAY WILLOUGHBY, India Office.—Educ. at Eton, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; junr. clerk, finl. dept., 18th May, 1877; rev., statistics and commerce dept., 1881; private sec. to partly under sec. of state, 1883-92; senr. clerk, Oct., 1892; private sec. to permanent under sec., Oct., 1892, to Feb., 1894; sec. to royal commn. on Indian expenditure, May, 1895, but resigned on appt. as private sec. to sec. of state (Lord George Hamilton), July, 1895.

RIVAZ, CHARLES MONTGOMERY, C.S.I., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Blackheath Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 28th Nov., 1864, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and offg. under sec. and sec. to govt.; supt., Kapurthala state, April, 1877; dep. commr., April, 1885; sec. to Punjab govt., May, 1887; commr. and supt., Nov., 1888; and finl. commr., Feb., 1893; C.S.I., May, 1895; addl. member of legislative council of gov. gen., May, 1896-Oct., 1896; offg. ord. member of gov.-gen's Council, Oct., 1897.

RIVAZ, GEORGE WILMOT, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Blackheath Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 29th Oct., 1870, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; registrar, chief court, Punjab, 1877-84; district judge, Aug., 1886; divl. judge, March, 1891; edited the 2nd edn. of the circular orders of the chief court.

RIVETT-CARNAC, CHARLES JAMES, Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the dept., 21st May, 1872, and served in the N.W. Prov. and the Punjab; asst. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, Oct., 1882; asst. comptr.-gen. (forest branch), Oct., 1884; asst. acctnt.-gen., Bengal, March, 1885; comptr., Central Prov., Nov., 1891; transf. to Burma, Nov., 1895.

RIVEITT-CARNAC, JOHN HENRY, C.I.E., A.D.C. to the Queen, V.D., F.S.A.; late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 12th Nov., 1858, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; offg. under sec., govt. of India, home dept., Sept., 1861; asst. sec. to the chief commr., Central Prov., June, 1862; settl. officer, Chanda and Wardha, Aug., 1864; cotton commr., Central Prov., Sept., 1866, and Berars, April, 1867; commr. of cotton and commerce with the govt. of India, Dec., 1871; member and hon. sec. of central committee of international exhibs.; on duty in England, 1872-73; special commr. of transport, Bengal famine; opium agent, Benares, March, 1875; retd., Feb., 1894; author of reports on Indian cotton cultivation and trade, and on the interchange of traffic on Indian railways, &c.

RIX, HARRY SIDNEY, B.A., Indian C.S., (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Sherborne Sch., and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 28th Dec., 1894, and served in N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

ROBARTS, HARRY OCTAVIUS WARWICK, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Blundell's Sch., Tiverton, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 15th Dec., 1890, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., and asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., April, 1896.

ROBB, JOHN, M.D., C.M., Surgn.-Major, late Med. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the Indian med. service, 1st Oct., 1868; from Nov., 1873, served as civil surgn.; Zanzibar, and acted as asst. pol. agent in 1874-75 and 1881; from July, 1882, served under the govt. of Bombay, as civil surgn., jail supt., &c., at Aden, Surat, and Ahmadabad; retd., Nov., 1880.

ROBERTS, ALLAN SCOTT, Lieut.-Col., Bengal Infantry, late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 2nd April, 1862; from June, 1866, served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and jud. asst.; dep. commr., Nov., 1884; retd., Dec., 1894.

ROBERTS, ARTHUR WILLIAM, Col., late Pol. Dept., Govt. of India.—Cornet, Bengal cavalry, Feb., 1859; asst. to gov-r.-gen's agent, Rajputana, 1864; cantonmt.mag., Morar, Feb., 1875; asst. commr., Merwara, April, 1881; pol. asst., Sujangarh, Aug., 1881; in 1881-82 was employed in operations against the rebellious Bikaran thakurs, and received the surrender of the fort of Nahargarh; asst. pol. agent, Banswara and Partabgarh, Aug., 1883; pol. agent and supt., Charkhari, Sept., 1884; cantonmt. mag., Nasirabad, Dec., 1885; pol. agent, Jacobabad, Dec., 1887; Khelat, March, 1888; Alwar, May, 1888; asst. agent, Mount Abu, Nov., 1888; pol. agent, Kotah, April, 1889; cantonmt. mag., Nasirabad, Sept., 1889; returned to Europe, Feb., 1897.

ROBERTS, CHARLES HAMILTON, Kunnaun Commn.—Joined the service, 25th Feb., 1874, and served as extra asst. commr. and cantonmt. mag.; dep. collr., Jan., 1887; on special duty in Garhwal, April, 1890; supt., Tarai, Sept., 1890; dep. commr., Naini Tal, Oct., 1891.

ROBERTS, DAVID THOMAS, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Liverpool, Liverpool Inst. and London Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 14th Nov., 1868, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., April, 1879; dep. commr., Dec., 1886; mag. and collr., June, 1887; commr., April, 1894; author of 'Ballia Gazetteer' (in part), and of the Ballia settl. report.

ROBERTS (BARON), RIGHT HON. FREDERICK SLEIGH, V.C., G.C.B., G.C.S.I., G.C.I.E., Field-Marshal, R.A.—First commn., Bengal artillery, 1851; during the Mutiny served at the siege and capture of Delhi, &c. (medal and three clasps, V.C.); dep. asst. quartermaster-gen., Bengal, April, 1858; served in the N.W. frontier expedn., 1863 (medal and clasp); asst. quartermaster-gen., Bengal, Feb., 1863; served with the Abyssinian expedn., 1868 (medal), and with the Lushai expedn., 1871-72; dep. quartermaster-gen., Bengal, Jan., 1872; quartermaster-gen., Bengal, Jan., 1875; during the operations in Afghanistan in 1878-9-80, com-
manded the Kuram valley field force, and subsequently the Kabul field force at the occupation of Kabul and battle of Charasiah, and in the march to the relief of Kandahar (medal with four clasps, bronze star, thanks of both houses of parliament, created a bart., K.C.B., G.C.B.); commander-in-chief, Madras, and member of govr.'s council, Nov., 1881; commander-in-chief, in India, and member of the govr.-gen.'scouncil, Nov., 1885, to April, 1893; created a peer, Jan., 1892; G.C.S.I., June, 1893; field-marshal, May, 1895; commander-in-chief in Ireland, Oct., 1895.

ROBERTS, SYDNEY GORDON, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Haileybury Coll., and Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 27th Nov., 1893, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

ROBERTS, THOMAS, M.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Cheltenham Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, Nov., 1863, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., jud. asst., and dep. commr.; addl. commr., Jalandhar, Aug., 1884; divl. judge, Nov., 1884; retd., April, 1891.

ROBERTS, WILLIAM HOWLAND, M.D., Surgn.-Col., late Madras Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., 23rd July, 1858; arrived, 24th Sept., 1858, and served in the Central Prov. till Sept., 1864, and subsequently in Madras as civil surg., supt. of jail, &c.; was also in charge of meteorological observatories at Coimbatore and Salem; reverted to mil. duty, Sept., 1885; retd., July, 1893.

ROBERTSON, BENJAMIN, C.I.E., Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at the Inst., Elgin, the Gr. Sch. and Univ. of Aberdeen, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 28th Nov., 1885, and served in Bombay as asst. collr.; transfd. to Central Prov. as provl. supt. of census operations, April, 1890; asst. commr., Oct., 1892; commr. of excise, Oct., 1894; dep. commr., Nov., 1894; C.I.E., Jan., 1898.

ROBERTSON, CHARLES, M.D., Dep. Surgn.-Gen., late Madras Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., 4th Aug., 1856; arrived, 17th Dec., 1856; served under the mil. dept. and also as zillah surgn., Masulipatam (1862-65); from May, 1874, served as zillah surgn., and supt. of jail, Cuddalore; retd., Dec., 1885.

ROBERTSON, DONALD, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Ensign, royal Scots fusiliers, Aug., 1865; arrived, Oct., 1865; served from Nov., 1866, as asst. commr. in the Central Prov.; transfd. to Rajputana, June, 1872; cantonmt. mag., Nasirabad, May, 1877; offg. asst. commr., Merwara and Ajmir, 1877-78; offg. supt., Jhalawar, 1879; 1st ass't. agent, Indore, 1881; pol. agent, Bhopawar, Feb., 1885; pol. agent, Bundelkhand, May, 1885; asst. to the rest. in Mysore, and sec. to the chief commr. of Coorg, Dec., 1886; pol. agent in Baghelkhand, and supt. of the Rewa state, Dec., 1888; rest., Gwalior, Feb., 1894; offg. govr.-gen.'s agent, Central India, April, 1895; rest. and chief commr., Mysore and Coorg, Dec., 1896.

ROBERTSON, ELPHINSTONE FOURTALES, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 27th March, 1851, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., dep. commr. of customs, salt, and opium, and sub-collr. and joint mag.; senr. collr. and mag., Dharwar, Jan., 1873; rev. and police commr., Nov., 1876; commr. of the central divn., Jan., 1878; retd., 1886.

ROBERTSON, FREDERICK ALEXANDER, B.L., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 5th Dec., 1876, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and settlt. officer; special duty, Maler Kotla settlt. operations, Nov., 1888; dir. of land records and agric., Dec., 1889; divl. judge, Nov., 1890; author of 'Customary Law of Rawalpindi District,' and of reports on the revised settlt. and forest settlt. of that district.

ROBERTSON, SIR GEORGE SCOTT, K.C.S.I., Surgn.-Major, Indian Med. Service.—Educ. at Westminster Hosp.; joined the service, 30th March, 1878; served through the Afghan war, 1879-80; civil surgn., N.W. Prov., 1880-88; on depn. to Gilgit, June, 1888; agency surgn., Gilgit, July, 1889; on special duty in Kafiristan, 1890-91; chief pol. officer, Hunza-Nagar expdn., 1891; C.S.I., May, 1892; offg. agent, Gilgit, May-Oct., 1892; mission to Gor and capture of Chilas, 1892; in charge, Chitral mission, 1893; agent, Gilgit, Jan., 1894; K.C.S.I., July, 1895, for his defence of Chitral fort.

ROBERTSON, GRAHAM, Bengal Marine Dept.—Joined the service, 25th Feb., 1891; 2nd marine surveyor, Calcutta port, Nov., 1892; 1st engr. and shipwright surveyor, June, 1895.

ROBERTSON, JAMES CASAMAJOR, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1854; arrived, 31st Jan., 1855, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., asst. supt., Dehra Dun, small cause court judge, and joint mag.; mag. and collr., Allahabad, Oct., 1871; offg. inspr.-gen. of registn., and commr. of excise and stamps, July, 1876; civil and sessions judge, April, 1879; commr., Jan., 1882; offd. as member of the board of rev. on various occasions; retd., Jan., 1890.

ROBERTSON, JOHN HERBERT, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Sir Roger Cholmeley's Sch., Highgate, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 29th Nov., 1889, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; special asst., Oct., 1896.

ROBERTSON, LAURENCE, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Glasgow Acad., Glasgow Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 23rd Dec., 1893, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; compiled general admn. report, 1896-7.

ROBERTSON, WILLIAM, Funds Dept., India Office.—Clerk, and class, India audit office, 27th Feb., 1886; transfd. to funds dept., India office, 3rd Dec., 1894.

ROBERTSON, WILLIAM ROWNTREE, M.R.A.C., late Madras Educn. Dept.—Arrived, 21st Nov., 1868; supt., govt. farms, Nov., 1868; supt. of the sch. of agric., Saidapet, Oct., 1876; fellow of Madras univ., May, 1882; supt., govt. farms and sch. of agric., and agric. reporter to govt. of Madras, Nov., 1882; principal, agric. coll., Saidapet, April, 1884; retd., April, 1889.

ROBINSON, ALEXANDER, B.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Royal Sch., Armagh, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 9th Nov., 1865, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., and dep. commr.; mag. and collr., April, 1887; retd., Sept., 1892; author of 'Memoirs of the Ballia and Jaunpur Districts.'

ROBINSON, WILLIAM, B.A., Mil. Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Carmichael Sch., Queen's Coll.,
Cork, and the Royal Univ. of Ireland; junr. clerk, 11th June, 1894; rest. clerk, Dec., 1894-May, 1897.

ROBSON, SAMUEL, M.A., Bengal Educl. Dept.—Educ. at Edinburgh Univ.; joined the dept., 20th Dec., 1878, as prof.; presidency coll.; transfd. to Patna coll., June, 1880; and to Hughli coll., Jan., 1883; again prof., Patna coll., Aug., 1888; principal, Dacca Coll., March, 1897.

ROE, SIR CHARLES ARTHUR, M.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Merton Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1863, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and settlt. officer; dep. commr., Nov., 1878; addl. commr., Lahore and Rawal Pindi divns., May, 1883; div. judge, Nov., 1884; addl. judge, chief court, Nov., 1888; judge, April, 1890; chief judge, Dec., 1895; Kt., Jan., 1897; author of 'Customary Law of the Multan District,' and of three settlt. reports.

ROE, FRANCIS REGINALD, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Winchester and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 8th Nov., 1890, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

ROE, WILLIAM ALEXANDER CRAWFORD, Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Med. Dept., Punjab.—Joined the service, 1st Oct., 1869; in mil. employ till 22nd March, 1873, when he was apptd. offg. civil surgn., Jalandhar; in 1879 served with the Kuram valley field force; confd. as civil surgn., Sept., 1880; med. adviser to Maharaja of Kapurthala, April to Oct., 1885; sanitary commr., Punjab, May, 1894.

ROGERS, ALEXANDER, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1845; arrived, 9th Nov., 1845; served in the Bombay rev. and jud. dept., and was apptd. 1st asst. collr. and mag., Broach, Oct., 1851, and afterwards at Ahmadabad, Oct., 1852; settlt. officer, Gujarat, Nov., 1852; collr. and mag., Ahmadabad, March, 1860, and afterwards at Surat; rev. and police commr., N. divn., April, 1865; member of council, Bombay, June, 1872; retd. in 1879; author of a transl. of three modern Persian plays, a 'History of the Land Rev. Settlt. of Bombay,' and a transl. of 'Yusuf and Zuleika'; has also edited the 'Bostan' of Sa'di.

ROGERS, CECIL ALFRED PELHAM, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Portora School, Enniskillen, and Dublin Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived 4th Dec., 1896, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

ROGERS, ERNEST, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Bedford Gr. Sch. and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 25th Nov., 1887, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Dec., 1890; dep. commr., Dec., 1896.

ROGERS, HENRY THOMAS, Major-Gen., R.E., late Madras Rev. Survey Dept.—Second lieut., Dec., 1849; arrived, 28th Aug., 1852; served in the public works dept., Bengal, 1853-59, and subsequently in Madras as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; fellow of the univ. ot Madras, 1872; principal, civil engrg. coll., April, 1871, to Jan., 1880; from Nov., 1879, served as supt. of rev. survey, Madras; retd., July, 1886.

ROGERS, MALCOLM WILLIAM, Col., R.E., late Survey of India Dept.—Lieut., royal engrs., Dec., 1861; arrived, Oct., 1865; asst. surveyor, great trigonl. survey, July, 1866; served with the Quetta field force as survey officer, 1878-79 (medal); dep. supt. of survey, July, 1882; asst. surveyor-gen., May, 1884, to Sept., 1887; supt. (new scale), Aug., 1892; again asst. surveyor-gen. in charge of surveyor-gen.'s office and mathematical instrument office, from May, 1889.

ROGERS-HARRISON, AUGUSTUS NAPOLEON, Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Oct., 1879, and was employed under the mil. dept. until Dec., 1880, when he was apptd. civil surgn. and supt. of jail and lunatic asylum, Vizagapatam; civil surgn., Salem, June, 1887; district med. and sanitary officer, Oct., 1895.

ROLLAND, ALEXANDER TULLOCH, Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Madras.—Ensign, Madras infantry, April, 1856; served in the dept. from Dec., 1862, as asst. supt., and supt.; dep. inspr.-gen. of police, Feb., 1885; acted as commr. of police, Madras city, in 1889; reverted to mil. dept., Oct., 1893.

ROLLO, JAMES THEODORE, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 7th Oct., 1870, and posted to Rajputana; transfd. to Assam, June, 1880; exec. engr., May, 1881; transfd. to Burma, June, 1892.

ROMESH CHUNDER DUTT, C.I.E., B.L., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Colootola Branch Sch., Calcutta, Presidency Coll., Calcutta Univ., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 28th Sept., 1871; served in rev. and jud. depts., Bengal, and was apptd. mag. and collr., March, 1888; acted as commr., Bardwan, 1894-95; member of provl. legisl. council, Jan.-Oct., 1895; retd., Oct., 1897; has published 'Three Years in Europe,' 1872; 'Peasantry of Bengal,' 1876; 'Literature of Bengal,' 1877; a 'History of Civilisation in Ancient India,' 1888-89; a 'Brief History of Ancient and Modern India,' 1891; 'Lays of Ancient India, 1894;' &c., &c.

ROMESH CHUNDER MITTER, Sir, B.L.—Puise judge, high court, Calcutta, 30th March, 1874; acted as chief justice in 1882; retd., 1890; member of the govr.-gen.'s legisl. council to Aug., 1891.

RONSON, WILLIAM TOMLINSON, Rev. and Statistics Dept., India Office.—Writer, 1st Sept., 1873; clerk, 2nd class, Feb., 1879; junr. clerk, Feb., 1894.

ROPER, CAMPBELL ROWLEY, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Shrewsbury Sch., Trinity Coll., Dublin, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 10th Dec., 1894, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

ROSE, BENJAMIN JAMES, Rev. and Statistics Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Williams' Gr. Sch., Clapham, and the Birkebeck Instn.; entered the India office, 23rd Feb., 1871; technical asst. in the rev. and statistics dept., June, 1882; also clerk to the special assts., 1891; awarded gold medal at Amsterdam exhibn. for statistical diagrams shewing the condition and progress of British India; prepared abstract catalogue of the Indian section at the same exhibn.; also reports on wheat and Madras tobacco.

ROSE, EDWARD, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Folkingham Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 7th Nov., 1868, and served in the N.W. Prov. and in Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and asst. commr.; mag. and collr., Aug., 1887; offg. commr., Gorakhpur, April-Oct., 1894; commr., Agra, June, 1896.
ROSE, EDWARD ERNEST PILKINGTON, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Shrewsbury, Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 26th Nov., 1896, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

ROSE, FRANCIS ERNEST, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 1st Sept., 1865, and posted to Central Prov.; transld. to the Punjab, Nov., 1866; exec. engr., Jan., 1877.

ROSE, GEORGE PRINGLE, C.I.E., A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1877; posted to state railways, Nov., 1878; exec. engr., Feb., 1891; C.I.E., 1892; lent to Nizam's govt., April, 1895.

ROSE, HORACE ARTHUR, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch. and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 4th Oct., 1888, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

ROSS, ALEXANDER, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at the Acad. and Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. from Haileybury, 1836; served in the jud. and rev. depts. of the N.W. Prov., and was apptd. mag. and collr., 1853; special commr., Farakhabad, Dec., 1857; civil and sessions judge, 1858; commr.of rev. and police, Agra divn., May, 1859; judge of the sadar court, N.W. Prov., 1862; judge, high court, N.W. Prov., 1866; retd., Oct., 1871.

ROSS, ALLAN, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Beaumont Coll., Windsor, and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 7th Jan., 1892, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

ROSS, DAVID (Burma Commn.)—Joined the service, March, 1886, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

ROSS, SIR EDWARD CHARLES, Kt., C.S.I., Col., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Ensign, 3rd European regt., Bombay, May, 1855; served in Central India during the Mutiny (medal and clasp); asst. to pol. agent, Muscat, 1863; asst. pol. agent, Gwadur, 1869; pol. agent and consul, Muscat, April, 1871; pol. rest., Persian Gulf, Oct., 1872; also consul-gen. for Fars and the Persian Gulf, Nov., 1878; offg. rest., Haidarabad, April-Oct., 1886; reverted to mil. dept., 1891; Kt., Jan., 1892; author of several reports and memoranda on subjects connected with the Persian Gulf.

ROSS, GEORGE CUMBERLAND, Surgn.-Col., Bengal Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 2nd Oct., 1865; arrived, 11th April, 1866; served from Nov., 1867, as civil surgn. in various stations in the Punjab; administrative med. officer and sanitary commr., Central Prov., Jan., 1884; inspr.-gen. of civil hosps., Bengal, March, 1895.

ROSS, HENRY THOMAS, M.A., LL.B., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Perth Acad., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 26th Oct., 1873, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settl. officer; special asst., Malabar, Sept., 1884; acting subsec., board of rev., Aug., 1885; registrar, high court, Feb., 1886; sub-collr. and joint mag., Sept., 1888; district and sessions judge, Nov., 1889.

ROSS, HERCULES GREY, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1856; arrived, 16th Nov., 1856; from April, 1858, served in the N.W. Prov. and in Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., asst. commr., and city mag. at Lucknow; supt., Dehra Dun, Dec., 1869; mag. and collr., Benares, Oct., 1882; settl. officer, Dehra Dun, Oct., 1883; commr., Kumaon, April, 1885; retd., Nov., 1888.

ROSS, WILLIAM.—Apptd. supt. of govt. printing, India, 1st May, 1891.

ROSSITER, CHARLES ARTHUR, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Apptd. supplemental clerk, 1st Jan., 1893.

ROSSITER, REGINALD ARTHUR, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Royal Univ., Ireland, and Univ. of Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 21st Dec., 1895, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

ROUSE, ROBERT, Dep. Surgn.-Gen., late Med. Dept., Punjab.—Joined the Indian med. dept. in 1854; from May, 1869, served as civil surgn. and offg. supt. of jail in the Punjab; retd., Sept., 1885.

ROUTH, REGINALD SAMUEL JOHN, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. 1st October, 1876, and posted to State Railways as asst. engr.; exec. engr., June, 1889.

ROWE, FREDERICK JAMES, M.A., Educn. Dept., Bengal.—Joined the service, 15th June, 1870, and served as profr. at Krishnagar, Dacca, and Hugli colls., also as inspr. of schs.; profr. presidency coll., July, 1880; joint author of various educ. works, &c.

ROWE, JOSIAH EBENEZER, late Punjab Commn.—Joined the service, 20th March, 1858, and served in the Punjab in various capacities; extra asst. commr., Oct., 1865; small cause court judge in 1874, 1875, and 1881-84; extrajud. asst., Nov., 1884; retd., Nov., 1894.

ROWLANDS, PERCY JONES, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—East India house writer, old establ., 1st Sept., 1858; asst. to registrar, June, 1877.

ROXBURGH, JAMES, Finl. Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 30th Dec., 1895.

ROY, MADHUB CHUNDER, B.A., B.C.E., M.I.C.E., Rai Bahadur, late India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Calcutta Civil Engrg. Coll.; apptd., 16th Sept., 1862, and posted to Bengal; exec. engr., March, 1872; retd., 1894.

ROYLE, JOSEPH R. E. J., C.I.E.—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., London; entered Indian army from Addiscombe, 7th June, 1861; retd., Jan., 1867; on the extra staff of the India museum, 1st Jan., 1867; sec., Indian commn. for Vienna exhibn., 1873; supt., India museum, 1874; clerk to the special asst. in the statistics and commerce dept., India office, 1879-91; exec. commr. for govt. of India, Amsterdam exhibn., 1883; asst. sec. for India to royal commn. for the Colonial and Indian exhibn., 1886, and official agent for the govt. of India; C.I.E., 1886; curator of Indian section, Imperial Inst., 1891; author of the official reports on the Indian sections of the Amsterdam and Colonial and Indian exhibns.; also of a lecture before the Society of Arts, June, 1882, on the 'Production of Tea, Cinchona, Wild Silks, and Rhea in India.'

RUNDALL, FRANCIS HORNBLOW, C.S.I., Gen., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Madras engrs., 1841; asst. civil engr., 1844; civil engr., public works dept., Ganjam, 1854; district engr., Rajamahendri, May, 1855; consulting engr., Madras irrign. and canal co., Oct., 1859; chief engr. of irrign. and joint sec. to govt. of Bengal, July, 1867; chief engr., 1st class, Aug., 1869; inspr.-gen. of irrign. and dep. sec. to govt. of
India, April, 1872, to April, 1874; C.S.I., Dec., 1875.

RUNDALL, JAMES WILLIAM, M.I.C.E., late Public Works Dept., Madras.—Joined the dept. as supernumerary engr., 2nd Aug., 1855; exec. engr., July, 1863; supt. of works, Kista, Aug., 1880; suptg. engr., Oct., 1881; retd., 1889.

RUSSELL, ALEXANDER SHERWOOD, Madras Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; joined the service, 1st Oct., 1875; asst. to chief engr. and under sec. to govt., irrig. branch, in 1882; exec. engr., April, 1886.

RUSSELL, CHARLES LENNOX SOMERVILLE, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Rugby, and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 1st Dec., 1893, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

RUSSELL, EDGAR GEORGE, M.B., B.Sc., Brigade-Surgn.—Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 30th March, 1872, and served on gen. and mil. duty, and in various offg. appts.; civil surgn., Patna, March, 1890; Darjiling, April, 1892; Dacca, March, 1894; prof., Calcutta med. coll., Sept., 1896; author of a work on 'Malaria and Injuries of Spleen.'

RUSSELL, SIR EDWARD LECHMERE, K.C.S.I., Gen.—Ensign, 12th native infantry, Bombay, Jan., 1838; served in the Afghan war of 1842, and the Sind campaign of 1842-43; fort adjutant, Bombay, Jan., 1855; remount agent, May, 1857; commanding brigade, Disa, March, 1863, and subsequently at Bombay; pol. rest. and commanding brigade, at Aden, Dec., 1867; commanding northern divn., Bombay, 1870-76; placed on unemployed list, July, 1881.

RUSSELL, GEORGE WILLIAM ERSKINE.—Educ. at Harrow, and Univ. Coll., Oxford; M.P., Aylesbury, 1880-85; parly. sec. to local govt. board, 1883-85; alderman of the county of London, Feb., 1889; M.P. for N. Bedfordshire, 1892-95; under sec. of state for India, Aug., 1892; under sec. of state, home dept., March, 1894, to July, 1895; author of a 'Life of Mr. Gladstone,' and editor of 'The Letters of Matthew Arnold.'

RUSSELL, ROBERT VANE, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Winchester, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 5th Sept., 1893, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

RUSSELL, SAMUEL, B.A., LL.B., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Santry Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 7th Nov., 1877, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settl. officer; special asst., Ganjam, Feb., 1885; sub-collr. and joint mag., April, 1890; district and sessions judge, Feb., 1893.

RUSTAMJI DHANJIBHAI SETHNA, B.A., LL.B., B.L., Bombay High Court.—Joined the service, 27th March, 1886, as acting profr., Bombay law sch.; confd., Feb., 1889; registrar of the high court, appellate side, July, 1895.

RUTHERFORD, DAVID, Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, July, 1867, as proby. asst. engr.; exec. engr., Feb., 1873.

RUTHERFORD, JAMES, Col., late Mysore Rev. Survey.—First commn., ensign, 4th Aug., 1859; joined the Mysore rev. survey dept., Jan., 1865; dep. supt., April, 1881; reverted to mil. dept., Nov., 1892.

RYLAND, WILLIAM HENRY, late Jud. Dept., Bengal.—From 10th Dec., 1852, served in the subord. exec. service, Bengal; offg. collr. of stamps, and supt. of abkari rev., March, 1868; offg. asst. sec., govt. of Bengal, May, 1869; from Dec., 1874, served in the jud. dept. and was apptd. judge of the small cause court at Sealdah, April, 1875; offg. supt. of stamps and stationery, April, 1880; retd., April, 1887.

RYVES, ROBERT HUGH, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 15th Nov., 1891, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr. and acting under sec.

RYVES, THOMAS JAMES, Local Capt., late Police Dept., N.W. Prov.—Served as a volunteer in the Mutiny (medal); adjutant of mil. police, Bijnaur, 1859; asst. inspr.-gen., Rohilkhand, April, 1861; from Aug., 1861, served as supt. of police in various districts; asst. inspr.-gen., railway police, June, 1888; dep. inspr.-gen., June, 1892; retd., Jan., 1895.

SABONADIERE, ALFRED, Indian C.S., N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Charterhouse, and St. John's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 19th Jan., 1888, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., and asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., March, 1893.

SADLER, JAMES HAYES, Lieut.-Col., Indian Staff Corps.—First commn., 5th July, 1870; mil. duty to July, 1877; offg. asst. pol. agent, Mahi Kantha, July, 1877; asst. pol. agent, Baroda, May, 1881; pol. agent, Muskat, Nov., 1892; asst. sec., govt. of India, foreign dept., April, 1895; asst. pol. rest., Aden, and pol. agent for Somali coast, Jan., 1897.

ST. CLAIR, THE HON. LOCKHART MATHEW, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1876, and posted to Central Prov.; exec. engr., Jan., 1884; services lent to Nepal state, 1886-92; transd. to Assam, April, 1894; on special duty, office of chief commr. public works dept., Central Prov., April, 1897.

ST. QUINTIN, WILLIAM ASTELL, India Audit Office.—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and Blackheath Proprietary Sch.; temporary clerk, 31st Dec., 1866; junr. examr., Dec., 1868; senr. examr., Nov., 1878; designation changed to senr. clerk, Oct., 1892.

SAIYID MAHMUD, B.L., late High Court, N.W. Prov.—Educ. at the Delhi Govt. Coll., Queen's Coll., Benares, and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; joined the service as district judge, Oudh, 1st Aug., 1879; served under foreign dept., 1881-82; district judge, Rae Bareli, Nov., 1883; judge of high court, N.W. Prov., May, 1887; retd., Dec., 1893; author of 'The Law of Evidence in British India' (in Hindustani).

SALAMAN, SELIM MYER, M.A., M.D., M.Ch., Brigade-Surgn.—Lieut.-Col., Bombay Jail Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Oct., 1869; civil surgn. and supt. of jail, Bijapur, Nov., 1870; from Feb., 1872, served under the mil. dept. until June, 1874, when he was apptd. offg. civil surgn. and supt. of jail, Shikarpur; supt., Yeranda central jail, May, 1878; in addn. supt., Poona city jail, Dec., 1878.

SALE, EDWARD LITTLE, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Bury St. Edmunds Sch., and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 22nd Dec., 1894, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settl. officer.

SALE, STEPHEN G., B.L.—Entered the service
as offg. judge nigh court, Calcutta, March, 1893; confd., Jan., 1895.

SALIG RAM, Rao Bahadur, late Postal Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Served in the dept. from March, 1847; inspr., post offices, Agra divn., July, 1876; supt., Agra divn., April, 1881; postmr.-gen., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, June, 1884; retd., 1887.

SALISBURY (MARQUESS OF), RIGHT HON. ROBERT ARTHUR TALBOT GASCOIGNE CECIL, K.G., P.C., D.C.L., LL.D., M.A.—Born in 1830; educ. at Eton and Christ Church, Oxford, where he graduated, and was elected a fellow of All Souls' Coll. in 1853; represented Stamford in the house of commons from 1853 to 1868, when he succeeded to the upper house; sec. of state for India, July, 1866, to March, 1867; chancellor of the univ. of Oxford, Nov., 1869; in 1871-72 acted with Lord Cairns in conducting the investigation into the affairs of the London, Chatham, and Dover railway company; sec. of state for India, second time, Feb., 1874; was sent as special ambassador to the Sublime Porte in 1876, and acted with Sir Henry Elliot as joint plenipotentiaries of Great Britain at the conference of Constantinople, Dec., 1876; was apptd. sec. of state for foreign affairs on the resignation of Lord Derby, April, 1878, and afterwards accompanied the Earl of Beaconsfield to Berlin, as representative of Great Britain at the congress held there; K.G., July, 1878; prime minister and sec. of state for foreign affairs, June, 1885, to Feb., 1886; prime minister and first lord of the treasury, Aug., 1886; prime minister and sec. of state for foreign affairs, Jan., 1887, to Aug., 1892; and again from July, 1895; lord warden of the cinque ports, Oct., 1895; has served on the royal commis. on historical manuscripts, 1882, on the housing of the working classes, 1884, and for the Indian and Colonial exhibn., 1886; is hon. col., Bedfordshire regt., and an elder brother of the Trinity House.

SALMON, ALEXANDER McDONALD, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Madras Civil Engrg. Coll.; apptd. 24th Sept., 1869, and posted to Bengal; employed in Bombay on famine relief works, 1877; district engr., Patna, 1889-95; exec. engr., Aug., 1893.

SALMON, WILLIAM ARTHUR, Col., I.S.C., late Pol. Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 11th May, 1859; served from March, 1867, in the pol. dept.; asst. pol. agent in Kathiawar, June, 1870; from Feb., 1879, served as asst. pol. agent, Janjira; joint administrator of Rajpipla, July, 1884; and of Sangli, Feb., 1885; asst. to the govr.-gen.'s agent, Baroda, in charge of the Okhamandal district, and commandant Waghir corps, Nov., 1887; pol. agent, Mahi Kantha, Jan., 1892; pol. supt., Palanpur, July, 1893; acting pol. agent, Kolhapur, June, 1894; reverted to mil. dept., Aug., 1895.

SAMPSON, ARTHUR BISKS, B.A., late India Public Works Dept.—Asst. sec., public works dept., govt. of India, May, 1859; under sec., Sept., 1860; retd., May, 1887.

SAMMAN, HERBERT FREDERICK, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Edward VI.'s Sch., Stratford-on-Avon, and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 4th Nov., 1892, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transf. to Assam as asst. commr., April, 1894; retransf. to Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., Mar., 1897.

SAMUELLS, CHARLES ARCHIBALD, B.L., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., Blackheath Proprietary Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 25th Nov., 1869, and served in Bengal as asst. mag., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; on famine duty at Champaran, March, 1874; offg. port commr., Calcutta, April, 1886; mag. and collr., Oct., 1886; offg. commr. of excise, Bengal, April to Aug., 1892; retd., March, 1895.

SAMUELLS, WILLIAM LEYCESTER, Col., I.S.C.—First commn., 20th Nov., 1857; served from 18th Dec., 1864, in the non-regulation commn., Bengal, as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; special boundary commr. (Rewa and Chota Nagpur), 1868-71; offg. cantonmt. mag. and small cause court judge, Barrackpur, April, 1873; offg. pol. agent, Hill Tipperah, April, 1875; retd., April, 1890.

SANDELL, JOSEPH WILLIAM HENRY, late Indian Postal Dept.—Joined the service, 1st March, 1862; chief asst. to dep. acctn.-gen., Assam, Dec., 1878; chief supt., fin. dept., Jan., 1881; transf. to office of acctn.-gen., Bombay, Sept., 1883; comptr., Calcutta post office, Jan., 1890; retd. April, 1897.

SANDEMAN, JOHN EDWARD, Col., I.S.C., Survey of India Dept.—Joined at Addiscombe, 1860; ensign, Bengal infantry, 7th June, 1861; studied at Rurki Coll., and obtained certificate qualifying for engr. public works dept., Sept., 1864; apptd. to the survey dept., Oct., 1864; served with the Hazara expdn., 1868 (medal); dep. supt., Jan., 1879; supt. (new scale), Aug., 1892; dir. of Bengal surveys, April, 1892; promoted to dep. surveyor-gen. (in charge, rev. surveys), in addn., March, 1895.

SANDERS, EDWIN, Surgn.—Major, late Bengal Med. Dept.—Served under the govt. of Bengal from 1st Nov., 1869, to May, 1871; offg. civil surgn., Chittagong, March, 1881; civil surgn., Murshidabad, June, 1889; retd., Jan., 1891.

SANDERS, JAMES, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Coll. Sch. and Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1879, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr. and asst. commr.; offg. city mag., and wasika officer, Lucknow, 1886, 1888 and 1889; joint mag., March, 1888; dep. commr., April, 1894; dist. and sess. judge, Feb., 1896.

SANDERS, RICHARD CARELESS, M.D., F.R.C.S., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., 1869; in mil. employ till July, 1874, from which date he served as surgn. and civil surgn. at various stations in the N.W. Prov.; ophthalmic surgn. and prof., med. coll., Calcutta, Aug., 1886.

SANDHURST (BARON), RIGHT HON. WILLIAM MANSFIELD, G.C.I.E.—Born, 1855; educ. at Rugby; sub-lieut., Coldstream guards, 1875; succeeded his father (who had been chief of the staff during the Indian Mutiny, commander-in-chief, Bombay, 1860-65, commander-in-chief in India, 1865-70, and commander-in-chief, Ireland, 1870-75) in the title in 1876; resigned his commn., 1879; acted as a lord in waiting to H.M. the Queen from Sept., 1880, to June, 1885; under sec. of state for war, Feb.-Aug., 1886, and again from Aug., 1892; succeeded Lord Harris as govr. of Bombay, 18th Feb., 1895.

SANDIFORD, CHARLES THOMAS, M.I.C.E.,
M.I.M.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept. from Sind, Punjab, and Delhi railway as locomotive supt., N.W. state railway, Jan., 1886.

SANFORD, GEORGE EDWARD LANGHAM SOMERSET, C.B., C.S.I., Major-Gen., R.E., late India Mil. Works Dept.—Lieut., R.E., Oct., 1856; served in the China war, 1853 (medal and clasp); served in the public works dept. (mil. works), April, 1872, to Jan., 1873, as asst. and exec. engr. and in the Jowaki campaign, 1878 (medal and clasp); asst. quartermaster-gen., Bengal, 1873-80; during this period served in the Afghan campaign (medal and clasp); dep. quartermaster-gen., Bengal, 1880-85; commanded royal engrs. in Burmese expedn., 1883-86; C.B., Nov., 1886; inspr.-gen. of mil. works, March, 1886; chief engr., March, 1887; C.S.I., Jan., 1890; dir.-gen., mil. works, Sept., 1890; chief engr., mil. works, Bombay, April, 1893; commanding at Meerut, Sept., 1893.

SANKEY, SIR RICHARD HIERAM, K.C.B., Lieut.-Gen., late R.E.—Ensign, 11th Dec., 1846; arrived, Nov., 1848; offg. suptg. engr. Nagpur subsidiary force, 1850-53; supt. of the east coast canal, 1856-57; addl. under sec., govt. of India, public works dept., March, 1857; on outbreak of Mutiny proceeded with special appt. to Allahabad, acting for a time as suptg. engr. and consulting engr. for railways, N.W. Prov., acted as field engr. at Cawnpore, and was subsequently senr. engr. officer with the Gurkha force under Jung Bahadur; exec. engr. and supt. of convicts, Maulmain, Jan.-Nov., 1859, and subsequently garrison engr., Fort William; asst. to chief engr., Mysore, June, 1861; chief engr., Mysore, 1866-77; services placed at disposal of govt. of Victoria for reporting on the waterworks of the colony, 1871; dep. sec. to govt. of India, Sept., 1877; commanding engr. of the S. Afghanistan expedy. force under Lieut.-Gen. Stewart, C.B., 1878-79; sec. to govt. of Madras, public works dept., April, 1879; fellow of Madras univ., March, 1881; resigned the public works dept. in 1883; retd. from the army, Jan., 1884; chairman, board of works, Dublin.

SAPTE, BRAND, C.B., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Winchester; apptd. from Haileybury, 1843; served in the rev. and jud. depts. in Bengal, the Punjab, and N.W. Prov.; mag. and collr., 1857; C.B. in 1859; from 1864 to 1865 served as judge of Ghazipur, and subsequently of Farakhabad; retd., 1871.

SARGEAUNT, CHARLES CHESTER, Col., I.S.C., late Rev. Survey Dept., Madras.—Ensign, 31st May, 1856; arrived, 25th Sept., 1856; served in the dept. from Feb., 1867; dep. supt., Dec., 1881; on special duty to revise and republish the survey manual, April, 1886; supt. of rev. survey, June, 1886; retd., July, 1887.

SARGEAUNT, RICHARD ARTHUR, Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., Dec., 1861; joined the Bombay public works dept., May, 1864; asst. consulting engr. for railways, Nov., 1864; served in the Abyssinian expdn. of 1868 (medal); examr. of railway acts., Bombay, April, 1872; dep. consulting engr. for guaranteed railways, Calcutta, May, 1877; sec. to railway conference, 1879; rev. asst., railway branch, public works secretariat, govt. of India, 1880; manager, N. Bengal state railway, July, 1882; offg. under sec. to govt. of India, railway branch, Feb., 1883; offg. manager, Punjab N. state railway, June, 1884; offg. manager of E. Bengal railway, June, 1887; offg. consulting engr. for railways, and joint sec. railway dept., Bombay, May, 1888; manager, Oudh and Rohilkhand railway, Jan., 1889; dir.-gen. of railways, and dep. sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., May, 1892; retd., Aug., 1895.

SARGENT, SIR CHARLES, Kt., M.A., B.L., late Jud. Dept., Bombay.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Cambridge; called to the bar (Lincoln's Inn), 1843; apptd. judge of the high court, Bombay, 26th April, 1866; chief justice, Aug., 1882; resigned, April, 1895.

SATYENDRANATH TAGORE, late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Presidency Coll., and Calcutta Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 12th Dec., 1864, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., asst. judge, and judge and sessions judge; judge, Sholapur-Bijapur, Aug., 1883; ditto Satara, April, 1896; retd., Jan., 1897.

SAUNDERS, ARTHUR LESLIE, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at the Oratory Sch., Edgbaston, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1882, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; transf'd. to the Central Prov., Oct., 1885; asst. commr., Oct., 1888; judge, small cause court, March, 1892; commr. of excise, April, 1892; dep. commr., Feb., 1893; also second sec. to chief commr., Feb., 1894; acting chief sec., Nov., 1894, and May, 1895.

SAUNDERS, LESLIE HARRY, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., and Wadham Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 30th Nov., 1889, and served in Burma as asst. commr., and offg. under sec.; offg. supt., N. Shan states, Sept., 1893, to May, 1894.

SAVAGE, HENRY, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Liverpool Inst.; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 23rd Oct., 1874, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Sept., 1885; mag. and collr., Jan., 1891.

SAVILLE, GEORGE ABREO, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1877, and posted to state railways as asst. engr.; lent to B. B. and C. I. Rly., Jan., 1885; exec. engr., Sept., 1891.

SCANNELL, HENRY, Police Dept., Bombay.—Educ. at King's Coll., London; joined the service, 28th May, 1868, as acting asst. supt. of police; dep. conservator of forests, Feb., 1871; asst. supt. of police, Feb., 1872; supt., Jan., 1874; supt. of police, Great Indian Peninsula railway, Dec., 1890; inspr.-gen. May-Dec., 1896.

SCHARLIEB, WILLIAM MASON, B.L., late Jud. Dept., Madras.—Served from 25th March, 1847, in subord. posts, and was apptd.first uncov. asst. to the board of rev., June, 1862; resigned the service to practise at the bar, Oct., 1867; actd. as administrator-gen., and as govt. pleader; asst. sec. to govt., jud. and legis. depts., Dec., 1874; actd as first judge of the court of small causes, Madras, and served from 1885 as presidency mag. for the town of Madras; retd., 1890.

SCHLICH, WILLIAM, C.I.E., PH.D., late Forest Dept., Govt. of India.—Apptd. asst. conservator of forests, Dec., 1866; conservator, Bengal, Dec., 1872; transf'd. to the Punjab, 1880; inspr.-gen. of forests, April, 1883; retd., 1888, and was apptd.
principal proir. of forestry at Cooper's Hill Coll.; author of 'A Manual of Forestry,' &c.

SCHNEIDER, Sir John William, K.C.B., Gen.—Educ. at Christ's Hosp., and afterwards at Addiscombe; ensign, and native infantry, Bombay, 20th Feb., 1841; served in the S. Mahratta campaign, 1845; second in command and commandant of the Kolhapur infantry, and also asst. pol. supt., 1852-50; in 1857-58, took part in the suppression of the Mutiny at Kolhapur (medal); served in the Abyssinian expdn. of 1867-68 (medal, and C.B.); judge advocate-gen., Bombay army, 1868-72; pol. rest. at Aden, 1872-77; commanded N. divn., Bombay army, 1877-81; K.C.B., May, 1889.

SCOBIE, Mackay John, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1876, and posted to Haidarabad as assist. engr.; exec. engr., Aug., 1886.

SCOBLE, Sir Andrew Richard, K.C.S.I., Q.C., M.P.—Called to the bar at Lincoln's Inn, Jan., 1856; held the offices of clerk of the crown and commr. for taking accts. and for local investigations, under the high court, Bombay, 1863-66; advocate of the high court, 1866-76, and successively held the offices of sheriff, 1866-67, legal remembrancer, 1869-72, and advocate-gen., 1872-77; conducted the prosecution of the Gaekwar of Baroda, 1875; was also member of the legisl. council of Bombay, 1870-76; Q.C., 1876; legal member of the govr.-gen.'s council, 1886-91; C.S.I., Jan., 1889; K.C.S.I., May, 1890; M.P. for Central Hackney from 1892; member of royal commn. on Indian expenditure, May, 1895.

SCONCE, Gideon Colquhoun, B.L., late Jud. Dept., Bengal.—Offg. mag., Calcutta, 12th Nov., 1866; clerk of the Calcutta court of small causes, Dec., 1870; judge of the court, Jan., 1874; chief judge, Oct., 1889; retd., Oct., 1893.

SCONCE, James, Col., I.S.C., late Survey Dept.—Joined at Addiscombe, Feb., 1852; licut., Bengal artillery, Dec., 1853; served during the Mutiny (medal and clasps); served from Oct., 1859, as asst. and rev. surveyor in Bundelkhand, Central Prov., and Bengal; dep. surveyor-gen. (rev. survey branch), Jan., 1879; offd. as surveyor-gen. of India; reverted to mil. duty, April, 1891.

SCOTLAND, Sir Colley H., Kt.—Educ. at the Royal Sch., Raphoe; entered as a student at the Middle Temple in 1849, and was called to the bar in 1843; practised on the common law side of Westminster Hall, and on the Oxford circuit; apptd. chief justice of the supreme court, Madras, 1861, and of the high court of judicature on its establ. in 1862; resigned, 1871; vice-chancellor of the Madras univ., 1861-71; contributed to the Law Journal reports of cases in the court of Queen's bench, 1848-57, and is joint author of a work 'On the Crown Office Practice of the Court of Queen's Bench.'

SCOTT, Arthur Guillum, Dep. Acctnt.-Gen., India Office.—Educ. at the Royal Agricl. Coll., Cirencester, and at private schs.; East India house writer, old establ., 7th Nov., 1857; junr. clerk, acctnt.-gen.'s dept., India office, Aug., 1860; senr. clerk, Jan., 1872; assessor of income-tax, 1892; dep. acctnt.-gen., June, 1893.

SCOTT, Buchanan, C.I.E., Lt.-Col., R.E., Calcutta Mint.—Joined the service, and 2nd Aug., 1871; from Oct., 1874, served as asst. engr. in the Punjab; on field service in the Afghan war, 1878-79 (medal); exec. engr., May, 1883; supt. of works and engr.-in-chief, Zhob valley survey, Aug., 1888; acted as mint master, Calcutta, 1891; mint master, Bombay, March, 1895; ditto. Calcutta, 1897.

SCOTT, Edwin, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch. and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 15th Jan., 1887; and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., July, 1893.

SCOTT, George Batty, Survey of India Dept.—Joined the service, 1st May, 1863; asst. supt., survey dept., Nov., 1884; dep. supt., April, 1890; supt. of land record surveys, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Dec., 1894; served in the Black Mountain expdn., Jowaki-Afriidi expdn., Afghan war, Zhob valley expdn., &c.; author of a Pushto vocabulary, 'Pathans of the N.W. Frontier,' reports on various parts of Afghanistan, &c.

SCOTT, James George, C.I.E., Pol. Dept., Burma.—Apptd. asst. commr., 9th April, 1886; on duty in the Shan states, Dec., 1886; asst. supt., Shan states, Dec., 1888; on duty with Anglo-Siamese boundary commn., 1886-90; supt., N. Shan states, July, 1892; charge d'affaires at Bangkok, Nov., 1893; on depn. with Anglo-French buffer state commn., Oct., 1894; author of 'The Burman, His Life and Notions,' 'France and Tong-king,' 'Burma as it was, as it is, and as it will be,' 'Burma, the Eastern Country, and the Race of the Brahmis,' and 'The Hill Slopes of Tong-king.'

SCOTT, Sir John, K.C.M.G., M.A., B.L., late Jud. Dept., Bombay.—Judge of the high court, Bombay, 13th Nov., 1882; services lent to the Egyptian govt. from April, 1890; resigned, April, 1891; K.C.M.G., Feb., 1894.

SCOTT, Mathew Henry, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 16th Dec., 1863, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag. and asst. judge and sessions judge; judge, Khandesh, Feb., 1881; judge and sessions judge, Ahmadnagar, May, 1882; district judge, Satara, April, 1892; retd., May, 1893.

SCOTT, Ross, M.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Omagh Acad., the Royal Acadl. Instn. and Seminary, Belfast, and Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 26th Oct., 1873, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Nov., 1886; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1890.

SCOTT, Thomas Augustus, Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—First commn., June, 1857; arrived, 29th June, 1857; from Jan., 1862, served in the police dept., Central Prov., and was apptd. district supt., March, 1864; from June, 1865, served as asst. commr.; dep. commr., Dec., 1882; offd. as commr., 1890-91; reverted to mil. dept., Aug., 1894.

SCOTT-MONCRIEFF, Sir Colin Campbell, K.C.M.G., C.S.I., Col., R.E., retd.—Joined the service as 2nd lieut., Bengal engrs., 13th June, 1856; arrived, 10th June, 1858; served with the Bengal sappers and miners until Feb., 1859, through the campaign in Oudh (medal); joined public works dept., Feb., 1859, and served in the N.W. Prov. in the irrign. branch; principal, Thomason civil engrg. coll., Sept., 1861; asst. to chief engr., irrign. branch, April, 1869; from Nov., 1869, served on the Ganges canal as exec. and suptg. engr.; in 1877 was sent on depn. to Mysore to serve as chief engr. and famine
commr.; C.S.I., May, 1878; again joined the irrign. dept. of the N.W. Prov., Feb., 1879; offd. as sec. to the chief commr. of British Burma, May, 1881; retd., Jan., 1883; K.C.M.G., 1887; under sec., public works ministry, Egypt, to 1892, when he was apptd. under sec. for Scotland.

SCROOPE, HENRY WILLIAM PAUL, M.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Stonyhurst Coll., London Univ., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 24th Dec., 1895, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

SCULLY, JOHN, Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Indian Med. Dept.—Joined the dept., 1872; served as med. officer, Kashgarh pol. agency, 1874-76; residency surgn., Nipal, 1876-78; med. officer, Gilgit, 1878-80; acting dep. assay master, Calcutta mint, 1882-83; dep. assay master of the Bombay mint, May, 1884; assay master of the Calcutta mint, May, 1886.

SEABROOKE, JAMES HERBERT, B.A., Mil. Dept., India Office.—Educ. at King's Coll., London (Jelf medallist and associate, 1871), and Queen's Coll., Oxford (scholar, 1871-74); junr. clerk, finl. dept., 13th Jan., 1876; mil. dept., 1877; senr. clerk, June, 1887.

SEALY, CHARLES WILLIAM HENRY, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Bombay Pol. Dept.—First commn., 17th July, 1866; cantonmt. mag., Aden, May, 1875; and asst. to rest., Oct., 1885; asst. pol. agent, S. Mahratta country, May, 1886; and asst. to pol. agent, Kathiawar, Sept., 1889; 1st asst. to rest., Aden, and pol. agent for the Somali coast, Aug., 1893; acting pol. rest., Aden, May-July, 1894; pol. agent, Mahi Kantha, March, 1896; alienation settl. officer, Feb., 1897; joint compiler of an account of the Arab tribes in the vicinity of Aden, and has transl. Van Den Berg's work on Hadhramuth, and part of Carsten Niebuhr's description of Arabia.

SEATON, WILLIAM JOHN, Col., I.S.C., late Forest Dept., Burma.—Ensign, Madras infantry, Sept., 1855; asst. supt. in the forest dept., Dec., 1860; dep. conservator, 1st class, April, 1865; conservator, Nov., 1867; reverted to mil. duty, 1892.

SECCOMBE, HENRY LAWRENCE, Finl. Dept., India Office.—East India house writer, old establ., 14th May, 1856; junr. clerk, finl. dept., Dec., 1866; senr. clerk, Dec., 1882.

SECCOMBE, SIR THOMAS LAWRENCE, G.C.I.E., K.C.S.I., C.B.—Entered the home service of the East India Co. in Jan., 1829, as a clerk in the dept. of auditor of India accts.; on the transfer of the govt. of India to the Crown in 1858 was apptd. asst. finl. sec.; finl. sec., 1859; dir. of mil. funds, and chairman of consulting committee, 1866; chairman of a joint India office and war office committee for adjusting the charges for services of H.M.'s regts. on the India establ., 1869; and was a member of a similar committee in 1874 and 1879; C.B., Dec., 1869; acctnt.-gen., in addn. to other duties, Feb., 1872; asst. under sec. of state for India, July, 1872; K.C.S.I., June, 1877; apptd. one of three commrs. to represent H.M.'s govt. at the international monetary conference at Paris, 1878; continued asst. under sec. of state until 1881, but resigned his other offices on 31st Jan., 1879; member of a joint India office and admiralty committee on finl. questions connected with the India troop service, 1879 to 1892, when he finally retd. from the service; G.C.I.E., Aug., 1892.

SEDDON, CHARLES NORMAN, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Liverpool Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 25th Nov., 1891, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 2nd asst., April, 1897.

SEDGEFIELD, ARTHUR ROBERT WYATT, M.B., Surgn.-Major, Bengal Opium Dept.—In mil. employ from 14th April, 1881; apptd. supt., Chenawau jail, Sept., 1887; civil surgn., Murrice, March, 1891; supt., Benares opium agency, Oct., 1891.

SELBY, FRANCIS GUY, M.A., Educl. Dept., Bombay.—Educ. at Wadham Coll., Oxford; arrived, 7th Feb., 1877, and served from that date as prof. of logic and moral philosophy in the Deccan coll., Poona; principal, Deccan coll., Dec., 1890.

SELBY, HENRY OLIPHANT, Lieut.-Col., R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 13th Jan., 1869; arrived, 26th Dec., 1871; on famine duty in 1874; served in Afghanistan (medal), 1879-81, the latter part of the time as supt., signalling lines of communications; dep. consulting engr. for railways, Bombay, Dec., 1883; under sec. to govt. of Bombay in the railway branch, March, 1892; dep. consulting engr., Nov., 1892; also under sec. (railway), Jan., 1894; sec. and consulting engr., Oct., 1894; rank of suptg. engr., March, 1895.

SELLS, ARTHUR, B.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Merton Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 28th Nov., 1860; from Nov., 1861, served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; mag. and collr., Muzaffarnagar, Aug., 1878, and civil and sessions judge, Cawnpore, April, 1882; district and sessions judge, Meerut, Oct., 1886; retd., May, 1890.

SEN, BIRENDRA CHANDRA, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Dacca Coll., Presidency Coll., and the Univ., Calcutta, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 17th Nov., 1893, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

SETON-KARR, WALTER SCOTT, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Rugby; apptd. from Haileybury in 1842; arrived, 12th Dec., 1842, and served in Bengal as asst. and joint mag. and dep. collr.; mag. of Jessore, 1847; under sec., govt. of Bengal, 1847-53; collr. of Tirhut, 1857; civil and sessions judge, Jessore, 1858-60; prest.of indigo commn., 1860; sec. to govt. of Bengal, 1860-61; legisl. council of India, 1861; commr. of rev. and circuit, Chittagong, and member of provl. legisl. council, 1862; judge, high court, Calcutta, 1862-68; foreign sec., govt. of India, 1868; retd., 1870; vice-chancellor of the univ. of Calcutta in 1868 and 1869.

SEWELL, EBENEZER JAMES, late Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 1st Nov., 1872, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; on famine duty, 1877-78; senr. asst., Ganjam, June, 1882; sub-collr. and joint mag., Dec., 1887; district and sessions judge, Oct., 1889; collr. and mag., Feb., 1890; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1891; retd., July, 1897.

SEWELL, HENRY, M.A., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Radley, and Univ. Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1861; served in Madras as asst. mag. and collr., acting under sec., and
