SEWELL, ROBERT, late Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at St. Peter's Coll., Radley; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 19th Dec., 1868, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; on famine duty, Oct., 1877, and on special duty in connection with the archaeological survey of the Madras presidency, Jan., 1881, and again, Jan., 1883; sub-collr. and joint mag., Tinnevelly, Sept., 1884; fellow of Madras univ., 1887; from Sept., 1888, served as district and sessions judge, and collr. and mag.; retd., Dec., 1894; author of 'A Report on the Amaravati Tope, and Excavations on its Site,' 'Chronological Tables for S. India from the 6th Century, A.D.,' 'A Sketch of the Dynasties of S. India,' vols. I and II. of the 'Archaeological Survey Series of S. India,' 'Early Buddhist Symbolism,' &c.

SHADBOLT, ERNEST IFILL, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., May, 1883; services lent to Bhavnagar and Gondal states, 1887-91; engr.-in-chief, Bezwada-Madras railway survey, Feb., 1894; employed in same capacity on Madura-Pamban and Tinnevelly-Quilon railway surveys, Dec., 1894; supt. of works, Kotri-Rohri railway, Dec., 1895.

SHAKESPEAR, ALEXANDER MURISON WAKE, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Harrow; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 17th Nov., 1878, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Aug., 1887; private sec. to lieut.-govt., March, 1888; asst. commr., Jan., 1890; dep. commr., Feb., 1894; mag. and collr., Nov., 1895; dist. and sess. judge April, 1896.

SHAMS-UD-DIN ALI KHAN, Saiyad, Khan Bahadur, Berar Administration.—Joined the service, 1st March, 1869; asst. commr., Jan., 1882; special asst. commr., Jan., 1893; dep. commr., May, 1894.

SHANKER MADHO CHITNAVIS, B.A., Statutory C.S. (Central Prov.).—Apptd. probr. for the civil service under the statutory rules, July, 1885; confd. as asst. commr., 5th Oct., 1887; dep. commr., Dec., 1896.

SHARP, FREDERICK, A.M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1875, and posted to Mysore; on famine duty, 1877; transfd. to Coorg, April, 1881; exec. engr., May, 1883; transfd. to Central Prov., Dec., 1886; and to Burma, March, 1887; retd., May, 1897.

SHARP, FREDERICK WILLIAM, Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Milton Coll., Ullesthorpe; clerk, 2nd class, India store depot, March, 1885.

SHARP, HENRY GRANVILLE, B.A., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Horncastle Gr. Sch., Marlborough Coll., and Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 27th Jan., 1868; served in the rev. and jud. depts. in Bengal; on famine duty at Madras, 1877; joint mag. and dep. collr., Dec., 1878; mag. and collr., Oct., 1884; retd., Jan., 1894.

SHARPE, CHARLES FERGUSON, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Police Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Arrived, as ensign, 1st Feb., 1851, and served under the mil. dept. till Sept., 1858, when he was apptd. to the Oudh mil. police (medal for Mutiny services); from Feb., 1859 served as district supt. in the police dept. in Oudh; reverted to mil. duty, March, 1891.

SHARPE, FREDERIC ROBERT, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Christ's Hosp.; writer, India office, 7th Aug., 1877; clerk, 2nd class, Sept., 1878.

SHARPE, HENRY GRATTAN, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Dublin High Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 12th Nov., 1890, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

SHARPIN, VEN. FREDERICK LLOYD, M.A., late Ecclesl. Dept., Bombay.—Educ. at Exeter Coll., Oxford; joined the service, Aug., 1865; arrived, 13th Oct., 1865; served as chaplain at various stations in Bombay and Sind; senr. chaplain, Oct., 1875; senr. presidency chaplain, June, 1880; archdeacon and commissary, June, 1886, also chaplain of Satara; retd., Oct., 1888.

SHAW, ARTHUR TREVOR AMBROSE, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 13th Dec., 1883, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transfd. to Burma as asst. commr., Feb., 1886; dep. commr., Oct., 1890.

SHAW, GEORGE WATSON, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Hertford Gr. Sch., and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 20th Dec., 1879, and served in British Burma as asst. commr.; dep. commr., May, 1888.

SHAW-MACKENZIE, CHARLES FORBES HUDSON, B.L., late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 21st Aug., 1850, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and acting collr. and mag. up to Feb., 1864, and subsequently as judge and sessions judge in various districts; retd., Sept., 1885.

SHAW-STEWART, JOHN HERON MAXWELL, Col., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Madras.—First commn. as lieut., Madras engrs., June, 1851; arrived, 31st Dec., 1853; served in the dept. from Jan., 1854, as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; served in the China campaign, 1860 (medal and two clasps); dep. sec. to govt., public works dept., Dec., 1863; under sec., Oct., 1866; comptlr., public works accts., Madras, May, 1867; consulting engr. for railways, Madras, Oct., 1867; chief engr., Oct., 1870; joint sec. to govt., railway branch, Feb., 1877; sec. to govt., public works dept., Sept., 1883; member of legisl. council, Madras, Sept., 1883; retd., Sept., 1886.

SHEEPSHANKS, RICHARD, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Winchester, and at St. John's Coll., Cambridge, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 27th Dec., 1895, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

SHEPHERD, HORATIO HALE, M.A., B.L., Madras Jud. Dept.—Profr. of law at Presidency Coll., Madras, 1st Oct., 1873; fellow of Madras univ., 1881; apptd. govt. pleader, June, 1881; member of Madras legisl. council, March, 1885; advocate-gen. of Madras and offg. judge of high court, Jan., 1888; confd. as judge of high court, July, 1889.

SHEPHERD, CHARLES EDWARD, Col., I.S.C., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 26th Sept., 1864, and posted to Central Prov.; exec. engr., Sept., 1868; transfd. to mil. works, Dec., 1872;
and to state railways, Nov., 1874; dep. consulting engr. for railways, Lucknow, May, 1891.

SHEPHERD, GEORGE EDWARD, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 4th Sept., 1893.

SHEPHERD, WALTER CURZON, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Sedbergh Sch. and Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 19th Nov., 1894, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

SHEPPARD, GEORGE FREDERICK, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 23rd Nov., 1854, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; collr. of salt rev., Bombay, Dec., 1871; collr. and mag., Kaira, Feb., 1873; senr. collr. and mag. and pol. agent, Kaira, Nov., 1875; commr., Oct., 1882; retd., May, 1889.

SHEPPARD, WILLIAM DIDSBURY, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Hereford Cathedral Sch. and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 13th Dec., 1886, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 2nd asst. and forest settlt. officer, Nov., 1893; 1st asst., March, 1897.

SHERER, JOHN WALTER, C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1846; served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. and joint mag., and asst. sec. to govt.; on special duty to report on reh efflorescence, W. Jumna canal, 1856-57; mag. and collr. of Cawnpore, 1857; civil officer with Gen. Havelock's column in 1857, in the advance on Cawnpore; commr. to enquire into claims against ex-king of Oudh, 1864; judge of Allahabad, 1871, and afterwards of Azimgarh and Mirzapur; retd., 1877.

SHERIDAN, CHARLES JAMES, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 1st April, 1872, and posted to N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., Feb., 1876; employed on state railways, 1876-78.

SHERIDAN, PHILIP, Post Office Dept., Govt. of India.—Served in the postal dept., Punjab, from March, 1861; chief supt., travelling post office, Allahabad, Dec., 1873; chief inspr. of post offices, Assam, Dec., 1873; asst. dir.-gen. of the post office of India, July, 1880; inspr. of railway and mail service, Nov., 1885; dep. dir.-gen. of the post-office of India, April, 1888; postmr.-gen., Punjab, July, 1891.

SHERLOCK-HUBBARD, ISAAC SHERLOCK, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. compiler of telegraph accts., 1st March, 1872; asst. comptr., April, 1872; asst. examr. of telegraph accts., June, 1877; dep. examr., Jan., 1880; examr., Aug., 1885.

SHERMAN, WILLIAM HANBURY PETTINGALL, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 31st July, 1866, and employed in the Central Prov.; transfd. to state railways, April, 1874; exec. engr., Jan., 1877; services lent to S. Indian railway co., Feb., 1880, and to Gwalior durbar for Bhopal-Ujjain line, Feb., 1891; suptg. engr., Nov., 1892.

SHERRING, CHARLES ATMORE, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Westminster and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 11th Nov., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr. and asst. commr.

SHEWAN, ALEXANDER, M.A., late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the Gymnasium, Aberdeen, and Univ. of Aberdeen; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 23rd Oct., 1873, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag. and asst. pol. agent; on famine duty in 1876 and 1877; from Jan., 1885, served as asst. judge and sessions judge, and acting under sec. to govt.; administrator of Rajpipla state, Nov., 1887; judge and sessions judge, July, 1894; retd., Dec., 1897.

SHIPLEY, REGINALD HEBER, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Winchester and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 20th Dec., 1883, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; special asst., July, 1890; sub. collr. and joint mag., Sept., 1895.

SHIRRES, LESLIE PITTENDRIGH, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Aberdeen and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 18th Dec., 1882, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; under sec. to govt., Jan., 1888; offd. as under sec. to the govt. of India, dept. of fin. and commerce, in Nov., 1887, and again from April, 1888; joint mag. and dep. collr., Aug., 1890; mag. and collr., Feb., 1896; author of 'An Analysis of the Ideas of Economics.'

SHOPLAND, EDWIN REW, Comdr.late R.I.M.—Joined the service 18th Feb., 1867; comdr., 1st April, 1887; port officer, Karachi, Sept., 1895; retd., March, 1897.

SHOWERS, EDWARD MELIAN, Bengal Police Dept.—Entered the service Feb., 1867, and served as asst. supt. and dist. supt. of police.

SHIRIRAM BHIKAJI JATAR, C.I.E., B.A., Rao Bahadur, late Haidarabad Administration.—Served in the Bombay educn. dept. from Jan., 1859, and from July, 1867, in Berar as dep. educn. inspr. and educn. inspr.; dir. of public instrn., Haidarabad assigned districts, Aug., 1884; retd., Sept., 1894; C.I.E., May, 1894.

SHURLOCK, HENRY JAMES, Store Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, India store depot, 5th Aug., 1886.

SHUTTLEWORTH, ALLEN THORNTON, Forest Dept., Bombay.—Apptd. to the Indian marine, Nov., 1855; served in the Persian war (medal), and in the operations against the Waghiris in Okhamandal; from Nov., 1863, served in the dept. as asst. and dep. conservator, and was apptd. conservator of forests and supt. of botanical gardens, Sept., 1866; addl. member of Bombay legisl. council, July, 1895; on special famine duty, Nov., 1896-June, 1897; while stationed at Alibag was instrumental in saving upwards of a hundred lives from different wrecks (Albert medal, medals of the Royal Humane Society, &c.).

SIBOLD, ERNEST ALFRED, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomson Coll.; apptd., 23rd Dec., 1864, and employed on irrign. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., Sept., 1872; in 1874 served in Bengal on famine relief works; retd., Feb., 1895.

SIBTHORPE, CHARLES, Surgn.-Major-Gen., F.R.C.P.I., Madras Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., 1st April, 1870; arrived, 27th Dec., 1870; civil surgn. and supt. of jail, Banda, July, 1874; from May, 1875, to Nov., 1880, served as rest. surgn., gen. hosp., Madras, and profr. in the med. coll.; also served in the Afghan war, 1878-79 (medal), and in the Burma expdn., 1885-86; from Oct., 1882, served as fort surgn., and profr. in the med. coll.; fellow of Madras univ., 1884; surgn., gen. hosp., and profr., med. coll., Jan., 1888; reverted to mil. duty, May, 1890; surgn.-gen., Madras, May, 1894; author of a
Clinical Manual,' and various papers on med. subjects.

SILBERRAD, CHARLES ARTHUR, B.A., B.Sc., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Aldenham Gr. Sch., St. Peter's Coll., Cambridge, and London Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 10th Dec., 1894, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

SILCOCK, HENRY FOSTER, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Drogheda Gr. Sch. and Kingstown Sch., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 24th Nov., 1874, and served in Bombay as asst. mag. and collr., and forest settl. officer; on famine duty in 1876 and 1877; 2nd asst., April, 1887; 1st asst., April, 1890; collr. and mag. Aug., 1893.

SILCOCK, JAMES GREER, B.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Armagh Royal Sch. and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 16th Nov., 1872, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; district judge, June-Nov., 1888, and March, 1889; dep. commr., April, 1889.

SIM, HENRY ALEXANDER, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 19th Nov., 1878, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; from Jan., 1883, served as dep. conservator of forests, Karnul, and forest settl. officer; special asst., Malabar, Feb., 1886; employed under govt. of India as offg. dep. acctnt.-gen., Aug.-Nov., 1887; dep. acctnt.-gen., Madras, Jan., 1888; acting sec. to the commrs. of land rev., 1888-90, and again, 1890-92; sub-collr. and joint mag., July, 1890; collr. and mag., April, 1895; dist. and sess. judge, March, 1896.

SIMCOX, ARTHUR HENRY ADDENBROOKE, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Winchester and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 19th Nov., 1894, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

SIME, JOHN, M.A., LL.D., Educn. Dept., Punjab.—Profr., govt. coll., Agra, April, 1869; from Sept., 1870, served in the Punjab as principal, Delhi coll., till 1877, and subsequently as profr., Lahore coll.; inspr. of schs., Aug., 1887; tutor to the Maharaja of Patiala, May, 1885; dir. of public instrn., Punjab, and under sec. to govt. in the educ. dept., Oct., 1890; author of 'Man and his Duty,' and of works on arithmetic and mensuration.

SIMPSON, SIR BENJAMIN, K.C.I.E., M.D., Surgn.-Gen., late Bengal Med. Service.—Joined the Indian med. dept., 1853; served in civil employ from 1860, as asst. surgn. in Bengal, and was in med. charge of the Bhutan mission in 1863; on special duty on N.E. frontier, 1867-68; civil surgn., Darjiling, April, 1868; from Jan., 1871, served as civil surgn. of Patna with charge of the Mitapur jail; on special duty to the cinchona commn., Feb., 1871; guardian to the Maharaja of Kuch Behar during his visit to Europe, March, 1878; dep. surgn.-gen., S. Afghanistan field force, 1881; principal med. officer, Quetta, 1881; dep. surgn.-gen., March, 1882; sanitary commr., Central Prov., 1882; surgn.-gen. in the Punjab, 1883-84; surgn.-gen., Bengal, 1884-85; sanitary commr. and surgn.-gen. with the govt. of India, March, 1885; K.C.I.E., Feb., 1887; retd., March, 1890.

SIMPSON, FRANK DOUGLAS, M.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Aberdeen Univ. and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 10th Dec., 1894, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr. and asst. mag. and collr.

SIMPSON, JAMES THOMAS, B.C.E., M.I.C.E., M.I.M.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 4th May, 1869, and posted to Bengal; exec. engr., March, 1880; transf. to Burma, June, 1887.

SIMPSON, JOHN HOPE, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at foreign schs. and at St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 30th Oct., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Nov., 1895.

SIMPSON, STUART JOHN, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd. 1st April, 1872, as asst. engr., and posted to Oudh; exec. engr., Jan., 1885.

SIMSON, D., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at the Gr. Sch. and Marischal Coll., Aberdeen; apptd. from Haileybury in 1845; arrived, 5th April, 1846; served in the N.W. Prov. and in the Punjab as asst. mag. and collr., asst. commr., joint mag., and dep. commr.; commr. in Oudh, June, 1859; extra judge, court of sadar diwani and nizamat adalat, N.W. Prov., April, 1864; judge, chief court, Punjab, April, 1868; retd., 1872.

SINCLAIR, DAVID, M.B., C.M., Surgn.-Col., Jail Dept., Burma.—Joined the Indian med. dept., 1st Oct., 1869; arrived, 14th May, 1870; from 1871, served in British Burma, and was employed in the analysis of potable waters in cantonments, 1871-72; served subsequently as jail supt., offg. civil surgn., and offg. inspr.-gen. of prisons; inspr.-gen. of jails, sanitary commr., supt. of vaccn., and chief of civil med. dept., Burma, Jan., 1884.

SINCLAIR, WILLIAM FREDERICK, late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Armagh Royal Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 21st Nov., 1868, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and was on special duty for demarcation of forests; on famine duty, 1877; first asst. collr. and forest settl. officer, Feb., 1883; junr. collr. and mag., and pol. agent, Cambay, March, 1890; senr. coll. and mag., and pol. agent, Thana, March, 1892; retd., June, 1892; author of 'Notes on Arboriculture in the Bombay Presidency.'

SITARAM VISHWANATH PATWAR-DHAN, Rao Saheb, B.A., Haidarabad Administration.—Joined the Bombay educ. service, 14th Jan., 1867; principal, Poona training coll., Dec., 1876; educ. inspr., April, 1885; dir. of public instrn., Haidarabad assigned districts, Sept., 1894.

SKINNER, JOHN ALLAN CLEVELAND, Indian C.S.(Central Prov.).—Educ. at Wellington Coll., and Keble Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 28th Oct., 1885, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., and registrar, jud. commr.'s court; dep. commr., Oct., 1894.

SKINNER, RUSSELL MORLAND, Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Bengal.—First commn., 7th Dec., 1855; served through the Mutiny; joined the dept. as asst. supt., April, 1862; district supt., Aug., 1863; retd., April, 1888.

SKINNER, STEPHEN STUART, B.A., Indian C.S.(Bengal).—Educ. at Eton and Hertford Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 6th Dec., 1896, and served in Bengal as asst. commr.

SKIPWITH, GREY TOWNSEND, Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., 11th June, 1858; joined the dept., Oct., 1860;
exec. engr., April, 1865; asst. sec. to chief commr., Central Prov., and asst. to chief engr., Feb., 1870; asst. sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., Feb., 1872; suptg. engr., Feb., 1880; offic. as chief engr. and joint sec. to govt., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, public works dept. irrig., in 1889; retd., Jan., 1893.

SKRINE, FRANCIS HENRY BENNETT, late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Blackheath Proprietary Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1870, and served as asst. mag. and collr. in Bengal; on famine relief duty, 1874 and 1877-78 (in Madras); supt. of Salem central jail, Jan., 1878; joint mag. and dep. collr., May, 1884; mag. and collr., Aug., 1887; offic. commr., Bhagalpur, 1893-94; collr. of customs, Calcutta, Oct., 1895; retd., April, 1897.

SLACK, FRANCIS ALEXANDER, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Taunton Coll. Sch., Univ. Coll., Oxford, and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 8th Dec., 1876, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; settl. officer of wards' and attached estates in Chota Nagpur; joint mag. and dep. collr., Jan., 1888; offic. as commr., Chittagong, Sept., 1890; mag. and collr., May, 1892; sec. to board of rev., Nov., 1896.

SLADEN, JOSEPH, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 19th Nov., 1888, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; and in Sind as asst. commr., and Sindhi transl.

SLATER, ALFRED WILLIAM, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 6th Nov., 1872, and employed on irrig. works in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; on famine relief duty in Madras, 1877-78; transf. to buildings and roads branch, Feb., 1881; exec. engr., Nov., 1881.

SLATER, JOHN SAMUEL, Bengal Educl. Service.—From Sept., 1870, served in the public works dept., Punjab, on the Bari Doab and Indus canals; from Nov., 1875, served in the Bengal educn. dept. as prof'r, civil engrg. dept., presidency coll., and, from April, 1880, as prof'r of the Howrah engrg. coll.; principal, Sibpur engrg. coll., Dec., 1891.

SLATER, JOHN SANDERS, B.A., B.L., Bombay Police Dept.—Joined the service, 23rd Jan., 1883, as prof'r Elphinstone Coll.; apptd. acting chief presidency mag. and rev. judge, Bombay, Aug., 1891; confd., March, 1895.

SLIGHT, ANDREW MURE, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Royal Coll., Mauritius, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 12th Nov., 1889, and served as asst. collr. and mag.; dist. mag., Mar., 1896.

SLOCOCK, FRANCIS SAMUEL ALFRED, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Marlborough and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 10th Dec., 1891, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

SLOCOMBE, CHARLES, Accntn.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 22nd July, 1892.

SLY, FRANK GEORGE, Indian C.S.—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 16th Dec., 1887, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr. and settl. officer; under sec. to govt. of India, dept. of rev. and agric., Aug., 1895.

SMALLMAN, HENRY FRANCIS, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 3rd Nov., 1868, and employed on irrig. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., Jan., 1880; services lent to Patiala state, 1885-87.

SMART, ALEXANDER WILLIAM, Lieut.-Col., R.E., Madras Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 15th July, 1868; from March, 1871, served in Madras as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; asst. chief engr. for irrig., and under sec. to govt., 1885-86; acting principal, coll. of engrg., 1891-92, and in 1894; supg. engr., July, 1895.

SMEATON, DONALD MACKENZIE, C.S.I., M.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at the Abbey Park Inst., St. Andrew's, and St. Andrew's Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1867, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; from May, 1870, served in the settl. dept.; transf. to British Burma as settl. sec. to chief commr., April, 1879; sec. to chief commr., Burma, in the land rev. and agric. dept., and dir. of agric., May, 1882; dir. of agric. and commerce, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, May, 1886; offic. chief sec. to chief commr., Burma, April, 1887; commr., central divn., Upper Burma, May, 1888; finl. commr., March, 1891; in May, 1892, and in 1896 offic. as chief commr.; C.S.I., Jan., 1895; author of an annotated edition of the N.W. Prov. rev. act of 1873, 'The Currency of India,' 'The Karens of Burma,' &c.

SMEATON, ROBERT, M.A., LL.D., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Abbey Park Instn., St. Andrew's, and St. Andrew's Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 5th Dec., 1868, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. settl. officer; first asst. sec. to govt., July, 1876; under sec., May, 1877; junr. sec., Aug., 1877; sec., finl. dept., May, 1884; member of prov'l. legisl. council, Dec., 1891; retd., April, 1894.

SMITH, ALBERT CHARLES, Lieut.-Col., R.E., late Madras Public Works Dept.—Arrived, 5th Jan., 1864; joined the dept., Sept., 1864, and was apptd. exec. engr., March, 1870; suptg. engr., Sept., 1880; offic. joint sec. in the public works dept., April-July, 1891; retd., Jan., 1894.

SMITH, ALEXANDER, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Marischal Coll., Aberdeen; apptd. after exam. of 1856; arrived, 16th Dec., 1856, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and mag. and collr.; senr. supt. of survey, Aug., 1872; commr. of Orissa, and supt. of tributary mehals, Cuttack, Oct., 1879; commr., presidency divn., July, 1884; retd., Dec., 1891.

SMITH, CHARLES JOHN, Col., R.E., late Madras Public Works Dept.—First commn., Madras engrs., Dec., 1855; asst. engr., Jan., 1858; exec. engr., Nov., 1865; dep. consulting engr. for railways, 1870-83; under sec. to govt., public works dept., May, 1872; suptg. engr., 1st class, Sept., 1883; consulting engr. and joint sec. to govt., railway branch, 1883; chief engr., Dec., 1885; rc-apptd. consulting engr., July, 1889; reverted to mil. duty, July, 1891; retd., May, 1892.

SMITH, FRANCIS WHITMORE, Mil. Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Bedford Sch. and Cheltenham Coll.; temporary clerk, 23rd Jan., 1864; junr. clerk, mil. dept., July, 1866; senr. clerk, Jan., 1880; asst. sec., mil. dept., May, 1895.

SMITH, GILBERT LESLIE, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Twyford Sch. and St. Andrew's Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 9th Nov., 1871, and served in the Punjab as asst.
SMITH, Henry Andrew Felton, late Police Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service, 7th Aug., 1861; inspr. of police, April, 1866; asst. district supt., July, 1867; district supt., March, 1876; retd., April, 1897.

SMITH, Henry Babington, C.S.I., M.A., Private Sec. to the Viceroy.—Educ. at Eton and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; examr. in the educn. dept. (England), Dec., 1887; private sec. to the chancellor of the exchequer (Mr. Goschen), May, 1891; clerk in the treasury, Aug., 1892; sec. to the British delegates at the Brussels monetary conference, Nov., 1892; private sec. to the viceroy, Feb., 1894.

SMITH, Henry George Frederick, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd. apprentice engr., 11th Mar., 1874; asst. engr., Mar., 1875; exec. engr., July, 1891.

SMITH, Henry Scott, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Stratford-on-Avon, and Keble Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 4th Dec., 1886, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; dist. judge, June, 1894.

SMITH, James Cowlishaw, B.A., LL.B., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Derby, and Caius Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 7th Dec., 1896, and served in the N.W.P. and Oudh as asst. commr.

SMITH, John Macdonald, Col., I.S.C., late Jail Dept., Madras.—First commr., Madras infantry, 20th April, 1855; served in the China expdn.; asst. to the agent in Vizagapatam, 1861-68; junr. asst. collr., Ganjam, 1870-78; supt. of jails, Rajamahendri, 1880-82; from June, 1882, served as paymaster of pensioners, Bangalore, and also acted as district mag. and prest. of the municipality; chief presidency mag., Madras, Dec., 1885; inspr.-gen. of jails, Mar., 1891; reverted to mil. dept., Aug., 1892; author of a hand-book in the Khond language.

SMITH, John Manners, C.I.E., V.C., Capt., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the service, 10th March, 1883; attaché in the foreign dept., Nov., 1887; on special duty to Sikkim, in connection with the negotiations with the Chinese Amban, Nov., 1888; asst. to the officer on special duty at Gilgit, June, 1889; asst. to agent, Rajputana, Sept., 1892; on depn. to Kotah state, Oct., 1892; on duty under the orders of the British agent at Gilgit, April, 1893 on depn. with Kabul mission, Aug.-Dec., 1893; C.I.E., Jan., 1894; pol. agent, Bundelkhand, July, 1894; first asst. to agent in Baluchistan, Nov., 1894; mil. sec. to the Kashmir durbar.

SMITH, Joseph, B.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at King’s Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 25th Sept., 1861; from Sept., 1862, served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; mag. and collr., Aug., 1881; offg. district and sessions judge, July, 1886; retd., April, 1887.

SMITH, Sir Robert Murdoch, K.C.M.G., Major-Gen., R.E., late Indo-European Telegraph Dept.—Apptd. to the dept., Aug., 1863; dir. of the Persian section from June, 1865; dir.-in-chief, March, 1887; retd., Feb., 1888.

SMITH, Samuel George, Acctnt.-Gen.’s Dept., India Office.—Jnr. clerk, 6th Jan., 1883.

SMITH, Thomas, B.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Merton Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., asst. commr., and dep. commr.; apptd. district and sessions judge, Tipperah, Dec., 1877, and served subsequently in the jud. dept.; retd., Jan., 1888.

SMITH, Thomas William, Store Dept., India Office.—Apptd. 2nd class clerk, India store depot, 23rd May, 1888.

SMITH, Turton, Police Dept., Punjab.—From 26th March, 1863, served in the dept. as asst. supt. and district supt.; between Dec., 1871, and Sept., 1878, also served in the postal dept. as offg. asst. dir.-gen. of post offices, and as offg. postmr.-gen. at Bombay, Aug., 1876, and at Madras, May, 1878; dep. inspr.-gen. of police, Aug., 1892; acted as inspr.-gen. in 1893-94.

SMITH, Vincent Arthur, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 2nd Nov., 1871, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; from Nov., 1874, served in the settl. dept.; on special duty in the Allahabad district, Nov., 1880; served subsequently as asst. mag. and joint mag., and was also settl. officer of Basti, 1883-84; mag. and collr., June, 1889; district and sessions judge, March, 1895; author of ‘The Settlement Officer’s Manual,’ ‘Coinage of the Early Gupta Dynasty,’ ‘Graeco-Roman Influence on the Civilization of Ancient India,’ &c., and editor of Sleeman’s ‘Rambles and Recollections.’

SMITHE, Edmund Du Cane, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper’s Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1875, and employed on irrigtn. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., Dec., 1883; transf. to buildings and road branch, Oct., 1894; under sec. to govt., Punjab, Jan., 1897.

SMITHER, Maurice, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Aldenham Gr. Sch. and Caius Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 9th Jan., 1895, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and offg. cantonmt. mag.

SMYTH, John Watt, B.L., late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Queen’s Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1857; arrived, 29th Dec., 1857, and was apptd. asst. mag. and collr., Agra; transf. to Punjab, May, 1859, and served as asst. commr., and as personal ass.; registrar of the chief court, Feb., 1866; dep. commr., Oct., 1866; judge, chief court, March, 1880; retd., 1885.

SMYTH, Ralph Graham, Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Lieut., Bengal engrs., 7th Dec., 1855; from 6th Nov., 1857, served in the dept. in the Central and N.W. Prov. as asst. engr.; served in the Mutiny (medal and clasp); offg. garrison engr., Lucknow, June, 1859; on mil. duty, May, 1861; re-apptd., April, 1862, and served in Bengal as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; suptg. engr., July, 1876; transf. to Haidarabad, Dec., 1881, as sec. to rest. in the public works dept.; offg. chief engr. and sec. to chief commr., Burma, 1885; retd., Dec., 1889.

SMYTH, Thomas Watt, M.A., B.L., late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Queen’s Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 2nd Feb., 1862, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and small cause court judge; registrar of the chief court, 1867-70; dep. commr., April, 1877; commr., April, 1883; divl. judge, Nov., 1884; judge, chief court, Jan., 1887; retd., April, 1889; author of ‘Acts and Regulations applicable to the Punjab.’
SMYTH, WILLIAM JOHN, B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Bath Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 1st Jan., 1894, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

SNELL, FRANCIS WILLIAM, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Bombay Pol. Dept.—First commn., 23rd Jan., 1860; mil. duty to Jan., 1885; asst. pol. rest., Perim, Jan., 1885; Aden, Aug., 1886; served also at Savantvadi and Baroda; admr., Rajpipla State, Aug., 1895.

SNOW, PHILIP CHICHELEY HYDE, B.L., Indian C.S.(Bombay).—Educ. at Haileybury and Merton Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 11th Nov., 1876; asst. commr., Delhi, Nov., 1876; from March, 1877, served in British Burma as asst. commr., asst. cantonmt. mag., &c.; from Nov., 1881, served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and district registrar; forest settlt. officer, Dec., 1885; acting under sec. to govt., pol., &c., dep'ts., Sept., 1886; junr. collr. and mag., June, 1894; municipal commr., Bombay, Mar., 1896.

SORABJI PADAMJI PESTANJI, Statutory C.S. (Bombay).—Probr. under the native civil service rules, 14th Jan., 1880; confd., March, 1882; served as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settlt. officer; 2nd asst., May, 1889; 1st asst., March, 1893.

SPANKIE, GEORGE THEOPHILUS, B.L., Oudh Jud. Commn.—Called to the bar (Lincoln's Inn), 6th June, 1871; apptd. addl. jud. commr. in Oudh, 11th Nov., 1892.

SPANKIE, JOHN PATRICK WALTER, Major, I.S.C., Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov.—First commn., 9th Aug., 1873; served during the Afghan war, 1877-78 (medal); offg. cantonmt. mag., Oct., 1881; confd., Sept., 1882.

SPEARMAN, HORACE RALPH, Col., I.S.C., late Burma Commn.—Ensign, 91st Highlanders, 18th Dec., 1857; proby. asst. engr., public works dept., 1862; from Dec., 1862, served in the Burma commn. as asst. commr. and asst. sec. to the chief commr.; offg. asst. pol. agent, Bhamo, March, 1871; dep. commr., Jan., 1877; prest., Rangoon municipal committee, 1883, and 1886, and of the Akyab municipal committee, 1884; commr., April, 1890; returned to Europe, Dec., 1895; author of 'British Burma Gazetteer.'

SPEDDING, ROBERT DECY, M.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 17th Nov., 1861, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; dep. commr., Jhansi, April, 1879; mag. and collr., Dec., 1879; commr., Oct., 1889; retd., July, 1891.

SPENCE, JAMES KNOX, C.S.I., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll. and Royal Mil. Acad., Woolwich; apptd. after exam. of 1864, arrived, 29th Oct., 1865, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; from May, 1878, to Oct., 1880, served in the postal dept.; junr. collr. and mag., and pol. agent, Kolaba, June, 1885; senr. collr. and collr. of land rev., &c., Bombay, Nov., 1888; acting commr. of customs, &c., Dec., 1889; also British delegate for the Portuguese treaty; commr., Nov., 1891; member of legisl. council, July, 1895; acted as member of council, April-July, 1896; C.S.I., Jan., 1898.

SPENCER, CHARLES GORDON, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Marlborough and Keble Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 26th Nov., 1890, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

SPENCER, HUGH, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Bristol Gr. Sch., and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 17th Dec., 1888, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Nov., 1893.

SPENCER, LIONEL DIXON, M.D., Surgn.-Col., Indian Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., Bengal med. establ., March, 1865; served under the civil dept. in the Central Prov., and with the Central India horse; from Oct., 1871, served as agency surgn., E. states, Rajputana; on famine duty, 1877, and acted as pol. agent, Karauli, 1877, and Bharatpur, 1878; in 1879 was in med. charge of the Marwar and Jaisalmir agency; from March, 1881, served as agency surgn., Rajputana, and supt.-gen. of dispensaries and vaccn.; reverted to mil. dept., July, 1892; apptd. princ. med. offr., Punjab Field Force, Oct., 1892 to Oct., 1897.

SPILSBURY, EDGAR CHARLES, Major, R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to Bombay public works dept. as asst. engr., 17th Aug., 1876; served in the Afghan war, 1879-80 (medal); employed on Bombay defences, March, 1883; exec. engr., March, 1886; transfd. to Burma, Dec., 1893; to Rajutana and Central India, Sept., 1895.

SPRING, FRANCIS JOSEPH EDWARD, C.I.E., M.I.C.E., M.I.M.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. 4th Aug., 1870, and employed on irrigtn. works in the Punjab; transfd. to state railways, May, 1873; exec. engr., Jan., 1880; under sec. to govt. of Bengal, railway branch, Sept., 1884; employed on N.W. line, March, 1888; engr.-in-chief, E. Coast railway, Nov., 1890; offg. consulting engr. for railways, Bombay, and sec. to govt., Aug., 1893; employed on Bezwada-Madras railway survey, Nov., 1893; consulting engr. to govt. of India for railways, Assam, Jan., 1894; C.I.E., May, 1894; rank of suptg. engr., July, 1894; consulting engr. for railways, Madras, and joint sec. to govt. public works dept., March, 1897.

SPRY, ARTHUR HUME, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1857; arrived, 22nd Oct., 1857, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., special officer of income tax, and asst. pol. agent; junr. collr. and mag., Dharwar, Dec., 1878; senr. collr., Kaira, Oct., 1882; on special duty in the Cambay state, Feb., 1883; retd., 1886.

SRI LAL, Pandit, B.L., Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. by the govt. of India as a probr. under the statutory civil service rules; asst. mag. and collr., 30th March, 1889; confd., 21st May, 1891; asst. settlt. officer, Jan., 1894; joint mag., May, 1896.

SRINIVASA AIYAR, R.V., Rao Barhadu, Madras Revenue Settlt. Dept.—Apptd. sec. to commr. of rev. settlt., and dir. of the dept. of land records and agric., Madras, July, 1896.

SRINAVASA RAGHAVA AIYANGAR, SESHAYANGAR, C.I.E., B.A., Dewan Bahadur, Madras Registrn. Dept.—Joined the service, Nov., 1870; head acctnt., rev. board's office, March, 1878; 2nd asst., Nov., 1879; and 1st asst., Aug., 1880; inspr.-gen. of registrn., Madras, Sept., 1886; C.I.E., June, 1893; member of legisl. council, Nov., 1893; Diwan of Baroda, 1890.
SRINIVASA RAO, PATEKI, Dewan Bahadur, Jud. Dept., Madras.—Served in the jud. dept. in various capacities from 16th Dec., 1844; apptd. police mag., Madras, May, 1871; fellow of Madras univ., 1875; small cause court judge, Madras, April, 1880; judge, Madras city civil court, Dec., 1892.

STACE, EDWARD VINCENT, C.B., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., late Pol. Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 13th Nov., 1862; from June, 1871, served in the Bombay rev. survey dept. as asst. supt., and as boundary settlt. commr.; from May, 1873, acted as asst. pol. rest., Aden, and from April, 1875, as asst. pol. agent, Kathiawar, &c.; second asst. rest. at Aden, Sept., 1880; asst. pol. agent, Kathiawar, Dec., 1881; joint administrator, Rajpipla, Feb., 1885; first asst. pol. rest. at Aden, and pol. agent for the Somali coast, Feb., 1889; acted as rest. at various periods; pol. agent and collr. of stamp rev., Cutch, Aug., 1893.

STACK, GEORGE AUGUSTINE, late Bengal Educl. Dept.—Served from 1st Jan., 1868, as profr. at the Agra, Bareilly, and Dacca colls.; profr., Patna coll., Jan., 1883; presidency coll., Feb., 1888; retd. April, 1897.

STACK, OLIVER STOKES, late Police Dept., Bengal.—From 8th June, 1859, served as dep. mag. and dep. collr.; from May, 1862, served in the police dept., and was apptd. district supt., 1st grade, Oct., 1873; dep. inspr.-gen., July, 1885; offg. inspr.-gen., June, 1886; retd., Oct., 1890.

STALEY, ALFRED EVELYN, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch., Concord, U.S.A., and St. Peter's Coll., Radley; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 20th Oct., 1875, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; transf'd to Bengal, Jan., 1880; offg. under sec. to govt., 1884 and 1885; joint mag., Aug., 1886; acting junr. sec. to rev. board, March, 1890; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1891.

STANDEN, BERTRAM PRIOR, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Uppingham, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 5th Dec., 1888, and served in Burma and the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; registrar, jud. commr.'s court, Nagpur, March, 1891; settlt. officer, Dec., 1894.

STANSFELD, RIGHT HON. SIR JAMES, G.C.B., LL.B., B.L.—Born in 1820; educ. at Univ. Coll., London; called to the bar at the Inner Temple, 1849; M.P. for Halifax, 1859-95; a lord of the admiralty, 1863-64; under sec. of state for India, Feb. to June, 1866; third lord of the treasury, Dec., 1868; joint sec. to the treasury, Oct., 1869; prest. of the poor law board, March, 1871; prest. of the local govt. board, 1871-74, and again in 1886; G.C.B., 1895.

STANTHILL, WILLIAM, Public Works Dept., India Office.—Educ. at the City of London Sch.; clerk, and class, 25th Sept., 1882.

STANYON, HENRY JOHN, C.I.E., B.L., Judicial Dept., (Central Prov.)—Apptd. divl. judge, Nagpore, March, 1897.

STEAD, VEN. SAMUEL, M.A. (Oxon.), late Ecclesl. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the service, March, 1863; arrived, 24th April, 1863, and served as chaplain at Karachi, Sholapur, Belgaum, and Poona; senr. chaplain, April, 1873; archdeacon and commissary, Nov., 1878; held charge of the diocese of Bombay, 1877-78, and 1883-84; retd., June, 1886.

STEANE, WILLIAM COPELY, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Temporary clerk, 9th Nov., 1860; clerk, 2nd class, Aug., 1878.

STEAVENSON, JOSEPH, B.A., Jud. Dept., Madras.—Served from 25th Feb., 1878, as acting registrar of the high court (original side), Madras, and was confd. in this appt., Feb., 1880.

STEDMAN, SIR EDWARD, K.C.I.E., C.B., Major-Gen., I.S.C.—First commn., 19th Dec., 1860; served in the Hazara campaign, 1868 (medal with clasp); also in the Afghan war of 1878-80 (medal with clasp and bronze star); served in the Burma expdn. of 1886-87, and commanded the operations in the Shan states (two clasps; C.B.); inspr.-gen. of police, Upper Burma, May, 1887; and of Burma, Oct., 1888; apptd. quartermaster-gen. in India, March, 1892; comdg. Burma dist., Nov., 1895; K.C.I.E., June, 1897.

STEEDMAN, EDWARD BRITTAIN, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Shrewsbury; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 31st Oct., 1871, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and settlt. officer; dir. of settlt. and rev. records, May, 1887; designation changed to dir. of land records and agric.; dep. commr., Dec., 1889; in 1892 offd. as dir. of land records and agric., and rev. sec. to govt.; author of 'Report on the Settlement of the Jhang District.'

STEEL, CHARLES DENTON, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Wesleyan Connexional Sch. and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 13th Nov., 1876, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; asst. supt. and judge, small cause court, Dehra Dun, in 1888-89; asst. commr., April, 1889; joint mag., Jan., 1890; district and sessions judge, April, 1891; dep. commr., April, 1892; mag. and collr., March, 1894; author of 'Allahabad Gazetteer.'

STEEL, HENRY WILLIAM, late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Caius Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 10th Nov., 1862, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; employed in connection with Punjab N. state railway, July, 1874; jud. asst., Dec., 1878; dep. commr., Nov., 1884; retd., May, 1890.

STEEL, JOHN PHILIP, Lieut.-Gen., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Lieut., Bengal engrs., Dec., 1855; joined the dept., March, 1860, as asst. engr., Bengal; exec. engr., April, 1868; offg. under sec., govt. of India, public works dept., 1873-75, and again Feb., 1877; suptg. engr. and sec. to agent, Rajputana, May, 1879; offg. chief engr. and sec. to govt., Punjab, March, 1887; offg. sec. to chief commr., Central Prov., Oct., 1887; chief engr. and joint sec. to govt., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, 1888; sec., Dec., 1889; retd., March, 1892.

STEELE, CHARLES EDWARD STAFFORD, Sind Commn.—Educ. at Victoria Coll., Jersey; joined the service, 11th June, 1869, and served in Sind as supernumerary asst. settlt. officer; supernumerary dep. collr., Dec., 1871; employed under the Transvaal govt. as fin. and rev. commr., 1879-81; served subsequently as asst. collr. and mag., manager of encumbered estates, acting city mag., Karachi, and acting conservator of forests; head asst. collr., Feb., 1892; dep. commr., upper Sind frontier, Feb., 1894; dep. commr., Thar and Parkar, Nov., 1895; acting collr. and district mag., Hyderabad, April, 1897.

STEINBELT, JEAN MARIE CONRAD, late Bengal
C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861; from Jan., 1863, served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., asst. commr., and joint mag.; from April, 1881, served as civil and sessions judge in Banda, and afterwards at Azamgarh; retd., April, 1887.

STEINBERG, ALFRED FREDERICK, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 12th Dec., 1881, and served in Assam as asst. commr.; transfd. to Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., Jan., 1892; joint mag., March, 1892; district and sessions judge, March, 1895.

STENT, WILLIAM KITSON, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 14th April, 1871, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., April, 1880; engr.-in-chief, Bellary-Kistna railway, in 1885 and 1886; services lent to S. Indian railway co., 1891; engr.-in-chief, Delhi-Minchinabad railway survey, Nov., 1892; suptg. engr., Oct., 1894; engr.-in-chief, Kotri-Rohri railway, Oct., 1894.

STEPHEN, ARTHUR, M.A., M.B., Surgn.-Col., Med. Dept., Assam.—Joined the service as probr. at Netley, 30th Sept., 1867; served under the mil. dept. in Abyssinia and the Punjab as asst. surgn. and surgn.; acted at various periods as civil surgn., jail supt., and chemical examr. to the Punjab govt.; supt. of jail, Lahore, Sept., 1875; statistical officer to govt. of India, sanitary and med. depts., Nov., 1880; sanitary commr., Punjab, Nov., 1886; acting principal med. officer and sanitary commr., Assam, March, 1894.

STEPHEN, CARR, B.L., late Punjab Jud. Dept.—Served in the Punjab from 11th June, 1856, as extra asst. commr. and small cause court judge; extra jud. asst. commr., 1st grade, Oct., 1875; offg. divl. judge, 1885-86; retd., 1890; has publd. ‘Indian Registration Act,’ ‘Handbook for Delhi,’ and ‘Archaeology of Delhi.’

STEPHEN, KENT HUME, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper’s Hill Coll.; apptd., 24th Sept., 1878, and employed on irrig. works in Bengal; exec. engr., March, 1889; under sec. to govt. of Bengal, public works dept., March, 1892, to March, 1895.

STEPHENSON, HUGH LANSDOWN, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Westminster and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 14th Dec., 1895, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

STERNDALE, R. A., late Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Served during the Mutiny as a volunteer, 1857 (medal); from Aug., 1859, served in the Central Prov. as dep. collr. and asst. settl. officer; from June, 1864, served in the finl. dept. in various capacities in Nagpur, Calcutta, and the Punjab; asst. acctn.-gen., Bombay, Jan., 1884, and Madras, Nov., 1887; retd., 1890; author of ‘Mammalia of British India and Ceylon,’ ‘Denizens of the Jungles,’ an ‘Account of the District of Seoni,’ ‘Turkey and India; or Our Indian Moslems,’ and other works.

STEVENS, CHARLES CECIL, C.S.I., B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Univ. of Melbourne; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 2nd Feb., 1862; served in Bengal, and was apptd. mag. and collr., Oct., 1873; offg. sec. board of rev., April, 1882; commr., Aug., 1885; offg. chief sec. to govt. of Bengal, 1890; member of rev. board, Dec., 1891; member of supreme legisl. council, Jan., 1893; C.S.I., Jan., 1895; offg. Lieut.-Gov. of Bengal, June, 1897.

STEVENS, JOHN FOSTER, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Birmingham Gr. Sch., at Versailles, and at King’s Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 16th Oct., 1865, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., May, 1876; district and sessions judge, Sept., 1884; jud. commr., Central Prov., April, 1894; acting judge, high court, Calcutta, Feb. to Sept., 1895, and from April, 1897; confd., Dec., 1897.

STEVENSON, EDWARD SNEADE BOYD, Madras Police Dept.—Entered the service, Oct., 1870, and served as inspr., asst. supt. and supt. of police; dep. inspr.-gen., Nov., 1895.

STEVENSON, FRANCIS, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Apptd. supplemental clerk, 1st Jan., 1893.

STEVENSON, GEORGE, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at King’s Coll., Aberdeen, and Glasgow Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 11th Nov., 1872, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and in Assam as asst. commr.; dep. commr., Sylhet, Jan., 1885; returned to Bengal, June, 1889, as joint mag.; mag. and collr., July, 1889; acted as commr., Orissa, in 1895, and at Burdwan, July, 1896, and March, 1897.

STEVENSON, ROBERT CHARLES, Burma Commn.—Entered the service, May, 1871, and served in police dept. till 1886; apptd. to Burma commn. as asst. commr., Mar., 1886; has publd. a ‘Vernacular Police Manual for British Burma,’ and a revised edn. of ‘Judson’s Burmese Dictionary.’

STEVENSON - MOORE, CHARLES JAMES, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Felsted Sch., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 10th Dec., 1887, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Aug., 1894; also asst. settl. officer, Dec., 1894; settl. officer, Feb., 1896.

STEVINSON, JOHN SANDBACH, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Queen’s Coll., Taunton; Pemb. Coll., Oxford, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 8th Nov., 1895, and served in N.W.P. and Oudh as asst. commr.

STEWARD, ARTHUR BENNET, B.A., B.L., late Indian C.S.(Bombay).—Educ. at Rugby and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 5th Nov., 1870, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; second asst. collr., Dec., 1882; acting postmr.-gen., Bombay, 1884-85; acting asst. judge, Poona, and asst. agent for sardars in the Deccan, Oct., 1885; jud. asst. to pol. agent, Kathiawar, Nov., 1887; judge and sessions judge, May, 1891; retd., Aug., 1896.

STEWART, ALFRED JOSEPH, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, pol. dept., 27th Sept., 1892; transfd. to registry and record dept., Jan., 1896.

STEWART, SIR DONALD MARTIN, Bart., G.C.B., G.C.S.I., C.I.E., Field-Marshal.—First commn., Bengal army, 12th Oct., 1840; served against the hill tribes on the Peshawar frontier in 1854-55, and against the Bussee Kheyl tribes in 1855 (medal and clasp); commanded volunteers in Aligarh district, May and June, 1857; dep. asst. adjutant-gen., Delhi field force, June, 1857; asst. adjutant-gen. of army, Dec., 1857; was present at siege and capture of Lucknow, and the operations in Rohilkhand (medal with
two clasps); dep. adjutant-gen. in India, Feb., 1863; brigadier-gen., Abyssinian expedition force, 1868 (medal and C.B.); in command of Peshawar district, July, 1869; chief commr. of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, 1871; in command of Lahore divn., April, 1876; commanding Kandahar and S. Afghanistan force, 1878-80; commanding at Kabul and in N. Afghanistan, 1880, till withdrawal from that country (thanks of both houses of parliament; K.C.B., G.C.B., bart., and medal with clasp); mil. member of govr.-gen.'s council, 1880; commander-in-chief in India, and extraordinary member of the govr.-gen.'s council, 1881; member of council of India, Dec., 1885; on expiration of his term of office in Dec., 1895, was re-apptd. for a further period of five years; field-marshal, May, 1894; member of royal commn. on Indian expenditure, May, 1895.

STEWART, ROBERT BARTON, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Dulwich and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 27th Dec., 1886, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 2nd asst., Feb., 1893; 1st asst., June, 1896.

STEWART, WILLIAM HALL MACKINTOSH, Capt., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 25th May, 1878; from June, 1889, acted as attache, foreign dept., and asst. sec. to govt.; confd. in former post, Oct., 1890; asst. agent, Indore, Jan., 1891; asst. rest., Kashmir, July, 1891; asst. pol. agent, Gilgit, April, 1893.

STEWART-WILSON, CHARLES, B.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Edinburgh High Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 23rd Dec., 1886 and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Dec., 1890; under sec. to govt., Aug., 1891; from April, 1892, served as offg. postmtr.-gen., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Bengal (1892-94), and Bombay (1894); offg. dep. dir. of post office, Oct., 1894; postmtr.-gen., Calcutta, April, 1896.

STIBBS, JAMES CHARLES, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Plymouth Corp. Gr. Sch., Penzance Coll. Sch., and King's Coll., London; clerk, 2nd class, 5th Nov., 1807.

STIFFE, ARTHUR W., Captain, late R.I.M.—First commn., Indian marine, 24th Feb., 1849; served in Persian war, 1856-57; on special survey for telegraph cable in Persian Gulf, 1862; on special duty in Turkish Arabia, 1863; engr. Persian Gulf telegraphs, and commanding 'Amberwitch,' Oct., 1863; offg. dir., Persian Gulf telegraphs, 1866 and 1869-71; port officer, Calcutta, Aug., 1879; offg. supt. of marine, July, 1880; ex-officio shipping master of Calcutta, Feb., 1882; retd., 1888; has brought out new charts and pilots of the Persian Gulf and Mekran coast; also a new chart of Maskat, and a description of the Hugli.

STIFFE, NORMAN CECIL, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 16th Dec., 1896, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

STIMPSON, EDWARD JOHN, Store Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 21st May, 1873; resigned, 24th June, 1879; recaptd., 10th July, 1880.

STOGDON, ABRAHAM WILLIAM, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Uppingham Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 11th Nov., 1864, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; jud. asst., Sept., 1877; services placed temporarily at disposal of govt. of India, mil. dept., Feb., 1881; dep. commr., Aug., 1883; divl. judge, Nov., 1884; judge of the chief court, July, 1894.

STOKER, GEORGE HERBERT, B.A., Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Educ. at the City of London Sch., and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford (scholar, 1893-97); junr. clerk, 11th Oct., 1897.

STOKER, THOMAS, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Rathmines Sch. and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 14th Nov., 1872, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; dep. supt. of family domains of Maharaja of Benares, March, 1878; 1st asst. sec. to govt., April, 1884; under sec., May, 1884; settlt. officer, Bulandshahr, Sept., 1886; inspr.-gen. of registrn., and commr. of excise and stamps, Nov., 1891; sec. to govt., scarcity dept., Jan., 1897; author of 'A Gold Standard for India,' and of the Bulandshahr settlt. report.

STOKES, GABRIEL, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Kilkenny Coll., Royal Sch., Armagh, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 28th Oct., 1871, and served in Bombay and Madras as asst. mag. and collr.; acting addl. under sec. to govt. of Madras in the rev. (famine) dept., 1877-79; acting Kanase translr. to govt., Feb., 1880; dep. supt. of census operations, Sept., 1880; sub-collr. and joint mag., May, 1886; collr. and mag., Aug., 1889; govt. agent, Tanjore, Nov., 1895.

STOKES, SIR HENRY EDWARD, K.C.S.I., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Minehead Diocesan Sch., Kilkenny Coll., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 4th Jan., 1864, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; under sec. to govt. in the depts. under the chief sec., Aug., 1869; acting collr. of sea customs and protector of emigrants, Madras, Jan., 1871; fellow of the univ. of Madras, 1875; sub-sec., board of rev., July, 1875; on special duty with the Madras salt commn., 1876; sec., board of rev., Jan., 1877, to Feb., 1878, and addl. sec. on famine duties, Feb., 1877; district and sessions judge, S. Malabar, Oct., 1879; collr. and mag., Salem, June, 1881; sec. to govt. in the rev. dept., Jan., 1884; member of legisl. council, Oct., 1886; chief sec. to govt., Oct., 1887; temporary member of govr.-gen.'s council, July, 1888; ordinary member, Nov., 1888; C.S.I., May, 1889; K.C.S.I., May, 1892; retd., Nov., 1893.

STOKES, HENRY JOHN, B.A., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at St. Columba Coll., Rathfarnham, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1861, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; served in Bombay from Oct., 1864, to Jan., 1870, and subsequently in Madras; principal asst., July, 1871; district and sessions judge, June, 1877; collr. and mag., June, 1879; on famine duty, Madura, Aug., 1877; district and sessions judge, Madura, Jan., 1884; collr. and mag., N. Arcot, Oct., 1884; district and sessions judge, Coimbatore, May, 1886; member of the public service commn., Nov., 1886; retd., July, 1889.

STOKES, HOPETOUN GABRIEL, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Clifton and Oriel Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 7th Dec., 1896, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

STOKES, WHITLEY, C.S.I., C.I.E., Hon. D.C.L. (Oxon.), LL.D. (Dublin), B.L. (Inner Temple), late LegisL. Dept., Govt. of India.—Reporter to the high court and acting adminis-
trator-gen., Madras, 1863-64; served subsequently as asst. sec. to govt. of India, legisl. branch, sec. to legisl. council and sec. in the legisl. dept.; law member of the council of the govr.-gen., May, 1877, to May, 1882; prest. of Indian law commn., 1879; in 1868 framed a scheme for collecting, copying, and cataloguing the Sanskrit MSS preserved in India; author of 'Hindu Law Books,' 1865; the 'Indian Succession Act, with a Commentary,' 1865; the 'Indian Companies Act, 1866, with Notes'; the 'Older Statutes in Force in India, with Notes,' 1874; the 'Unrepealed General Acts of the Governor-General of India, with Chronological Tables, &c.,' 1875-76; the 'Anglo-Indian Codes,' 1887-88, and other works.

STONE, SAMUEL JAMES, late Police Dept., Punjab.—Apptd. asst. district supt. of police, 10th March, 1865; district supt., Nov., 1872; served in Assam, 1884-85; resumed his post in the Punjab, April, 1885; retd., Feb., 1894.

STOREY, HENRY FRANCIS, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, Nov., 1868, as exec. engr.; engr.-in-chief, Kandahar state railway, March, 1880; engr.-in-chief, Indus valley and Kandahar railways, Oct., 1881; supt. of way and works, Sukkur, 1883; suptg. engr., N.W. railway, Jan., 1886; sec. to rest., Haidarabad, Dec., 1889; retd., April, 1893.

STOW, ALAN CHARLES, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Apptd. 2nd class clerk, 7th Oct., 1803.

STOW, ALEXANDER MONTAGU, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Harrow, and Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 17th Dec., 1896, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

STOWELL, VERE ARTHUR, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Rossall, and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 7th Dec., 1896, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr.

STRACHEY, ARTHUR, B.A., LL.B., B.L., Bombay High Court.—Educ. at Trinity Hall, Cambridge; called to the bar at the Middle Temple; joined the service, 26th July, 1884, as offg. reporter for the Indian law reports, high court, N.W. Prov.; confd., March, 1877; public prosecutor and standing counsel to govt., Nov., 1892; judge of Bombay high court, Nov., 1895.

STRACHEY, SIR JOHN, G.C.S.I., C.I.F., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1842; served in the N.W. Prov. in the grades of asst. commr. and asst. mag. and collr.; senr. asst., Kumaon, 1848; mag. and collr., Moradabad, 1854; offg. commr. of Kumaon, 1861; prest. of commn. to inquire into cholera epidemic of 1861; jud. commr., Central Prov., 1862; prest. of the sanitary commn. with govt. of India, 1864; chief commr., Oudh, 1866; member of govr.-gen.'s council, March, 1868; acting viceroy and govr.-gen. on death of Earl of Mayo, 9th to 23rd Feb., 1872; lieut.-govr., N.W. Prov., 7th April, 1874; retd. from the civil service, Dec., 1876; finl. member of the govr.-gen.'s council, Dec., 1876 to Dec., 1880; member of council of India, July, 1885, to July, 1895; joint author with Lieut.-Gen. R. Strachey of 'The Finances and Public Works of India,' 1882; author of 'India,' 1888 (2nd edn., 1894), and of 'Hastings and the Rohilla War,' 1892.

STRACHEY, SIR RICHARD, G.C.S.I., F.R.S., Lt.-Gen., R.E.—2nd lieut., Bengal engrs., June, 1836; was employed on irrign. works in the N.W. Prov. from 1840, and apptd. exec. engr., Ganges canal, July, 1843; under sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., 1857; sec. to govt., Central Prov., 1857; consulting engr., railway dept., Sept., 1858; sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., 1862; inspr.-gen. of irrign., and chief engr., 1st class, Dec., 1866; member of supreme legisl. council, 1869; inspgr. engr. of machinery and stores for state railways, India office, 1871; member of council of India, Jan., 1875, to July, 1878; on special duty in India, 1878; offg. member of council of govr.-gen., Jan., 1879; prest. of the famine commn., 1880; re-apptd. member of council of India, March, 1879; prest., royal geographical society, 1887; retd. from the council o India, on his appt. as chairman of the E. Indian railway company, Oct., 1889; apptd. a representative of India at the international monetary conference, Brussels, 1892; member of Indian currency committee, 1892-93; joint author with Sir John Strachey of 'The Finances and Public Works of India,' 1882; G.C.S.I., June, 1897.

STRAFFORD (EARL OF), RIGHT HON. GEORGE HENRY CHARLES BYNG.—Born in 1830; educ. at Eton and Oxford; M.P. for Tavistock, 1852-57, and for Middlesex, 1857-74, when he was called to the upper house, as Viscount Enfield; attached to Earl Russell's special mission to Vienna, 1855; parly. sec. to the poor law board, 1865-66; under sec. for foreign affairs, Dec., 1870; under sec. of state for India, Sept., 1880, to Dec., 1882; succeeded to earldom of Strafford, 1886.

STRAHAN, CHARLES, MAJOR-GEN., R.E., Survey of India Dept.—First commn., Bengal engrs., June, 1860; arrived, Oct., 1862; joined the survey dept. as mil. 2nd asst., Sept., 1863; served with the Bhutan field force in charge of reconnoitring party, 1865-66 (medal and clasp); surveyor, Dec., 1867; dep. supt., Sept., 1869; served with the Peshawar field force in Afghanistan, 1879 (medal); asst. surveyor-gen. in charge of cartographic and engraving branches, May, 1883; dep. surveyor-gen. (rev. branch), July, 1892; surveyor-gen. of India, March, 1895.

STRAHAN, GEORGE, COL., R.E., late Survey of India Dept.—Obtained commn. from Addiscombe, Dec., 1858; arrived, Nov., 1860; served under the mil. and public works dept. till July, 1862, when he was apptd. to the survey dept.; served as asst. in the Gwalior and Central India survey, and afterwards held charges in the Rajputana, Mysore, and Khandesh surveys; dep. supt., Nov., 1867; offg. asst. surveyor-gen., in charge of engraving and cartographic branches, Calcutta, April-July, 1883; dep. surveyor-gen. (trigonl. branch), Oct., 1889; offd. as surveyor-gen. in 1892; reverted to mil. dept., May, 1894; retd., June, 1895.

STRAIGHT, SIR DOUGLAS, KT., B.L., late Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Called to the bar at the Middle Temple, Nov., 1865; counsel to London banks association from 1868; junr. counsel, treasury prosecution, from 1877; M.P. for Shrewsbury, 1870-74; apptd. one of the royal commrs. to inquire into corrupt election practices at Boston, 1875; puisne judge, high court, N.W. Prov., June, 1879; offd. as chief justice in 1883, 1884, and 1886; fellow of Calcutta univ., 1883, and of the Allahabad univ., 1887; retd., April, 1892; KT., Aug., 1892.
STRATTON, WALLACE CHRISTOPHER RAMSAY, Capt., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 26th July, 1881; from May, 1885, acted as asst. agent, Rajputana, and asst. gen. supt., thagi and dakaiti; confd. as asst. agent, Mt. Abu, March, 1888; pol. agent and consul, Muscat, April, 1889; 1st ast. rest., Nov., 1889; transfd. to Bishire, Dec., 1889; asst. pol. agent and consul, Bassora, April, 1890; 1st ast. agent, Baluchistan, April, 1891; pol. agent, S.E. Baluchistan, Oct., 1894; author of a narrative of Muscat affairs, 1885-88; offg. pol. agent, Kotah.

STREATFEILD, CLAUDE ARTHUR CECIL, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Marlborough and Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 21st Nov., 1891, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Nov., 1896.

STREATFIELD, HENRY CUTHBERT, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Marlborough and Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 29th Dec., 1887, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; under sec. to govt. in the finl. and municipal depts., Nov., 1890; and in the jud., &c., depts., Oct., 1892; sec. to the jury commn., 1893; joint mag. and dep. collr., Aug., 1894.

STREET, BROOKS HENRY GEORGE, Store Dept., India Office.—Writer, 30th June, 1874; clerk, 2nd class, Sept., 1878; supervisor, 2nd grade, India store depot, Oct., 1883.

STREET, HENRY ALFRED, Capt., R.I.M.—Commander of 'Tenasserim,' Dec., 1876, to June, 1880; asst. sec. to govt. of India, mil. (marine) dept., June, 1880, to March, 1882; on duty in Bombay, 1882-84; asst. dir., Indian marine, April, 1884; port officer, Madras, Dec., 1887; presidency port officer, Madras, Aug., 1888, to Jan., 1893, and again from Feb., 1896; offg. in the same post, 1893-94; and at Calcutta, April, 1895.

STRICKLAND, WILLIAM ALEXANDER WICKEDE, Capt., I.S.C., Burma Commn.—First commn., Oct., 1880; employed in Burma as asst. commr., Aug., 1886; dep. commr., Jan., 1896.

STRINGER, JOHN ALFRED, India Audit Office.—Educ. at Macclesfield Gr. Sch.; clerk, 2nd class, 26th March, 1897.

STROVER, GEORGE AUGUSTUS, Col., I.S.C., late Burma Commn.—Joined the service as ensign, 20th Jan., 1857; arrived at Madras, Feb., 1857; served in the Burma commn. from 14th April, 1862, as asst. commr. and cantonmt. mag.; offg. mag. and small cause court judge of Rangoon, 1866; supt. of hill tribes, N. Arakan, Sept., 1868; from Aug., 1869, to Sept., 1875, served as asst. pol. agent at Bhamo, and pol. agent at Mandalay; from Nov., 1877, served as dep. commr. of Toungoo, and acted as commr. of Arakan, 1883; commr., May, 1889; acted as finl. commr. in 1892; reverted to mil. dept., Oct., 1894.

STUART, ANDREW EDMUND CASTLE-STUART, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Wellington Coll. and Kingstown Sch., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 17th Nov., 1879, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag. and forest settlt. officer; special asst. to the collrs. of Nilgiris and Malabar for settlt. purposes, Aug., 1886; head asts., July, 1888; sub-collr. and joint mag., Feb., 1893; collr. and mag., March, 1896; compiled a 'Manual of the Wynnaad.'

STUART, CHARLES AUGUSTUS, late Postal Dept., Bombay.—Served from 23rd Nov., 1855, as postmr. in Mysore, Madras, and Haidarabad; presidency postmr., Madras, Jan., 1864; from March, 1865, served in Bombay as presidency postmr., and also offd. for various periods as postmr.-gen., Bombay, Punjab, and Madras; retd., Feb., 1892.

STUART, CHARLES JOSEPH, Col., I.S.C., late Madras Rev. Dept.—Arrived, 21st Aug., 1852; served in the Madras rev. settlt. dept. from April, 1861, as asst. dir. and dep. dir.; special asst. to collr. of Karnul for survey and settlt. purposes, 1871-73, and afterwards in Chengalpat and Madura; retd., 1889.

STUART, GEORGE HENRY, M.A., Madras Educl. Dept.—Educ. at Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; joined the service, 14th Aug., 1882, as principal, Kumbakonum coll.; principal and prof'r., presidency coll., Aug., 1895.

STUART, HAROLD ARTHUR, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at High Sch., Bishop's Stortford, and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 25th Nov., 1881, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and under sec. to govt.; acting private sec. to govr. of Madras, Nov.-Dec., 1889; provl. supt. of census operations, April, 1890; on special duty to revise district manuals, 1893-94; sub-collr. and joint mag., Aug., 1893; principal asst. collr. and district mag., Oct., 1895; private sec. to the govr. of Madras, March, 1896.

STUART, HARRY, India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service as dep. examr. of railway accts., 29th Jan., 1878; examr., Jan., 1882; acted as manager, Tirhut state railway, in 1889 and 1890; govt. examr., Indian Midland railway, Nov., 1890; examr. of accts., E. Bengal state railway, July, 1892.

STUART, LOUIS, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Charterhouse, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 17th Dec., 1891, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; joint mag., March, 1897.

STURDY, WILLIAM ARTHUR, India Audit Office.—Educ. at Leeds Gr. Sch.; clerk, 2nd class, 27th Dec., 1894.

STURMER, ARTHUR JAS., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., I.M.S., Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service, March, 1875; served on regtl. duty, and as civil surgn. till 1893; dist. surgn., Feb., 1894; surgn., 4th dist., and prof. Madras med. coll., April, 1896.

STURROCK, JOHN, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the High Sch., Dundee; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 20th Nov., 1864, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; acting sec. to govt. in the rev. dept., Nov., 1873; boundary commr. between Kanara and Mysore, 1873, and 1880-81; Kanarese translr. to govt., Jan., 1874; under sec. to govt. in the chief sec.'s dept., July, 1875; addl. sub-sec., board of rev., for special duty with famine commn., Nov., 1878; sub-sec., board of rev., Oct., 1879; collr. and mag., Oct., 1883; member of legisl. council, March, 1894; member of rev. board, and commr. of land tax, Sept., 1894; member of legisl. council of Madras, April, 1896.

STURT, JOHN VENABLES, late Kumaun Commn.—Joined the service, 24th Dec., 1856; held various non-gazetted appts. till 1860; served as extra asst. commr. from 1862; asst. commr., 1871; dep. commr., April, 1896; retd., Nov., 1896.

STURT, WILLIAM NEVILLE, Rev. and Statistics Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Repton; tem-
porary clerk, 1st May, 1862; junr. clerk, store dept., 1862; acctnt-gen.'s dept., 1863; mil. dept., 1863; private sec. to parly. under sec. of state, 1863-64, and 1868-77; senr. clerk, rev. dept., April, 1877; served temporarily in pol. and secret dept., 1890-94; asst. sec. judi. and public dept., March, 1896.

SUBRAMANIYA AIYAR, S., C.I.E., Dewan Bahadur, Madras High Court.—Acted as govt. pleader in 1888-89 and 1892-94; also as judge of the high court in 1891-92, and from Jan., 1895; confd., May, 1895.

SULLIVAN, HENRY EDWARD, C.S.I., late Madras C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1850; served in rev. and jud. depts., Madras, and was apptd. small cause court judge, Sept., 1866; civil and sessions judge, Dec., 1866; collr. and mag., March, 1868; offg. dir. of rev. settlt., Feb., 1874; in charge of the inam dept., May, 1876; acting rest. of Travancore and Cochin, 1877-78; board of rev., April, 1878; famine commn., Jan., 1879; 1st member, board of rev., and commr., uncov. civil service exams., Jan., 1879; on duty to England as member of famine commn., 1879-80; member of legisl. council, Jan., 1881; in charge of settlt. dept., Feb., 1881; ordinary member of council, June, 1882; prest. of local self-govt. committee, June, 1882; retd., Dec., 1886.

SULLIVAN, WILLIAM JAMES AUGUSTUS, Madras Police Dept.—Joined the service, 28th Jan., 1869; asst. supt. of police, April, 1873; supt., June, 1882; dep. inspr.-gen., Oct., 1893.

SUMMERS, THOMAS, B.Sc., A.M., I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; joined the service, Oct., 1877; and served as asst. engr.; exec. engr., March, 1889.

SURYA KUMAR AGASTI, M.A., Statutory C.S. (Bengal).—Apptd. under the native civil service rules asst. mag. and collr., Purniah, on probn., March, 1885; confd., April, 1887; joint mag. and dep. collr., June, 1892.

SUTHERLAND, ALGERNON ROBERT, India Public Works Dept., Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1876, and posted to N.W.P. and Oudh.; exec. engr., Oct., 1890.

SUTTON, ERNEST WILLIAM, Pol. Dept., India Office.—Second divn. clerk, census office, 7th April, 1891; 2nd class clerk, India office, 1st Sept., 1891.

SWAIN, WILLIAM HENRY, B.A., B.Sc., Mil. Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 4th June, 1881; B.Sc. (honours), London univ., 1883; B.A., 1895; joint editor of the 'India List,' 1887-95, and of the 'India Office List' from Oct., 1895.

SWAMINATHA AIYAR, TIRUVARAR MUTUSWAMI AIYAR, B.A., Statutory C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Madras Univ.; apptd. probr. for the civil service, Nov., 1883; confd., Jan., 1886; asst. collr. and mag., July, 1887; head asst., Feb., 1893.

SWANN, FREDERICK SAMUEL PHILIP, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Berkhamsted Sch. and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 12th Dec., 1894, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

SWETENHAM, EDMUND, Col., I.S.C., late Public Works Dept., N.W. Prov.—Joined the dept. from Rurki coll., Nov., 1853, and served in the Punjab; resigned on obtaining commn. in the army, March, 1857; served in the N.W. frontier campaign, 1858 (medal); re-apptd. to public works dept., Feb., 1859, and served in N.W. Prov., buildings and roads branch; transf'd. to British Burma, May, 1872; transf'd. to Central India, Sept., 1874; transf'd. to N.W. Prov., buildings and roads branch, Aug., 1880; suptg. engr., Sept., 1880; retd., Feb., 1890.

SWIFTE, LATHAM CODDINGTON, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Eton and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 6th Nov., 1892, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

SWINNERTON, ROBERT ALLEN WILLIAM, M.I.C.E., M.I.M.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd. apprentice engr., 24th Oct., 1877; asst. engr., June, 1878; exec. engr., April, 1889.

SYAD ALAY MAHOMED, Statutory C.S. (Central Prov.).—Acting extra asst. commr., 26th Jan., 1881; probr. for the native civil service, Dec., 1882; apptd. member of the civil service, and supernumerary asst. commr., 12th Dec., 1883; judge, small cause court, April, 1892; dep. commr., April, 1894.

SYKES, ROBERT, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Giggleswick Gr. Sch. and Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 18th Dec., 1888, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and offg. under sec.; junr. sec. to finl. commrs., Dec., 1893 till Dec., 1895; dist. judge, Jan., 1897.

SYMES, EDWARD SPENCE, C.I.E., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Univ. Coll. Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 26th Oct., 1875, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; transf'd. to Burma, Aug., 1876, as asst. commr.; personal asst. to chief commr., May, 1879; junr. sec., June, 1881; sec. to chief commr. and officer in charge of Delhi state prisoners, April, 1886; C.I.E., May, 1886; chief sec., April, 1887; commr., Minbu, July, 1890; resumed post as chief sec., Dec., 1890; chief sec. to gov't., May, 1897.

SYMNS, ROBERT CORSER MONTFORT, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Westminster, King's Coll. Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 12th Dec., 1888, and served in Burma as asst. commr.; acting under sec., and acting dep. commr.

SYMonds, WILLIAM POWELL, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Hereford Cathedral Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 16th Nov., 1876, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; acting under sec. to govt., rev., finl., and gen. depts., 1884; forest settlt. officer, March, 1887; and asst. collr., and acting dir. of land records and agric., Aug., 1887; postmr.-gen., Bo bnoy, May, 1889; revised the manual of rev. acc.s. in Bombay.

SZCZEPANSKI, HENRY CHARLES ANTHONY, Col., I.S.C., late Berar Commn.—First commn., Bengal infantry, June, 1857; employed under the mil. dept. up to 1860, including service during the Mutiny (medal); asst. commr., Punjab, July, 1860; on special famine duty, Nov., 1861; transf'd. to Haidarabad assigned districts, Nov., 1864, and served as asst. commr., cantonmt. mag. and small cause court judge, and dep. commr.; ofsl. as jud. commr. at various periods, and as commr. in 1888 and 1889; reverted to mil. dept., June, 1895.

TABOR, FRANCIS SAMUEL, Indian C.S.
(Central Prov.).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch. and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 26th Nov., 1890, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; transfd. to the Central Prov., May, 1893.

TAHEIRUDDIN AHMED, B.L., Bengal Provl. Service.—Apptd. probr. under the native civil service rules, 9th March, 1890; asst. settlt. officer in Orissa, March, 1891; apptd. to provl. service as dep. mag. and dep. collr., Nov., 1893.

TALBOT, Sir Adelbert Cecil, K.C.I.E., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., royal artillery, Jan., 1867; joined the Bengal staff corps, 1869, and served with 4th cavalry, Haidarabad contingent; on special duty with the Afghan commr., Seistan arbitration, 1872-73; offg. asst. agent, Rajputana, 1873; attache, foreign dept., 1874; offg. assst. sec. to the govt. of India, legisl. dept., 1875-76; acting asst. rest., and asst. gen. supt., thagi and dakhili dept., Haidarabad, 1878; 1st assst. agent, Rajputana, Feb., 1878; fellow of Calcutta univ., 1879; addl. pol. agent, E. Rajputana states, 1881; pol. agent, Bhartpur and Karauli, 1882; pol. agent, Bikaniir, 1883; offd. as rest. in Turkish Arabia, 1883-89; rest., Persian Gulf, Sept., 1891; dep. sec. to govt. of India, foreign dept., May, 1894; on special duty to England with Sardar Nasrulla Khan of Kabul, Aug., 1895; K.C.I.E., Aug., 1895; rest., Kashmir, June, 1895; publd. a revised edn. of 'Aitchison's Treaties,' 1876.

TALBOT, Gerald Henry, Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at St. Peter's Coll., Radley; supervisor, 1st grade, India store depot, 19th June, 1877.

TALBOT, Walter, Store Dept., India Office.—Apptd. supplemental clerk, India store depot, 1st Jan., 1893; clerk, 2nd class, June, 1895.

TALBOT, Walter Stanley, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Wellington Coll. and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 31st Oct., 1890, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., offg. under sec. to govt., and offg. sec. to fin. commrs.

TANNER, Henry Charles Baskerville, Col., I.S.C., late Survey of India.—First commn., Bombay artillery, June, 1854; accompanied the Persian expedy. force of 1856 (medal and clasp); joined the survey dept., Oct., 1862, and was employed on various rev. surveys; dep. supt., April, 1870; accompanied the Lushai expdn. in 1871-72, and the Khaibar column in the Afghan campaign, 1878-79; was afterwards in charge of the Darjiling and Nepal boundary parties, Nov., 1882; employed with the Tibet mission from May, 1886; reverted to mil. duty, 1890.

TAPLIN, Herbert, Registry and Record Dept.—Apptd. supplemental clerk, 1st Jan., 1893.

TARGET, Charles Albert BagenaI, late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to the Madras public works dept., 8th Oct., 1888; transfd. to state railways, April, 1870; and to Mysore, irrign. branch, March, 1872; exec. engr., Sept., 1874; employed in Calcutta mint, Feb., 1880; served subsequently in Rajputana, Madras, Burma, and Rajputana; retd., 1897.

TATE, Alexander Chambers, M.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Belfast, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1879, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., Anantapur, Sept., 1888; principal asst., Vizagapatam, Jan., 1892; sub-collr. and joint mag., Godavari, March, 1894; collr. and mag., March, 1896.

TATE, John, M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 26th July, 1857, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., Feb., 1873; suptg. engr., Dec., 1896.

TATE, William Jacob, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Repton; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 25th Nov., 1874, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., Salem, Jan., 1883; sub-collr. and joint mag., Jan., 1889; district and sessions judge, March, 1890.
