TAUNTON, Alfred George, Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at the Jesuits' Coll., Tournay; writer, India store depot, 29th July, 1868; clerk, 2nd class, Aug., 1878.

TAWNEY, Charles Henry, C.I.E., M.A., Librarian, India Office.—Educ. at Rugby and Trinity Coll., Cambridge, of which he was elected a fellow in 1860; joined the Bengal educ. dept., Nov., 1864, and served as prof'r., presidency coll., up to Nov., 1876, when he was apptd. principal; acted for various periods as dir. of public instrn.; registrar of Calcutta univ., 1877, 1884, and 1889; librarian, India office, 1st Oct., 1893; has transfd. from the Sanskrit the Katha Sarit Sagara, the Uttara Rama Charita, the Malavikagni-mitra, the Kathakoça, and two centuries of Bhartrihari.

TAWNEY, James Walter, late Bengal C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Repton Sch., and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 23rd Dec., 1863; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr., Bhutan, till Oct., 1865, and subsequently in the Central Prov. as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; retd., April, 1889.

TAYLER, William Vansittart Graham, late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 6th Nov., 1855; served in the rev. and jud. depts., Bengal, and was apptd. mag. and collr., 1st grade, Pubna, Oct., 1866; retd., 1890.

TAYLOR, Sir Alexander, G.C.B., Gen., R.E.—Educ. at Hofuzil, Switzerland, and Addiscombe mil. coll.; 1st commn., 9th June, 1843; entered the India public works dept., 26th Dec., 1846; exec. engr., Jan., 1848; supt. of the Lahore and Peshawar road, Dec., 1849; suptg. engr., Nov., 1856; offg. sec. to the govt. of the Punjab, public works dept., 1865-67, and 1871-72; chief engr., April, 1872; dep. inspr.-gen. of mil. works, 1870-78; prest. of the defence committee of India, 1876, 1877, 1878; prest. of Cooper's Hill coll. from Nov., 1880; served throughout the Sutlej campaign (medal with clasps for Firozshah and Sobraon), the Punjab campaign, 1848-49 (medal with 2 clasps), and the Indian Mutiny (medal with 2 clasps); also during the Ambela campaign, 1863; C.B. in 1858, K.C.B. in 1877, and G.C.B. in 1889.

TAYLOR, Franklin Eden, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 13th Dec., 1886, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Aug., 1891; under sec. to govt., June, 1893; acting dir. of land records and agric., July-Nov., 1894; joint mag., Dec., 1895; dist. and sess. judge, Feb., 1897.

TAYLOR, Frederick Beatson, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Christ's Hosp., and
King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 30th Nov., 1874, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., April, 1886; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1891.

TAYLOR, GEORGE NOBLE, late Madras C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1840; served in Madras as asst. and head asst. collr. and mag., and was apptd. sec. to the coll. and univ. boards, and asst. collr. of customs at Madras in special charge of the salt dept., 1849; sub-collr. and joint mag., Rajmahendri, 1851; acted as collr. and mag. of Nellore in 1857, and of S. Arcot in 1858; inam commr., 1858; special commr. for railways, Calcutta, to report upon the affairs of the East Indian railway, May, 1863, and subsequently held a similar post at Bombay; provisional member of govr.-gen.'s council, 1864; ordinary member of council, March, 1865; retd., March, 1870.

TAYLOR, HERBERT DOUGLAS, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Winchester, and St. Peter's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 7th Dec., 1885, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst. and agent to govt., Vizagapatam, April, 1896.

TAYLOR, JAMES, late Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the dept., 1st Sept., 1865, and served in Bengal as asst. and dep. acctnt.-gen.; asst. compt.-gen., June, 1879; retd., March, 1893.

TAYLOR, SAM ARTHUR, Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Epsom Coll.; junr. clerk, 31st Jan., 1867; senr. clerk, Nov., 1889.

TEAGUE, GEORGE FLETCHER, Funds Dept., India Office.—Senr. book-keeper, funds dept., 28th Sept., 1866; head book-keeper, March, 1873; designation changed to senr. clerk, Oct., 1892.

TEBBITT, ROBERT THEODORE, India Store Depot.—Clerk, 2nd class, 8th July, 1896.

TEBBS, FRANCIS ROBERT, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. 1st Oct., 1877, as asst. engr., and posted to state railways; exec. engr., Dec., 1890.

TEK CHAND, DIWAN, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Punjab Univ. and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 17th Dec., 1895, and served in Punjab as asst. commr.

TEMPLE, HENRY MARTINDALE, Major, I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Sub-lieut., 1st regt., June, 1872; arrived, Sept., 1872; extra A.D.C. to lieut.-govr., Bengal, Dec., 1875; attache, foreign dept., March, 1876; cantonmt. mag., Nasirabad, Feb., 1878; asst. to rest., Haidarabad, and asst. gen. supt., thagi and dakiati, Oct., 1880; offg. jud. supt. of railways, Nizam's dominions, June, 1881; asst. to agent, Baroda, Nov., 1882; boundary settlt. officer, Bundelkhand, Nov., 1884; pol. agent, Khelat, May, 1885; pol. agent, S.E. Baluchistan, May, 1887; and at Khelat, April, 1888; offg. pol. agent, Bikanir, June, 1895.

TEMPLE, JAMES HERBERT, B.A., LL.B., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Burnley Gr. Sch., Repton Sch., and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 20th Dec., 1889, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; acted as collr. of customs, Calcutta, Oct.-Dec., 1893, and as under sec., 1894 and 1895; joint mag. and dep. collr., Oct. 1896.

TEMPLE, JOHN ALEXANDER, Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—First commn., Dec., 1860; arrived, 8th Aug., 1861; from Feb., 1864, served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; small cause court judge, 1872-74, and 1877-80; sessions judge, Oct., 1894; commr., May, 1896; returned to Europe, 1897.

TEMPLE, RIGHT HON. SIR RICHARD, Bart., G.C.S.I., C.I.E., D.C.L. (Oxon.), LL.D. (Cantab.), late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1846; served in the N.W. Prov. and Punjab as asst. commr. and asst. mag. and collr.; settlt. officer, trans-Sutlej divn., 1852; sec. to chief commr., Punjab, 1854; commr., Lahore, 1859; chief commr. of currency and chief asst. to finl. member of council, 1860; chief commr., Central Prov., 1865; rest., Haidarabad, 1867; finl. member of govr.-gen.'s council, April, 1868; pres. of statistical committee, 1868; lieut.-govr. of Bengal, April, 1874; govr. of Bombay, April, 1877, to March, 1880; retd. from the civil service in 1877; chairman of the board of visitors, Cooper's Hill coll., 1880; M.P. for Evesham, 1885-86 and 1886-92; and for Kingston, 1892-95; member of the London sch. board, 1884-94, and vice-chairman, 1885-88; privy councillor, Jan., 1896; author of 'India in 1882,' 'Men and Events of My Time in India,' 1882, 'Oriental Experience,' 1883, 'Cosmopolitan Essays,' 1886, 'James Thomason,' 1893, 'Life in Parliament,' 1893, &c.

TEMPLE, RICHARD CARNAC, C.I.E., Lt.-Col., I.S.C.—First commn., 4th Jan., 1871; from 11th Aug., 1879, served in the Punjab as asst. cantonmt. mag., and cantonmt. mag.; transf. to Burma as cantonmt. mag., Mandalay, March, 1887; asst. commr., April, 1887; dep. commr., Dec., 1888; provl. supt. of census, 1890; pres. of the Rangoon municipality, Feb., 1891; C.I.E., Jan., 1894; chief commr., Andamans and Nicobar, Sept., 1895; author of 'Notes on the Transliteration of the Burmese Alphabet,' 'A Dissertation on the Proper Names of Punjabis,' 'Wide-awake Stories' (Punjabi and Cashmiri Folk Tales), and other works; also founded and conducted 'Indian Notes and Queries,' and is an editor of the 'Indian Antiquary.'

TENNANT, JOHN FRANCIS, C.I.E., F.R.S., Lieut.-Gen., R.E.—Second lieut., Bengal engrs., June, 1847; arrived, 7th March, 1849; asst. engr., Ganges canal, 1849-51; asst. in the great trigonl. survey of India, 1851-59; served in the Mutiny (medal with two clasps); govt. astronomer at Madras, Oct., 1859; commandant, sappers and miners, Oct., 1860; served in the public works dept., from Sept., 1863, as exec. engr. in Burma, and in the Punjab and Bengal; apptd. to observe eclipses of the sun, 1867-68 and 1871; served as mint master, Calcutta, from July, 1871, to Jan., 1884; superintended the observations of the transit of Venus at Rurki and Lahore, 1876; C.I.E., Jan., 1879; retd., Jan., 1884.

TEUNON, WILLIAM, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Univ. of Aberdeen, and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 24th Dec., 1883, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transf. to Assam as asst. commr., Jan., 1888; dep. commr., July, 1892; dist. and sessions judge, Dec., 1895.

THIBAUT, GEORGE FREDERICK WILLIAM, Ph. D., Educn. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the dept., 17th March, 1875, as prof., Benares coll.; inspr. of schs., Jan., 1878; principal, Benares coll., Nov., 1879; prof. of English literature, Muir coll., Oct., 1888; principal, Muir Coll., July, 1895; also supt. of Sanskrit studies in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Jan., 1893;
has transld. the Jatapatala, the Vedanta Entras, with Sankaracharya's commentary, &c., &c.

THOM, WILLIAM, F.R.C.S., Surgn.-Gen., late Bombay Med. Service.—Educ. at Marischal Coll., and Univ. of Aberdeen, and at Univ. Coll., London, and in Paris; fellow of Univ. of Bombay; was apptd. asst. surgn. on the Bombay establt., 1841, and served under the mil. dept.; garrison surgn., and surgn. to the European gen. hosp., 1861; served on the med. board of the India office, 1866-67; dep. inspr.-gen. of hosps., March, 1867; surgn.-gen., Feb., 1874; retd., Sept., 1877.

THOMAS, GEORGE EBENEZER, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. from the E. Indian railway as asst. engr., 28th Aug., 1867, and posted to the Central Prov.; transf'd. to the Punjab N. state railway, March, 1868; locomotive supt., Punjab N. state railway, April, 1875; exec. engr., April, 1876; transf'd. to Indus valley state railway, Nov., 1878; and to British Burma, Nov., 1881; retd., 1889.

THOMAS, HENRY SULLIVAN, late Madras C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1855; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., sub-collr. and joint mag., and member of the board of examrs.; collr. and mag., May, 1867; from April, 1878, served on the board of rev., Madras, and acted as sec. to govt. in the rev. dept. in 1878-79; pres't. board of examrs., Oct., 1881; member of supreme legisl. council, 1882 and 1883; on special duty in connection with the pearlfisheries at Tuticorin, 1884; 1st member, board of rev., July, 1884; fellow of Madras univ., March, 1886; retd., Jan., 1889; has publs. 'A Report on Pisciculture in S. Kanara,' 1870; 'The Rod in India,' 1881; and 'A Report on Pearl Fisheries and Chank Fisheries,' 1884.

THOMAS, ROBERT MOSLEY BRYCE, Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—First commn., 6th Jan., 1859; arrived, 26th Feb., 1859; from Oct., 1864, served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., and cantonmt. mag.; dep. commr., Dec., 1885; inspr.-gen. of police and jails, April, 1894; commr., Chhattisgarh, Oct., 1894; reverted to mil. dept., Sept., 1895.

THOMAS, THOMAS EDWARD, Madras Police Dept.—Joined the service, Aug., 1865, and served in the police dept. as asst. supt. and supt.

THOMAS, WILLIAM CHARLES, Lieut.-Col., late Police Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service, Dec., 1858, having previously served as a volunteer in Gen. Havelock's cavalry, 1857-58; adjutant of mil. police, Oct., 1859; inspr. of district police, Jan., 1861; district supt. of police, May, 1861; junr. dep. inspr.-gen. of police, May, 1886; senr., Jan., 1890; retd., March, 1893.

THOMASON, CHARLES SIMEON, Major-Gen., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Lieut. Bengal engrs., June, 1852; joined the dept., July, 1855, as dep. supt., Ganges canal; served during the Mutiny (medal and clasp); exec. engr., Oct., 1858; supt., Rohilkhand canals, Dec., 1864; oflfg. suptg. engr. and dep. sec., public works dept., N.W. Prov., Sept., 1873; on special duty to Madras, in connection with harbour work, 1877-79; suptg. engr. and sec. to agent, Central India, Aug., 1880; reverted to mil. dept., May, 1888; retd., Jan., 1895.

THOMPSON, ARTHUR, M.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at St. Cuthbert's, Ushaw, and Univ. of London; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 20th Nov., 1876, and served in Madras as asst collr. and mag., and district and sessions judge; head asst. collr., Cuddapah, Nov., 1884; sub-collr. and joint mag., Jan., 1890; district and sessions judge, N. Malabar, June, 1891.

THOMPSON, ARTHUR, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Appleby Gr. Sch. and Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 21st Dec., 1894, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

THOMPSON, CHARLES THOMAS, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Educ. at the City of London Sch.; clerk, 2nd class, 10th March, 1883.

THOMPSON, DANIEL ROBERT, C.I.E., M.D., M.R.C.S., L.M., Surgn.-Major, late Madras Med. Service.—Joined the Indian med. service as asst. surgn., 1st April, 1867, and served under the mil. dept., also acting as zillah surgn. and supt. of jail; rest surgn., gen. hosp., Madras, and prof'r. in med. coll., March, 1875; surgn., 1st district, Madras, med. inspr. of emigrants, &c., May, 1875; C.I.E. (for special famine services in 1876-78), Jan., 1879; retd., May, 1888.

THOMPSON, DAVID WILLIAM, late Educn. Dept., Punjab.—Served in the dept. from March, 1862, as master in the zillah schs. at Lahore and Amritsar; inspr. of schs., May, 1870; retd., Dec., 1892.

THOMPSON, FREDERICK C., Public Works Dept., India Office.—Junn. clerk, accts. branch, 9th March, 1872; public works dept., Aug., 1875; editor of 'India Office List,' 1885-87; senr. clerk, Feb., 1889.

THOMPSON, GEORGE, B.A., Educl. Dept., Central Prov.—Head master, Saugor high sch., Sept., 1866; served from Oct., 1875, as inspr. of schs., Central Prov.; oflfg. inspr.-gen. of educn., Oct., 1893.

THOMPSON, HENRY EDWARD, M.I.C.E., late India Telegraph Dept.—Joined the dept. as Morse asst., 12th May, 1857; arrived, 12th Sept., 1857; supt., Dec., 1866; held charge of various divns., including Malabar, Bangalore, Arakan, Nagpur, and Rajputana; retd., Dec., 1892.

THOMPSON, HENRY MUNGO, B.A., M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, July, 1866, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., April, 1871; supt. engr. in Sind, June, 1892; transf'd. to N. divn., April, 1895; chief engr., June, 1896; addl. member of council, Bombay.

THOMPSON, HERBERT, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at St. Peter's Sch., York, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1891, and served in Burma as asst. commr.; sec. to finl. commr., March, 1895.

THOMPSON, RICHARD HORATIO ELY, Forest Dept., Central Prov.—Joined the service as overseer of the govt. tea plantation, Gurhwal, Oct., 1855; asst. supt., Kumaon forests, Jan., 1860; asst. conservator of forests, April, 1864; transf'd. to Central Prov., Aug., 1871; dep. conservator, Oct., 1871; services lent to govt. of Ceylon, June, 1887; conservator, April, 1892.

THOMPSON, ROSS, Col., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Madras.—First commn., June, 1858; arrived, 14th Jan., 1861; joined the dept., Aug., 1863; exec. engr., April, 1867; district engr., presidency, April, 1875; consulting architect to govt., May, 1875; commanded Queen's Own sappers and miners throughout the Afghan war, 1879-80 (medal); acted as dep. chief engr.
and under sec. to govt., Oct. 1881, and served subsequently in various divns.; retd., Dec., 1894.

THOMPSON, THOMAS MOORE LANE, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 1st Aug., 1872, and posted to Bengal; exec. engr., Sept., 1886.

THOMSON, ALEXANDER, late Educ. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Served in Oudh, Aug., 1866, as inspr. of schs., and acted as dir. of public instrn. in 1866 and 1868; from April, 1877, served as profr. of English literature in the Agra coll.; principal, July, 1883; retd., April, 1892.

THOMSON, ARTHUR SACKVILLE, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 24th Sept., 1878, and posted to Bengal; exec. engr., Nov., 1889; under sec. to govt. of Bengal, June, 1897.

THOMSON, CAMPBELL, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 15th July, 1860, and posted to Bengal; transfd. to state railways, Sept., 1872; exec. engr., Jan., 1880; services lent to Mewar durbar, Jan., 1885; suptg. engr., June, 1894.

THOMSON, GEORGE, C.B., M.B., Surgn.-Col., late Med. Dept., Central Prov.—Arrived, 7th April, 1866; apptd. ofig. civil surgn. in the Punjab, Aug., 1879; confld., Sept., 1880; med. adviser to the Maharaja of Patiala, in 1882, 1888, 1889, and 1890; administrative med. officer and sanitary commr., Central Prov., April, 1893; reverted to mil. dept., April, 1893, and apptd. princ. med. officer, Lahore district; C.B., Jan., 1896.

THOMSON, JAMES, M.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Aberdeen Gr. Sch. and Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 24th Nov., 1871, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; sub-collr., joint mag., and principal asst., Godavari, June, 1885; collr. and mag., Nov., 1889; rest., Travancore and Cochin, July, 1895.

THOMSON, JOHN BROWN, M.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Acad., and Univ., Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, Nov., 1870, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; dep. supt. of family domains of Maharaja of Benares, Nov., 1882; registrar of the high court, May, 1884; mag. and collr., April, 1889; ofsd. as sec. to govt. in 1889 and 1890; inspr.-gen. of police, May, 1894.

THOMSON, ROBERT GEORGE, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Islington Proprietary Sch., and Univ. of London; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 13th Nov., 1874, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and settlt. officer; jnr. sec. to finl. commr., Dec., 1882; senr. sec., March, 1886; postmr.-gen., Punjab, Feb., 1888; jnr. sec. to govt. of Punjab, April, 1890; rev. sec., April, 1892.

THOMSON, SAMUEL JOHN, C.I.E., Surgn.-Major, Med. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service as surgn., 1st Oct., 1877; arrived, 27th April, 1878, and went through Afghan campaign, 1880 (medal); dep. sanitary commr., May, 1885; sanitary commr. (pro tem.), April, 1895; C.I.E., Jan., 1898; author of 'Sanitary Principles.'

THOMSON, WILLIAM BOYD, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at the Belfast Methodist Coll., Trinity Coll., Dublin, and the Royal Univ. of Ireland; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 16th Dec., 1892, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. settlt. officer; asst. mag. and collr., Feb., 1897.

THORBURN, SEPTIMUS SMET, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 24th Nov., 1864, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and settlt. officer; jud. asst., 1st grade, Jan., 1881; dep. commr., April, 1883; commr. and supt., Jan., 1892; author of 'Bannu'; or, Our Afghan Frontier,' 'David Leslie,' 'Asiatic Neighbours,' 'Musalmans and Money-lenders,' 'Report on Peasant Indebtedness and Land Alienations to Money-lenders,' and a report on the settlt. of the Bannu district.

THORBURN, WALTER MILLER, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Dalhousie Coll. and Univ., Halifax, Univ. of Edinburgh, and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 26th Nov., 1875, and served in Madras as ass't collr. and mag.; head ass't, Oct., 1884; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1890.

THORNHILL, GEORGE, C.S.I., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Rugby and Haileybury, and apptd. in 1842; arrived, 7th April, 1843; served in Madras, as asst. to collr. and mag. in various districts, and was employed as civil officer in connection with the construction of the Godavari and Kistna anicuts; principal asst., Ganjam, 1856; collr. and mag., Kistna, 1861; member of board of rev., 1870-78; was also apptd. dir. of bank of Madras, and commr. for unconv. civil service exams., 1875; retd., 1878.

THORNHILL, HENRY BEAUFROY, Major, I.S.C., Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov.—First commn., 23rd April, 1873; arrived, 1st Nov., 1873; on field service, Afghanistan, 1878-79 (medal); cantonmt. mag., Feb., 1887; dep. supt., Port Blair, May, 1888; cantonmt. mag., N.W. Prov., June, 1891.

THORNHILL, JOSEPH HELEN, M.E., M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 15th July, 1869, and employed on irrign. works in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., Sept., 1879; retd. March, 1897.

THORNTON, ARTHUR PARRY, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Ensign, 14th foot, 14th Sept., 1867; admitted to the Bengal staff corps, Sept., 1871; on famine duty, 1874; served under the foreign dept. from Jan., 1875, and acted as asst. agent, Rajputana, and as mag., Mount Abu, and asst. gen. supt. for thagi and dakaiti; attache to foreign office during Delhi durbar, 1876-77; on mil. duty, 1878-79; from March, 1879, served as cantonmt. mag. at Morar, and at Nasirabad; asst. to govr.-gen.'s agent, Rajputana, Jan., 1882; cantonmt. mag. and small cause court judge, Secunderabad, Feb., 1884; pol. agent, Bhopawar, May, 1886; Haroati and Tonk, March, 1889; offg. commr., Ajmir, March, 1895; rest. and commr., Ajmir 1897.

THORNTON, EDWARD LABOUCHERE RUTHVEN, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Marlborough, and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 5th Dec., 1891, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; acted as manager, Jaipur estate, 1893.

THORNTON, HUGH AYLMER, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 30th Nov., 1896, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

THORNTON, JAMES HOWARD, C.B., B.A., M.D., Surgn.-Col., late Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., 1856; from 9th Nov., 1861, served
as civil asst. surgn. and civil surgn., besides service under the mil. dept.; principal med. officer with the Indian forces, Egypt, 1885; C.B., Aug., 1885; dep. surgn.-gen., Punjab frontier force, June, 1886; retd., Aug., 1891; author of 'Memories of Seven Campaigns', 1895.

THORNTON, LESLIE MELVILLE, M.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Marlborough and Univ. Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 1st Jan., 1881, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; asst. sec. to govt., Oct., 1883; under sec., Oct., 1886; offd. as finl. sec., 1891; joint mag., Aug., 1891; offg. legal remembrancer, and member of, and sec. to, provl. legisl. council, Dec., 1892, to March, 1893; dep. sec. to govt. of India, home dept., Oct., 1894.

THORNTON, THOMAS HENRY, C.S.I., D.C.L., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch., and St. John's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1855; asst. commr., Punjab, 1857-59; personal asst. to finl. commr., Punjab, 1859-60; personal asst. to jud. commr., 1860-62; small cause court judge, Lahore, 1862-63; dep. commr., Delhi, 1863-64; sec. to the govt. of the Punjab, 1864-78, and was on two occasions temporarily in charge of the administration of the province; acted as foreign sec. to the govt. of India, 1876-77; member of gov't.-gen.'s legisl. council, 1877-79; judge, chief court, Punjab, 1878-81; retd., 1881; fellow of univ. of Calcutta, 1875; vice-prest., univ. coll., Lahore, 1879; author of a life of Sir Robert Sandeman.

THUILLIER, SIR HENRY EDWARD LANDOR, Kt., C.S.I., F.R.S., Gen., R.A., late Survey of India.—Educ. at Addiscombe, 1831-32; first commn., Bengal artillery, Dec., 1832; served in the survey dept. from Dec., 1836, and conducted the surveys of Jaintia, the Puri divn. of Cuttack, and the district of Cachar, and part of Sylhet; dep. surveyor-gen. of India, Jan., 1847, to March, 1861, when he was apptd. surveyor-gen.; retd., Dec., 1877; C.S.I., May, 1870; knighted in 1879; col. commandant, R.A., Jan., 1883; joint author of the 'Manual of Survey for India.'

THUILLIER, SIR HENRY RAVENSHAW, K.C.I.E., Col., R.E., late Survey of India.—Entered Addiscombe, Aug., 1855; licut., Bengal engrs., June, 1857; apptd. to the survey dept. as asst. in the great trigonl. survey, May, 1859; dep. supt., Sept., 1869; offg. supt., great trigonl. survey, April-Oct., 1876; dep. surveyor-gen. in charge of the rev. survey branch, Oct., 1884; surveyor-gen., Feb., 1887; C.I.E., June, 1893; K.C.I.E., Jan., 1895; retd., March, 1895.

THURBURN, JAMES WHITE, Lieut.-Col., R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 7th May, 1872, and employed in the mil. works branch in the Punjab; served in the Afghan war, 1878-79 (medal); reverted to home establt., Nov., 1880; re-apptd., Jan., 1884, and posted to the Punjab; exec. engr., Feb., 1884.

THURSTON, JOHN NEVILLE OLDFIELD (Burma Commn.)—Joined the service, March, 1886, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

TICKELL, CHARLES, late India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1875, and employed on irrign. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., Nov., 1884; under sec. to govt., public works dept., 1890-92; services lent to Kashmir state, 1892-94; retd., March, 1897.

TIDY, WILLIAM MEYMOOTT, M.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Merton Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 28th Nov., 1860; served in the N.W. Prov. from Aug., 1862, as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; mag. and collr., Sept., 1878; retd., 1886.

TIGHE, MICHAEL AUGUSTUS, Captain, I.S.C.—First commn. April, 1881; apptd. to pol. dept., August, 1887; pol. agent, south-eastern Baluchistan, April, 1896.

TILLY, HARRY LINDSAY, A.M.I.C.E., Burma Commn.—Joined the public works dept., 1st Oct., 1877, and served in Burma as asst. engr., personal asst. to chief engr., and exec. engr.; transf. to the commn. as asst. commr., Dec., 1885; sec. to finl. commr., 1893-94, and 1894-95.

TINNEY, GEORGE FREDERICK, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 4th July, 1882.

TODD-NAYLOR, HENRY PAUL, C.I.E., B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Shrewsbury, and Univ. Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 14th Dec., 1882, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transf. to Burma as asst. commr., March, 1886; dep. commr., May, 1890; C.I.E., Jan., 1890.

TODHUNTER, CHARLES GEORGE, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Aldenham Gr. Sch. and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 26th Nov., 1890, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; dep. registrar, high court, July, 1895, acted as registrar, appellate side, from May, 1896.

TOLLINTON, HENRY PHILLIPS, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Leamington Coll. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 17th Dec., 1894, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

TOMKINS, WILLIAM PERCIVAL, C.I.E., Lt.-Gen., R.E., late Mil. Works Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., June, 1860; joined the public works dept., June, 1863, as asst. engr., Assam; transf. to British Burma, Jan., 1865; acted as asst. to chief engr. and asst. sec. to chief commr., 1865; exec. engr., Oct., 1866; transf. to mil. works branch, Nov., 1873; asst. sec. to govt. of India, civil and mil. works branch, April, 1880; suptg. engr. and sec. to agent, Baluchistan, 1882; suptg. engr., Aug., 1884; took part in Zhob valley expd., Sept., 1884; C.I.E., Jan., 1890; chief engr., Sept., 1890; dir.-gen. of mil. works, April, 1893; returned to Europe, June, 1896.

TOMLINSON, THOMAS ARMSTRONG, late Madras Rev. Survey Dept.—Apptd., 10th Aug., 1859, and served as asst. supt.; dep. supt., June, 1886; on special duty, Pudukottai boundary, 1887, and in 1888; retd., April, 1895.

TOOGOOD, JOHN HENRY, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Calcutta Civil Engrg. Coll.; apptd., 11th Oct., 1871, and employed on irrign. works in Bengal; on famine relief duty in Madras, 1877-78; exec. engr., Nov., 1881; offg. under sec. to govt. of Bengal, public works dept., April-Nov., 1894; supt. of famine relief works, and circle, Feb., 1897.

TOTENHAM, LOFTUS RICHARD, late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 11th July, 1856, and served in Bengal as asst., joint mag. and dep. collr., and mag. and collr.; also as supt. of stamps and stationery, Jan., 1866, and registrar of the high court, Dec., 1866; from Jan., 1874, served in the jud. dept. as district and sessions judge, and offd. as supt. and remem-
brancer of legal affairs, Feb., 1878; judge of the high court, Calcutta, July, 1879; retd., March, 1893.

TOWERS, GRAINGER LAWRENCE, M.I.E.E., India Telegraph Dept.—Apptd. asst. supt., Nov., 1870; in charge of field telegraphs, Perak expedn. (medal and clasp) 1875-6; attached to Kabul field telegraphs, 1880 (Afghanistan medal); supt., Oct., 1887.

TOWERS, ROBERT MASON, M.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 21st Jan., 1863, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; from July, 1867, served in the jud. dept. as small cause court judge and district and sessions judge; from Jan., 1878, to Feb., 1880, served as offg. jud. commr., Chota Nagpur; retd., 1888.

TOWNSEND, STEPHEN CHAPMAN, C.B., Surgn.-Gen., late Bengal Med. Service.—Educ. at Ottery St. Mary Gr. Sch., and the London Hosp. Med. Sch.; asst. surgn. in the Indian med. service, June, 1852; served in the Burma campaign, 1852-53; civil surgn., Nagpur, Jan., 1865; sanitary commr., Central Prov., March, 1868, and offd. as sanitary commr. with the govt. of India, 1877-78; dep. surgn.-gen., Dec., 1878; principal med. officer with the Kuram field force under Gen. Sir F. Roberts, April, 1879; and was wounded in action, Sept., 1879; surgn.-gen. with the Punjab govt., April, 1880; C.B., Feb., 1881; retd., Dec., 1883.

TOYNBEE, GEORGE, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 27th Nov., 1865, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; supt. of canal rev., Oct., 1871; on famine relief duty, Nov., 1873; offg. sec., board of rev., lower prov., Dec., 1874; second inspr. of registrn. offices, April, 1877; joint mag., Dec., 1877; mag. and collr., Feb., 1884; commr., May, 1891; author of ‘Sketch of the History of Orissa from 1803 to 1828,’ ‘Sketch of the Administration of the Hugli District from 1795 to 1845,’ and ‘A Chowkidari Manual.’

TOZER, HENRY JOHN, M.A., Rev. and Stat. Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, acctnt.-gen.’s dept., 19th Jan., 1882; B.A. (honours), London univ., 1889; M.A. (phil. and pol. econ.), 1893; transf. to rev. and stat. dept., 17th Dec., 1897.

TRACY, THOMAS BURROWES, B.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1857; arrived, 29th Dec., 1857, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; mag. and collr., Muttra, April, 1877; from Feb., 1883, served as civil and sessions judge, and acted as jud. commr. in Oudh, 1884-85; retd., Sept., 1887.

TRAFFORD, RICHARD WYLME, late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Rugby; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 28th Nov., 1864, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and jud. asst.; district judge, Nov., 1884; divl. judge, Dec., 1886; retd., Oct., 1891.

TREASURE, WILLIAM HOUSTON, Legal Adviser’s Dept., India Office.—Clerk to the legal adviser to the sec. of state, June, 1877; solicitor of the supreme court, 1887; asst. to the solicitor to the sec. of state, Aug., 1892.

TREMENHEERE, CHARLES WILLIAM, C.B., Lieut.-Gen., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Educ. at Addiscombe; 2nd lieut., Bom-

bay engrs., 11th Dec., 1829; served as civil engr. in Dharwar, 1833-40, and as exec. engr., Surat and Broach, 1843-46; asst. exec. engr., Aden, 1846-47; from Dec., 1848, served in Sind as exec. engr., Karachi; dockyard, Bombay, March, 1850; on special duty, Bombay, designing reclamations, docks, and fortifications, Jan., 1854; dep. consulting engr., railway dept., Jan., 1855; garrison engr., Bombay, and acted as suptg. engr., Poona circle, 1856-57; served in the Mutiny (medal with clasp for Central India); mil. C.B., March, 1861; suptg. engr., S. prov., Feb., 1860; chief engr., Sind, May, 1862; chief engr., presidency, Nov., 1866; pol. rest., Aden, Dec., 1870; retd., July, 1874.

TREMENHEERE, JAMES HENRY APPERLEY, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Lancing and Cheltenham Colls.; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 23rd Nov., 1875, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; in 1883 served in Mysore as acting civil and sessions judge; served subsequently in Madras as head asst. collr., and acting asst. sec. to govt.; offg. private sec. to the govr., May to Aug., 1885; sub-collr. and joint mag., Aug., 1888; collr. and mag., Nilgiris, July, 1890; district and sessions judge, Aug., 1890; collr. and mag., Kistna, Jan., 1894; addl. sess. judge, Nilgiris, May, 1897.

TREMLETT, JAMES DYER, M.A., B.L., late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Sidney Sussex Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 17th Nov., 1860, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and dep. commr.; commr., Nov., 1880; addl. judge, chief court, April, 1884; divl. judge, Nov., 1884; judge, chief court, Punjab, Sept., 1886; retd., March, 1889.

TRETHEWY, ANTHONY WILLIAM, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Winchester, and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1885, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and asst. commr.; dep. commr., May, 1896; mag. and collr., April, 1897.

TREVELYAN, ERNEST JOHN, B.L., Calcutta High Court.—Advocate, high court, Calcutta, 1875-85; offg. sec., board of examrs. for pleaders, &c., 1875-82; offg. mag., Calcutta, N. divn., 1876; judge, high court, Calcutta, 12th Jan., 1885; also prest., board of examrs. for pleaders and mukhtars, 1886.

TREVOR, SIR ARTHUR CHARLES, K.C.S.I., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Lincoln Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 28th Oct., 1861, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and dep. commr. of customs and opium; collr. of customs, Bombay, April, 1879; senr. collr., Dec., 1884; collr. of salt rev., Oct., 1885; commr. of customs, salt, opium, and abkari, and reporter-gen. of external commerce, Sept., 1888; also British delegate for the Portuguese treaty; commr. in Sind, Nov., 1890; member of Bombay council, Nov., 1892; C.S.I., May, 1894; temporary member of govr.-gen.’s council, April-Oct., 1895; confd., April, 1896; K.C.S.I., Jan., 1898.

TREVOR, CHARLES BINNY, late Bengal, C.S.—Apptd. in 1830; arrived, 12th June, 1832; served in Bengal, in the grades of asst. commr., asst. collr. and mag., and joint mag.; mag. of Bakarganj, June, 1840; supt. and remembrancer of legal affairs, 1849; judge of sadar diwini
and nizamat adalat, presidency, 1859; judge of the high court, Calcutta, 1863; retd. in 1867.

TREVOR, EDWARD WALTER, Col., I.S.C., late Sind Commn.—First commn., April, 1855; arrived, 8th May, 1855; from Nov., 1864, served in Sind as dep. collr. and mag., and acting district supt. of police; on mil. duty, 1879-81; dep. commr., Upper Sind frontier, Jan., 1881; collr. and mag., Haidarabad, Dec., 1884; at various periods acted as commr. in Sind; reverted to mil. dept., April, 1893.

TREVOR, FREDERICK GEORGE BRUNTON, Dir. of Funds, India Office.—Educ. at St. Peter's Sch., York, and Marlborough Coll.; E. India house writer, old establ., 10th March, 1858; junr. clerk, public, edcl., and eccles. depts., Aug., 1860; senr. clerk, July, 1875; jud. and public dept., 1877; asst. sec. in that dept., June, 1887; dir. of funds, Feb., 1894.

TREVOR, GEORGE HERBERT, C.S.I., Col., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt of India.—Joined the Madras artillery, 5th April, 1858; from June, 1862, served in the Central Prov. as inspr. of schs., cantonmt. mag., asst. sec. to chief commr., and asst. commr.; from Oct., 1867, acted as asst. rest., Haidarabad; sec. for Berar, April, 1877; depd. to accompany Sir Salar Jung on his tour to Europe in 1867 as pol. officer; ofd. as rest. at Haidarabad, May-June, 1882; rest. and commr., Ajmir-Merwara, Nov., 1887; agent to govr.-gen., Rajputana, and chief commr. of Ajmir-Merwara, March, 1890; reverted to mil. dept., March, 1895; author of 'Rhymes of Rajputana.'

TREVOR, SALUSBURY THOMAS, Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., Dec., 1852; arrived, 2nd Nov., 1854; from Jan., 1855, served in British Burma as asst. engr., exec. engr., asst. to chief engr., and asst. sec. to chief commr.; transf. to Bengal, Oct., 1863; served as garrison engr., Fort William, and suptg. engr., and was apptd. sec. to chief commr., Assam, public works dept., July, 1869; chief engr., and joint sec., public works dept., Bengal, March, 1881; on depn. in connection with international exhibn. buildings at Calcutta, July, 1883; chief engr. and sec. to govt. of Bengal, public works dept., railways and roads and buildings, Jan., 1884; retd., March, 1889.

TREVOR, WILLIAM SPOTTISWOODE, V.C., Major-Gen., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Second lieut., Bengal engrs., Dec., 1849; arrived, 5th Feb., 1852; served in the Burmese war, 1852-53 (medal with clasps); employed on the Pegu survey, 1854; exec. engr., Bassein, Nov., 1855; was subsequently posted to Darjiling and Dinajpur; garrison engr., Fort William, 1861; comptr. and examr. of accs., Bengal, May, 1863; served in the Bhutan campaign, 1865 (medal and V.C.); suptg. engr., Calcutta, Jan., 1867; consulting engr. to govt. of Bengal, irrign., Jan., 1868; suptg. engr., mil. works, Calcutta, 1872; addl. chief engr. for famine relief works, Bengal, 1874; offg. chief engr. and sec. to govr.-gen.'s agent, Indore, April-Dec., 1875; offg. chief engr. and sec. to chief commr., Burma, Feb., 1876; confd., Dec., 1878; dir.-gen. of railways and dep. sec. to govt. of India, March, 1881; sec. to govt. of India in the public works dept., Feb., 1882; retd., Feb., 1887.

TROWARD, THOMAS, late Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Victoria Coll., Jersey; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 9th Oct., 1869, and served in the Punjab as asst. cantonmt. mag., asst. commr., and offg. jud. asst.; dep. commr., Jan., 1887; divl. judge, May, 1889; retd., March, 1896.

TRUEMAN, THOMAS, Col., I.S.C., late Bombay Jud. Dept.—Arrived, 23rd Nov., 1856, and served in the Mutiny campaign under Sir Hugh Rose (medal and clasp), and subsequently as asst. cantonmt. mag. at Poona and Kirki, and cantonmt. mag., and city mag., Karachi; cantonmt. mag., Ahmadabad, April, 1877, and subsequently at Belgaum; on famine duty, Sholapur, Sept., 1877; retd., Nov., 1888.

TUCKER, ALEXANDER LAUZUN PENDOCK, Indian C.S.—Educ. at Winchester, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 28th Dec., 1882, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; forest settlt. officer, Bijapur, Feb., 1886; asst. to rest. at Haidarabad, and asst. sec. for Berar, April, 1888; on depn. to Khetri state, 1888-89; asst. to the govr.-gen.'s agent, Central India, April, 1890; in 1891 acted as under sec. to govt. of India, foreign dept.; 1st asst. to rest., Haidarabad, and sec. for Berar, Oct., 1893; pol. agent, Harooli and Tonk, Dec., 1895.

TUCKER, HENRY ST. GEORGE, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1865, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and settlt. officer; jud. asst., Dec., 1883; dep. commr., Nov., 1884; commr. in Burma, May, 1886; retd., Sept., 1890; author of reports on the settlt. of the Dera Ismail Khan and Kohat districts.

TUCKER, HENRY PENDOCK ST. GEORGE, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1842; arrived, 14th April, 1843; served as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. judge in various districts in the Bombay presidency, and acted as dep. registrar of the sadar court in Bombay in 1845-46; acting first ass't, acctnt.-gen., Bombay, July, 1858; acting civil auditor, Bombay, 1858-59; collr. and mag., N. Kanara, July, 1862; judge and sessions judge, Konkan, Aug., 1862; offg. judge of the high court, Bombay, June, 1863; member of council, Bombay, April, 1869; retd. in 1876.

TUCKER, LOUIS HENRY EMILE, C.I.E., Col., Police Dept., Punjab.—First commn., 1860; arrived, 11th April, 1861; from Sept., 1864, served in the police dept., Punjab, as asst. supt. and district supt.; on special duty in connection with Kabul war, Nov., 1878, and again, Sept., 1879; dep. inspr.-gen., March, 1888; chief commr., Port Blair, Sept., 1888; re-apptd. dep. inspr.-gen. of police, Punjab, May, 1889; C.I.E., Jan., 1891; inspr.-gen. and under sec. to govt. (home police) dept., Dec., 1894.

TUCKER, WILLIAM ROXBURGH, Oudh Commn.—Joined the service, 12th Sept., 1871, as acting asst. commr.; confd., June, 1873; dep. commr., July, 1894.

TUDBALL, WILLIAM, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Bedford Modern Sch. and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 12th Nov., 1887, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., March, 1892; asst. commr., Feb., 1896; dep. commr., April, 1897.

TUPP, ALFRED COTTERELL, B.A., late
Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Univ. Coll. Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 29th Nov., 1862, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. supt. of Dehra Dun; also subord. judge from March, 1873; held charge of provl. gazetteer, 1876-77; joint mag. and dep. collr., Azimgarh, Aug., 1877; transfd. to the finl. dept., govt. of India, Nov., 1878, and served in Madras, Bombay, and Bengal; acctnt.-gen., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Nov., 1883; Bombay, Dec., 1887; N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Nov., 1888; retd., Oct., 1889; author of ‘The Indian Civil Service and the Competition System,’ 1875; ‘The Statistics of the N.W. Prov.,’ ‘The Paris International Monetary Conference of 1881, and Bimetallism,’ &c., &c.

TUPPER, CHARLES LEWIS, C.S.I., B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Harrow, and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 1st Nov., 1871, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and asst. settlt. officer; under sec. to govt. of Punjab, April, 1877; offg. under sec. to govt. of India, dept. of rev., agric., and commerce, Sept., 1878; junr. sec. to govt. Punjab, March, 1882; sec., Nov., 1888; chief sec. to govt., March, 1890; on special duty in foreign dept., govt. of India, 1893-94, and from April, 1895; commr. and supt., Sept., 1895; C.S.I., Jan., 1897; author of ‘Customary Law of the Punjab, vols. I-III, and of ‘Our Indian Protectorate.’

TUPPER, JOHN HOLMAN EYRE, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Rugby, and Queen’s Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 17th Nov., 1896, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

TURING, JULIUS MATHISON, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Bedford Gr. Sch., and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 7th Dec., 1896, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

TURNBULL, PETER STEPHENSON, M.D., Surgn.-Major-Gen., late Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Oct., 1860, and was employed under the mil. dept. until April, 1864, when he was apptd. supt. of vaccn., central circle; served in the Abyssinian campaign, 1867-68 (medal); examr. of med. accts., Feb., 1876; acted at various periods as supt.-gen. of vaccn., dep. sanitary commr., and inspr.-gen. of prisons; sec. to surgn.-gen., Bombay, Aug., 1882; dep. surgn.-gen., Sind, Feb., 1888; surgn.-gen. with the govt. of Bombay, Feb., 1893; retd., March, 1896.

TURNBULL, WILLIAM SATOOR, late Bombay Rev. Survey Dept.—Educ. at King’s Coll.; joined the service, 14th Aug., 1865, as supernumerary asst. settlt. officer in Sind; asst. supt., rev. survey, Berar, Oct., 1869, and afterwards in Bombay; dep. supt., Konkan survey, Dec., 1891; supt., Deccan rev. survey, April, 1894; retd., Feb., 1896.

TURNER, SIR CHARLES ARTHUR, K.C.I.E., M.A., Council of India.—Educ. at Exeter Coll., Oxford (fellow, 1855); called to the bar (Lincoln’s Inn), 1858, and went the western circuit; apptd. judge of the high court, N.W. Prov., and arrived, May, 1866; acted as chief justice in 1870, 1875, and 1878; chief justice of the high court, Madras, Jan., 1879; fellow of the univ. of Madras, Jan., 1879; member of the Indian law commn., Bengal, 1879; vice-chancellor of Madras univ., 1880 and 1882; retd., July, 1885; member of the public service commn., 1885-86; member of the council of India, Feb., 1888; vice-pres., 1896-97.

TURNER, EDWARD, late Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Shrewsbury, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 20th Nov., 1864, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; on famine relief operations, 1877-78; sub-collr. and joint mag., April, 1882; collr. and mag., Cuddapah, Jan., 1885; district and sessions judge, Cuddapah, Feb., 1885; collr. and mag., Madura, Jan., 1886; retd., April, 1895.

TURNER, FREDERICK CHARLES, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Christ’s Hosp., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 19th Dec., 1895, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

TURNER, HENRY GRIBBLE, B.L., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1863; asst. collr. and mag., April, 1866; from Aug., 1866, to Dec., 1867, served in the police dept. as asst. supt. and district supt.; postmr.-gen., Madras, March, 1875; district and sessions judge, N. Arcot, June, 1884; collr., &c., at Vizagapatam, Nov., 1885; retd., July, 1890.

TURNER, LAWRENCE HERBERT, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at City of London Sch., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 18th Dec., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., and asst. mag. and collr.; offg. under sec. to govt., May, 1894; joint mag., Dec., 1894.

TURNER, SAMUEL COMPTON, Col., R.E., Mil. Works Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 17th April, 1866; arrived, 18th Dec., 1868, and joined the public works dept. as asst. engr. in Bombay, Jan., 1869; exec. engr., Feb., 1873; from Dec., 1873, served under the govt. of India; took part in Mahsud-Waziri expdn., 1881; offd. as asst. sec., mil. dept., in 1886 and 1887; suptg. engr., March, 1890; chief engr., mil. works, April, 1895.

TUSON, FRANCIS EDWARD, Port Blair Administration.—Joined the service, 25th Dec., 1863, as extra asst. supt., Port Blair; asst. supt., Dec., 1884; 1st asst. supt., April, 1891.

TWEEDIE, MAURICE, Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Arrived in India as ensign, 23rd Oct., 1856; during the Mutiny served with the field force in Central India, and subsequently with the mounted police in Oudh, and on the Nepali frontier (medal and clasp); from June, 1860, served as district supt.; junr. dep. inspr.-gen., Jan., 1890; senr. dep., March, 1893; reverted to mil. dept., Sept., 1894; author of a chapter on the fauna of Oudh, for incorporation in the Oudh gazetteer.

TWEEDIE, WILLIAM, C.S.I., Major-Gen., I.S.C.—First commn., Bengal infantry, Jan., 1857; served during the Mutiny (medal and clasps); adjutant, 1st cavalry, Haidarabad contingent, March, 1859; acted as asst. to rest., Haidarabad, from 1863; served in the Abyssinian expdn., 1868 (medal); 1st asst. rest., Haidarabad, and gen. supt., thagi and dakai dept, Oct., 1868; agent to govr.-gen., Murshidabad, 1876-77; pol. agent, Gwalior, 1878-79; during the Afghan war was senr. pol. officer with Major-Gen. Bright, during advance on Kabul, and was in charge of
Jalalabad divn., March, 1880 (medal, C.S.I.); offg. pol. agent, W. Rajputana states, 1880-81; acted subsequently as rest in W. Rajputana, in Gwalior, and Turkish Arabia; offg. commr., Ajmir, March-June, 1885; rest, in Turkish Arabia, March, 1886; reverted to mil. duty, Oct., 1891; author of 'The Arabian Horse,' 1894.

TWEEDY, GEORGE ALFRED, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam.of 1877; arrived, 8th Dec., 1879, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and cantonmt. mag.; joint mag., Nov., 1887; asst. commr., March, 1890; supt., Dehra Dun, April, 1891; dep. commr., April, 1894; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1896.

TWEMLOW, EDWARD D'OYLEY, Major-Gen., R.E., late Mil. Works Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the Indian establ., 9th Dec., 1859; apptd. asst. engr., July, 1862; exec. engr., Dec., 1865; served in Afghan war, 1879-80 (medal); transf'd. to mil. works dept., Sept., 1887; suptg. engr., west of India coast defences, Feb., 1888; transf'd. to Lahore and Sirhind command, April, 1892; and to Rawal Pindi, Nov., 1892; re-transf'd. to Lahore and Sirhind, Feb., 1893; sec. to gov'r.-gen.'s agent, Baluchistan, June, 1895; reverted to mil. dept., Oct., 1895; retd., May, 1896.

TWIDELL, JOHN COOK, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at the Oxford High Sch. and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam.of 1893; arrived, 27th Dec., 1894, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and as sub-divl. officer.

TWIGG, JOHN, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Repton, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1879, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settlt. officer; special asst., Dec., 1887; head asst., Dec., 1890; sub-collr. and joint mag., Nov., 1891; collr. and mag., Oct., 1895.

TWIGG, JOHN HILL, B.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Royal Sch., Dungannon, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 12th Dec., 1863; from May, 1864, served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; on famine duty, 1874; joint mag. and dep. collr., 1st grade, May, 1880; mag. and collr., Hamirpur, April, 1882; addl. commr., Benares divn., April, 1889; retd., July, 1890.

TWISADAY, CHARLES EDWARD JAMES, Indo-European Telegraph Dept., India Office.—Apptd. to the London office of the dept., 27th July, 1869; accompanied the dir.-in-chief to Constantinople in 1880, as personal asst., and to the Persian Gulf in 1885 with the third Persian Gulf cable expdn., and afterwards to India; transf'd. to India office, 1st Jan., 1880.

TWOMEY, DANIEL HAROLD RYAN, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at St. Stanislaus' Coll., Tullamore, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 22nd Dec., 1884, and served in British Burma as asst. commr.; under sec. to chiet commr., Jan., 1889; dep. commr., April, 1891; offg. junr. sec., March-July, 1892; offg. sec., March-Sept., 1893, and March-Dec., 1896.

TYLER, HECTOR GRANVILLE SUTHERLAND, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Charterhouse and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 14th Dec., 1895, and served in N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

TYLER, SIR JOHN WILLIAM, Kt., C.I.E., M.D., F.R.C.S., late Jail Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service as offg. civil surgn., Etah, 6th May, 1863; apptd. also civil surgn. and supt. of jail, Mainpuri, March, 1866; supt., Meerut jails, April, 1873; supt., Agra jails, April, 1876; C.I.E., June, 1886; on special duty in Dholpur state, Dec., 1886; accompanied the Maharaja of Bharatpur to England for H.M.'s Jubilee, 1887; Kt., 1888; inspr.-gen. of prisons, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Sept., 1890; retd., July, 1896.

TYRRELL, WILLIAM, B.A., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov.).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1858; arrived, 12th May, 1859, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; registrar, high court, N.W. Prov., Aug., 1870; mag. and collr.; Jan., 1878; civil and sessions judge, Jan., 1882; puisne judge, high court, N.W. Prov., Nov., 1882; retd., Nov., 1894.

TYTLER, ADAM GILLES, C.I.E., Bengal Opium Dept.—Entered the service March, 1862, and served as asst. and sub-dep. opium agent.

UDNY, SIR RICHARD, K.C.S.I., M.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Univ. of Aberdeen, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 25th Nov., 1869, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and jud. asst.; dep. commr., Feb., 1885; C.S.I., Jan., 1894; on special duty with Indo-Afghan boundary commn., Aug., 1894; promoted to commr., Dec., 1894; K.C.S.I., June, 1897.

UMESH CHUNDER BATABYAL, M.A., Bengal Provl. Service.—Master in the Sanskrit coll., Calcutta, Aug., 1873; dep. mag. and dep. collr., Feb., 1880; apptd. member of the statutory civil service, May, 1888; asst. mag. and collr., June, 1888; dep. mag. and dep. collr. in provl. service, May, 1893; mag. and collr., April, 1896.

UNDERWOOD, WALTER GREGORY, late Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Rossall Sch., and Chester Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 17th Sept., 1870, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; on special duty to the Laccadives, Nov., 1881; sub-collr. and joint mag., Dec., 1885; collr. and mag., Jan., 1889; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1894; retd., Aug., 1897.

UNWIN, ARTHUR HAMILTON, late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at King's Sch., Sherborne, and Tonbridge Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 8th Nov., 1869, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; from Feb., 1873, served in British Burma as asst. commr. and inspr. of schs.; from Jan., 1880, served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. judge; judge and sessions judge, May, 1887; retd., Feb., 1896.

UPCOTT, FREDERICK ROBERT, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, Dec., 1868, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., Nov., 1874; suptg. engr., Dec., 1890; engr.-in-chief, Bengal-Assam railway, N. section, Nov., 1891; consulting engr. for railways, and joint sec. to govt., railway branch, Madras, Feb., 1893; rank of chief engr., Oct., 1894; offg. dir.-gen. of railways, and dep. sec. to govt. of India, May, 1897.

UPENDRA CHANDRA MALLIK, B.L., late Jud. Dept. (Bengal).—Joined the service, 3rd May, 1867 as munisif; subordinate judge, Dec., 1878; retd., July, 1897.
UPTON, ROBERT LEYCESTER.—Govt. solicitor, high court, Calcutta, from 4th March, 1881, to June, 1895.

UPTON, SAMUEL RICHARD, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Writer, India office, 3rd Feb., 1876; clerk specially attached, Sept., 1892.

USHER, CHRISTOPHER JAMES, Madras Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to the dept. as asst. engr., Oct., 1877; exec. engr., April, 1890.

VAN GEYZEL, JOHN LAWRENCE, M.B., Surgn.-Major, Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 2nd Oct., 1880; civil surgn., Negapatam, Jan., 1883; chemical examr. and prof. of chemistry, med. coll., Madras, Feb., 1890.

VAN SOMEREN, GODLIEB JAMES, Col., late Forest Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Madras infantry, Sept., 1859; apptd. to the forest dept., May, 1864; conservator, Mysore and Coorg, May, 1869; transid. to Punjab, 1881; asst. compt.-gen. of forest accts., Feb., 1883; conservator, Berar, Jan., 1885; also dir. of the forest sch. from Aug., 1889; retd., Feb., 1892.

VARADA RAO, TUMALAPALLI, B.A., B.L., Statutory C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Madras Univ.; prob. for the civil service, July, 1885; asst. collr. and mag., Dec., 1886; confd. in civil service, 17th Aug., 1887.

VARLEY, FREDERICK JOHN, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Westminster and at Oriel Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 25th Nov., 1895, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

VAUGHAN, ERNEST LLEWELLYN, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Blackheath Sch., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 10th Jan., 1886, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and acting asst. acctnt.-gen.; head asst., Nov., 1894.

VAUGHAN, HANNA PERCIVAL, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the Charterhouse and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 10th Dec., 1894, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

VAUX, ALFRED ROBERT BRICKWOOD, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Writer, India office, 29th June, 1874; clerk specially attached, Sept., 1892; resdt. clerk, May, 1897.

VENGALE VENUGOPAL CHETTI, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Madras Christian Coll., Madras Univ., and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 21st Nov., 1890, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

VENIS, ARTHUR, M.A., Educ. Dept., (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; entered the service as acting prof. of English literature, Queen's Coll., Benares, July, 1881; confd., April, 1885; prof. of philosophy, and principal, Sanskrit Coll., Benares, Nov., 1894.

VENNING, FREDERICK, late Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 24th Nov., 1864, and served in the Punjab and Central Prov. as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; inspr.-gen. of police and prisons, Central Prov., June, 1880; commr., Aug., 1881; acted also as jud. commr.; retd., April, 1894.

VERNEDE, ARTHUR HENRY, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch., and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 7th Dec., 1896, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

VERNER, WILLIAM HENRY, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and Victoria Coll., Jersey; apptd. after exam.of 1861; arrived, and Dec., 1863; served in Bengal as offg. asst. sec., board of rev., joint mag. and dep. collr., and district and sessions judge; also served as inspr. of schools, April, 1866, and offd. as under sec., gov't. of India, home dept., and as postmr.-gen., Bengal; retd., Dec., 1888.

VERNON, CHARLES VENABLES, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Manchester Gr. Sch., and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 17th Dec., 1896, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

VERTUE, WILLIAM, Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—First commn., June, 1857; from and Dec., 1862, served in the police dept. of the Central Prov. as acting district supt., and personal asst. to the inspr.-gen.; from May, 1865, served as asst. commr.; cantonmt. mag., Saugor, Jan., 1877; small cause court judge, Nagpur, Jan., 1882; dep. commr., Sept., 1883; reverted to mil. dept., Nov., 1894.

VIBART, HENRY MEREDITH, Col., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Madras.—First commn., Dec., 1857; arrived, 30th Nov., 1859; asst. engr. in the Madras public works dept., Sept., 1861; exec. engr., Dec., 1866; on special duty in Bangalore, 1877-78; in special charge of the restoration of Tirumal Naick's palace, Madura, 1878; acting dep. chief engr. for irrig., and under sec. to gov't., public works dept., March, 1879; supt. of works, presidency, April, 1880; suptg. engr., April, 1884; retd., Dec., 1891; author of 'The Mil. History of the Madras Engrs.', and 'The History of the East India Co.'s Mil. Coll. at Addiscombe.'

VIBERT, ARTHUR LIONEL, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Victoria Coll., Jersey, and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 8th Nov., 1893, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

VIDAL, GEORGE WILLIAM, B.L., late Indian C.S.(Bombay).—Educ. at Eton, and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 26th Oct., 1867, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settl. officer; first asst., Dec., 1878; member of the mixed commn. at Goa, 1880 and 1885; prest. of the Bombay forest commn., Dec., 1885; collr. and mag., Panch Mahals, and pol. agent, Rewa Kantha, Sept., 1886; collr. of salt rev., Bombay, Sept., 1888; sec., pol., &c., depts., Feb., 1895; acting chief sec., April, 1895; member of legisl. council from June, 1894; chief sec. pol. dept., July, 1896; retd., March, 1897.

VINCENT, CLAUDE, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and posted to Madras; asst. chief engr. and under sec., March-Oct., 1880; exec. engr., May, 1883; acting private sec. to gov't. of Madras, March, 1889; under sec. to gov't. of India, civil works branch, Dec., 1889; transid. to Central Prov., 1892; acted as dep. sec. to gov't. of India, public works dept., in 1892 and 1893; services lent to gov't. of Straits Settlements for Krian irrig. scheme, in 1894.

VINCENT, HENRY ALEXANDER, Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 9th Nov., 1866; prest., council of regency, Rampur, Nov., 1893; pol. agent, Baghelkhand, and supt., Rewa state, April, 1894-7; pol. agent, Bikanir, April, 1897.
VINCENT, ROBERT WILLIAM EDWARD HAMPE, C.I.E., Bombay Police Dept.—Joined the service, 1st March, 1860, and served as inspr. of police; asst. supt., May, 1875; supt., March, 1876; commr. of police, Bombay, Sept., 1894; C.I.E., Jan., 1894; retd., Bikani.

VINCENT, WILLIAM HENRY HOARE, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Christ Coll., Brecon, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 10th Dec., 1887, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Aug., 1894.

VOWELL, CHRISTOPHER HENRY, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Cheltenham; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 4th Dec., 1867; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; mag. and collr., July, 1884; retd., March, 1893.

WACE, ALFRED AUGUSTUS, late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Eton, and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1868; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; mag. and collr., Nov., 1884; in 1891-92 served in Assam as acting judge and commr., Assam valley districts; commr., Bardwan, April, 1894; retd., Sept., 1895.

WADDELL, LAWRENCE AUSTINE, LL.D., M.B., Surg.-Major, Bengal Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1880; ofig. civil surgn., Jhelum, April, 1881; civil surgn. Meerut, 1882; resp. physician, med. coll. hosp., Calcutta, Feb., 1883; prof. of pathology, 1884; supt. of vaccn. and dep. sanitary commr., March, 1885; served through the Burmese war, 1886-87; archaeologist with the Chitral Relief Force, 1895; chemical examr. to govt. and prof. of chemistry, med. coll., Calcutta, Jan., 1896; author of 'The Buddhism of Tibet,' &c., &c.

WADDINGTON, C. W., Educ. Dept., Bombay.—Apptd. vice-principal, Rajkumar coll., Rajkot, Dec., 1895; principal, Feb., 1896.

WADDINGTON, GEORGE, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1857; arrived, 21st Dec., 1857, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; junr. collr. and mag., Dec., 1878; senr. collr., Aug., 1881; retd., Nov., 1891.

WADE, EDWARD JOHN, M.A., India Office.—Educ. at Rugby, and Trinity Coll., Dublin (scholar and exhib., first senr. classical moderator and gold medallist); asst. librarian, India office, 23rd May, 1881; was for some time editor of 'Allen's Indian Mail.'

WAHAB, ROBERT ALEXANDER, Lieut.-Col., R.E., Survey of India Dept.—First commn., 29th April, 1873; asst. supt., survey dept., Jan., 1883; dep. supt., July, 1888; served in the Afghan war, 1879-80, in Mahsud Waziri expdn., 1881, Zhob valley expdn., 1884, and with Hazara field force and Miranzai field force in 1888 and 1891.

WAIT, LEWIS GORHAM, India Postal Dept.—Joined the service, 28th May, 1870; asst. dir.-gen., foreign post branch, Calcutta, Dec., 1880; first asst. dir.-gen. of post office, Sept., 1890; dep. postmr.-gen., Sind and Beluchistan, April, 1892.

WAKE, HERWALD CRAUFURD, C.B., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1851; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; mag. of Shahabad, 1853; C.B., May, 1860; mag. and collr., Patna, 1861; supt., Darjiling, 1862; retd., 1868.

WALCH, GEORGE TURNER, M.I.C.E., late Madras Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 31st March, 1866; exec. engr., April, 1873; suptg. engr., March, 1887; chief engr. for irrign., Sept., 1889; joint sec., public works dept., with charge of irrign. branch, July, 1890; retd., April, 1893; author of 'Notes on Some of the Navigable Rivers and Canals of the United States and Canada,' 1876.

WALES, JOHN ADOLPHUS GATGENS, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Lincoln Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 11th Dec., 1894, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

WALKER, ALEXANDER COULL, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., and Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 30th Oct., 1893, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

WALKER, FRANCIS BLENNERHASSETT, late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to the Bombay public works dept., Sept., 1863; exec. engr., July, 1868; transf. to Punjab, Jan., 1870, and employed on state railways; transf. to Bombay, March, 1881, and subsequently to Bengal; engr.-in-chief, N. Bengal and Tirhut railway extensions, March, 1883; suptg. engr., Dec., 1885; engr.-in-chief, E. coast railway survey, Nov., 1889; chief engr., Jan., 1892; consulting engr. for railways, Madras, Oct., 1892; retd., Feb., 1893.

WALKER, GEORGE CASSON, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Winchester Coll., and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 6th Jan., 1878, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; from April, 1883, served in the finl. dept. of the govt. of India, and was apptd. asst. acctnt.-gen., Punjab; transf. to office of acctnt.-gen., Bengal, Dec., 1883; from Feb., 1884, served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and ofig. district judge; served under the govt. of India from Sept. to Nov., 1886, as under sec., fin. and commerce dept.; settl. officer, Lahore, Feb., 1888; also ofig. dir. of land records and agric. in 1892, and ofig. commr. of excise, &c., 1894; commr. of excise, &c., Nov., 1895; dep. commr., Jan., 1896.

WALKER, GEORGE HERBERT DACRES, B.A., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. sec. to govt. of N.W. Prov. and Oudh, 1st May, 1874; served subsequently in acct. branch; under sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., May, 1887.

WALKER, GEORGE LEMON, M.D., C.M., L.M., Surg.-Lt.-Col., Indian Med. Service (Madras).—Entered the service, March, 1876; regtl. duty, and as civ. surg. till Feb., 1889; Zillah surg., Coonoor, Feb., 1889; dist. surg. and supt. of jail, Nellore, Oct., 1891; ditto, Tanjore, May, 1894; presy. surg., Madras.

WALKER, GEORGE WARREN, Gen., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Madras.—Second lieut., Madras engrs., 9th Dec., 1842; asst. civil engr., 1847; district engr., Kanara, Sept., 1859; suptg. engr., Coimbatore, May, 1863; chief engr., and sec. to govt. of Madras, public works dept., May, 1872; retd. from the dept. in 1876.

WALKER, HARRY BRUCE, Store Dept., India Office.—Matriculated at London Univ., 1875; clerk, 2nd class, India store depot, 6th July, 1877; and grade supervisor, July, 1888.

WALKER, JAMES, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at the Univ. of Aberdeen and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 1st Dec., 1886, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; transf. to Central Prov. as asst. commr., Dec., 1890; dep. commr., Jan., 1895.
WALKER, JAMES WILLIAM, LL.B., B.L., late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 5th Dec., 1868, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. judge; acting remembrancer of legal affairs, 1880; judge and sessions judge, Feb., 1885; retd., Nov., 1893.

WALKER, THOMAS GORDON, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at the Gymnasium, Old Aberdeen, and Univ. of Aberdeen; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 4th Nov., 1872, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and was settl. officer of Ludhiana, 1878-84; also acted as under sec. to govt. registrar of chief court, &c.; senr. sec. to finl. commr., Feb., 1888; commr. of excise, and inspr.-gen. of registrn., &c., Nov., 1888; dep. commr., April, 1896.

WALKER, THORNTON, M.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Edinburgh Univ. and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 8th Dec., 1885, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and 2nd asst.; judge and sessions judge, April, 1897.

WALKLATE, HAROLD THORNTON, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, India audit office, 31st Oct., 1892; transfd. to record and registry dept., India office, 9th Aug., 1894.

WALL, RICHARD, M.A., LL.D., B.L., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Cork; apptd. after exam. of 1856; arrived, 16th Dec., 1856; served in N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; mag. and collr., Benares, Feb., 1877; commr. of excise and stamps, and inspr.-gen. of registrn., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Feb., 1882; retd., Oct., 1891; author of stamp, excise, and registrn. manuals.

WALLACE, ALFRED CHARLES, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 17th Feb., 1872.

WALLACE, SIR DONALD MACKENZIE, K.C.I.E., M.A., LL.D.—Educ. at the Univs. of Edinburgh, Heidelberg, and Berlin, and the Ecole de droit, Paris; was 'Times' correspondent in Russia, Austria, and the East, 1878-84; private sec. to the govrn.-gen. of India (Lord Dufferin), 1884-88; member of mission to Kabul, 1888; accompanied the Czarewitch during his visit to India, 1890-91; author of 'Russia,' 'Egypt, and the Egyptian Question,' &c.

WALLACE, EDWARD HAMILTON, M.A. Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Glasgow Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived 16th Dec., 1865, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

WALLACE, JAMES, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1877, and posted to state railways as asst. engr.; transfd. to Burma, March, 1883; exec. engr., Nov., 1889; re-transfd. to state railways, Oct., 1893.

WALLACE, WILLIAM ARTHUR JAMES, C.I.E., Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., Dec., 1860; asst. engr., public works dept., April, 1864; asst. consulting engr., Calcutta, Feb., 1870; exec. engr., Sept., 1870; dep. consulting engr. for guaranteed railways, Calcutta, Oct., 1871; on special duty in connection with imperial assemblage at Delhi, acting as under sec. to govt. of India, 1876-77; on depn. to England with commission with Paris exhibn., 1878; sec. to railway conference at Calcutta, Oct., 1878; acting under sec. to govt. of India, railway branch, 1878-79; served in the Afghan war, 1879 (medal); engr.-in-chief and manager, N. Bengal state railway, Nov., 1879; served in the Egyptian campaign, 1882 (medal and clasp, and bronze star, 4th class Osmanieh); offg. consulting engr. for guaranteed railways, Lahore, Oct., 1884; dir., N.W. railway, May, 1887; depd. to Switzerland to examine the Abt system of railways, 1887; C.I.E., Jan., 1890; reverted to mil. dept., Oct., 1892.

WALLER, DAVID GRIERSON, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Bath Coll., and Trin. Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 30th Dec., 1896, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

WALLER, RICHARD MAUNSELL, B.A., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Marlborough Coll., and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 4th Dec., 1867, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1878; dep. commr., April, 1879; mag. and collr., Aug., 1885; retd., Jan., 1895.

WALLIS, BERESFORD GAHAN, L.C.E., A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 17th July, 1871, and posted to the Punjab; exec. engr., Oct., 1881.

WALMSLEY, HUGH, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Merton Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 28th Dec., 1894, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

WALPOLE, SIR HORACE GEORGE, K.C.B., Asst. Under Sec. of State, India Office.—Educ. at Eton; temporary clerk, India office, 12th Dec., 1862; junr. clerk, June, 1863; store dept., 1863; accnt.-gen.'s dept., 1863-64; public works dept., 1864; rest. clerk, 1870-77; senr. clerk, April, 1877; private sec. to the permanent under sec. of state (Mr. Herman Merivale, C.B.), 1866-74, and to the sec. of state (the Marquis of Salisbury, 1874-78, and Viscount Cranbrook, 1878-80); C.B., 1880; also served as clerk of the council from 1877, and was apptd. asst. to the under secs. of state in addn. to his other duties, Sept., 1881; asst. under sec. of state, Nov., 1883, continuing to be clerk of the council; royal commr. for the Colonial and Indian exhibn., 1886; sec. to the royal commn. on civil establs., 1886-90; K.C.B., Aug., 1892.

WALSH, ERNEST HERBERT COOPER, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Trent Coll. and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 11th Dec., 1884, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Nov., 1891; mag. and collr., Sept., 1895; junr. sec. board of rev., June, 1896.

WALSH, LANGTON PRENDERGAST, C.I.E., Bombay Pol. Dept.—Entered the service as asst. mail offr., April, 1873; British agent and vice-consul, Berbera, Aug., 1884; asst. pol. rest., Aden, Oct., 1885; C.I.E., Jan., 1889; asst. pol. rest., Belgaum, May, 1893; pol. supt., Savantadi, Feb., 1897.

WALTON, FREDERICK THOMAS GRANVILLE, C.I.E., M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to dept. as engr.-in-chief, Oudh and Rohilkhand railway, 1st Jan., 1889.

WAPSHARE, ARTHUR, Major, I.S.C., Bombay Jud. Dept.—First commn., 28th Oct., 1871; served in the Soudan expedn., 1884-85 (medal, clasp and star); offg. cantonmt. mag., Karachi, 1887-88; cantonmt. mag., Deesa, Sept., 1888.
WARBURTON, HARRIS GRANT, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Dover Coll. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 5th Dec., 1887, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; from Oct., 1891, to Aug., 1893, was employed under the govt. of India as asst. acctnt.-gen., Bengal, and asst. comptr.-gen. (paper currency); joint mag., March, 1895.

WARBURTON, JOHN PAUL, Police Dept., Punjab.—Joined the service, 23th May, 1864, as asst. district supt. of police; district supt., April, 1873; asst. inspr.-gen., railway police, June, 1894.

WARBURTON, ROBERT, C.S.I., Brevet-Col., I.S.C., Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 24th Oct., 1862; from Sept., 1869, served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; on special pol. duty in Khaibar, July, 1879; employed with Kabul force, Oct., 1879; pol. officer, Khaibar, Feb., 1882; C.S.I., Jan., 1890; author of 'An Account of the Boner and Amazai Tribes,' 'A Report on the District of Sughman,' &c.

WARBURTON, WILLIAM PLEACE, M.D., Surgn.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—Joined the Indian med. dept., 31st March, 1866; civil surgn., Jalandhar, April, 1868; acted as supt. of central jail, Lahore, 1872-73; med. officer to the Maharaja of Kapurthala, June, 1874; principal med. officer and sanitary commr., Assam, Jan., 1894; inspr.-gen. of civil hosps., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, April, 1895.

WARD, ALFRED WILLIAM, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, acctnt.-gen.'s dept., 2nd Aug., 1892; transf'd. to registry and record dept., Dec., 1894.

WARD, GEORGE ERNEST, B.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Wadham Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., asst. supt. of Dehra Dun, and joint mag.; mag. and collr., Jaunpur, July, 1879; commr., Jhansi divn., July, 1885; retd., July, 1889.

WARD, HENRY CONSTANTINE EVELYN, C.I.E., Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—Arrived as ensign, April, 1855; was employed under the mil. dept. up to 1864, including service in the Mutiny (medal and clasp), the Yusufzai expedn., 1858, and the campaign against the Mahsud Waziris, 1859-60 (frontier medal); asst. commr., Central Prov., Dec., 1864; dep. commr., May, 1870; acting inspr.-gen. of registrn., &c., Nov., 1873; addl. commr. in Kalahandi, June, 1882; special commr. for the repression of dakitai in Narbada divn., Feb., 1886; from June, 1882; served under the govt. of India, as minister of the Bhopal state; commr., Narbadadivn., Aug., 1889; reverted to mil. dept., 1892.

WARD, THEODORE METHUEN, Col., late Survey Dept., Sind.—Joined the service, 9th Dec., 1859; lieut., Bombay artillery, April, 1860; admitted to the rev. survey dept., Nov., 1864; supt., Sind rev. survey, June, 1839; reverted to mil. duty, 1890; retd., Dec., 1891.

WARD, SIR WILLIAM ERSKINE, K.C.S.I., M.A., Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 29th Nov., 1861, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; offg. under sec. to govt. of India, home dept., 1865-66, and 1866-67; under sec. in dept. of rev., agric., and commerce, March, 1873; from Oct., 1873, served in jud. dept. as acting district and sessions judge; transf'd. to Assam, March, 1876, and served as judge and commr. of Assam valley districts; offic. temporarily as jud. commr. of Central Prov., 1883; fellow of univ. of Calcutta; offg. chief commr. of Assam, July-Oct., 1883, and from Feb., 1885, to Oct., 1887; offg. jud. commr., British Burma, April, 1884, to Feb., 1885; confd. as jud. commr., Burma, May, 1886, continuing to act as chief commr. of Assam; C.S.I., Jan., 1888; took charge of substantive appt. of jud. commr. of Burma, March, 1889; chief commr. of Assam, May, 1891; K.C.S.I., May, 1896; retd., Nov., 1896.

WARD-SMITH, WILLIAM, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 3rd Dec., 1872, and employed on irrign. works in N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., Dec., 1881.

WARDE, HUGH NORTH, Captain I.S.C. (Burma commn.).—First commn., 6th Feb., 1884; apptd. to the Burma commn., Dec., 1886, and served as asst. commr.

WARDEN, AUGUSTUS BROOKE, late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at the Kensington Gr. Sch., and Haileybury Coll.; apptd., 1842, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. judge; judge and sessions judge, March, 1856; judge of the high court, 1865; was also pres't. of the deptl. exams. committee for junr. civilians for five years; retd., 1871.

WARDEN, CHARLES JAMES HISLOP, M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., 31st March, 1874; from 18th March, 1876, acted as civil surgn. of Bhagalpur, with med. charge of the central jail; offg. principal asst. to the opium agent, Behar, 1878; prof'r. of chemistry, med. coll., and chemical and opium examr. to govt., Dec., 1879; services placed at disposal of mil. dept., April, 1892; med. store-keeper to govt., Bengal command, April, 1894.

WARDEN, FREDERICK, Commander, late R.I.M.—Joined the Indian navy, 2nd March, 1852; from Dec., 1865, served as port-master of Canning, and asst. collr. of customs; from Dec., 1866, acted as asst. master attendant, and agent for govt. consignments, Calcutta, and from March, 1870, as agent for transports; also govt. prosecutor for trial of pilots, May, 1873; to March, 1876; asst. port officer, Aug., 1879; examr. in navigation, Nov., 1879; transf'd. to Rangoon as port officer, &c., March, 1882; retd., Sept., 1890.

WARDEN, JOHN LODWICK, B.A. (Oxon.), B.L., late Jud. Dept. Bombay.—Arrived, 8th March, 1852, and served in the Bombay cov. civil service as asst. collr. and mag., and dep. mag. in charge of the adalat, Haidarabad; resigned the civil service, May, 1858; apptd. extra asst. sec. to govt. of Bombay, jud. dept., Dec., 1866; asst. judge, April, 1867; from Jan., 1869, served as small cause court judge, and was apptd. third judge, Bombay, Dec., 1874, and second judge, May, 1888; retd., 1889.

WARING, MICHAEL LOUIS, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Clifton Coll. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 24th Dec., 1894, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

WARRE, SIR HENRY JAMES, K.C.B., Gen.
—Obtained commn. from Sandhurst, 1836; ensign, 54th foot, 3rd Feb., 1837; from 1839 served as A.D.C. to commander of the forces in British N. America (Sir R. Downes Jackson, K.C.B.); during 1845-46 was employed in Canada under the colonial office; served in the Crimea (medal with clasp, C.B., 5th class of the Medjidie and Turkish medal); in 1858 was in command of a mixed force on the Tapti River in co-operation with the Central India field force, and was subsequently apptd. brigadier at Mhow; mil. sec. to the commander-in-chief in India (Lieut.-Gen. Sir Hugh Rose, K.C.B.), June, 1860; served in the Maori war in New Zealand, 1861; was subsequently in command of the troops on the west coast, and in the prov. of Taranaki 1863-66 (medal); from 1870-74 was stationed in Ireland as brigadier-gen.; commander-in-chief, and member of govr.'s council, Bombay, Nov., 1878, to 1881; retd., Jan., 1886.

WARRY, WILLIAM, M.A., Pol. Dept., Burma.—Educ. at Exeter Coll., Oxford; in 1878 passed the competitive exam. for student interpreterships in China; was acting asst.
