Chinese sec. at Peking from Oct., 1881 to July, 1882; employed on special service under the govt. of India from Dec., 1885; received the Burma war medal for active service, 1887-88; apptd. pol. officer on special duty in Burma, 10th Feb., 1887; adviser on Chinese affairs, April, 1892; author of a transl. of the Peking Gazette, 1881-82.

WATERFIELD, SIR HENRY, K.C.S.I., C.B., Finl. Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Westminster; junr. clerk, India board, 1st Sept., 1853; finl. and railway dept., 1853; pol. and secret dept., 1856; private sec. to prest. of the India board, 1858; India office, finl. dept., 1858; asst. private sec. and précis writer to the sec. of state, 1860; finl. dept., 1863; senr. clerk, April, 1863; asst. sec. in the mil. dept., 1867; public works dept., 1871; sec. in the statistics and commerce dept., 1874; sec., finl. dept., 1879; C.B., Dec., 1885; sec. of the Indian currency committee, 1892-93; K.C.S.I., July, 1893; author of the first report on the moral and material progress of India, 1866, and of a memo. on the census of British India of 1871-72, both of which were presented to parliament.

WATERFIELD, WILLIAM, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Westminster; apptd. from Haileybury, 1852; arrived, 10th Nov., 1852; served in Bengal in the rev. and survey depts. till 1859, when he was transfd. to the finl. dept. as 1st asst. to the acctnt.-gen. for India; acted as sub-treasurer, Madras, and as civil auditor and supt. of stamps, Madras, Calcutta, and Bombay; from 1864 to 1877 served successively as civil paymaster, dep. acctnt.-gen., and acctnt.-gen., N.W. Prov. and Oudh; comptr.-gen., 1877-80; retd., 1881.

WATERHOUSE, JAMES, Col., I.S.C., Survey of India Dept.—Lieut., Bengal artillery, June, 1859; arrived, 11th Oct., 1859; asst. rev. surveyor, Lower Prov., June, 1866; asst. surveyor with superintendence of the photozincographic operations in the office of the surveyor-gen. of India, July, 1866; asst. supt. of survey, June, 1870; on special duty with the Indian eclipse expdn., 1871-72, and for observing the transit of Venus, 1874-75; in charge of Indian eclipse expdn. to Nicobar Islands, 1875; asst. surveyor-gen., April, 1874; dep. supt., and asst. surveyor-gen., July, 1882; supt. (new scale), and asst. surveyor-gen., Aug., 1892; in charge of photolithographic office, Calcutta, from Dec., 1886; author of a pamphlet on 'The Application of Photography to the Reproduction of Maps and Plans,' and other reports and handbooks on professional subjects.

WATERS, GEORGE, L.R.C.S., L.R.C.P.(Ed.), Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the Bombay med. service, 1st Oct., 1856; arrived, 27th May, 1870, and served in the mil. dept., and as acting ophthalmic surgn., Bombay, and civil surgn. at Bushire; surgn. to govr. of Bombay, May, 1877; from Oct., 1881, served as physician and registrar, Jamsetji Jijibhooy hosp., curator of the pathological museum, and prof'r., Grant med. coll.; presidency surgn., 3rd district, Nov., 1889.

WATKINS, LAWRENCE AUGUSTUS, Jud. Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 10th Dec., 1863; served in the dept. from Jan., 1865, as dep. registrar of the high court, clerk to the high court judges, and commr. for taking affidavits.

WATSON, CHARLES JAMES KNIGHT, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and posted to Bengal; on famine duty in Madras, 1877-78; exec. engr., May, 1883; employed in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as examr., public works accts., 1888-89, and in Madras, 1889-92; transfd. to Burma, Feb., 1892.

WATSON, HUBERT DIGBY, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Harrow, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1893, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

WATSON, SIR JOHN, K.C.B., V.C., Gen., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt.of India.—First commn., Bombay infantry, 1848; served in Punjab campaign, 1848-49, Bodzar expdn., 1857, Mutiny, 1857-58, and Ambela expdn., 1863; from Sept., 1871, served as commandant, Central India horse, and pol. agent; rest. and agent to the govr.-gen. at Gwalior, April, 1877, also acting as agent for Central India; brigadier-gen. commanding cavalry brigade, Malta expedy. force, 1878; commanding Punjab chiefs' contingent in Afghanistan, 1878-79; in pol. charge of the district of Kuram, 1879-80; rest., and agent to the govr.-gen., Baroda, Jan., 1882; retd. from the dept., March, 1886.

WATT, GEORGE, C.I.E., M.B., Rev. and Agric. Dept., Govt. of India.—Apptd., 11th July, 1873; arrived, 4th Nov., 1873; served in the Bengal educn.dept. as prof'r., presidency, Hugli, and Patna colls.; on special duty in connection with the Burma-Manipur boundary expdn., 1881, and for Calcutta international exhibn., 1883; served under govt. of India, rev. and agric. dept., from May, 1884; apptd. to charge of imperial Indian economic court of Colonial and Indian exhibn.; C.I.E., June, 1886; reporter on economic products, April, 1887; author of several scientific papers, and editor of the 'Dictionary of Indian Economic Products.'

WATTS, GEORGE KEMPBORNE, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1875, and posted to Haidarabad; exec. engr., Nov., 1881; asst. to suptg. engr., and asst. sec. to rest., Sept., 1886; transfd. to Assam, 1895.

WAY, ROBERT ATWELL, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hil
Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1873, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., Oct., 1880; services lent to Bengal and N.W. railway co., 1884; to Bengal-Nagpur co., 1887; and to Delhi-Ambara-Kalka co., 1893; employed on Chittagong-Akyab-Minhlha railway survey, Oct., 1893; suptg. engr., Aug., 1895.

WAY, THEODORE ALBAN HENRY, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Portsmouth Gr. Sch., Clifton Coll., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 26th Nov., 1890, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., and asst. mag. and collr.; asst. supt., Jan., 1896; joint mag., Mar., 1896.

WEBB, CHARLES MORGAN, B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 30th Dec., 1895, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

WEBB, WILLIAM HAROLD, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Worcester Cathedral Sch. and Hertford Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 10th Dec., 1894, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

WEBB, WILLIAM TREGO, M.A., late Educl. Service, Bengal.—Joined the service, 6th April, 1875; profr., Dacca coll., May, 1875; profr., Presidency coll., from Jan., 1878; retd., March, 1892; has publd. 'Hints on the Study of English,' 'Indian Lyrics,' and translns.

WEBSTER, EDMUND FORSTER, C.I.E., B.L., late Madras C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1857, and served in rev. and jud. depts., Madras; small cause court judge, May, 1867; district and sessions judge, June, 1873; collr. and mag. and agent, Tanjore, April, 1878; on special duty in connection with the famine commn., Oct., 1878, and again, Aug., 1881, as sec. to the famine code committee; sec. to govt., rev. dept., June, 1882; member of legisl. council, 1883, 1885, and 1886; chief sec. to govt., Jan., 1884; fellow of Madras univ., 1884; retd., Oct., 1887; C.I.E., May, 1888.

WEBSTER, HENRY BINNY, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1854; arrived, 17th June, 1854; served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and asst. settl. officer; mag. and collr., Saharanpur, Nov., 1867, and subsequently at Gorakhpur and Meerut; commr., Jhansi divn., Jan., 1878; inspr.-gen. of police, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, April, 1880; retd., 1886.

WEBSTER, JOHN EDWARD, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at the Charterhouse and Trinity Hall, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 26th Nov., 1891, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and collr., April, 1897.

WEDDERBURN, HARRY GEORGE, B.L., Jud. Dept., Madras.—Reporter for the Indian law reports (Madras series) June, 1881; law reporter, March, 1888; administrator-gen., March, 1889; acting advocate-gen., 1891-92; member of legisl. council of Fort St. George, 1893-94.

WEDDERBURN, SIR WILLIAM, Bart., M.P., late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 25th Nov., 1860, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., asst. judge, acting jud. asst. to the commr. in Sind, and small cause court judge; acting sec. to govt. in the jud., &c., depts., Dec., 1866, and again in 1870 and 1874; under sec. to govt., jud. and pol. depts., May, 1867; acting registrar, high court, Jan., 1869; acting jud. commr. in Sind and judge of the sadar court, 1874-76; judge and sessions judge, June, 1875; acting judge, high court, Bombay, Jan., 1885; acting chief sec. to govt., Oct., 1886; retd., May, 1887; M.P. for Banffshire from 1893; member of royal commn. on Indian expenditure, May, 1895.

WEEKES, ARTHUR, M.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 2nd Feb., 1862; served in the Bengal rev. and jud. depts., and was apptd. mag. and collr., 1st grade, Aug., 1885; on famine relief duty at Madras, 1877; retd., March, 1888.

WEIDEMANN, GEORGE LEVER, late Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Bedford Gr. Sch. and Oriel Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 23rd Nov., 1870, and served in Burma as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; addl. sessions judge, Oct.-Dec., 1890; acted as commr., 1893-95; addl. sess. judge, Jan., 1896; retd., April, 1897.

WEIR, CHARLES JAMES, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Royal Acadl. Instn., Belfast, and Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 17th Nov., 1879, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. sessions judge, and in Coorg as offg. first asst. commr. and district mag.; acting under sec. to govt. of Madras, rev. dept., Oct., 1886; offg. under sec. to govt. of India, fin. dept., May, 1887; offg. dep. acctnt.-gen., Bengal, April, 1888; head asst. to collr. and mag., S. Arcot, Aug., 1888; sub-collr. and joint mag., Jan., 1891; collr. and mag., Dec., 1894.

WEIR, JOHN WILLIAM ALLEN, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Godolphin Sch., Hammersmith, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 12th Nov., 1884, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and administrator of Sachin state; 1st asst., Aug., 1895.

WEIR, PATRICK ALEXANDER, M.B., Surgn.—Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—Joined the service in 1875; offg. 2nd rest. surgn., presidency gen. hosp., Aug., 1876; supt. of vaccn., March, 1882; principal asst. to opium agent, Benares, May, 1882; offg. residency surgn., Nepal, May, 1891; offg. agency surgn. and administrative med. officer, Baluchistan, June, 1894.

WEIR, THOMAS, B.A., late Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 8th Dec., 1867, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; dep. registrar, high court, 1870-72; Tamil transl. to govt., Jan., 1879; head asst., Godavari, March, 1880; registrar, high court, April, 1882; from July, 1883, acted as district and sessions judge, and was placed on special duty in connection with the reorganization of the subord. jud. service, Nov., 1883; sub-sec., board of rev., Feb., 1886; district and sessions judge, Nov., 1887; offg. judge of high court, March, 1890, to Jan., 1891; retd., Oct., 1896; author of 'Law of Offences and Criminal Procedure, as expounded by the High Court of Madras,' and of 'Rules of Practice (Civil) of the Madras High Court.'

WEIR, THOMAS STEPHENSON, Brigade-Surgn.—Lieut.-Col., Med. Dept., Bombay.—
First commn., Indian med. dept., 1st April, 1870; health officer, Bombay, from 1874.

WELD, MATTHEW RICHARD, B.A., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Dublin Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 21st Nov., 1868, and served in Madras as asst. mag. and collr., and sub-collr. and joint mag.; acted as collr. and mag., Kistna, from April, 1885; district and sessions judge, Ganjam, Sept., 1888; Karnul, May, 1889; retd., Aug., 1893.

WELDON, THOMAS, C.I.E., Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Madras.—Joined Addiscombe, Jan., 1852; ensign, Madras infantry, Dec., 1853; from July, 1860, served as asst. supt. and supt. of police; senr. mag. of police for town of Madras, March, 1867; chief mag. of police, Madras, April, 1877; chief presidency mag., Dec., 1880; board of examrs., Jan., 1882; commr. of police for town of Madras, Dec., 1885; C.I.E., May, 1888; reverted to mil. dept., Dec., 1891.

WELLS, HENRY LAKE, C.I.E., M.I.E.E., Lieut.-Col., R.E., Indian Telegraph Dept.—Apptd. to the public works dept. as asst. engr., Feb., 1876; transfd. to state railways, Dec., 1876; on special duty in Baluchistan, in opening up Thal Chotiali route, 1879; lent to telegraph dept. for surveys in connection with a telegraph line from Srinagar to Gilgit, 1879; again lent to mil. dept. for field service, 1880 (medal); transfd. to Indo-European telegraph dept., as asst. dir., Persian section, 1880; dir., Jan., 1891; C.I.E., Jan., 1897; author of several reports on tours in Persia, &c.

WELLS, WALTER FOX WILLIAMSON, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Cheltenham; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 16th Nov., 1875, and served in Oudh as asst. commr.; city mag., Lucknow, Oct., 1885; joint mag., July, 1889; dep. commr., Nov., 1891; district and sessions judge, May, 1894.

WELSH, WILLIAM HENRY, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Haileybury; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 20th Nov., 1876, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., asst. sessions judge, &c.; head asst. to collr. and mag., Jan., 1885; senr. ass., Dec., 1887; sub-collr. and joint mag., Aug., 1889; collr. and mag., Nov., 1891; district and sessions judge, Cuddapah, Jan., 1894; collr. and mag., S. Kanara, Nov., 1894.

WENLOCK (BARON), RIGHT HON. BEILBY LAWLEY, G.C.S.I., G.C.I.E.—Educ. at Eton and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; M.P. for Chester, April to July, 1880; was vice-chairman of county council, East Riding; apptd. gov'r. of Madras, 20th Dec., 1890, and assumed charge of office, 23rd Jan., 1891; G.C.S.I., Jan., 1896.

WEST, SIR RAYMOND, K.C.I.E., M.A., B.L., LL.D., late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Galway; apptd. after exam. of 1855; arrived, 18th Sept., 1856, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., asst. judge, and offg. under sec.; registrar, high court, Bombay, June, 1863; jud. commr. and judge of the sadar court in Sind, June, 1872; judge of the high court, Bombay, Sept., 1873; member of the law commission, Calcutta, 1879; vice-chancellor of the univ. of Bombay, Oct., 1886; member of council of gov'r. of Bombay, 12th Nov., 1887; K.C.I.E., June, 1888; retd., April, 1892.

WESTERN, JAMES HALIFAX, C.M.G., Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., Bengal engrs., 1860; arrived, Oct., 1862; asst. engr., public works dept., N.W. Prov., Dec., 1863; exec. engr., Ganges canal, June, 1863; transfd. to Punjab, May, 1882; suptg. engr., Sept., 1882; offg. chief eng. and joint sec. for irrigtn., Punjab, Nov., 1884; services lent to Egyptian gov't.; retd., Jan., 1887.

WESTLAND, SIR JAMES, K.C.S.I., Govt. of India.—Educ. at Marischal Coll., Aberdeen, and Wimbledon Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 10th Oct., 1862; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; offg. junr. sec., govt. of Bengal, July, 1869; offg. supt. and remembrancer of legal affairs, June, 1870; under sec., govt. of India, finl. dept., Dec., 1870; acctnt.-gen., Central Prov., Dec., 1873; inspr. of local offices of acctns., Nov., 1877; acctnt.-gen., Bengal, Oct., 1878; comptr.-gen. and head commr. of state paper currency, Sept., 1881; in England on special duty, 1884; member of fin. committee, March, 1886; offg. member, govr.-gen.'s council, Aug., 1887; temporary member, Nov., 1887; C.S.I., June, 1888; sec. to govt. of India, dept. of fin. and commerce, Nov., 1888; chief commr. of Assam, July, 1889; retd., Oct., 1889; finl. member of govr.-gen.'s council, 27th Nov., 1893; K.C.S.I., Jan., 1895.

WESTMACOTT, EDWARD VESEY, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Rugby, and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 8th Jan., 1863; served in the Bengal rev. and jud. depts., and was on famine relief duty, 1874; offg. inspr.-gen. of jails, March, 1884; commr. of excise, Bengal, April, 1889; commr., presidency divn., March, 1893; acting member of rev. board, April-Nov., 1894.

WESTON, DONALD, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Stratford-on-Avon, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 26th Dec., 1894, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

WESTROPPE, ALEXANDER SLIGO ANDERSON, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Dover Coll., and Magdalene Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 5th Nov., 1893, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

WESTROPPE, GEORGE RALPH COLLIER, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Pol. Dept., Bombay.—First commn., Bombay infantry, Dec., 1850; arrived, 27th Jan., 1851; was employed under the mil. dept., including service in Khandesh against the rebel leader Tantia Topi, 1858; adjutant, Sawantwari local corps, Feb., 1859; acting asst. mag. in Ratnagiri, May, 1860; asst. to pol. supt., Sawantwari, Nov., 1862; asst. pol. agent, Kolhapur, 1865-69; in charge, S. Maharra jaghir states, 1869-77; pol. supt., Sawantwari, and commandant of the local corps, Aug., 1877; on special duty in the Savanur state in 1880; retd. from civil employment, 1888.

WHALLEY, PAUL, M.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W.Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., offg. junr. sec., and under sec. to govt.; offg. under sec. to govt. of India, dept. of rev., agric. and commerce, Dec., 1871, to Feb., 1872; joint mag. and dep. collr., 1st grade, May, 1877; dep. commr., in Oudh, Dec., 1877; mag. and collr., Pilibhit, Nov., 1879; retd., Feb., 1890; author of "A Collection of the Laws and Rules of the Non-Regulation Provinces."
WHEELER, FRANK, Store Dept., India Office.—Apptd. supplemental clerk, 1st Jan., 1893.

WHEELER, HENRY, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 14th Dec., 1891, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

WHEELER, PERCY COTTERILL, B.L., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 25th Dec., 1877, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; asst. settlt. officer, Jaunpur, Nov., 1882; asst. commr., April, 1887; joint mag., Nov., 1888; retd., 1892.

WHISH, CHARLES WILLIAM, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Tonbridge Sch., and Blackheath Proprietary Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 1st Nov., 1871, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and asst. commr.; dep. commr., Feb., 1890; mag. and collr., July, 1890; author of 'The District Officer in India.'

WHITE, EDMUND, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 4th Dec., 1867, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; dep. supt. of provl. census operations, 1880; also under sec. to govt. in the census dept.; dir. of public instrn., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, June, 1885; member of licut.-govr.'s legisl. council, Feb., 1886; retd., Aug., 1892; author of 'Report on the Census, N.W. Prov. and Oudh,' 1881.

WHITE, GEORGE GILBERT, A.M.I.C.E., Indian Public Works Dept.—Apptd. from Cooper's Hill Coll.; arrived, 29th Oct., 1878; served in Central Prov. as asst. engr.; exec. engr., Nov., 1886.

WHITE, SIR GEORGE STEWART, G.C.B., G.C.I.E., V.C., Gen., Commander-in-Chief of the Forces in the East Indies.—First commn., 4th Nov., 1853; served in the Indian Mutiny, 1857-59 (medal), and Afghan war, 1879-80 (medal and star, V.C., and C.B.); mil. sec. to the viceroy, 1880-81; took part in the Soudan expdn., 1884-85 (medal and star), and was asst. adjutant and quartermaster-gen. in Egypt, 1885; brigadier-gen., Madras, Sept., 1885, and commanded the brigade detailed for service in Burma; from 1886 to 1889, commanded the Upper Burma field force (K.C.B.); commanded Zhob field force, 1890; commander-in-chief in India, 8th April, 1893; extraordinary member of viceroy's council, 12th April, 1893; G.C.B., June, 1897.

WHITE, HENRY FREDERICK, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; joined the service, 19th Dec. 1859; 1st civil divl. engr., April, 1865; exec. engr., Oct., 1866; in charge of Mhow mill works divn., 1872, 1878, and 1880; offg. chief engr. and sec. to chief commr., Burma, July, 1885; offg. suptg. engr. and sec. to rest., Haidarabad, Sept., 1887; suptg. engr., May, 1888; suptg. engr. and sec. to agents for Rajputana and Central India, public works dept., June, 1892; retd., June, 1895.

WHITE, HENRY RICHARD, B.A., Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 4th Dec., 1872; B.A., London univ., 1882.

WHITE, HERBERT THERKELL, C.I.E., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 2nd Jan., 1878, and served in Burma as asst. commr., and personal asst. to the chief commr.; cantonmt. mag. and small cause court judge, Thayetmyo, April-Sept., 1882, and again in 1883; sec. to the chief commr. for Upper Burma, March, 1886; sec. to the chief commr., April, 1887; chief sec., July, 1890; commr., Dec., 1890; C.I.E., Jan., 1892; offg. jud. commr., Upper Burma, May, 1894; offg. chief sec. to chief commr., July, 1894.

WHITE, JOHN CLAUDE, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; joined the service, 17th Nov., 1876, as asst. engr., and was posted to Bengal; temporarily employed on Behar-Assam railway, 1884; exec. engr., Aug., 1887; pol. officer, Sikkim, June, 1889; exec. engr., Sikkim, in addn. to other duties, April, 1890.

WHITE, JOHN HUBBARD, Major-Gen., R.E., late Mint-Master, Bombay.—Second lieut., Bombay engrs., Dec., 1853; arrived, Nov., 1855; from June, 1856, served in the Bombay public works dept. as asst. engr. and exec. engr. (for irrign.); from May, 1865, served as dep. consulting engr. for railways, Bombay; acting chief engr., and under sec. to govt. of Bombay, railway branch, June-Dec., 1874; acting mint-master, Bombay, June, 1876; rejoined the railway dept., Feb., 1878; from March, 1879, served as mint-master and mint-engr., Bombay; senr. mint-master from Jan., 1884; retd., March, 1890.

WHITE, PHILIP JAMES, Oudh Commn.—Signaller in telegraph dept., July, 1854; served in the Mutiny (medal); dep. collr. and dep. mag., Gorakhpur, Sept., 1858; ass't settlt. officer, Nov., 1859; from March, 1863, served in the Jhansi commn. as asst. commr.; dep. commr., Dec., 1879; settlt. officer, 1885-88; author of a report on the assessment revision of 1861-69, and of three settlt. reports.

WHITE, WALTER HANBURY, Lt.-Col., R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., Jan., 1874, and posted to state railways; asst. dir., north-eastern system, and asst. sec. to govt. of Bengal, Oct., 1878; served in Afghan war, 1878-80 (medal); exec. engr., Jan., 1880; services lent to S. Indian railway co., Jan., 1891; employed on E. Coast line, 1891; offg. consulting engr. to govt. of India for railways, central divn., April, 1893; and at Calcutta, April, 1894; suptg. engr., March, 1895.

WHITE, WILLIAM HENRY, Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 23rd June, 1873, as local fund engr., Surat; asst. engr., April, 1875; exec. engr., March, 1882.

WHITEHEAD, JOHN EDWARDS, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Apptd. supplemental clerk, 1st Jan., 1893.

WHITESIDE, WILLIAM SOUTHHEY, late Madras C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1855; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., acting dep. sec. to govt., sub-collr. and joint mag., and small cause court judge; collr. and mag., Feb., 1873; served on the board of rev. from Aug., 1882, in charge of the imam dept.; acting prest. of the board of examrs., Nov., 1882; acted as dir. of rev. settlt. and agric., and imam commr., 1884; member of the govr.-gen.'s legisl. council, Nov., 1886; member, board of rev., Jan., 1889; retd., Dec., 1890.

WHITEWAY, RICHARD STEPHEN, late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Univ. of London and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 10th Dec., 1868, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and
collr., asst. settlt. officer, and joint mag.; settlt. officer, Aligarh, Nov., 1881; settlt. officer, Ajmir and Merwara, Jan., 1883; dep. commr., March, 1888; mag. and collr., April, 1888; retd., Aug., 1893.

WHITLOCK, CHARLES JAMES TOLLER, Col., I.S.C., late Madras Police Dept.—First commn., 20th Feb., 1858; served in the suppression of the Mutiny (medal); joined the dept., April, 1867, as proby. asst. supt.; confd., Nov., 1868; resumed mil. duty, Aug., 1871; rejoined the dept., April, 1874; supt., Nov., 1881; reverted to mil. duty, April, 1895.

WHITMORE, JOHN, B.L., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch., and Merton Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 31st Dec., 1868; served in rev. and jud. depts., Bengal, and was apptd. joint mag. and dep. collr., Dec., 1878; offig. jud. commr., Chota Nagpur, Dec., 1881; district and sessions judge, Sept., 1885; retd., March, 1895.

WHITTEN, RICHARD JOHN, N. India Salt Rev. Dept.—Joined the service in Feb., 1862, as asst. patrol; dep. inspr., internal branch, Jan., 1867; personal asst. to commr. of inland customs, Oct., 1869; collr. of customs, Sept., 1871; employed temporarily under govt. of Bombay in salt inquiries in Cutch and Kathiawar; dep. commr. of inland customs, Dec., 1879; at various eriods hasofsd. as commr. of N. India salt rev.

WHITTLE, GEORGE, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 28th Nov., 1890, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as ast. mag. and collr. and asst. commr.; joint mag., Dec., 1895.

WHITWORTH, GEORGE CLIFFORD, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Sandicroft Sch., Northwich, and Queen's Coll., Liverpool; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 5th Dec., 1869, and served in Bombay as ast. collr. and mag.; acting under sec. to govt. of Bombay in the pol., &c., depts., Jan., 1876; under sec. to govt. in the public works dept., for relief purposes, 1877-78; second ast. collr., Feb., 1881; jud. ast. to the pol. agent, Kathiawar, Nov., 1886; judge and sessions judge, Nov., 1887; acting sec., pol., &c., depts., 1893-94; acting jud. commr., Sind; author of 'The Theory of Relevancy for the purpose of Judicial Evidence,' an 'Anglo-Indian Dictionary,' 1885, and the 'Rajkumar Law Lectures,' 1888.

WICKES, THOMAS HAINES, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., April, 1861; engr. to the suburban municipality, Calcutta, Jan., 1865; re-apptd. as exec. engr., public works dept., Bengal, Nov., 1865; on special duty in the famine districts, 1874; ast. sec. to the govt. of Bengal, April, 1880; suptg. engr., March, 1886; chief engr. and joint sec. to govt. of N.W. Prov. and Oudh, July, 1891; sec. to govt., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, buildings and roads branch, Dec., 1892; retd., Feb., 1895.

WICKHAM, WILLIAM ALLEN, Store Dept., India Office.—Apptd. 2nd grade supervisor, India store depot, 23rd Sept., 1889.

WIGHT, JOHN KNOX, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Queen's Coll. Sch., Trinidad, and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 4th Dec., 1872, and served in Bengal as ast. mag. and collr.; on famine duty, 1874; transfed. to Assam, Dec., 1874, and served as ast. commr. and ast. inspr. of immigrants; dep. commr., March, 1884; returned to duty in Bengal, May, 1890; district and sessions judge, June, 1890.

WIGNER, JOHN MURCH, B.A., B.Sc., Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at King's Lynn Gr. Sch., and London Univ.; temporary clerk, 17th July, 1862; junr. clerk, Jan., 1867; senr. clerk, July, 1885.

WILBERFORCE, SAMUEL, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Malvern Coll., and Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1805; arrived 17th Dec., 1866, and served in the Punjab as ast. commr.

WILCOX, FREDERICK, late Bengal Police Dept.—Joined the service, 25th May, 1862, as ast. supt. of police; district supt., June, 1873; retd., March, 1895.

WILD, ALBERT EDWARD, India Forest Dept.—Joined the service, 11th Dec., 1869, as ast. conservator, and served in Burma and the Punjab; dep. conservator, Oct., 1876; conservator, Jan., 1892; in charge, central circle, N.W. Prov., April, 1892; dir. of forest sch., Nov., 1893; conservator of forests, Bengal, April, 1894.

WILD, CHARLES EDMUND, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at City of London Sch. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 17th Dec., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as ast. mag. and collr., and ast. commr.

WILKIE, DAVID, M.B., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col.—Joined the service, 1st April, 1873, and was employed as civil surgn. and jail supt. at various stations in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; statistical officer to govt. of India in sanitary and med. depts., Nov., 1886.

WILKINS, CECIL ANSDELL, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 26th Nov., 1868; served in rev. and jud. depts., Bengal; joint mag. and dep. collr., March, 1884; registrar, high court, March, 1885; district and sessions judge, April, 1886; member of Bengal legisl. council, March, 1894; supt. and remembrancer of legal affairs, Dec., 1894; compiled revised edns. of the high court's rules and orders, in 1881 and 1883.

WILKINS, THOMAS JAMES HACKETT, Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 30th Sept., 1873; arrived, 29th April, 1874, and was employed in Madras under the mil. dept. (including service in the Burma campaign) and as acting civil surgn.; district surgn., Anantapur, Sept., 1887; Ganjam, Nov., 1894; Malabar, May, 1895.

WILKINS, WILLIAM HENRY, Col., I.S.C., late Survey of India.—Joined the Bengal artillery, Dec., 1857; arrived, Jan., 1858, and served with the Cawnpore field force; studied at Thomason Coll., 1861-62; served in the rev. survey from April, 1863, as ast. surveyor; dep. supt., Oct., 1878; supt. (new scale), Aug., 1892; ast. surveyor-gen., Sept., 1892; offig. dep. surveyor-gen. and offig. dir. of Bengal surveys, April, 1895; retd., Dec., 1895.

WILKINSON, CHARLES ROBERT, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Christ's Hosp., and Hertford Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 30th Nov., 1896, and served in Burma as ast. commr.

WILKINSON, FRANCIS HENRY, late Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Milton Abbas Sch., Blackheath Proprietary Sch., and Pembroke
Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 10th Nov., 1863; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and acting under sec. to govt.; on special duty as arbitrator of boundary disputes, 1870; sub-collr. and joint mag., Salem, April, 1878; district and sessions judge, S Malabar, June, 1882; judge of the high court, Madras, Nov., 1887; retd., Feb., 1893.

WILKINSON, THOMAS ORMEROD, late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Chudleigh Gr. Sch., and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1865, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and offg. registrar of the chief court; jud. asst., Dec., 1883; district judge, 1st grade, Nov., 1884; divl. judge, Jan., 1887; retd., Sept., 1890.

WILCOCKS, ALEXANDER JOHN, M.D., Surgn.-Lient.-Col., Med. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service as asst. surgn., 30th Sept., 1873; served on mil., civil, and jail duty, and was apptd. civil surgn., April, 1877; offg. profr., Calcutta med. coll., 1892; hon. surgn. to viceroy, Jan., 1894; depd. to Dholpur state in 1894; civil surgeon, Agra, Nov., 1894; Naini Tal, March, 1897.

WILLIAMS, ALBERT, LL.M., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Uppingham, Clifton, and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 8th Jan., 1886, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and under sec. to govt.; under sec. to govt. of India, foreign dept., May, 1894; pol. agent, Haidarabad, Nov., 1895; pol. agent, Quetta, May, 1897.

WILLIAMS, SIR EDWARD CHARLES SPARSHOTT, K.C.I.E., Gen., R.E.—Educ. at the Royal Naval Sch., New Cross, and Addiscombe; first commn., 1848; adjutant of engrs., Fort William, and studying machinery in Calcutta mint, 1850; extra asst. sec., mil. board, 1851; supt., iron bridge yard, Calcutta, 1851-52; served with the Pegu expdn., 1852-53 (medal and clasp); supt., Pegu topogrl. survey, 1854-56; principal, civil engrg. coll., Calcutta, 1856-60; member of senate, Calcutta univ.; acted as under sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., during the Mutiny; principal, Thomason Coll., 1861-62; under sec., govt. of India, public works dept., 1863-69; member of Bengal sanitary comm.; in charge of office of inspr.-gen. of forests for one year; acting mint-master and commr. of paper currency, Bombay, 1867; dep. sec., govt. of India, public works dept. (railway branch), 1869-74, and 1877-78; dir. of state railways, 1874-77; C.I.E., Jan., 1878; dep. govt. dir. of Indian railway companies, India office, March, 1880; govt. dir., March, 1892 to Aug., 1897; K.C.I.E., June, 1893.

WILLIAMS, GEORGE ROBERT CARLISLE, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 21st Nov., 1865, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr. and joint mag. and dep. collr.; dep. commr., Jhansi, March, 1883; mag. and collr., Dec., 1886; commr., Feb., 1894; author of 'An Historical and Statistical Memoir of Dehra Dun,' and 'Gazetteer of Dehra Dun' (part).

WILLIAMS, HENRY CLISSOLD, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Haileybury; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 25th Oct., 1871, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; on famine duty in Bengal, 1874; from Nov., 1878, served in Assam as asst. commr.; inspr.-gen. of police and jails, &c., Assam, Sept., 1885; returned to Bengal as mag. and collr., Nov., 1891; acting commr., April, 1894; prest. cf mining commn., May, 1895; prest. of labour enquiry commn., Dec., 1895; chairman of Calcutta Corporation, April, 1896.

WILLIAMS, RALPH KING, India Public Works Dept.—From Nov., 1869, served in the office of the consulting engr. for railways, Bombay, and was apptd. asst. examr. of guaranteed railway accts. in 1872; served in Madras from Feb., 1873, and was apptd. dep. examr., May, 1876; examr., Indus valley state railway accts., Aug., 1880; transf. to Nagpur, March, 1885; examr. guaranteed railway accts., Lahore, April, 1885; examr., N.W. railway accts., Jan., 1886.

WILLIAMS, WILLIAM, M.I.E.E., late India Telegraph Dept.—Joined the dept. as asst. supt., 16th Jan., 1868; arrived, 29th Feb., 1868; supt., April, 1880; held charge of various divns., including Indore, Bombay, and Nagpur; retd., 1890; author of 'Manual of Telegraphy.'

WILLIAMS-WYNN, ARTHUR W., B.A., B.L.—Educ. at Westminster Sch. and Christ Church, Oxford; called to the bar (Inner Temple), 1882; apptd. asst. private sec. (unpaid) to the sec. of state (Viscount Cross), Aug., 1886; asst. private sec., Dec., 1889; private sec., June to Aug., 1892.

WILLIAMSON, FREDERICK LENNOX JERVIS, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., Clifton Coll., and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 5th Jan., 1895, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; J.P., Sept., 1896.

WILLIS, JOHN, Funds Dept., India Office.—Writer, 3rd Nov., 1862; junr. book-keeper, Nov., 1866; asst. book-keeper, Dec., 1881; clerk, Oct., 1892.

WILLOCK, WILLIAM ALEXANDER, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin, and Sidney Sussex Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 12th March, 1870, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; sec. to the salt commn., Jan., 1876; from March, 1879, served in the salt dept. as dep. commr., and was also employed in suppressing the disturbances in the Gudum Hills, 1879; collr. and mag., Dec., 1888; collr. and agent, Vizagapatam, July, 1890; acting member of rev. board, July, 1895.

WILLOUGHBY, MICHAEL WEEKES, C.S.I., Lieut.-Gen., I.S.C., late Bombay Secretariat.—First commn., Bombay army, June, 1849; acted as sec. to govt. of Bombay in the mil., marine, and eccles. depts., from May, 1880, and was confd., Feb., 1881; returned to Europe, 1888.

WILLSON, JAMES, M.A., Bengal Educat. Service (Assam).—Educ. at Ballinasloe Coll., Ranelagh Inst., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; profr., cathedral mission coll., Calcutta, Jan., 1870; asst., geological survey of India, Sept., 1871; profr., Hughli coll., March, 1873; Dacea coll., Jan., 1874; Patna coll., May, 1875; from Jan., 1879, served in Assam as inspr. of schools, and was apptd. dir. of public instrn., Assam, Jan., 1883; has edited Wilson's 'Dynamics.'

WILMER, JOHN RANDAL, Col., I.S.C., late Survey of India.—Joined the service as lieut., royal artillery 2nd June, 1859; arrived, 27th Oct., 1860; served in the mil. dept., and in Aug., 1869, was apptd. asst. supt.; topogrl.
survey; dep. supt., July, 1882; in charge of Baluchistan survey party, Oct., 1885, to Oct., 1886; supt. (new scale), Aug., 1892; reverted to mil. dept., Jan., 1896.

WILSON, Sir Arthur, K.C.I.E., Legal Adviser, India Office.—Called to the bar (Inner Temple), 11th June, 1862; puisne judge, high court, Calcutta, 1878; vice-chancellor, Calcutta univ., 1880-3; pres. of the Crawford enquiry commn., at Poona, 1888-89; legal adviser and solicitor, India office, 27th April, 1892; K.C.I.E., Jan., 1898.

WILSON, David, M.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Hutcheson's Gr. Sch., Glasgow, Univ. of Glasgow, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 4th Feb., 1886, and served in Burma as asst. commr.; dep. commr., Oct., 1894.

WILSON, Frederick Alexander, Col., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt.of India.—First commn., as lieut., Bengal artillery, 8th June, 1860; extra A.D.C. to viceroy, Dec., 1860; from Nov., 1870, served under the foreign dept. as guardian and tutor to the Nawab of Jaora, and as pol. asst. in Jaora, in Central India, and at Tehri; tutor to the Maharaja of Mysore, June, 1876; 1st asst. rest., Haidarabad, Oct., 1879; pol. agent, Oct., 1881; agent with the king of Oudh, and supt. of pol. pensions, March, 1882; boundary settlt. officer and asst. to pol. agent, Bundelkhand, Jan., 1883; offd. as rest., Nepal, and pol. agent, Bhartpur and Karauli; pol. agent, Bundelkhand, Oct., 1886; commr., Ajmir, Feb., 1894; rest., Persian Gulf, May, 1894; served in the Bhutan campaign of 1864-65 (medal and clasp), the Hazara campaign of 1863, and the Black Mountain expdn. (clasp); returned to Europe, 1897.

WILSON, George, Commander, R.I.M., Marine Dept.—Commander, Indian marine, Aug., 1878; port officer, Bassein, April, 1882; acting asst. dir. of Royal Indian marine, May, 1889; port officer, Rangoon, Sept., 1890; port officer, Bombay and offg. dep. dir. of Royal Indian marine, Aug., 1896.

WILSON, George Frederick, Major, R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., May, 1875, and posted to state railways; asst. dir., N.E. system, 1877 and 1879; asst. sec., railway branch of public works dept., Bengal, 1878; exec. engr., May, 1883; served in Soudan expdn. (medal), and was employed on Soudan railway, 1884-85; asst. sec. to gov't. of India, public works dept., April, 1888; dep. manager, N.W. railway, April, 1891; on special duty in Ceylon, Oct.-Dec., 1895.

WILSON, James, M.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Perth Acad., and Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 14th Nov., 1875, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and settlt. officer; offg. under sec. to gov't., 1881 and 1884; offg. senr. sec. to finl. commr. in 1885 and 1886; dep. commr., Sept., 1890; author of works on tribal customs in the Gurgaon and Sirsa districts, and of the Sirsa settlt. report.

WILSON, John Hatton, M.I.C.E., late Public Works Dept., Bengal.—Proby. asst. engr., 5th March, 1856; served in the public works dept. in the Central Prov., and temporarily in Oudh (1865-67), as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; also in mil. works branch, 1879; suptg. engr., and transfd. to Bengal; Dec., 1881; retd., 1890.

WILSON, Robert Henry, B.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 2nd Feb., 1862; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., and mag. and collr.; offg. under sec. to the gov't. of Bengal, Dec., 1870; inspr. of registrn. offices, July, 1872; offg. sec., board of rev., 1877 and 1879; offg. commr., Bardwan divn., Aug., 1884; employed under the public works dept. on the commn. in connection with the Orissa canals, 1884; offg. sec., gov't. of Bengal, finl. dept., Feb., 1886; retd., Sept., 1887.

WILSON, Thomas Corby, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 26th Nov., 1883, and served as asst. commr., Central Prov.; asst. settlt. officer, June, 1886; settlt. officer, May, 1888; transfd. to Burma as dep. commr., Feb., 1891; dir. of land records and agric., Aug., 1892.

WILSON, William, M.A., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Marischal College, Aberdeen; apptd. after exam. of 1859; served in the Madras rev. and jud. dept., and was apptd. district and sessions judge, Kistna, Feb., 1874, and collr. and mag., June, 1877; dir. of rev. settlt. and agric., Nov., 1882; addl. member, board of rev., April, 1883; fellow of Madras univ., 1885; acting sec. to gov't. of Madras in the rev. dept., April, 1885; member of legisl. council, Sept., 1885; acting chief sec. to gov't. of Madras, Oct., 1885; member of board of rev., April, 1887; 1st member and commr. of land rev. settlt., &c., Jan., 1889; retd., Oct., 1889.

WILSON, William Henry, Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 22nd Jan., 1857, and was employed on mil. duties till April, 1864, when he was apptd. acting asst. pol. agent, Sadra; from Nov., 1864, served as asst. supt. of police, subord. mag., supt. of railway police, and district supt.; commr. of police, Bombay, July, 1888; reverted to mil. duty, Sept., 1894.

WILSON, William Herbert, Ph.D. (Heidelberg), Educn. Dept., Madras.—Served from 4th Feb., 1875, as prof. of physical science, presidency coll.; fellow of Madras univ., 1880; in admn., registrar of Madras univ., March, 1886; prof. of chemistry, presidency coll., Nov., 1892.

WILSON, William John, M.I.C.E., F.C.H., late India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and employed on irrign. works in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., May, 1883; personal asst. to chief engr., and under sec. to gov't., July, 1888, and again, Sept., 1891; services lent to Egyptian gov't. from Feb., 1892; retd., Feb., 1897.

WILTSHIRE, Charles Palmer Bluett, late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the Proprietary Sch., Islington, City of London Sch., King's Coll., London Univ., and Middle Temple; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 8th Nov., 1869, and served as asst. collr. and mag., acting port officer at Karwar, and supt., timber depot, Kanara; boundary commr. between Kanara and Mysore, May, 1873; on famine duty, Dharwar, in 1876, 1877, and 1878; in charge of Huzur treasury in 1880 and 1881; 1st asst. collr., Sept., 1886; also forest settlt. officer, Poona, June, 1891; retd., Aug., 1894;
transld. the preliminary chapter of Mills' 'Political Economy' into Marathi.

WIMBERLEY, REGINALD JUSTUS, B.L., Col., late I.S.C.—Ensign, 3rd Bengal European regt., 1859; served in the Punjab police force, 1861-67; commissariat dept., March-Aug., 1867; from Aug., 1867, served in Bengal as district supt. of police; in command of police force to quell insurrection in the tributary mehals, May, 1868; 1st asst. supt., Port Blair and Nicobars, April, 1872; dep. supt., Dec., 1884; retd., Dec., 1887.

WINCHESTER, CHARLES BLAKE, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Blundell's Sch., Tiverton; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 23rd Oct., 1873, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; on famine duty, 1877; and asst. collr., Nov., 1886; 1st asst., March, 1890; junr. collr. and mag., May, 1893; senr. collr., Oct., 1896.

WINCHESTER, ERNEST CHARLES, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Writer, India office, 16th Dec., 1872; clerk, 2nd class, Nov., 1878.

WINDSOR, JOHN, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Old Trafford Sch., Manchester, and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 23th Nov., 1887, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and acting under sec.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Aug., 1894; mag. and collr. June, 1897.

WINGATE, ANDREW, C.I.E., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Elizabeth Coll., Guernsey, Kensington Gr. Sch., Univ. of London, and Univ. of Heidelberg; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 8th Nov., 1869, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; in pol. charge of the Jath state, 1876; addl. sec. in the famine dept., Mysore, Aug., 1877; asst. sec. to famine commn., Aug., 1878; C.I.E., June, 1879; settlt. officer in Udaipur state, Aug., 1879; offg. rest., Mewar, and settlt. officer, Kashmir state, Feb., 1887; junr. collr. and mag., Kanara, July, 1890; acting collr. of salt rev., Bombay, Oct., 1890; also acting commr. of customs, &c., April, 1891; settlt. officer, Udaipur state, 1891-93; senr. collr., Sept., 1893; addl. mem. of legisl. council, July, 1896; offd. as commr. in Sind, Dec., 1896-June, 1897.

WINGATE, JOHN BRUCE, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Old Aberdeen Gymnasium, Aberdeen Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 28th Nov., 1890, and served in Burma as asst. commr.; under sec. to chief commr., Sept., 1895; under sec. to govt. of Burma, May, 1897.

WINMILL, GEORGE, India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service as second sub-engr., Indus valley railway, 17th Nov., 1875; transf. to N.W. railway, May, 1888; and to Oudh and Rohilkhand line, Oct., 1888; locomotive supt., Oudh and Rohilkhand railway, Jan., 1889.

WINNY, THOMAS HERBERT, A.R.I.B.A., India Office.—Apptd. asst. to the surveyor and clerk of the works, India office, 17th Aug., 1885; surveyor, 26 April, 1897.

WINTER, EDGAR FRANCIS LATIMER, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Harrow, Trinity Hall, Cambridge, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 20th Nov., 1884, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; under sec. to govt., Nov., 1889; dep. supt., family domains of Maharaja of Benares, April, 1893; supt., April, 1894; dep. commr., April, 1896; mag. and collr., Dec., 1896.

WINTER, HENRY EDWARD, late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Marlborough Coll., and King's Sch., Canterbury; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 21st Nov., 1868, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and acting asst. pol. agent; first asst. collr. and mag., and forest settlt. and demarcation officer, Poona districts, Jan., 1883; 2nd grade judge, Jan., 1885; junr. collr. and mag., Nov., 1888; senr. collr., Dec., 1890; retd., May, 1894.

WINTERBOOTHAM, HENRY MARTIN, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Portland Gr. Sch., and London Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived 19th Nov., 1869, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., principal asst., and sub-collr. and jcint mag.; collr. and mag., Malabar, Aug., 1888; Tanjore, Nov., 1893; member of rev. board, Sept., 1895.

WOODEHOUSE, THE HON. ARMIN, C.B.—Asst. private sec. (unpaid) to sec. of state for colonies (Earl of Kimberley), 1880; private sec. (unpaid) to sec. of state for India (Earl of Kimberley), Dec., 1882, to 1885; private sec., Feb. to Aug., 1886; and again, from Aug., 1892; private sec. to sec. of state for foreign affairs (Earl of Kimberley), March, 1894, to July, 1895; C.B., July, 1895.

WOLFE-MURRAY, FRANCIS D'ARCY OSBORNE, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Harrow, and St. Andrew's Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 19th Dec., 1877, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., ass't. sessions judge, forest settlt. officer, and district and sessions judge; sub-collr. and joint mag., March, 1890; collr. and mag., March, 1893.

WOLLASTON, ARTHUR NAYLOR, C.I.E., Rev. and Statistics Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Stockwell Gr. Sch.; entered the India office by open competition as writer, old establ., 3rd March, 1859; junr. clerk, pol. and secret dept., 1880; senr. clerk, Jan., 1873; asst. sec., rev., statistics, and commerce dept., Jan., 1884; in charge of the dept., May to Oct., 1886, and April, 1887, to March, 1888; in 1877 publ. a transl. of the 'Anvar-i-Suhaili, or Fables of Bidpai'; in 1879 edited Sir Lewis Pelly's miracle play of 'Hasan and Husain'; succeeded Sir F. J. Goldsmid as examr. in Persian at the royal staff coll., Sandhurst, 1880; selected in 1881 by the science and art dept. to superintend the transl. of the oriental inscriptions in the S. Kensington Museum; in 1882 publ. an English-Persian dictionary, and in 1889 a larger work of the same kind; C.I.E., Jan., 1886.

WOLLEY-DOD, F., A.M.I.C.E., F.C.H., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1876, and posted to state railways; services lent to Kashmir state, 1888-89; exec. engr., Oct., 1889; dep. consulting engr. to govt. of India for state railways, Nov., 1892; on special duty with govt. of India, May, 1897.

WOMACK, ARTHUR SHAW, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1850; arrived, 5th Dec., 1882, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transf. to Central Prov., July, 1885,
WOOD, ARTHUR LIDBETTER MARTIN, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch., and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 13th Nov., 1892, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; chief inspr. of factories, May, 1897.

WOOD, EDWARD SEPTIMUS, Capt., late Forest Dept., Oudh.—Arrived as lieut., 93rd Sutherland highlanders, 20th Sept., 1857; from Dec., 1859, served in the public works dept. on irrig. works, N.W. Prov.; offd. as conservator of forests, 1864-66; reverted to his regt., Feb., 1866; apptd. exec. engr., March, 1867; from April, 1867, served in the forest dept., Oudh and was apptd. conservator, Oct., 1868; retd., May, 1891.

WOOD, GEORGE PINCKNEY, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Marlborough Coll., and Addiscombe; writer, India office, 25th Jan., 1869; clerk, 2nd class, Aug., 1878.

WOOD, JOHN BARRY, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Marlborough Coll. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 11th Dec., 1894, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

WOOD, JULIUS JOHN, M.B., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Bengal Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 1st May, 1868, and served on gen. and jail duty, and as supt. of vaccn.; on famine relief duty in 1874; dep. sanitary commr., Ranchi circle, Sept., 1888; retd., Feb., 1892.

WOOD, RICHARD BOARDMAN, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Bromsgrove Sch., and Hertford Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 6th Dec., 1865, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

WOODBURN, ARCHIBALD FRANCIS, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Ayr Acad., and Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 11th Nov., 1872, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; second asst. collr., June, 1885; 1st asst., Sept., 1888; junr. collr. and mag., Hyderabad (Sind), Feb., 1893; collr. and mag. and dist. registrar, March, 1897.

WOODBURN, Sir JOHN, K.C.S.I., M.A., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Ayr Acad., Glasgow Univ., and Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 12th Dec., 1863, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; transfd. to Oudh, Feb., 1865, and served as asst. commr., asst. settl. officer, and offg. sec. to chief commr.; dep. commr., Faizabad, Aug., 1879; sec. to gov't. of the N.W. Prov. and Oudh, in the Oudh rev. dept. and forest branch, Jan., 1882; also in the Oudh pol. dept., March, 1882; sec. to gov't. of the N.W. Prov. and Oudh, jud. dept., May, 1884; chief sec., Nov., 1888; member of prov'l. legisl. council, Dec., 1886; member of viceroy's legisl. council, Feb., 1891; resumed his post as chief sec., April, 1891; again member of viceroy's legisl. council, 1891-92, and 1893; C.S.I., Jan., 1892; chief commr. of the Central Prov., Dec., 1893; member of govr.-gen.'s exec. council, Dec., 1895; K.C.S.I., Jan., 1897.

WOODCOCK, ELBOROUGH MARTIN, Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., N.W. Prov.—Arrived as ensign, 9th March, 1856; served with the Persian expdy. force, 1856-57 (medal and clasp); apptd. to Oudh mil. police, 27th Nov., 1858; from March, 1860, served in the dept. as district supt.; reverted to mil. dept., Jan., 1892.

WOODS, ALBERT EDWARD, Capt., I.S.C., Assam Commn.—Educ. at the Royal Naval Sch., New Cross, and Sandhurst; entered the army, 22nd Oct., 1881; joined the Assam commn., 12th Aug., 1889, as asst. commr.; dep. commr., Nov., 1893.

WOODTHORPE, ROBERT GOSSETT, C.B., Col., R.E., Survey of India Dept.—Joined the service, 25th June, 1865; entered the dept. as asst. supt., July, 1871; dep. supt., Nov., 1884; on special duty with Gilgit mission, May, 1885; on special duty in Europe, Feb., 1888; dep. quartermaster-gen. for intelligence, Simla, Feb., 1889; supt., April, 1894; attached to the Mekong commn., Oct., 1894; served in the Lushai expdn., the Afghan war, the Burma expdn., &c.; has written various papers on mil. and geographical subjects, and an acct. of the Lushai expdn.

WOODWARD, HILLERSDEN, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Oakham Gr. Sch., and Birmingham Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 28th Oct., 1871, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; forest settl. officer, Sholapur, Nov., 1883; 2nd asst. collr., May, 1885; 1st asst., July, 1888; junr. collr. and mag., Nov., 1892; senr. collr., July, 1896.

WOODWARD, WILLOUGHBY, M.A., late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Oakham Gr. Sch., and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 25th Nov., 1863, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; junr. collr. and mag. and district registrar, Panch Mahals, and pol. agent, Rewa Kantha, Aug., 1881; senr. collr. and mag. and pol. agent, Satara, March, 1886; retd., March, 1890.

WOOTTON, JOHN JOSEPH, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 20th Feb., 1872.

WORDSWORTH, WILLIAM, C.I.E., M.A. (Oxon.), late Educl. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the educ'l. service, May, 1861; arrived, 10th July, 1861, and served as head-master of the Elphinstone instrn., Bombay, acting prof'r. in the Elphinstone coll., and asst. inspr. of schs.; from May, 1862, served as principal of the Deccan coll., Poona; principal and prof'r., Elphinstone coll., Nov., 1874; also sheriff of Bombay, Dec., 1885; C.I.E., Feb., 1887; retd., 1890.

WORGAN, JOHN BERNEY, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1856; arrived, 16th Dec., 1856; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and mag. and collr.; from May, 1876, served in the jud. dept., and was apptd. district and sessions judge, 1st grade, July, 1879; retd., Dec., 1891.

WRAY, JOHN WILLOUGHBY, Lieut.-Colonel, Indian Staff Corps, Pol. Dept., Bombay.—First commn., 12th Nov., 1870; entered pol. employ as asst. pol. agent, Cutch, May 1877; acting asst. pol. agent, Kolhapur, Jan., 1885; pol. agent, Kolhapur, and southern Mahrratta country, April, 1897.

WRIGHT, FRANCIS NELSON, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Eton, and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 15th Jan., 1864; from Dec., 1864, served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag.
and collr., and from May, 1870, in the settlt. dept.; settlt. officer, Cawnpore, April, 1876; offg. dir. of agric. and commerce, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, 1878 and 1880-81; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1878; dep. commr., March, 1885; mag. and collr., April, 1885; commr., Allahabad, Nov., 1891; opium agent, Benares, Feb., 1894; author of a memo. on the 'Agriculture of Cawnpore,' 'Cawnpore Gazetteer,' 'Cawnpore Settlement Report,' and 'Report on Wheat.'

WRIGHT, FREDERICK, Police Dept., Haidarabad Administration.—Arrived, 20th Aug., 1859; served as inspr. in the Madras police from Jan., 1860; transfd. to Haidarabad assigned districts, Aug., 1862, and served as asst. supt. and district supt. of police; author of 'Margpradurshuk' (a treatise on the Indian Penal Code), 1878; a police manual of laws in 1883; and a schedule of all the penal acts of the govt. of India, 1881-83.

WRIGHT, FREDERICK CHARLES BUCKLEY, Store Dept., India Office.—Jntr. clerk, 4th July, 1867; senr. clerk, June, 1891.

WRIGHT, HENRY NELSON, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Eton and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 29th Oct., 1890, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Nov., 1895; under sec. to govt., April, 1897.

WRIGHT, JAMES McCALLUM, M.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Fordyce Sch., Univ. of Aberdeen, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1885, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Nov., 1890; asst. commr., April-Oct., 1894; dep. commr., Sept., 1896.

WRIGHT, JAMES WALKER, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to the dept in July, 1859; served in the Punjab as asst. and exec. engr.; transfd. to the Punjab provl. list, Nov., 1879; suptg. engr., July, 1886; offg. chief engr., and sec. to chief commr. of Burma, April, 1890; offg. chief engr., buildings and roads branch, and joint sec. to govt. of Punjab, Sept., 1890; sec. to chief commr. of Assam, June, 1891; retd., Jan., 1892.

WRIGHT, WILLIAM CHARLES, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd. proby. asst. engr., Oudh, 23rd Sept., 1864; confd. 1st April, 1865; exec. engr., March, 1871; leni to Cawnpore municipality, Sept., 1884; services lent to Rampur state, Jan., 1890; suptg. engr., May, 1891.

WRIGHT, WILLIAM HENRY, B.A., late Educl. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Educ. at Corpus Christi Coll., Cambridge; apptd., 7th Aug., 1867, and served as profir. Benares and Muir colls.; principal, Bareilly coll., Dec., 1873; profir., Muir coll., Jan., 1877; principal, Benares coll., Oct., 1888; retd. July, 1897; has publd. a handbook of the educn. dept., an account of the Muir coll., and various educn. works.

WROUGHTON, ROBERT CHARLES, Bombay Forest Dept.—Joined the service, 18th Oct., 1871; served as asst. and dep. conservator o forests; conservator, Dec., 1895.

WYBROW, GEORGE DIGBY, A.M.I.C.E., Public Works Dept., Madras.—Joined the service, 26th July, 1867, and served in Madras as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; suptg. engr., Jan., 1892.

WYER, FREDERICK, B.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Dec., 1861; served in the Bengal rev. and jud. depts., and was apptd. mag. and collr., 1st grade, May, 1884; offd. as commr. in 1883 and 1885; retd., May, 1887.

WYER, THOMAS ROWLAND, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Univ. of Glasgow, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 20th Oct., 1873, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. settlt. officer; asst. commr., Nov., 1884; joint mag., March, 1888; settlt. officer in admn., March, 1890; dep. commr., Nov., 1890; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1891; mag. and collr., May, 1894.

WYIF, HENRY, C.S.I., Col., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Ensign, Oct., 1861; arrived, 15th Nov., 1861; and took part in the N.W. frontier campaign, 1863, the 2nd Yusufzai expdn. (medal and clasp), the Bhutan campaign, 1865 (clasp), the Abyssinian expdn., 1868 (medal), and the Hazara campaign, 1868 (clasp); on special duty in Baluchistan, with Major R. Sandeman, 1875-77; asst. to govrgen.'s agent, Baluchistan, 1877; served in the Afghan campaign, 1878-80 (medal); C.S.I., Feb., 1881; asst. to the rest in Mysore, and sec. to chief commr., Coorg, 1882; pol. agent, Bhopawar, Feb., 1885; Jhalawar, April, 1885; Bhopal, March, 1887; rest., Nepal, Oct., 1893.

WYLLIE, WILLIAM HUTT CURZON, C.I.E., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Ensign, 106th Foot, Oct., 1865; arrived, Feb., 1867; served in Oudh, 1870-75, as asst. commr.; acted as inspr.-gen. of registrin. in 1875, and as junr. sec. to govt., 1876-77; from Jan., 1879, served under the foreign dept., as cantonmt. mag., Nasirabad, asst. commr. in Merwara and Ajmir, and as asst. to govrgen.'s agent, Baluchistan; served in Madras, 1880-81, as mil. sec. to the govr., and acted as private sec.; C.I.E., May, 1881; pol. agent, in charge of ex-Gaekwar of Baroda, Mulhar Rao, 1881; asst. rest., Haidarabad, 1882; asst. commr., Ajmir, Nov., 1883; 1st ass't. agent, Rajputana, 1884; addl. pol. agent, Kotah, April, 1885; boundary settlt. officer, Mewar-Marwar border, Nov., 1886; pol. agent, Kotah, Jan., 1889; offg. commr., Ajmir, July, 1891; offg. pol. agent, Jhalawar, in 1891 and 1892; offg. rest., states of Rajputana, May, 1893; rest., Mewar, March, 1894.

WYNCH, LIONEL MALING, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Bedford Gr. Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 7th Dec., 1885; and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; sec. to land rev. commrs., Feb., 1894; sec. to commrs. of salt, Abkari, and sep. rev., Oct., 1896.

WYNDHAM, PERCY, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Giggleswick Gr. Sch. and Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 13th Dec., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr.; joint mag., Aug., 1893; dep. supt. of family domains of Maharaja of Benares, April, 1894.

WYNNE, SYDENHAM HENRY, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Royal Naval Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 21st Oct., 1873, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst. to the collr. and mag., S. Arcot, Oct., 1882; sub-
YATE, CHARLES EDWARD, C.S.I., C.M.G., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C. Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 9th Nov., 1867; arrived, 27th Feb., 1868; from Aug., 1871, served under the foreign dept.; on special duty, Sind border, 1872 and 1873; boundary settlt. officer, Mewar-Marwar border, Sept., 1874; and Mewar-Tonk border, Dec., 1875; offic. for various periods as pol. asst., asst. to supt. for suppression of thagi and dakitai, &c.; supt. of operations for control of Moghlas, Sept., 1879; served in Afghanistan, 1880-81 (medal and clasp, and bronze star); subsequently served in the pol. dept. in Bhopal, Central India, and Bhopawar; attache with Afghan boundary commn., July, 1884; on duty at Herat in connection with the fortifications, 1885; employed on various special services in connection with the Afghan boundary commn. pol. agent, Thal Chotiali, March, 1890; offic. rev. commr., Baluchistan, Oct., 1892; pol. agent, Zhob, March, 1893; on special duty on Russo-Afghan frontier, April, 1893; acting govrs.-gen.'s agent and consul-gen., Khorassan and Seistan, Sept., 1893; confid. 1897; author of gazetteers of Mewar, Banswara and Partabgarh, 'Northern Afghanistan,' &c.

YIELD, HORACE PARR, Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Bengal Med. Service.—Joined the Indian med. dept., 1874; was employed in the mil. dept. up to Aug., 1884, when he was apptd. probr. in the assay dept., Bombay mint; transf'd. to Calcutta mint, Sept., 1884; dep. assay-master, Bombay mint, May, 1886, and Calcutta mint, Jan., 1888; dep. assay-master, Bombay mint, May, 1892; rettd., Nov., 1894.

YEWDALL, FRANK, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Leys Sch., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1895; arrived 10th Dec., 1896, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

YOUNG, GEORGE EDGAR, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Apptd. 2nd class clerk, 2nd May, 1888.

YOUNG, GEORGE GORDON, Col., I.S.C., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 23rd Oct., 1856; from June, 1858, served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and asst. settlt. officer; dep. commr., Jan., 1873; commr. and supt., Jan., 1881; offic. 2nd finl. commr., 1888 and 1890; reverted to mil. dept., 1892.

YOUNG, HARRY GAVIN, Madras Police Dept.—Entered the service, April, 1874, and served as inspr., asst. supt., and supt. of police; dep. inspr.-gen., Dec., 1895.

YOUNG, JAMES, Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 21st Dec., 1863, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., July, 1879.

YOUNG, MATTHEW, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 25th Nov., 1892, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

YOUNG, WILLIAM, C.S.I., B.A., B.L., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Heidelberg Univ. and Univ. Coll., London; called to the bar at the Middle Temple; apptd. after exam. of 1856; arrived, 16th Dec., 1856, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and mag. and collr.; civil and sessions judge, Oct., 1880; jud. commr., Oudh, Aug., 1886; acting judge of high court, April-Dec., 1890; C.S.I., Jan., 1891; retd., Dec., 1891.

YOUNG, SIR WILLIAM MACKWORTH, K.C.S.I., M.A., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Eton, and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 12th Dec., 1863, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., asst. settlt. officer, and offic. sec. to finl. commr.; offic. under sec. to govt., Oct., 1873; settlt. sec. to finl. commr., March, 1875; dep. commr., Jan., 1878; offic. supt., Kapurthala state, Feb., 1878; sec. to govt., Punjab, Jan., 1880; commr. and supt., May, 1887; offic. sec. to govt. of India, home dept., Jan., 1888; commr., Jalandhar divn., April, 1888; and finl. commr. of the Punjab, April, 1889; 1st commr., Feb., 1893; C.S.I., Jan., 1890; member of viceroy's legislative council, June-Nov., 1893; prest. of the Indian hemp drugs commn., Oct., 1893; rest., Mysore, and chief commr. of Coorg, Sept., 1895; lieut.-govr. of the Punjab, March, 1897; K.C.S.I., June, 1897.

YOUNGHUSBAND, ARTHUR DELAVAL, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Rugby, and Clifton Coll.; apptd. to the Bombay civil service after exam. of 1875; arrived, 9th Dec., 1877, and served as asst. collr. and mag.; talukdari settlt. officer, and asst. pol. agent; acted as private sec. to govr. in 1890; and as administrator, Rajpipla state, in 1888 and 1890-91; transf'd. to Central Prov. as asst. commr., Nov., 1891; dep. commr., Jan., 1892; also pol. agent, Chhattisgarh feudatories, Nov., 1893.

YOUNGHUSBAND, ROMER EDWARD, B.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Rugby, Clifton Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 14th Dec., 1879, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and settlt. officer; junr. sec. to finl. commrs., March, 1886; under sec. to govt., Jan., 1888, to April, 1890; offic. junr. sec., May, 1893; dep. commr., Sept., 1894.

YUSUF, MOHAMMAD, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at the Patna Coll. Sch., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 12th Nov., 1892, and served in Burma as asst. commr.; asst. mag. and collr., Jan., 1896.

ZORAB, JOHN MANOOK, M.B., C.M., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—Joined the service, 30th March, 1872; served in the mil. dept., and as civil surgn., Balasor, March, 1887, Cuttack, March, 1891, Bahagpur, April, 1896; Cuttack, June, 1897.
LIST OF CASUALTIES.

In addition to those mentioned in the casualty lists given in the earlier part of the book, the following casualties have been reported since the last issue.

AMOS, R., Bengal Customs.—Died 27th Jan., 1897.
BELL, J. M., late Madras Pub. Works Dept.—Died 5th Dec., 1896.
CARTER, Dep. Surg.-Genl. H. V., late Bombay Med. Serv.—Died 4th May, 1897.
CLERK, G. P., Madras Rev. Dept.—Died 26th Aug., 1897.
COOK, Surg.-Major-Genl. H., Bombay Med. Serv.—Died 15th Aug., 1897.
CORNISH, Surg.-Genl. W. R., C.I.E., late Madras Med. Serv.—Died 19th Oct., 1897.
CRUICKSHANK, Dep. Surg.-Genl. J., late Bombay Med. Serv.—Died 11th June, 1897.
DE BOINVILLE, C. A. C., India Office.—Died 25th April, 1897.
DE VILLE, L., Acct.-Genl.'s Dept., India Office.—Resigned 1st Sept., 1897.
ELIAS, N., C.I.E., Foreign Dept. Govt. of India.—Died 31st May, 1897.
EWART, Col. C. H., late Punjab Police.—Died 30th Dec., 1896.
FOX, C. E., late Bombay Jud. Dept.—Died 6th Nov., 1897.
GROVES, H. S., Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Died 6th July, 1897.
HAWES, Capt. A. B., India Office.—Died 15th May, 1897.
HOSKINS, Col. W. H., Madras Police.—Died 2nd June, 1897.
HOUSTON, Dep. Surg.-Genl. J., late Madras Med. Dept.—Died 25th Dec., 1897.
INNES, W., India Pub. Works Dept.—Resigned.
IVENS, F. J., India Pub. Works Dept.—Died 1st May, 1897.
LOBB, T., late India Pub. Works Dept.—Died 8th Jan., 1897.
MACGREGOR, J. L. L., Bombay Forest Dep.—Died 1st March, 1897.
MAC IVOR, Maj. L., Foreign Dept. Govt. of India.—Died 3rd Aug., 1897.
MACLEAN, L. F., C.I.E., India Public Works Dep.—Died 13th Nov., 1897.
MANSER, Surg.-Maj. R., Bombay Med. Serv.—Died 6th Jan., 1897.
MUHAMMAD AFZAL KHAN, C.S.I., Nawab.—Died 1st March, 1897.
NELSON, R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Died 10th Oct., 1897.
NICHOLSON, Bde.-Surg. Lieut. Col. F. C., late Bengal Med. Serv.—Died 24th Dec., 1896.
PEAT, Col. W. S., late Foreign Dept. Govt. of India.—Died 22nd April, 1897.
PHAYRE, Genl. Sir R., G.C.B., I.S.C.—Died 28th Jan., 1897.
PLANT, Col. W. C., late Tenasserim commn.—Died 3rd Jan., 1898.
PULFER, J. W., India Store Depôt.—Retired, 21st Oct., 1897.
RUTHERFURD, J. M., late India Pub. Works Dept.—Died 3rd April, 1896.
SHORTREDE, R., India Audit Office.—Retired, 26th March, 1897.
STAVELEY, Genl. Sir C. W. D., G.C.B.—Died 23rd Nov., 1896.
TOWLE, A. H., Store Dept., India Office.—Resigned, 15th March, 1897.
TUDOR-OWEN, E., Acct. Genl.'s Dept., India Office.—Resigned 31st Aug., 1897.
VENTRIS, H., Rev. and Stat. Dept., India Office.—Retired 28th Feb., 1897.
WATERFIELD, Col. W. G., C.S.I., late Punjab Commr.—Died 3rd Feb., 1897.
WOOD, Lieut.-Col. H. M. M., Punjab Commr.—Died 15th Jan., 1897.
